description: Bob was a Channel 9 News announcer who witnessed Peter Parker declaring his mistake of registering his identity, giving his allegiance to the non-registered, and giving a description of the Negative Zone Prison, where the caught superhumans were imprisoned for life during the Civil War.[198]

name: Bob
appearences: Incredible Hulk and the Human Torch: From the Marvel Vault Vol 1 1
description: Bob was a policeman from a little town in southern Virginia. He was called to the rescue by a diner owner due to the presence of the Hulk in his local.[199]

name: Bob
description: Bob was one of the guards hired by the Owl who captured the Sinister Six.[200]

name: Bob
description:
Bob was a guard in the J.A.N.U.S. assigned to Ravencroft and at the same time a member of the Cult of Knull who unearthed the tomb of Cortland Kasady.[201]
Bob witnessed the resurrection of Cortland by Knull who turned him into Plague and he became his first victim.[202]

name: Bob
description: After undergoing brainwashing, Bob believed to be a simple worker who worked at the mill, and among his colleagues there was Frank Castle. While Bob was talking to Frank, he noticed a slip by Frank when he called his wife Maria instead of Kim.[203]

name: Bobby
description: Bobby befriended an alien child whose ship had landed on Times Square.[85]

name: Bobby
description: Bobby was a reader of Amazing Adult Fantasy.[204]

name: Bobby
description:
Bobby and his brother Tommy were called back home by their mother as soon as the Hulk was spotted heading that way.[205]
A short time later, Bobby and his family were saved by the Hulk when their farmhouse was on fire; although the family inside were safe, they were all terrified of the monster's presence.[206]

name: Bobby
description: Bobby was cured by Dr. Blake.[207]

name: Bobby
description: Bobby noticed Spider-Man coming out a house in Forest Hills.[208]

name: Bobby
description: Bobby spotted Quasar in Manhattan.[209]

name: Bobby
description: Bobby was the newborn son of a couple who gave Eddie Brock a lift. Stopping at a diner, they were held hostage by a gang of robbers. When one of the robbers began harassing Bobby, his father fought back but the robber shot him in the shoulder. Later responding to the taunts of the bandits, Eddie decided to intervene and eliminated the entire gang.[141]

name: Bobby
description: Bobby was a bellboy working at the Embassy Crown Hotel.[210]

name: Bobby
description: Bobby was a paramedic who went on Highway 18 to the scene of the Wolverine and Hulk confrontation and tried to assist Roger carrying his now dead wife who didn't want to stop.[211]

name: Bobby
description: Bobby was a police officer hypnotized by Kid Omega at the international arms control conference in Switzerland.[122]

name: Bobby
description: Bobby was a traitorous guide at the Maiko National Park who was confronted and defeated by the Black Widow.[212]

name: Bodi
appearences: Moon Knight: Black, White & Blood Vol 1 2
description: Bodi was a fellow mercenary and ally of Marc Spector. Together they carried out the task for the Republic of Narobia to oppose the rebel forces during the civil war in that country. Bodi was killed when another mercenary named Henrik Kless betrayed them to steal all the diamonds they were tasked with transporting safely.[213]

name: Boggs
description: Mr. Boggs was a teacher at Peter Corbeau Preparatory, and during an argument between Cole Rivera and Benny Thomas he intervened and threatened both of them that they would regret it if they did not calm down when he returned.[214]

name: Boinard
description: Boinard with Blackie and other crooks, was captured by Spider-Man during a robbery trumped-up by the Green Goblin.[215]

name: Boleyn
description: Desperate after having lost everything due to a scam suffered using the Ponzi system, Artemis's father, unable to bear to become poor, remembering his noble origins deriving from being related to Queen Anna Boleyn, decides to commit suicide by doing it in front of his daughter.[216]

name: Bolton
description: Minor Appearances: Deadpool (Vol. 4) #12

name: Bongert
description: Bongert was on the Sweat Shoppers team sent by the Power Broker on the order of the Red Skull to the federal penitentiary in Virginia to evade Viper from prison, which they successfully accomplished.[218]

name: Borback
description: Mr. Borback was a resident of Centerville and runs the Eastern Union.[219]

name: Boris
description: Boris was an horror actor who came across Triton.[220]

name: Boris
description: Boris was one of the Russian government agents who faked Yuri Petrovich's rescue in West Berlin and took him back across the Wall.[221]

name: Boris
description: Boris was confronted by the X-Men in a tavern south of Province 13 after his gang tried to rob them.[222]

name: Boris
description: After Blade discovered the Contessa's attempt to assassinate Dracula and explained his findings to her at her home, the Contessa called her aides Boris and Sergei, but they did not answer. Instead, Blade pulled back a curtain and showed the corpses of the two that he had killed before.[223]

name: Bormann
description: Bormann was a street gang leader who was confronted and killed by Johann Schmidt.[224]

name: Bosco
description: Bosco had been taken out to have him do his bodily needs, and his master complained that he didn't have all night.[225]

name: Boss-Man
description: Boss-Man and his gang were defeated by Bloodscream, Elsie-Dee, and Albert.[226]

name: Boswell
description: Boswell was a heavily-armed espionage agent who managed to defeat Daredevil and Ka-Zar in order to obtain his Anti-Metal medallion. Back to the Plunderer's castle, he accidentally killed Feepers, and was subsequently subdued by the Plunderer.[227]

name: Boswell
description: Mentions: Marvel Feature #9

name: Boz
description: Boz was of the looters arrested by the West Coast Avengers.[229]

name: Brackett
description: Brackett was one of the government agents who killed Ivan Petrovich's wife and abducted his son Yuri.[221]

name: Brad
description: Brad was a young man who challenged Outlaw Kid, but was easily disarmed by the Kid. A local arms dealer, Mr. Wilkins, seeing the courage with which Brad had challenged the Kid, suggested that he work for him, but that he was hiding weapons for Indian rebels. When Brad's aunt intervened to prevent his nephew from committing a crime even though he didn't know it, Wilkins and his men would kill her if it wasn't for the woman's skill in using guns, but anyway, having seen her aunt that could have been injured by Wilkins' gang, even Brad came to his senses and attacked the members of the gang, defeating them with his fists.[230]

name: Brad
description: Brad needs to raise money for his brother's medical treatment and so he answers an ad from a scientist seeking to test a shrinking ray. He agrees to be the subject and the ray works. He finds himself shrinking past microscopic objects and finally finds himself in a new world. When he asks a native what this world is called, he receives the answer 'Earth'.[231]

name: Brad
description: Brad was an airline pilot who brought participants to the government conference on man-made mutations. His plane was attacked by the Lords of Light and Darkness and he himself was injured in the eyes due to the assault of the Rakks on the plane.[232]

name: Brad
description: Brad tried to lure Elektra, while she was trapped within Sandy's personality, to a location where he could kill her. As Garrett rushed to save her, Brad framed him for the death of his partner Minelli, but he was eventually killed by the S.H.I.E.L.D. special agent.[233]

name: Brad
appearences: Daredevil: The Man Without Fear Vol 1 2
description: Brad was a Columbia University student who was punished by Matt Murdock for bullying Foggy Nelson.[234]

name: Brad
description: Brad and Mikey were two bicyclists who were caught by Spider-Man after causing an accident.[235]

name: Brad
description:
Brad is introduced by Kate Vinokur to Daredevil telling him that he and his other assistant took care of everything in the office, from the investigation to making her the coffee.[236]
Kate asks Brad how far Arnold Quaid was to locate, and Brad eloquently answered her by pointing out various indications about Quaid.[237]

name: Brad
description: Brad was the butler, bodyguard and combat assistant to Jubilee's aunt Hope Lee.[238]

name: Brad
description: Brad was the cameraman assigned to follow the adventures of the New Warriors in their reality show[238] and was present during the Stamford tragedy where he also lost his life.[239]

name: Brad
description: A student in Midtown High, he bullied another student at school and was rebuked by Peter Parker but the coach Flash Thompson intervened in his defense.[240]

name: Brad
description: Brad was an alien who belonged to the Omega Confederation brigade who crossed the rest of the Deadpool Corps about to save Deadpool and Headpool and was promptly killed by Lady Deadpool.[241]

name: Bradford
description: Mister Bradford worked with the Eternals to deal with the Celestials.[242]

name: Bradley
description: Bradley tried hard to make Anya love him, considering her claim that she was a lesbian just a fool. When Karma ran to Anya's aid in the woods where Bradley had taken her, she arrived at the scene and she realized that Anya did not need help because she knocked out Bradley with one punch.[243]

name: Brainard
description: One of the members of the cult that was lead by Joshua Kale and accused Kale of having stolen the Tome of Zhered-Na and for being in league with the Demons.[244]

name: Brandi
description: Brandi worked as a waitress in a famous jazz club. She served the table where three visiting Avengers had been sat, exchanging witty banter with the Beast for ordering non-alcoholic drinks.[245]

name: Brandon
description: Brandon was a little boy who came into contact with Carnage when the supervillain was hiding out in his family's barn and torturing Spider-Man. Brandon suffered from physical and emotional abuse at the hands of bullies at school and his stepfather Dan, with Carnage attempting to corrupt him to his nihilistic worldview. Carnage eventually bonded Brandon to an offshoot of the Carnage symbiote, which he used to kill his stepfather. Carnage then tried to persuade him to kill Spider-Man, but Brandon instead freed the superhero - rejecting Carnage's twisted advice due to only wanting to be left alone. However, the offshoot of the Carnage symbiote ambushed Brandon while he was being hugged by his mother and bonded to him.[246]

name: Brandt
description: Professor Brandt was Reed Richards' and Victor von Doom's teacher at the State University.[247]

name: Brathwaite
description: Gabriel Brathwaite's father was a firefighter, he died of cancer and it was only around that time that Gabriel's grades dropped but only for a semester.[248]

name: Brathwaite
description: Gabriel Brathwaite's mother was a widow and math teacher. She knew of her son's mutant powers and worried that people would react if he used his powers among normal people.[248]

name: Bratton
description: Bratton was a prisoner who died in a fire which Two-Gun Kid witnessed.[249]

name: Braun
description: Herr Braun was one of the villagers possessed by Possessors, until they were whisked away by Dr. Strange.[250]

name: Brayle
description: Dr. Brayle was a member of Las Vegas C.S.I. who performed an autopsy on Deadpool's body.[251]

name: Brenner
description: Captain Brenner was one of Major Del Tremens' men, and was left in charge of Tranquility Base when Tremens led an assault against the Woodgod. He was later tricked into releasing Spider-Man from his restraints when the web-slinger claimed to have taken photographs of Liberty, New Mexico.[252]

name: Brent
description: Brent was the Bill Travis' second in command n the nationalist terrorist group the Sons of Hancock that had occupied Philadelphia's Independence Hall. Upon request as a gesture of goodwill on Captain America's part, Travis ordered Brent to release the held hostage Park Feds.[253]

name: Brentano
description: Brentano was ordered by General Nguyen Ngoc Coy to observe and test the children for any sort of paranormal psychic ability; should they lack such talents, his organization would have put them to other profitable uses. He eventually surrender to Spider-Man and the Fantastic Four.[254]

name: Bresnavich
description: Doctor Bresnavich made sure that the American had escaped.[255]

name: Brett
description: Logan scuffled with Brett to get Sheriff MacReedy's attention in Pottsville.[256]

name: Brett
description: CBA News anchor Brett hosted Harry Hauser to talk about Sam Wilson's battle against U.S.Agent.[257]

name: Brewster
appearences: Avengers: Death Trap, The Vault Vol 1 1
description:
Ms. Brewster was the assistant warden at the super-villain prison called The Vault. During the insurrection created by Venom, Brewster called in the Avengers after Director Truman Marsh was taken hostage.[258]
Following Director Marsh's death, Ms. Brewster became the Vault's Project Head and briefed a Justice Department agent on the safety improvements and rehabilitation methods being used at the Vault.[259]

name: Brian
description: Brian was an IRA guard who was watching over the Old Woman of Beare.[260]

name: Brice
description: Brice was one of the security men at the Smith Building serving the Red Skull. He called Elron over the radio and told him that the Red Skull sparring partners supplied by Taskmaster, whom he called the five little lambs, had been checked and that he could proceed.[261]

name: Brick
description: Dr. Brick was a psychiatrist who worked at the Arizona Home for Troubled Empowered Youth and assisted in the action of one of his patients as he helped the Marshals free Jake Gomez and the other prisoners Life Pharmaceuticals was experimenting with.[262]

name: Bridget
description: Bridget was Tony Stark's cook. She was an immigrant from Ireland.[263]

name: Bridget
description:
Bridget was Lewis Green's girlfriend. When he returned from the excavations carried out in Troy to retrieve an amulet for the General, he went to Bridget's house, defying the General's orders to go directly to him, but when he was at the door of his house Bridget told him that things during her absence had changed and she was now with another man.[264]
After acquiring the powers of Achilles, Lewis returned to Bridget wanting to win her back and heavily beat up Joey, but Bridget refused him in spite of everything, telling him that she had never loved him.[265]

name: Bridgette
description: Bridgette was one of Sat-Yr-Nin's amazonian guards. She was ordered to find Kitty Pryde.[266]

name: Briggs
description: Agent Briggs is an operative for Damocles Foundation.[267][268]

name: Briggs
description: Sheriff Briggs was head of the Omaha police and welcomed the Hellions when they were sent to Omaha to demolish Mr. Sinister's orphanage.[269]

name: Brinina
description: Brinina was the saleswoman of a cosmetics store that Jessica Jones approached to find a lipstick to use for her wedding to Luke.[270]

name: Britney
description: Britney was a girl lured into a party by a group of Skrulls that tried to slaughter her. She was saved by Ryder.[271]

name: Brokeridge
description: Mentions: Avengers: The Initiative #24

name: Brokeridge
description: Mentions: Avengers: The Initiative #24

name: Bromes
appearences: X-Men: Curse of the Man-Thing Vol 1 1
description: After her daughter Harriet was expelled from seven schools for continuing bouts of violence. he satisfied her that she wanted to stay away from her people, so they moved to the woods where he died in a fire.[273]

name: Bronson
description: Bronson was a grave robber and a murderer who took a job as a deep-sea diver to hide from the authorities. Bronson decided to murder the crew and keep the treasure for himself. Bronson donned a heavy diving suit and blew up the ship and went to claim the diamonds.

name: Brown
description: Brown was a secret service agent tasked to protect Chelsea Clinton.[275]

name: Browning
description: Mr. Browning was an hospital ward at Ryan Mental Hospital killed by the Master of Vengeance.[276]

name: Brownlee
description:
Minor Appearances: Jessica Jones (Vol. 2) #6, Jessica Jones (Vol. 2) #13, Jessica Jones (Vol. 2) #16
Mentions: Jessica Jones (Vol. 2) #4

name: Bruce
description: Before going to the party Roddy Colt goes to Mr. Bruce to give him the war stamps and thanked him for buying them, but Mr. Bruce replied that he should not thank him, that for him it was a privilege to buy them, that he is buying of shares in freedom.[279]

name: Bruce
description: In 1965, a giant floating head appears over New York and proclaims it is the first to arrive in an invasion force. The army attack it but it disappears and reappears faster than the speed of light and the head explains they travel by there minds and can telepathically blow things up, demanding the entire city leave. A boy named Bruce figures out the truth that this is all a ruse by some criminals to rob the entire city and that the head is nothing more than a projection.[280]

name: Bruce
description: Bruce and his friend were near the pier when Sub-Mariner emerged from the water and for no apparent reason but driven by an unjustified hatred Bruce threw himself at Namor hitting him with a flying kick. This infuriated Namor who reacted by hitting Bruce violently making him fly in the water and if it hadn't been for the intervention of his friend who threw himself into the water and rescued him Bruce would have drowned.[281]

name: Bruce
description: Bruce was a fashion designer who worked for Daphne von Wilkinson's fashion studio and was systematically abused by her.[282]

name: Bruce
description: Bruce was one of the guards hired by Dr. Pernell Solomon who worked in his institute where Taskmaster trained his agents inside.[283]

name: Bruce
description: Mentions: Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man Annual #7

name: Bruce
description:
Brother Bruce was a psychopath and pyromaniac loyal to the Cult of Love and especially to his leader the Teacher.[286]
Bruce died in the collapse of the Cult headquarters, also causing the Teacher's death, caused by a fire ignited by himself.[287]

name: Bruce
description: Bruce thanked Colossus for saving his family.[288]

name: Bruce
appearences: Punisher Back to School Special Vol 1 1
description: A student who didn't think school was necessary with one of his classmates but wanted to make easy money as an acquaintance of theirs by working for a drug dealer. When the Punisher broke into the den of the drug dealer killing everyone, Bruce and his companion were there and the Punisher frightened them saying he would keep an eye on them, and in doing so the two students returned to school and because of the warning of the Punisher no longer lost a lesson and sharply improved their grades.[289]

name: Bruce
description: Bruce was the director of the film on Cap'n Oz which had as its protagonist the Australian actor and secret a member of the Clan Destine William Chance.[290]

name: Bruce
description: Bruce was the leader of a Paris street gang involved in smuggling, drug trafficking and illegal gambling and after observing with his own eyes what the Stacy twins were capable of he made them join the gang.[291]

name: Bruce
description: Bruce was Linda's boyfriend (the counterpart of Nightcrawler's wife of Earth-295), and while Linda was talking on the phone telling about the one who kept giving her romantic gifts, Bruce showed up at his house earlier than he had planned because he loved her and missed her.[292]

name: Bruce
appearences: Avengers Standoff: Welcome to Pleasant Hill Vol 1 1
description: Dr. Bruce was a psychologist included in the "Pleasant Hill" program of S.H.I.E.L.D. and in particular he took care of the psychological conditioning of Helmut Zemo, succeeding us almost completely if Fixer had not intervened.[293]

name: Brucknerr
description: Dr. Brucknerr was a henchman and scientist who worked for Lady Octopus. He was the one who informed her that Seward Trainer had gotten around their computer defenses, and later used Trainer's files to enhance her VR wave generator.[294]

name: Bruno
description: Bruno was a burglar who was shrunk and encased in a crystal ball by a gypsy.[295]

name: Bruno
description: A musclebound enforcer in the employ of Ward Meachum prior to his death, Bruno was one of a trio of goons who paid an unwelcome visit to Henri Sorel's private lab. Sorel had been working on a universal cure for radiation poisoning on the behalf of the World Health Organization, and Bruno and his fellow goons had been hired by Meachum to pressure Sorel into selling his discoveries to his company. When Sorel resisted them, it was Bruno who beat the physicist and sent him crashing into samples of plutonium isotopes. They then left him to die, unaware that effects from his experiments combined with the radiation exposure would mutate Sorel into Radion the Ravager. Iron Fist would later see all of this documented on a video diary midway through a confrontation with Sorel/Radion in London.[296]

name: Bruno
description: Bruno was one of Amos Jardine's employees, who escorted Peter Parker and Mary Jane Watson to the door, after Parker asked Jardine questions about the Man-Thing.[297]

name: Bruno
description: Bruno was a clown who worked for "Mr. Mike's One-Ring Traveling Tent Show" in Sullivan County.[298]

name: Bruno
description: Bruno was a retired killer who died while attempting to murder Vanessa Fisk.[299]

name: Bruno
description: Bruno was killed by Malone as they were hunted by Wolverine for torturing and abusing a Canadian nun in Iraq.[300]

name: Brutus
description: One of the robotic members of Madame Masque's Inner Guard. It was destroyed in a battle between the Avengers and Count Nefaria.[301]

name: Bryan
appearences: Strange Tales of the Unusual Vol 1 5
description: Bryan was an inventor who built a robot with the features of his brother-in-law on his sister's instructions.[302]

name: Bryant
description: Mr. Bryant was a new English literature teacher in Centerville. Hedy Wolfe had a crush on him and began performing poorly in English to garner his tutelage,[303]

name: Bryant
appearences: Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 2 5
description: Member of the famous rap duo AK-47 together with his wife and father of Tiowa, classmate and girlfriend of Víctor Álvarez who to annoy her parents she dressed in the fashion of the 20s.[304]

name: Bryant
appearences: Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 2 5
description: Member of the famous rap duo AK-47 together with her husband and mother of Tiowa, classmate and girlfriend of Víctor Álvarez who to annoy her parents she dressed in the fashion of the 20s.[304]

name: Bryce
description: Mentions: Emma Frost #5

name: Bubba
description: Bubba was the little dog who had escaped to two twins who became desperate as their grandmother was told to be responsible but Spider-Man went to their aid and found Bubba who he handed back to the two girls.[310]

name: Buchinsky
description: A Colonel who administered a military school and at the same time presided over a secret military operation by storing huge quantities of cocaine inside the school to create a wealth standard based on cocaine and not gold.[311]

name: Bud Boy
description: Bud Boy was one of the former workers at Brombline Cross Mining who was interviewed after the mine closed and the Virago arrived.[312]

name: Buddha
description: Buddha was one of Veronica's cameramen.[313]

name: Buddy
description: Buddy served a burger to Rachel Summers, right before three armed men entered and told everyone to hand over their money. Rachel ignored them and then finally used her powers to turn their guns into scrap-metal.[314]

name: Buddy
description:
Buddy was Eve's dog. When Kerry met Buddy and Eve she greeted buddy and told Eve to take off her heels and go for a run with Buddy.
[315]

name: Buddy
description: Buddy was Senator Krane's dog. During a meeting in Washington, D.C., Senator Krane asked his security guard Hank to stay outside with Buddy.[316]

name: Buehller
description: Mr. Buehller was the defense attorney assigned to Red Skull in the trial brought against him for his war crimes.[317]

name: Buggles
description: Buggles is the one of the housekeepers/cooks to Hedy Wolfe and her family.[318][319]

name: Bule
description: Bule is a boy from Ephraim who, together with his friends, woke Morrie Watanabe while he was sleeping in his car using a real gun, even if it was unloaded.[320]

name: Bull
appearences: Spider-Island: I Love New York City Vol 1 1
description: Bull was in charge of three other criminals, after being infected by the Spider-Virus and having acquired powers similar to those of Spider-Man, disguised as Spider-Men, they robbed a bank killing various hostages until the Punisher intervened who first eliminated one of the criminals who made the stake during the robbery after which using his disguise eliminated Bull and the other two gang members.[321]

name: Bullfinch
description: Mr. Bullfinch was a drug dealer and a pedophile. When he was cornered he tried to find an agreement with Nick Fury that in exchange for his immunity he would reveal the names of those with whom he traded in drugs, but despite everything he was killed by Wolverine.[322]

name: Bullwinkle
description: Bullwinkle was one of the explorers who were crushed by a sea monster after discovering an ancient Viking dragonship.[323]

name: Bunk
appearences: Ghost Rider: Kushala Infinity Comic Vol 1 1
description: Mentions: Ghost Rider: Kushala Infinity Comic #2, Ghost Rider: Kushala Infinity Comic #4

name: Bunky
description: Bunky was a former employee of Tombstone who was fed to his ghetto pigs for skimming off the top.[326]

name: Burdick
description: Minor Appearances: Amazing Spider-Man (Vol. 5) #80

name: Burke
description: Burke was an police officer sent to the Logan's Woods to investigate the disturbances.[329]

name: Burke
description: Burke was killed for informing Portia Clennon of her former husband's meeting with the Kingpin.[142]

name: Burke
description: Professor Burke was the last of the original crew trained to operate the Quintronic Man.[330]

name: Burnatt
description:
Agent Burnatt of the Springdale Police surprised three winos fleeing into the park not knowing they had attempted to rob Robbie Baldwin.[331]
Agent Burnatt consoles Robbie for making fun of him from his schoolmates because of the situation in which his parents found themselves involved.[332]
Burnatt was on patrol in Hammond Park in the period that the Two-Legged Rat was hunting for cats and during the clash between the criminal and Speedball there was little that Burnatt was not hit by the two-legged Rat rifle.[333]
Burnatt was on guard at the park during the charity fundraiser whose money collected was robbed by Bonehead and he himself recovered the stolen goods after Bonehead and his gang were defeated by Speedball.[334]

name: Burroughs
description: Dr. Burroughs let Dr. Hope continue his experiments in the secret Mad Dog ward at the City Hospital.[335]

name: Burt
description: Burt was a bodybuilder who witnessed the Inhumans landing on a private beach.[336]

name: Burt
description: Burt was a farmer from Roundup, Montana, whose cows were actually disguised Skrulls. He and Carl were saved by Ryder.[337]

name: Burt
description: Burt welcomed the surviving sons of his wife's sister onto his ranch, accompanied by Logan on the run from two criminals. The two criminals later identified Burt's ranch and killed him.[338]

name: Buster
description: Buster was the Quentin Carnival cashier and was killed during a robbery by Tex.[339]

name: Butch
description:
The past of the man-monster known as Butch is unknown. He was found by a mobster named Brink and brought to his employer, mob leader Rickie. When Rickie refused to employ Butch, Brink decided to take control of Rickie's gang and ordered Butch to kill Rickie. With the gang under his control, Brink sent Butch out to terrorize the city, causing massive amounts of property damage, loss of life, and large thefts in the millions. Local law enforcement proved powerless against this monster.
The creature's rampages attracted the attention of the Angel who frightened Butch with his superior fighting prowess sending the monster fleeing back to his employer. That lead the Angel and the police to their location. As the police nabbed Brink and his gang, the Angel clashed with Butch, tricking the creature into ramming through a wall and falling down five stories. The impact shattered the pavement down to the subway below, apparently killing Butch.[340]

name: Butch
description: Butch was one of grave robbers hired by Dr. Maluski to rob corpses for his experiments.

name: Butch
description: Butch was a mover of Verners Moving of Salt Lake City who cared to download a very heavy load of equipment that Herr Krauss' ring of Nazi spies had stolen to Namor.[342]

name: Buzz
description: Buzz was one of the best Taskmaster students and was hired with others for a sparring partner session dressed as Captain America. The opponent turned out to be the Red Skull who killed Buzz and the other sparring partners in an extremely simple way.[261]

name: Buzz
description: Buzz was a teenage friend of Robert Reynolds and Lindy Lee.[343]

name: Buzzy
description: Buzzy was a member of the rival gang of Red Fever who kidnapped Archie Andrews thinking he was their rival criminal due to their resemblance, and together with the other gang members came up against with the Punisher.[165]

name: C.J.
description: C.J. he was one of the men belonging to the apparently bucolic covenant created by Selene in the small town of Adamsville in Ohio. He met Alvin Watts who accompanied Steve Rogers and Sam Wilson, disguised with an image inducer, at the weekly meeting chaired by Selene and greeted him by calling him Brother Al and Watts responded to the greeting by calling him Brother C.J.[1]

name: Cabbie
description:
Cabbie was a taxi driver driving around town one day, trying to find a fare, unaware that the Invisible Girl was in his taxi with him. While he was stopped near the Baxter Building, she got out and tried to pay him, still invisible. The surprised cab driver then panicked and took off.[2]
A few years later, he recounted this run-in while taking Alicia Masters to the Baxter Building.[3]
Most recently, Cabbie was seen at a bar on Tenth Avenue, again retelling his chance encounter while the bar patrons were toasting the passing of the Fantastic Four, among many other super-heroes, during the recent Onslaught event. He then watched news footage of a new, potential replacement super-team, the Thunderbolts, in battle with the incredible Hulk, and expressed misgivings, pointing out Citizen V's use of a sword over Captain America's shield.[4]

name: Cabot
description: Ms. Cabot was a member of the Hellfire Club who during a dinner at the Manhattan headquarters discussed the virtue with Roberto Da Costa.[5]

name: Caesar
description: Casesar was the favourite pet rat of two sisters, Agnes and Laura, who was visited by Mr. Cotton after receiving complaints about the smell and filth of the house. He threatened to call an exterminator on the rats and attempted to kill Caesar, who attacked and bit him back. Mr. Cotton killed Caesar.[6]

name: Caesar
description: Caesar was a member of Wicked Wally Wuggens' gang who was confronted and defeated by Excalibur after trying to escape from Crossmoor Prison.[7]

name: Caffe
appearences: X-Men: Children of the Atom Vol 1 3
description: A member of Jack Winters' gang, Caffe was knocked out by Professor X.[8]

name: Cahill
description: Dr. Cahill ffrom the Toronto General Hospital reported to Northstar that Joanne Beaubier had AIDS.[9]

name: Cal
description: Cal was one of the now elderly members of the Renegades biker gang. When the leader of the Hell Hounds gang, Len, threatened Jake Yahkin, the leader of the Renegades, Cal was about to respond by drawing a weapon but jake stopped him saying that he had already seen too much blood in a lifetime. Cal, along with the other members of the renegades perished in the ensuing firefight following the death of Jake killed by Len with a gunshot.[10]

name: Calderon
description: His daughter Lucia was attacked by a Harlem boy, and thanks to Falcon's intervention she was saved and the boy captured. At that point Falcon told Mr. Calderon that the boy was drunk and that he was not actually a bad boy and even though he had no excuses he asked him if he had been a bit soothing towards him. Calderon replied that since he was a good person he would consider it, which in fact he then did in front of the judge by withdrawing the complaint against the boy.[11]

name: Califore
description: Mr. Califore was the doorman of the building that served as Mysterio's headquarters while he posed as Nicolas Macabes. Califore was ordered to kill Daredevil as he entered the building, but he was easily knocked out by Daredevil's Billy Club.[12]

name: Calleja
appearences: Ghost Rider/Blaze: Spirits of Vengeance Vol 1 22
description: Ms. Calleja was the receptionist at the Children Inc. building in Manhattan.[13]

name: Calnor
description: Calnor was Talena's father, who was arranging her marriage with Kull when his daughter told him Gallus was fatally bleeding out in the royal garden.[14]

name: Calvin
description: Calvin was one of Cornelius van Lunt's henchmen. After their Quienjet was shot down, Calvin and Jason Birch captured the Vision and an unconscious Scarlet Witch and took them to Van Lunt's hacienda. He was apparently defeated by the Red Wolf and the Avengers, who attacked the mansion to free their kidnapped members.[15]

name: Calvin
description: Calvin and his girlfriend witnessed Ramrod defeating Iron Man.[16]

name: Calvin
description: Calvin was an owner of a groceries store in Harlem where someone had broken into the shop doing minor damage but stealing CCTV recordings.[17]

name: Cam
appearences: Captain America: Symbol of Truth Vol 1 3
description: Cam was an inmate at the Sing Sing Correctional Facility and an acquaintance of Sam Wilson when he was a social worker. Sam approached him in a prison interview to obtain information on a secret Vibranium trafficking from Wakanda.[18]

name: Camilo
appearences: America Chavez: Made in the USA Vol 1 2
description: Camilo was a schoolmate of America Chavez. When America presented in class a drawing with her family described on Utopian Parallel on her, Camilo and her friends told her that her family was not real, and upon leaving school America beat Camilo for it.[19]

name: Camino
description: Mrs. Camino with her husband Lee and their son Danny participated in advertising for her husband's automobile company.[20]

name: Campbell
description: Campbell was in charge of the construction of the Fantastic Four's new headquarters.[21]

name: Cappy
description: Cappy was the doorman who worked the front door of the building where rich socialite Marla Drake lived. He was one of the few people who knew she was also secretly the costumed hero Miss Fury.[22],[23]

name: Captain
description: The Captain was a melon farmer who, upon hearing of a superhero going by the same name, tracked him down and got him to pay money for usage of the name.[24]

name: Cara
description: Cara was at Yancy Street when she was was saved by Spider-Man from being forever trapped in the Negative Zone.[25]

name: Carey
description: Carey was a Midtown High student and one of Amelia Hopkins' friends.[26][27]

name: Cargill
appearences: Amazing Spider-Man: Chaos in Calgary Vol 1 4
description: Dr. Cargill was a famous Nobel Prize scientist and father of the disabled heroine Turbine. During a rodeo event where he and his daughter were invited as guests of honor, The Wizard along with the Frightful Four attempted to kidnap him but was saved by the intervention of Spider-Man, the Rangers and the Right Riders, as well as his daughter.[28]

name: Cargill
description: Mr. Cargill was inadvertently killed by his daughter.[29]

name: Cargill
description: Mrs. Cargill was a churchgoing woman who couldn't stop her husband from beating their daughter.[29]

name: Carl
description: Carl was one of Doctor Doom's men who operated the nuclear-powered excavator.[30]

name: Carl
description: Carl was the police officer from Hope who handed Peter Parker's report to Chief Inspector Krahn.[31]

name: Carl
description: Carl was DuPrey's yacht driver, who was rewarded for covering the killing of Mr. Shockett.[32]

name: Carl
description: Carl reported live from the press conference where Trapster publicly confessed to have killed Joey Z, framing Spider-Man for murder.[33]

name: Carl
description: Carl was a farmer from Roundup, Montana, whose cows were actually disguised Skrulls. He and Burt were saved by Ryder.[34]

name: Carl
description: Carl was a security guard working at Horizon Labs.[35]

name: Carl
description: Carl was an Omaha policeman who when he ordered the dog Jenny to stop was misunderstood by Wild Child as the alpha component of the pack and was attacked and saved just in time by Greycrow.[36]

name: Carl
description: Carl meets Bruce Banner after he wakes up in tattered clothes and jokes by telling him that he had nice clothes not caring why he was looking that way.[37]

name: Carl
description: Carl and his accomplice Karen were robbing a trendy shop convinced that no costumed heroes were on patrol that night, but instead they were wrong as Silk was on patrol and having spotted them he easily defeated them and handed them over to the police.[38]

name: Carl
description: Carl was a New Yorker living in Queens with his wife Louise. One day Louise was chastising him for his lack of domestic help while Carl was trying to watch a baseball game on TV. As their discussion escalated, the cosmically-empowered Iron Man happened to use the Power Cosmic to boost the collective brainpower of the entire city to match his own. This caused Carl and Louise to suddenly become more introspective, allowing them to settle their differences amicably.[39]

name: Carla
description: Carla was one of three Dreadnought 2000 controllers who were sent to oppose Spider-Man and the New Warriors when they entered the Target Technologies plant, since Dreadnought 2000 were new automatons not yet programmed for autonomous functions and needed someone to handle them maneuvered. When Spider-Man realized they were being remote controlled, he burst into the control room and knocked out Carla and the other two controllers so the Dreadnoughts started acting randomly and the New Warriors could destroy them.[40]

name: Carla
description: Carla was a member of the Bloodshadows street gang led by Blade in his youth. When they went inside a house to rob it, they met the vampire Lamia who was feeding on some of bodies and rushed at her with a knife stabbing her and Lamia replying lifted her and tore her in two killing her.[41]

name: Carla
description: Carla was a 911 receptionist who received an alert call of a possible imminent terror attack on San Diego.[23]

name: Carla
description: Carla was a Mexican girl involved in drug trafficking but was discovered by corrupt Mexican soldiers who riddled her and her boyfriend with blows. However, Carla was saved by the intervention of the Silver Surfer who, however, was unable to save her boyfriend.

name: Carlie
description: Carlie reported an attempt to capture Deathlok in Coney Island, being saved when Harlan Ryker ordered Ian Wajler to destroy the news helicopter.[42]

name: Carlo
description: Carlo was one of the two employees of Jason Tso, who were tasered and rigged with explosives by the Pro. Sent into Club Noir to kill Tso, their grenades were slapped away by Ben Reilly.[43]

name: Carlo
description: Carlo was a policeman who was rescued by the Human Torch.[44]

name: Carlo
description: Carlo was a robber, who tried to rob an old man, only to be stopped by Rick Jones and Mar-Vell.[45]

name: Carlos
description: Carlos was a sanitation truck driver who used to collect trash from the Avengers Mansion.[46]

name: Carlos
description: Carlos was a member of the Jaguars Hispanic gang.[47]

name: Carlos
description: Carlos was an acquaintance of Bonita Juarez living in Albuquerque.[48]

name: Carlos
appearences: Captain America: What Price Glory? Vol 1 3
description: Carlos was one of Nicoli Spano's henchmen who were knocked out by Captain America.[49]

name: Carlos
description: Carlos was one of Bill Hollister's assistants.[50]

name: Carlos
description: Main enforcer of Mr. Alcantara.[51][52]

name: Carlson
description: Carlson explained to the New Warriors how the ribonucleic nanoncontagium supply was stolen from the Genetech Science Facility.[53]

name: Carlton
description: Carlton was the doorman at Ann Weying's apartment building. When Peter Parker introduced himself as a reporter to speak to her, Carlton buzzed her apartment and announced this, but she reiterated to Carlton that she would not speak to reporters.[54]

name: Carlyle
description: Ms. Carlyle was Peter Parker's Geography teacher and taught him the importance of the Ogalalla Aquifer water reservation.[55]

name: Carmelo
description:
Vito and Carmelo, two of Hammerhead's henchmen, were
confronted by Spider-Man, who took the captured Eel away from them.[56]

name: Carmine
description: Carmine from the Plummer Advertising Agency bought Steve Rogers' storyboards.[57]

name: Carmine
description: Carmine was killed while escorting Gradon Bianco.[58]

name: Carmody
description: Carmody the Pirate at his death declared that his older son Bruce was too wicked even to share a treasure of a buccaneer, then disinherited him leaving everything to his younger son Joe.[59]

name: Carn
description: Trooper Carn reported to the Kingpin to have seen Peter Parker in the New Jersey swamp where Fisk and Jimmy Six met.[60]

name: Carol
description: Carol was saved from a mountain lion by her magical teddy bear.[61]

name: Carol
description: Carol was an actress who warned Simon Williams of an incoming Avengers call on his transceiver.[62]

name: Carol
description: Carol and Harold witnessed Mr. Hyde getting out the elevator at the ballroom level reserved for Joe Robertson's farewell party.[63]

name: Carol
description: She supposedly was Brad's girlfriend.[64]

name: Carol
description: Carol and her unborn child was killed during a fight between the Hulk and Wolverine. Her husband Roger blamed Wolverine for her death, motivating him to later join the Red Right Hand to get revenge on Wolverine.[65]

name: Carol
description: While traveling by car in the Southwest, Carol's daughter spotted Captain America.[66]

name: Carole
description: Carole was Jean Grey's roommate when she attended Metro College.[67]

name: Carole
appearences: Captain America: Man Out of Time Vol 1 4
description: Carole was General Jacob Simon's private nurse who looked after him in his last days of life.[68]

name: Caroline
description: A native Sioux Lakota, wife of Michael, she had her newborn son treated for bronchitis by Dr. Waking-Bear.[69]

name: Carpenter
description: Carpenter opposed Jester's handling of the robberies, and during a meeting he said that he and his men would come out and at that statement Jester threw him an explosive bill that exploded beside Carpenter.[70]

name: Carrie
appearences: King in Black: Gwenom vs. Carnage Vol 1 1
description: Carrie was a dormmate of Gwen Stacy's at Empire State University and was among the few to have failed evacuation during the onslaught of the Dragons of Knull and was possessed by a Symbiote.[71]

name: Carter
description: Mr. Carter was the father of the Northside High School football star, Bill Carter, and welcomed him home returning from training asking if the Saturday game would have won her not imagining that his son had cheated on the history exams in order to play the match.[72]

name: Carter
description: Mrs. Carter was the mother of the Northside High School football star, Bill Carter, and welcomed him home returning from training telling him that supper was ready.[72]

name: Carter
description: Corso Lenori and one of his men have come to Lafitte Island to make it their home base for modern piracy. However they are caught on the property by the land owner Colonel Carter who demands to know what they are doing on his island. Lenori makes it all sound like a misunderstanding when he suddenly pulls out a gun and shoots Carter dead.[73]

name: Carter
description: Carter was the butler of Mr. Benson, a wealthy man who had an extreme fear of heights and tried to help him overcome his phobia but to no avail.[74]

name: Carter
description: Carter was a lion tamer who mistreated the animals he had to teach until Jann intervened who overwhelmed Carter and made him swear in the shadow of the totem to no longer mistreat the animals. Although at the time he accepted the oath later Carter tried to take revenge on Jann but he did not succeed and almost rushed towards his death because of the totem that fell towards him but was saved from falling off a cliff by Jann's intervention.[75]

name: Carter
description: At the birth of his daughter Beverly he was entranced by her beauty, declaring he could not wish for anything else.[76]

name: Carter
description: Mother of the beautiful Beverly Carter, at her birth she said she had never seen a baby more beautiful than she.[76]

name: Carter
description: Mr. Carter is Stanley Walker's boss. He's the father of Cliff Carter.[77][78]

name: Carter
description: He invented the enlarging serum he intended to use to enlarge insects to be used for transport but his assistant used it on a common ant that became the monstrous Krang.[79]

name: Carter
description: Mrs. Carter was the wife of atomic scientist Brad Carter and mother of Tad Carter, one of the first mutants to be historically documented.[80]

name: Carter
description: Mr. Carter was the father of Billy, a lame boy who with the power of thought managed to travel into the future and there he was healed from his impairment. Upon returning in his time, Mr. Carter and his wife, although initially thought that their son's story was the result of his imagination, they were incredulous and ecstatic with Billy's actual recovery.[81]

name: Carter
description: Mrs. Carter was the mother of Billy, a lame boy who with the power of thought managed to travel into the future and there he was healed from his impairment. Upon returning in his time, Mrs. Carter and her husband, although initially thought that their son's story was the result of his imagination, they were incredulous and ecstatic with Billy's actual recovery.[81]

name: Carter
description: Owner of the Carter Ranch, he tried to oppose the relationship between his daughter Nancy and the rude and uneducated Bull Barker, but eventually he had to surrender and the couple married.[82]

name: Carter
description: A doctor from the town of Allentown, and father of Linda Carter, when his daughter announced that she had been accepted to Metro General Hospital as a nurse he told her that he knew they would.[83]

name: Carter
description: Linda Carter's mother and wife of the Allentown village doctor, when her daughter announced that she had been accepted to Metro General Hospital as a nurse, she told her that she and her father were very proud of her.[83]

name: Carter
description:
Minor Appearances: Spider-Man Human Torch #3
Mentions: Amazing Spider-Man (Vol. 5) #6

name: Carter
description: Carter was one of Henry Gyrich's security assistants.[46]

name: Carter
description: An employee of Hammer Industries, he give Justin Hammer a report from Sapirdyne.[86]

name: Carter
description: A boy to whom Dr. Cecilia Reyes was operating an appendectomy when she was forbidden to operate on their parents' side because they did not like the mutants.[87]

name: Carter
description: In agreement with his wife they banned Dr. Cecilia Reyes from operate on their son as they did not like the mutants.[87]

name: Carter
description: In agreement with her husband they banned Dr. Cecilia Reyes from operate on their son as they did not like the mutants.[87]

name: Carter
description: Dr. Carter was a scientist running a teleportation research facility partnered with Namorita.[88]

name: Cartwright
description: Cartwright and his colleague Van Dorn were two executives of General Electronics, the company who were present when Roger decided to hire Reed Richards.[89]

name: Cartwright
description: General Cartwright commanded the battle against the Plunderer and his men. Once they were defeated by Daredevil, he sent a statement of innoncence to the judge in London who put Ka-Zar on trial for murder, and the charges were dismissed.[90]

name: Casey
description: Mr. Casey was Carmen Pryde's bank guard in Deerfield.[91]

name: Casey
description: Casey hired Ben Grimm as a construction worker.[92]

name: Casey
description: Casey was among the reporters who came to the H.A.M.M.E.R. press conference.[93]

name: Cass
description: Cass and Donna were rescued by Lizard from the Pipers. They then died on their way back to Lubbock.[94]

name: Castro
description: Castro was a member of a boat crew in Brazil. He was part of the crew that took the New Mutants to Maderia. Before they arrived, he murdered the captain and sabatoged the boat.[95]

name: Cat
description: Cat spotted Captain America passing by the Great Falls during the fireworks for the Fourth of July, just before he was attacked by a group of terrorists.[96]

name: Cataka
description: Facing the Progenitor's judgment, Ajak was confronted with an illusion of Cataka, the first mortal who perished to resurrect her when Ajak was killed facing the Avengers of 1,000,000 BC.[97]

name: Catherine
description: Catherine interviewed the Scientist Supreme after the death of Senator Ralston.[98]

name: Cathy
description: Cathy was Paul Harper's girlfriend.[61]

name: Cathy
appearences: Daredevil: The Man Without Fear Vol 1 2
description: Cathy was a Columbia University student and an acquaintance of Matt Murdock.[99]

name: Cawley
description: F.A.A. representative Mr. Cawley was contacted by Iron Man to track the plane which was hijacked by Moses Magnum.[100]

name: Cecilia
description:
Cecilia was a member of S.W.O.R.D. and she assisted Gyrich in his attempt to send all the aliens back to their home.[101]
Cecilia tries to warn Gyrich of anomalies in her communications but he is annoyed by asking only if the alien arrests were proceeding.[102]
She connects with Brand and listens to her suggestions regarding the alien invasion.[103]
She informs Brand that the surveillance grid has a possible lead on an extinction team location.[104]
Inform Brand of the Kree Sentries situation.[105]
She warns Brand that they can't fire the defense missiles.[106]

name: Cedaric
description: Cedaric was a Viking who met Thor in the past in his human guise of Sigurd. Eric Masterson told the story of him to his son Kevin to make him understand that strength was not the only way to achieve results and not wanting to fight was not a sign of cowardice.[107]

name: Cee
description:
Cee was a member of the Yancy Street Gang who during the Civil War supported the heroes who refused to register and told the Thing that he could not be neutral but that he should take a position.[108]
During a clash between the two factions of heroes, Puppet Masters took control of Mouse, a member of the Gang of Yancy Street and made him carry a bomb and to avoid killing the Thing, Cee launched himself against Mouse making him drop the bomb but in the the explosion that followed Cee was killed.[109]

name: Celia
description: Celia was the wife of the mutant mercenary, King, who worked for the Kingpin. After her husband's retirement, the couple hid in Bulgaria, but both were killed when Knight betrayed them to S.H.I.E.L.D..[110]

name: Cesar
description: Cesar's mother was saved by the Ghost Rider from her husband.[111]

name: Cesar
description:
Cesar was a man who was accused by Mister Hyde for stealing his formula. His life was saved by Kamala Khan.
[112]

name: Cesare
description: Cesare was a Madripoor crime boss. When he learned that the escort Joon had intended to terminate the pregnancy, whose baby Cesare thought was his son, he intervened to avoid this, killing Ryan who was in Joon's company. In help of Joon Elektra intervened as a favor for Logan, as he could not intervene himself due to the pact of non-belligerence between Caesar and Tyger Tiger. However, who eliminated Cesare was Joon herself who shot Cesare while fighting with Elektra killing him and with his death she decided to carry on the pregnancy, as her son was not her but Ryan's.[113]

name: Chad
appearences: X-Men: Children of the Atom Vol 1 1
description:
Chad was a Freeport High School student who idolized William Metzger.[114]
Chad was confronted and knocked out by Hank McCoy when he tried to harass Bobby Drake.[115]
Chad was later introduced to William Metzger in Trenton.[8]
He informed him of Starkey's mutant nature.[116]
Chad helped the F.B.I. catch his former friend Starkey.[117]

name: Chad
description: Together with his mother Chad met Thor who was walking on the streets of New York, and told his mother that Thor claimed to be a god but that his priest said it was not true. Thor came to meet the boy and told him that there was a place called Asgard where there were divinities but that it was not Heaven anyway, the home of the One whose radiance dwarves also the Asgardian divinities.[118]

name: Chad
description: Chad was a boy who beat River because he told stories about people who were already dead and whose ghosts he saw. A week later Chad disappeared, made to disappear by the Adversary as a favor to River, even though River was sorry and didn't want anyone to get hurt.[119]

name: Chadwick
description:
Chadwick, a manager at Genetech, was rebuked by Walter Rosen who blamed him for Edward Lansky's escape and the subsequent deaths of two people. Chadwick tried to justify himself that he couldn't imagine that Lansky had regained his powers, but this didn't calm down Rosen who told him that he was waiting for him in his office in 10 minutes and it was better for him to come up with a solution.[40]
Chadwick gathered the Light Brigade and with them went to capture Lansky, but found that Cloak and Dagger had already defeated him. Chadwick sought to get Lansky back into Genetech custody and unleash the Light Brigade on the two heroes, but the pair easily got rid of the Light Brigade. However in the end Cloak handed Lansky over to Chadwick telling him to keep a shorter leash next time and to Chadwick's threat that he told the couple he had to report them to the authorities, Cloak replied that he wouldn't do it also because he knew he wasn't acting legally.[120]

name: Chalmers
description: Mr. Chalmers warned Doctor Hunt of the danger posed by the nuclear oscillotron.[121]

name: Chalmers
description: Chalmers was the corrupt Los Angeles District Attorney paid by The Pride and when Geoffrey Wilder was arrested for kidnapping Tamara and Tyree Robinson, he was on vacation and as soon as he heard the news he returned immediately to Los Angeles to free him but this did not satisfy Wilder in how much he spent the night in prison and then slapped him publicly and declared that he would lose his reelection as district attorney.[122]

name: Chang
description: Dr. Chang attended Reed Richards' Singularity 2010 conference in Golden, Colorado.[123]

name: Charlene
description: Charlene and her husband Red were on vacation in New York and met Thor on the street. Approaching Charlene asked him if it was true that Thursday was called after him.[124]

name: Charlene
description: Charlene was a waitress at the City Limits Diner in Austin who met Vegas.[125]

name: Charlene
description: Charlene was a long-time patron of the Velvet Morgue.[126]

name: Charlene
description: Charlene was a news reporter who interviewed Venom.[127]

name: Charles
description: Charles was the butler of the rich and greedy Andrew Malvern. Despite many years of faithful service Charles saw himself refused a period of paid vacations to cure himself from Malvern.[128]

name: Charles
description: Charles was the personal chauffeur of Vincent Farnsworth.[129]

name: Charles
description: Acting regent uncle Charles was transformed into a toad by his own spell.[130]

name: Charles
description: Charles was a henchman, personal bodyguard and chauffeur for Damon Dran, specializing in martial arts.[131]

name: Charles
description: Charles concocts a scheme with his lover to get his wife out of the picture by causing her to have a mental breakdown when confronted with a werewolf. The man thinks his lover is just using a trained animal, but when he goes to her during a night of the full moon, he observes her transformation into a werewolf. The beast ignores him and heads off to attack his wife. The man returns to his wife just as the werewolf has scratched her neck and leaves. The man is able to stop his wife's bleeding and she recovers as the monster is shot and killed by the locals. The moon affects a transformation upon his wife and she attacks him.[132]

name: Charles
description: A guest of Kerwin J. Broderick who witnesses Kraven's assault on Daredevil and who is rebuked by the Black Widow for not intervening in aid of Daredevil.[133]

name: Charles
description: Charles was the personal chauffeur of Ralph Roberts[134]

name: Charles
description: Charles was the personal chauffeur of Simon Garth.[135]

name: Charles
description: Charles was an anthropologist and colleague of John Chambers who had discovered traces of the coming of an alien race on Earth in the primitive era.[136]

name: Charles
description: On an abandoned stretch of the West Side waterfront, Charles hit Elektra with a tranquilizer dart, knocking her out.[137]

name: Charles
description: Charles was present to the party at Hotel Pierre and he was reprimanded by his wife to look too intensively at the women present.[138]

name: Charles
description: Charles and his wife Lucy were taking a trip on a balloon when the casing was hit by a darting armor of Iron Man controlled by the Omnos making the ball fall with the unfortunate couple inside but fortunately during the fall the ball caught between the branches of a tree, slowing down the fall so that Charles and his wife were saved.[139]

name: Charles
description: An old man to whom the Mask of Death by Koala Mumba guaranteed youth along with four other men to the detriment of various teenagers without their knowledge. They were forced to become members of the very successful boy-band among the teenagers of the Podunk Slam by Mr. Appletree, the one who had made them rejuvenate using the mask. But when Moon Knight showed them what was happening to their fans, they all gave up their success and youth by destroying the mask.[140]

name: Charles
description: Charles was an assistant to Dr. Druid for whom he organized a talk show presence to promote his new book, but when Druid had to intervene urgently in a demonic case by asking Charles to apologize to the host of the show, Charles remembered to Druid how this would have adversely affected his career.[141]

name: Charles
description: Charles was the butler of the famous sculptor Paul St. Pierre, alias the Grey Gargoyle in disguise.[142]

name: Charles
description: A control technician for Project Ultra-Tech.[143][144]

name: Charles
description: Charles was a gang member who killed a woman that together with other gang members killed passers-by, including two children.[145]

name: Charles
description: Charles was rescued by Spider-Man from a couple of bullies at a schoolyard in Lower Manhattan.[146]

name: Charles
description: Charles was one of the five Crusader knights rendered almost immortal to protect the Spear of Destiny.[147]

name: Charles
description: Charles was the chauffeur of Anton Hellgate.[148]

name: Charles
description: Charles was Norman Osborn's chauffeur who took him to the cemetery where his son Harry was buried and since there was a storm he offered to accompany him with his umbrella even though Norman told him it did not matter as he liked storms.[149]

name: Charles
description: In his television show, he interviewed a man who had written a book against the super-heroes[150]

name: Charles
description: An actor, Charles, was taken hostage and killed by Face.[151]

name: Charles
appearences: United States of Captain America Vol 1 2
description: Charles was the son of a Harrisburg policeman and along with his armed accomplice Taylor attempted to rob a diner but were stopped by Nichelle Wright, who however took the blame for assaulting a policeman's son.[152]

name: Charley
description: Charley was a pianist working J. Nelson Earplug.[153]

name: Charley
description: Charley was a friend of Jacko Tanner, who witnessed Hurricane fighting against Captain Britain at Thames University.[154] Charley and Tommy used to tease Jacko about how much Courtney prefered Brian Brian Braddock to him.[155]

name: Charley
description: Charley was a security guard at the Double Helix laboratory and was on duty when the lab was attacked by Romulus.[156]

name: Charley
description: Charley was a corrupt prison guard who didn't help Alan Fagan.[157]

name: Charlie
description: To pressure Marie Lathrop to marry him, Barrows shot her boyfriend and ranch hand Charlie. Marie and her father Jim then rushed Charlie to the local doctor Matthew Masters who, unknown to them, promised years ago to the Governor of Texas to never kill again and took up medicine instead. Later Barrows returned and killed Charlie.[158]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a bartender who was forced to put up with the ravings of the various customers.[159]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a real estate agent working for Richard Burns.[160]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie is the elderly worker on Ted's father's ranch, who took care of him following his father's death, along with his uncle Steve. While Steve has always been mean toward Ted, old Charlie is the only friend he has back home.

name: Charlie
description: A resident of the village of Stockton, he was thrown out of the saloon and mocked by a local bully until the intervention of Kid Colt who came to the aid of Charlie and forced the bully to apologize.[162]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie and his companion wandered around looking for a place where they would be accepted and instead they were systematically refused until they arrived at the village of Deepgulch where they were welcomed amicably and there he helped his partner build a medicine factory.[163]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a friend of Ned Flanders, the owner of a fish shop. As he visited him around the shop's closing time, Charlie re-remarked to Ned how tired he was and was starting to look like his fish.[164]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was the asian cook at Seth Maple's ranch. It was Charlie Charlie to tells Two-Gun Kid that after Maple died, Kip Rank, the ranch foreman, fired all the ranch hands and hired all new ones.[165]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie believed that Chondu the Mystic was a fake.[166]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was Mr. Baxter's assistant and helped him create the giant Ulvar mannequin to trick the alien Goliath.[167]

name: Charlie
description: He was sent by his sergeant to investigate the presence of a monster as reported by a taxi driver, but on his return Charlie reports that it was simply a costume party.[168]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a sailor who was taking a boat ride on Lake Central Park with his girlfriend when suddenly Monsteroso dived into the lake.[169]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie run a small side show at a local carnival with with his greedy and lazy partner Mike. Unbeknownst to Mike, Charlie helped to free an extradimensional being that had been stuck with his hand in Charlie's dimension and to reward the being covered Charlie of gold, a metal that in his dimension had no value.[170]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a member of the Arctic expedition that discovered the alien Oog buried in the ice, dug it out and brought it home to study it.[171]

name: Charlie
description: While inside the Metrogeneral Hospital he noticed the nurse Linda Carter and dazzled by her beauty he immediately asked the reception to be able to become a patient of the Hospital.[172]

name: Charlie
description:
At a Teen Brigade radio post, Charlie called Rick Jones to let him know that the Hulk got a pardon because he defeated the Metal Master.[173]
A while later, Charles sent a coded message to the Fantastic Four asking to help Hulk.[174]
He then confronted Ant-Man, Iron Man, Thor and the Wasp when they broke into the Teen Brigade hideout in Albuquerque.[175]
Charlie, like Rick Jones and the rest of the Teen Brigade, was trapped by Count Nefaria in his castle atop the New Jersey Palisades: They were all eventually saved by Captain America when the Avenger broke into the building.[176]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a attacker who worked for the Super Sign Co. and was among those who teased Willie Wopper because of his exaggerated tall tales.[177]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a cameraman who filmed the Fantastic Four landing at the Idlewild Airport.[178]

name: Charlie
description: Unmasked

name: Charlie
description: Colleague of the beautiful Beverly Carter and among her many suitors.[76]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was Reed Richards' pet guinea pig.[181]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie and Rocco witnessed the Angel steal some T.N.T. and fly away with it.[182]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a student that attended Midtown High School along with Peter Parker.[183]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a watchman in a construction power station where, one night, he recognized Captain America, his childhood idol, who was battling Iron Man, because the latter believed that Cap was being impersonated by Chameleon.[184]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a trans-oceanic jet pilot who witnessed Iron Man flying near the aircraft, while it was over Ireland.[185]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a friend of Johnny Storm who worked on a custom racing car with the intention of trying it on the Salt Flats.[186]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was one of the neighborhood kids who used to bully young Henry McCoy.[187][188]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a musician who witnessed Hercules eating a grand meal in a dinner club.[189]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie witnessed Thor plummeting to the ground like a streak complaining that the city was filling up with powerhouses as Hercules had also happened to be in the same place before.[189]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie and Eddie attempted to capture the X-Men, and became shocked when they suddenly vanished.[190]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was nearby when Scott lost control of his optical beam due to a fortuitous collision with a passerby who dropped his ruby quartz glasses. A friend of Charlie realizing that Scott was a mutant shouted to Charlie to capture him, but Charlie instead replied that he would go the other way.[191]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was one of two National Guard soldiers who tried to stop the Juggernaut using a bazooka but with a totally negative outcome.[192]

name: Charlie
description: As soon as she arrived at the station in New York, Millie said the word "porter" and immediately rushed Charlie who, seeing no baggage, decided to carry the same Millie out of the station.[193]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a sailor of a freighter who attempted to shoot at the X-Men.[194]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was on the dock with a friend of his when Triton emerged from the sea and seeing him both got scared because of his appearance and fled in terror.[195]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was among the group of Nassau County citizens intent on lynching Bobby Drake after he was arrested for defending himself using his powers against a bully at school.[196]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie witnessed the Hulk suddenly appearing in the middle of Times Square, but mistook him for an ad campaign by the Jolly Green Giant Company.[197]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie and a friend of his were in a truck when they met Clea and Dr. Strange in Greenwich Village and one of them gave an appreciation to Clea that she didn't appreciate doing to get rid of the truck.[198]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie encountered a fugitive Bruce Banner.[199]

name: Charlie
description: During a press conference by Jason Roland, Charlie asked the famous actor if it was true that the voice said that his fee had risen to a million dollars per film.[200]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie and Eddie were unloading a load of stolen goods under the gaze of the corrupt night watchman until the moment Daredevil intervened and knocked out all three scoundrels.[201]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a member of the Astrologer's "Family" that came into conflict against the Black Widow.[202]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was the first victim of Morbius' vampirism as soon as he arrived in New York.[203]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a mugger who, along with an accomplice, tried to rob Angel O'Hara not expecting her to become the vampire Lilith, thus becoming a victim himself.[204]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a security guard at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and was on duty when a mechanoid bear robbed the Stavros Diamond who was exhibited there.[205]

name: Charlie
description: Some time later, Charlie witnessed the Crusader attacking a branch of the Franklin Pierce National Bank.[206]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a hippy who witnessed the Fantastic Four landing 747 jet on a highway.[207]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was one of the customers of a bar on Manhattan's Waterfront who clashed in a fight with the Warriors Three.[208]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was the janitor of the apartment building where lived Tony Stark in Manhattan.[209]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was part of Samuel T. Underwood's staff and worked to convince Captain America to run for President.[210]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a paramedic who tried to save Madame Web after her encounter with the Juggernaut.[211]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was the helicopter co-pilot of the Ryker's Island prison who tried to stop the Vultures escape.[212]

name: Charlie
description: Together with his co-pilot sighted in flight Thundersword on his winged horse and decides do not tell their passengers fearing that they both are imagining it.[213]

name: Charlie
description: During the transaction of drug, Charlie and the other drug dealer were caught and captured by Spider-Man.[214]

name: Charlie
appearences: Vision and the Scarlet Witch Vol 2 4
description: Charlie was a neighbor of the Vision and Scarlet Witch when the couple lived in Leonia after their marriage and was relieved to know that they would leave the neighborhood after an arson attack destroyed their home.[215][216]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was an employee of the Bar With No Name located in Medina County.[217]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was the judge of Middletown and he was among the victims of the detonation of the gamma bomb carried out by the Leader.[218]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was shot and killed by James Woo for sheltering Nick Fury in the sewers beneath the Grand Central Station.[219]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was businessman who managed to bring Havok and Scarlett to Poland.[220]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was the winner of the Winnipeg Science Fair and that he abused drugs.[221]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was in the audience at Fogwell's Gym acclaiming an amnesiac and blindfolded Matt Murdock who challenged a professional boxer.[222]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie and his partner tried to rob Johnny Blaze in the night at Hoboken thinking he was a tourist but they got the worst and Charlie found himself disarmed and whining on his knees with Blaze's shotgun aimed at his head, however Blaze did not shoot him but aimed all in frightening him.[223]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie, like half the life in the whole universe, seemingly disappeared in front of his friend.[224]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a sewer worker who witnessed the Abomination wandering the New York sewers.[225]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie belonged to the film staff who was taken hostage by the Night Shift and rescued by the West Coast Avengers.[226]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a security guard in a shopping center in Toronto and was in service when there was the assault of Omega Flight against some members of Alpha Flight present there and he was a victim of Bile.[227]

name: Charlie
description: One of the mercenaries and member of the Model Soldiers.[228]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was the only one of the three orderlies who survived Adam Casim's assault outside the hospital.[229]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a serial killer who taught Rose how to make their murders artistic. After somehow succeeding in defeating both Daredevil and Black Widow in combat, he was killed by the Black Widow herself that broke his neck with a chain.[230]

name: Charlie
description: Jealous of Bob O'Bryan because he had blown the contract for the special effects of a new film, Charlie built a contraption to control the robot of Brown and star of the movie It, the Living Colossus and with it create confusion and destruction thus blaming Bob O'Bryan and appropriating the contract for the film, but during the assault of It intervened Wonder Man, also the protagonist of the film, who defeated It while Charlie was discovered and arrested.[231]

name: Charlie
description: He was hunting with his friend Mike just when landed Galen-Kor and his team of Kree rebels who killed them both.[232]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a member of the gang of drug manufacturers in Brooklyn and was present when their manufacturing lab was attacked by Cloak and Dagger.[233]

name: Charlie
description: Fast Charlie was beaten by Bloody Mary for abusing his wife.[234]

name: Charlie
description: While he was having fun with his friend Jay Glazer at Wackyworld, on their little car jumped over Risque fleeing from Caliban and asked if they would give her a ride.[235]

name: Charlie
description: Years later, Charlie piloted the Champion Air six-one-niner whose wing was accidentally damaged during a battle between Iron Man and Warbird.[236]

name: Charlie
description: He commented on the vicissitudes that occurred to his colleague Malik and how much he risked and that if he did not find the religion, nothing would have succeeded.[237]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a young martial arts student in Drake's dojo.[238]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a soldier who served in the secret government Project Armageddon.[239]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was one of the reporters who attended Senator Myles Clennon's press conference at his country estate in Westchester County.[58]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie is a student at Payton Noble High School and a former member of Shooter's gang.[240]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was one of the paramedics who assisted Mary Bastelli.[241]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was an inmate on Ryker's Island and was punished by the Enforcers who broke his arm for using the shower used exclusively by the Kingpin.[242]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a corrupt prison guard.[243] He helped Kingpin dealing with Spider-Man.[244]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie, along with the rest of the Mason County Sheriff's Department, was part of a county wide gas station and tour bus robbing ring. After robbing the tour bus that Deadpool was on, Charlie was tracked down to the police department by Deadpool, where he and the rest of the crooked cops were incarcerated.[245]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a security guard at a Mall in Alberta and was present when the Mall was attacked by members of the Hand and was killed by one of them.[246]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a Nazi follower of the Red Skull and was killed by Sabretooth to take possession of his truck to infiltrate the Avengers by surprise in the Nazi base.[247]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was with his mom in the subway when the Evolutionaries attacked the Morlocks derailing the train carriage and thanks to the intervention of Mark Sim, Charlie avoided getting hurt even though everyone in the carriage blamed Mark for the incident.[248]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was the cameraman for reporter Phoebe Gold's outdoor shooting.[249]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was a piragua vendor and an acquaintance of Mara Rodriguez.[250]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie warned Ms. Marvel, who was traveling on the roof of his bus, they arrived in front of the City Hall, the place where Ms. Marvel had to go.[251]

name: Charlie
description: Charlie was an orderly at the Central Indiana State Mental Institution where Greg Salinger was hospitalized during his period of treatment after his first exploit as the Foolkiller.[252]

name: Charlie
description: A detective in the LVMPD, he is ordered by his superior to accompany Slate to a specific cell and then leave him alone and walk away.[253]

name: Charlie
appearences: Cloak and Dagger: Negative Exposure - Marvel Digital Original Vol 1 3
description: Charlie was the security guard in Martin Li's building in Los Angeles. Suspicious of the presence of Mr. Li (at that time not owned by Mr. Negative) and other people at a strange time, he warned the Inner Demons of their presence.[254]

name: Charlie
description:
Charlie was an actor who played the role of Spider-Man in the Mysterio biopic.[255]
He renounced his part after the umpteenth incident that occurred during the filming of the film.[256]

name: Charlita
description: Cecilia was a little girl who was playing on the beach when they were rescued by Man-Slaughter, not having realized they were about to be attacked by an infected orca.[257]

name: Charlotte
description: Charlotte was saved by Nightcrawler from a fall of construction bricks.[258]

name: Charlotte
appearences: Spider-Island: I Love New York City Vol 1 1
description: Charlotte was a six-year-old girl who acquired Spider-Man-like powers after being infected with the Spider-Virus. She defeated and captured two would-be robbers who had broken into her house and tied up her parents to rob their apartment.[259]

name: Charnoff
description: Mrs. Charnoff used to run the Saint Joan's Orphanage.[260]

name: Charteris
description: Captain Charteris was John Kowalski's main accuser during the court martial trial where he accused him of espionage and high treason and dishonorably discharged him from the Marine Corps.[261]

name: Chase
appearences: Strange Academy Presents: Death of Doctor Strange Vol 1 1
description: Chase and Avery were the two Weirdworld Mapmakers.
