When Amora and her son Alvi were looking for the wizard Pulsari who had taken Alvi's twin, Iric, thanks to an agreement signed between Amora and Pulsari years earlier, they turned to the Mapmakers who in exchange for an ice cream each drew a map, even if in their childish drawing it was difficult to interpret.[262]

name: Chavez
description: Chavez was a technician who worked at the Mexican Army base where Norrin Radd was held prisoner. He warned that due to a solar storm Suzi Endo was needed to re-establish communications.[263]

name: Chaz
description: Chaz was the leader of the bikers who harassed Connie.[264]

name: Chelsea
description: Chelsea was an acquaintance of Fife.[265]

name: Chen
description: Chen was a thug who harassed Madame Joy and was killed by Jessan Hoan.[266]

name: Chen
description:
Doctor Chen from the Hu Po Psychiatric Institute showed Karim Mahwash Najeeb where the Mandarin was being kept.[267]
He was then immediately killed by Darius Faraz.[268]

name: Chen
description: Chen was a hardware dealer at Ludlow Street who was shown a StarkTech hard drive by Natalia Romanova.[269]

name: Cheryl
description: Cheryl was one of the party-goers to Graviton's retreat.[270]

name: Chesterton
description: Mr. Chesterton was a representative for the council of crime bosses in New York City, who told Tombstone that his application had been rejected because of Nick Kaska.[271]

name: Chet
description: Chet was an HIV-positive person on the verge of suicide who called the general emergency hotline and talked all night with Betty Ross, before dying in a train crash without telling her his girlfriend's name.[272]

name: Chiang
description: Prof. Chiang was a scientist who produced the Wild Tiger drug for the Wild Tiger Mob and when asked to reduce production time she replied to Deng Ling-Xiao that she was unable to change the laws of physics and therefore he had to wait. Ling-Xiao did not like that ironic response, as he stabbed it with his claws and killed it.[273]

name: Chico
description: Chico was a club bouncer who happened to know Johnny Storm.[274]

name: Chico
description: Chico was a junkyard owner and an acquaintance of Deadpool.[275]

name: Childs
description: Childs was one the mercenaries sent by Mr. Raven to capture Dani Moonstar at 1128 Mission Street.[276]

name: Chilton
description:
Astrid Bloom's mother was widowed when Astrid was 7, but shortly thereafter she remarried Aubrey Chilton and had another daughter upon whom she poured out her maternal love at Astrid's expense, and when at thirteen Astrid revealed to her mother and adoptive father of her powers as soon as they emerged they refused her completely.[277]
It was later revealed that Astrid was not hunted by her on her parents, but she mentally controlled her 5 year old sister Yvonne who killed her parents in her sleep and Yvonne was interned.[278]

name: Chip
description: Chip was one of the explorers who were crushed by a sea monster after discovering an ancient Viking dragonship.[279]

name: Chloe
description: Mentions: Ghost Rider (Vol. 4) #1

name: Chloe
description: Chloe was a child who was trapped in the rubble of a collapsed building and was rescued by the Vision.[281]

name: Choi
description: Mr. Choi was the leader of a South Korean gangster family called the Choi Faction who employed the body-snatcher Mongdal to compromise patriotic hero Taegukgi and use him as leverage for a coup. However, Mongdal had no interest in the Choi Faction's plan and only wanted to use Taegukgi to wreak as much havoc as possible, so he hired the death cult known as the Maidens to slaughter the Choi Faction. The piled-up bodies of the Choi Faction were found inside their base in the abandoned Alps Ski Resort by Taegukgi's Tiger Division teammate White Fox and conscripted ally the Black Cat. Using facial recognition software installed in her mask, White Fox identified one of the bodies as Mr. Choi.[282]

name: Choll
appearences: Captain America: What Price Glory? Vol 1 1
description: Choll was one of the mobsters who were confronted Captain America for roughing up Jimmy Sanders.[283]

name: Chong
description: Detective Chong was killed by Hydra agents after helping Jessica Drew.[284]

name: Chowder
description: Doctor Chowder was an elderly physician who lived on the island of Harrow's Point in the early 1900s. Chowder was called upon to examine young Angelica Neal who had suffered from a vampire attack. Chowder immediately recognized the symptoms and informed her father Frank that his daughter was the victim of a vampire. He performed a blood transfusion between Angelica and her mother Laurie. Rather than administering conventional medical care, Doctor Chowder provided Frank Neal with a string of garlic cloves (which he just happened to have been carrying on his person). He advised Neal to hang them from his daughter's window. That evening, Dracula attacked again, but this time his victim was Laurie Neal. The viciousness of the attack, in combination with the blood she already loss due to the transfusion, resulted in Laurie's immediate death. Doctor Chowder attended the funeral service officiated by bishop Father McFarland and later accompanied McFarland and Frank Neal on an attack against Dracula. Though McFarland was killed, Doctor Chowder assisted Frank Neal in operating a lighthouse beacon which drove the vampire away. Doctor Chowder's activities following this incident are unknown, though it is safe to assume that he likely passed away of natural causes in the intervening years.[285]

name: Chris
description: Chris was the agent of the boxer Lefty Belton who together with Lefty's girlfriend tried to make up the boxing match by betting against Lefty's opponent and also involving Two-Gun Kid who made their frauds fail.[286]

name: Chris
description: Chris was a security technician on the train from New York City to Montreal which was attacked by the Beetle, in order to rob the shipment of the Regina necklace.[287]

name: Chris
description: Chris was a crack addict who was blackmailed by a drug dealer because he owed him money, so Chris asked for help from his cousin Slag who took care of the drug dealer but who could not convince Chris to get into rehab.[288]

name: Chris
description: Chris was a trainee of the Taskmaster Academy and together with another trainee they mocked Siren telling her that she was Taskmaster's pet and she don't had what it takes to cut it, to which Siren gave a painful lesson to both students.[289]

name: Chris
description: Chris was returning home on his SUV when he was involved in the fight between the Punisher and Deadpool and he himself was hit on the head unintentionally by Deadpool.[290]

name: Chris
description: A nurse from Sioux Falls who handed a corpse to the pathologist Karen to be able to do an autopsy.[291]

name: Chris
description: A paramedic who handed a corpse to the pathologist Karen at the Morgue in Sioux City commenting that the body resembled the recovered corpses drained of their lifeblood in a bus in Colorado.[292]

name: Chris
description: Chris was an employee at Merx Pharmaceutical and was present in the company's offices during the clash between Spider-Man and Mysterio.[293]

name: Chris
description: Chris and his girlfriend were fleeing the law after robbing a bank until they had a serious car accident and Chris was seriously injured. Chris was saved by Wasp who cauterized his lung wound.[294]

name: Chris
description: Chris was the foreman on the construction site of the North Pole Children's Hospital where Michael Pointer also worked.[295]

name: Chris
description: Chris was the producer of the television show written by Catherine Donovan when she was still separated from Carol Danvers.[296]

name: Chris
description: Chris was a high school student and a member of a group of white supremacists.[297]

name: Chris
description: Chris was an Inuk who lived in Fairbanks, Alaska, with his daughter Tiffany and his great-grandfather Auckaneck who in the past worshipped the frozen Cap believing him to be a god and that Chris did not want him to tell that story to his daughter.[298]

name: Chris
description: Chris was Sally's son.[299]

name: Chris
description: Chris was a member of the Tombstone's gang, who had been charged with eliminating Kingpin, but who himself was killed by Fisk.[240]

name: Chris
description: Chris was a homeless girl who lived in Central Park near Harlem and gave Patient 86 some information.[300]

name: Chris
appearences: War of the Realms: War Scrolls Vol 1 1
description: Chris was a friend of Jae Yeong. When Malekith's forces invaded Manhattan during the War of the Realms, Chris and his friends ran towards the Sanctum Sanctorum. Chris fell and hurt himself, and Jae stayed behind to attend to him, leaving the two of them at the mercy of a group of Dark Elves. They were saved by Wolverine, and then reached the Sanctum Sanctorum.[301]

name: Christina
description: Christina was the master of ceremonies of the Elysée Palace in Paris and she recommended the utmost precision in advent of the visit of the dictator Aziz Nabavi to discuss the actions to be taken because of the situation in his country.[302]

name: Christina
appearences: Strange Academy Presents: Death of Doctor Strange Vol 1 1
description: Christina was a waitress in a pub where the Enchantress and her son Alvi were discussing the pact she had made with the sorcerer Pulsari about having to give him her firstborn, and during the discussion Amora apologized to Christina and her colleague Michael of the animosity of his son. After the mother and son couple left, Christina pointed out that Amora hadn't paid her bill, and Michael replied that she never does.[262]

name: Christine
description: Christine was rescued by Iron Man from a collapsing terminal building.[303]

name: Christophe
description: Inspector Christophe helped Tony Stark uncover the mystery of the Night Phantom, who kidnapped him. He was eventually rescued by Iron Man.[304]

name: Chu
description:
Dr. Chu visited the rescue camp in the Custer State Park with Warbird.[305]
As the red cloud began spreading through South Dakota, they then moved to St. Mary's Hospital.[306]

name: Chuck
description: Chuck and Bob recognized Prof. August Hopper.[307]

name: Chuck
description: Chuck was a bodybuilder who witnessed the Inhumans landing on a private beach.[308]

name: Chuck
description: Chuck was one of the security guards assigned to the Dallas plant.[309]

name: Chuck
description: In a weird twist of fate, a Man-Thing-shaped candle (created after his New York rampage) was drugged and given to Ted Sallis' former love interest Sainte-Cloud by her jilted lover Chuck, causing her to see Man-Thing hallucinations; exposed to the drug himself, a terrified Chuck badly burnt his face on the candle.[310]

name: Chuck
description:
Chuck and Jane Hanson reported Billy O'Koren's acquittal of the charge of second degree murder in the slaying of Flapper.[311]
Chuck and Katy reported the news about Bloody Mary's serial beatings.[234]

name: Chuck
description: Chuck was among the White Rabbit Gang members who attempted to rob the Kwikkee Burger.[312]

name: Chuck
description: During the news he launches the external service of the correspondent Linda Mai about the activity of the vigilante in the city.[313]

name: Chuck
description: Chuck and his wife Ellen with their small newborn Bobby gave Eddie Brock a lift, stopping at a diner, where they were held hostage by a gang of robbers. When one of the robbers began molesting his newborn, Chuck fought back but the robber shot him in the shoulder. Later responding to the taunts of the bandits, Eddie decided to intervene and eliminated the entire gang.[314]

name: Chuck
description: Chuck was one of Mr. Brazo's henchmen, who was killed by his boss because he didn't notice Carson was a federal agent.[315]

name: Chuck
description: Mentions: Hulk (Vol. 2) #31

name: Chuck
description: Chuck was a mercenary in the service of Wilson Fisk who attempted to arrest Boomerang, while it was in effect a way to distract him and get Bullseye's task done.[318]

name: Chuck
description: Chuck was the doorman of the building of a Janet van Dyne's apartment in wich she had housed Jennifer Walters.[319]

name: Chuck Barris
description: Chuck Barris is a winged ant aided Scott Lang during an infiltration of Stark Tower.[320]

name: Chumley
description: Mr. Chumley was the executive vice-president of the Tokyo branch of Fireheart Enterprises and was concerned by the sudden and unexpected appearance of the Fireheart's owner in Japan.[321]

name: Cindy
description: Cindy was a ranch girl at Cheery-O's Dude Ranch who met Clinton Barton and Two-Gun Kid.[322]

name: Cindy
description: Cindy witnessed her boyfriend being crushed by the anomaly in Mount Pressure.[323]

name: Cindy
description: Cindy was part of a blind group who helped Daredevil when the entire city was struck blind.[324]

name: Cirello
description: After the beating of the fight with Denny Haynes, Jessica Jones went to the emergency room of the hospital where she was treated by Doctor Cirello and who assured her that she would not have permanent damage.[325]

name: Cissy
description: Cissy and Mitchell were a couple that were kidnapped in Central Park by the Ludberdites in order to control their minds and offer them an artificial type of peace.[326]

name: Clancy
description: Clancy was a Starcore jet pilot who was saved from Havok's attack at JFK Airport by Nightcrawler.[327]

name: Clancy
description: Clancy was one of the state troopers who were watching over Bruce Banner in Simetry.[328]

name: Clarissa
description: Clarissa was one of Freddy Moyer's models.[329]

name: Clark
description: Clark was guarding the Sword of Liberty's camp but he was taken from behind by the Punisher who broke his neck.[330]

name: Claude
description: Claude was the father of the mutant boy Etienne. When he entered his son's room where his mutant powers had just been activated and consumed his body, Claude became his first host until he found another host to move his essence to.[331]

name: Claudia
description: Claudia was a slave girl who was given two ruby earrings by Eliphas.[332]

name: Clay
appearences: Daredevil: The Man Without Fear Vol 1 4
description: One of the Kingpin's men, Clay was killed by Larks for his incompetence.[333]

name: Clay
description:
Clay was a motorcycle rider affiliated with the Hell's Angels.[334]
After shooting Johnny Blaze, he shot himself.[335]

name: Clem
description: Clem was a motorized policeman in Arizona who chased Johnny Blaze for having exceeded the speed limit, but he and his partner were eventually left behind by the speeding cyclist.[336]

name: Clem
description: Clem was an enhanced individual who was the opponent of Kate Bishop at an illegal fight club. He nearly beat her until he was defeated and taken into custody.[337]

name: Clem
description: Clem was fishing in the swamp on a boat with his friend Zeke when he yelled that he had caught a very large one, but in fact it turned out to be a monstrous being who overturned the boat while Zeke said it was not a fish but the Glob.[338]

name: Clementine
description: Clementine worked as a waitress at Bill's Diner.[339]

name: Clemson
description: Clemson and his twin brother Durnis were poaching in Azania when after Durnis hit a zebra with the shotgun, Deadpool cut his left arm. Later on during their return with their private jet they were assaulted by Jack O'Lantern who threw a pumpkin bomb into the jet that made him explode killing them both.[340]

name: Clifton
description: Clifton was a patient in the Queens County Hospital that didn't want to stay, but after that, he saw Spider-Man he insisted to stay in the hospital.[321]

name: Clyde
description: Clyde tried to shoot Daredevil as he attempted to rescue Judge Lewis from the Owl's mock trial, but he was immediately knocked down.[341]

name: Clyde
description: Clyde was one of the former students of Midtown High School that attended the Midtown High School's Pre-Reunion Bash.[343]

name: Clyde
description: A member of the Tombstone's Gang. When Spider-Man went to the place White Rabbit had told him where he would find Tombstone, he had no idea it was a trap and when he got into Tombstone's van, he ordered Clyde to start the van and so the trap set off.[344]

name: Cohuelo
description: Dr. Cohuelo was the father of Gabriel Cohuelo, one of the first new mutants to arise after the Decimation. He allowed Hope Summers and the X-Men to help stabilie his son's powers.[345]

name: Cohuelo
description: Mrs. Cohuelo was the mother of Gabriel Cohuelo, one of the first new mutants to arise after the Decimation. She allowed Hope Summers and the X-Men to help stabilie her son's powers.[345]

name: Colby
description:
Government agent Colby shared intelligence with Black Fox and Pixie of the First Line about the criminal activities of Ionel Ceaucescu and his contacts with the vampire Nocturne.[346]
Years later, on orders from Avengers' government liason Raymond Sikorski, Colby and another government agent carried out espionage actions against the Avengers.[347]
And still on Sikorski's orders, Colby and Agent Ward questioned Avengers' butler Edwin Jarvis.[348]

name: Colchiss
description: Mr. Colchiss and his wife lived a happy family life until their son Chris accidentally killed them with his powers.[349]

name: Colchiss
description: Mrs. Colchiss and her husband lived a happy family life until their son Chris accidentally killed them with his powers.[349]

name: Cole
description: The sheriff of a town in New Mexico, he intervened to quell the beating of Pike and his men against Matt Murdock, but soon afterwards advised Murdock to leave the town and researched who he was.[350]

name: Cole
description: Father Cole was the guiding priest of the Nightguard but turned out to be a vampire and betrayed them.[351]

name: Coleman
description: Dr. Coleman assisted Mac Gargan in the Raft's infirmary.[352]

name: Coleman
description: During a series of fires following the Spider-Virus infestation, her father, being one of those infected, took care to save her and her mother feeling only responsible for them at the expense of the neighbors who perished in the fire.[353]

name: Colin
description: Colin was blind kid who was scared of Victor von Doom.[354]

name: Colin
description: Colin died for an inoperable brain tumor at the base of the skull, despite Stephen Strange's efforts to cure him.[355]

name: Colleen
description: Colleen was the fiancée of Dean "The Deadman" Donnelly, an ex-gunslinger for hire, who became the sheriff of Clearwater, Arizona.[356]

name: Collin
description: Collin lost a street race against Robbie Reyes in Arizona, and proposed to repeat a double or nothing in Los Angeles. Collin won this second race due to the interference of rats mutated by the Hyde Formula, so Eli Morrow took control of Reyes' body and beat up Collin to claim the money.[357]

name: Collins
description: She was the sister of the professional boxer Curly Collins and pretended that Two-Gun Kid was her brother to make him fight in the ring instead of Curly to prevent his brother from being killed as reported to her.[358]

name: Collins
description: Collins was the notary who read the last wishes of Robert Hammer in favor of his two young members and after the death of Mr. Hammer he made sure that these wishes were respected.[359]

name: Collins
description: Playing poker with Black Jack Barker, he asked him how he could have four aces if he himself had one and feeling offended by being labeled as a cheat Black Jack shot Collins at point-blank range by killing him.[360]

name: Collins
description: The Human Torch and Toro pay a visit to Professor Collins at his observatory to witness the approach of what the professor believes to be a meteor, however the Torch thinks it might be an alien space ship, a notion that Collins dismisses as foolishness. When it lands nearby, Collins shows the two heroes where it is on his map and Toro notes that it is the same region where the some Vampire stories are coming from.[361]

name: Collins
description: Mr. Collins was a science fiction movie director who got some help from a real alien and flying saucer, but the film flops when the footage of the saucer is dismissed as too phony-looking.[362]

name: Collins
description: Mary Collins's father, because of his injury, changed Mary's mind about what the man of his life should be like.[363]

name: Collins
description:
Nurse Collins worked at Blessing Hospital in Manhattan assisting Dr. Wirtham. When a patient had a heart attack in their presence, Dr. Wirtham sent Nurse Collins to get emergency equipment so that he could secretly use his powers to save the patient.[364]
Later Nurse Collins witnessed a criminal assault with a knife by Dr. Wirtham noting that he was injured, but he calmed her by telling her it was only a scratch.[365]

name: Collins
description: He was among the members of the O.I.E. who scoured in armor for the city questioning by force anyone who had come into contact with Sleepwalker.[366]

name: Collins
description: Collins was a security guard at the Frost Enterprises building located in the Upper West Side of Manhattan and alarmed the other members of the security that there had been a security breach in the building not knowing that the one who was broken inside was in fact Emma Frost in the body of Iceman.[367]

name: Collins
description: Collins accompanied by helicopter Mr. Livingstone at the Raft.[368]

name: Coltrane
description: Coltrane was a dog owned by Mr. Nancy, actually the Vudu god Kwaku Anansi, who pretended to be a con artist pretending to be blind and begging for alms. The sign where he said he was blind was actually addressed to Coltrane but the people passing by didn't bother asking who the blind was, him or Coltrane.[369]

name: Conal
description: Conal befriended Dazzler when she and several other X-Men were staying on Muir Island. He was with Dazzler when she performed secretly in a local pub.[370]

name: Conner
description: Sean's son, Conner was rescued by Spider-Man from a building on fire.[371]

name: Conner
description: A Hell's Kitchen boss had a local girl deliver Conner's amputated hand with which she had to fingerprint guns with which crimes had been committed in order to blame him, but the boss did not know that Conner was left-handed while his amputated hand was the right one.[372]

name: Connie
description: Connie was one of Liz Allan's friends, who saw her going off with Peter Parker.[373]

name: Connie
description: Connie was Mr. Fixit's chaffeur.[264]

name: Connie
description: Connie was a reporter who was outside the Tower of London awaiting the unveiling of the UK's new team of super heroes and witnessed the explosion created by Steve Darwin.[264]

name: Connor
appearences: Lords of Empyre: Celestial Messiah Vol 1 1
description: Connor was a neighbor of Mantis and Quoi when they lived in Connecticut. After a negative first approach, Connor and Quoi became friends and Connor was present when Quoi first developed his powers.[374]

name: Conrad
description: Conrad was a Vault employee who was killed by Carnage during his escape attempt from a mobile transport unit in Colorado.[233]

name: Conrad
description: Conrad is a regular at the Three Strikes Bar. Unlike most of the other patrons, Conrad does not have any powers, but he does always pick up the tab.[375]

name: Constance
description: Mister Conrad was a director of the Omni Corporation in the United Kingdom. He was overseeing ivory poaching in Tsavo, Kenya.[376] Conrad was murdered by the Green Knight as a retaliation for violating the balance with nature.[377]

name: Consuelo
appearences: Decimation: House of M - The Day After Vol 1 1
description: Constance was an MI13 agent who told Pete Wisdom that he had kept his mutant powers intact after M-Day[378]

name: Coogan
description: Consuelo was a secretary working at the San Pedro Cat & Dog Clinic.[379]

name: Cooley
description: Coogan was one of Peter Quill's schoolmates.[380]

name: Cooper
description: Cooley was one of the schoolmates who were bullying Thomas H. Hanson.[21]

name: Cooperton
description: Sergeant Cooper investigated Valeria Richards' disappearance.[381]

name: Cora
description: Mr. Cooperton was employed in a bank which was robbed by the Scorpion.[382]

name: Corbel
description: Cora was Henry's wife.[307]

name: Corbel
description: Wandering the country, Viv met an elderly lady named Cora in rural Kansas and helped her fix her power and telephone lines. Cora hosted Viv in her home and gave her a series of tips.[383]

name: Corbin
description: Dr. Corbel was an old acquaintance of Logan.[384]

name: Corday
description: Corbin retrieves Thor's helmet after it fell to him due to the brawl between Thor and Hercules in a bar.[385]

name: Corey
description: Doctor Corday diagnosed Tony Stark with a deterioration in his nervous systerm that could prove terminal, and advised him to check into the clinic, but Stark politely refused, but promised to monitor the condition himself.[386]

name: Cory
description: During an unnatural cyclonic blizzard in Calgary, Corey and his friends decided to get people off the street.[387]

name: Cosie
description: At the end of the Reckoning War and with the return of the Moon in the sky and the consequent tides, Professor Jeffers and his team studied the consequences of the event and Cory, a member of his research staff, analyzing the radar for the movement of the plankton initially thought that what he observed was promising and then immediately had to change his mind.[388]

name: Cosgrove
description: The owner of Cosie's Motel, Cosie was killed by Beaver Stillwell.[389]

name: Costello
description: Mr. Cosgrove was a night club owner whose cash box was robbed by Trago.[390]

name: Cotton
description: Doctor Costello was among the members of a commission of psychiatrists that was to decide on the recovery of Stan Carter and thus be able to release him at liberty. Costello presented the case as he was convinced of the cure and managed to convince the other members for release.[391]

name: Courtney
description: Mr. Cotton was a worker for the Welfare Bureau who visited two sisters, Agnes and Laura after receiving complaints about the smell and filth of the house. He threatened to call an exterminator on the rats and attemepted to kill one himself, one named Caesar, who attacked and bit him back. After he killed the rat, the women were distraught and lead him to their clean cellar where they chained up Mr Cotton and fed him to the rest of the rats.[6]

name: Craig
description: Courtney's boyfried Stephan was making the marriage proposal to her just when Thor shot down by Enrakt fell near their table. Believing the omens Stephan decided not to marry Courtney anymore.[392]

name: Cranston
description: Craig was a member of Las Vegas C.S.I. who was killed by Deadpool.[275]

name: Cranston
description: Craig is a robot dog that was created by Doc Croc and had the ability to release sleep gas.[393]

name: Cranston
description: Craig was a member of C.R.A.D.L.E. who was instructed by Miriam Blakemoore to intervene at a gathering organized by Roxxon in which she would make sure that there would be confrontations.[394]

name: Cranston
description:
While investigating Olio group, Yelena got herself captured until Natasha intervened to save her, and then pointed to Craig as the boy she was supposed to take away to get answers.[395]
Craig was among the people who were captured and imprisoned by Host who fortunately was spotted by Natasha and released.[396]
Craig introduced Will to Natasha, the Starfish that Living Blade was looking for, and Will hung up and healed Natasha's arm that had been severed in the fight with Living Blade using his powers.[397]

name: Crawford
description: Doorman and bouncer at Manhattan's Hellfire Club, he warmly welcomed Tony Stark but tried to prevent Logan from entering, until Sebastian Shaw intervened and told Cranston to let them both enter.[398]

name: Creel
description: Crawford was one of Morris Sackett's teammates on the New York Stride.[265]

name: Creeper
description: Carl Creel's father was a violent guy who mistreated and beat his son as a child who consequently became a violent person too.[399]

name: Creighton
description: Creeper was a pit bull who was killed by Tigra.[379]

name: Crespi
description: Creighton was one of the students from the Cresskill School for the Blind who were rescued by Matthew Murdock when their bus crashed during a snowstorm in the Catskill Mountains.[400]

name: Cristina
description: Mentioned: Amazing Spider-Man #257

name: Cristina
description: Detective Crespi was a small town cop in Lawrenceville. He called Jamie Madrox asking if he knew of a woman who lived in her old house in Lawrenceville and than announced him that woman had been killed. When Madrox together with X-Factor went with Crespi to the morgue to view the corpse, when the name of the woman's son was pronounced, the corpse woke up screaming the child's name and immediately attacked those present. He lifted Crespi by choking him, but he was saved by the intervention of X-Factor.[403]

name: Cronenburg
appearences: Fantastic Four: ¡Isla de la Muerte! Vol 1 1
description: Cristina was among the festive crowd in San Juan that celebrated Ben Grimm as El Morrito and was recognized by Ben and greeted by him.[404]

name: Crosby
description: Dr. Cronenburg witnessed Dr. Burroughs letting Dr. Hope continue his experiments in the secret Mad Dog ward.[405]

name: Crow
description: Crosby escorted Ant-Man inside the Vision's body and it was soon hit by the android's immune system.[406]

name: Cruikshank
description: Crow was a law office intern at the Nelson and Murdock Law Office.[407]

name: Crusher
description:
Mrs. Cruikshank was the headmistress of the Snow Valley School for Girls. After the illness that happened to her Emma Frost she decided that the midterma was postponed to the next day. Shortly thereafter, hearing some complaints about Emma's midterm grades, she had Emma repeat the test but soon after receiving a generous donation from Emma's father, Mrs. Cruikshank tore up the new test by declaring that she had taken one more time a perfect exam.[408]
Mrs. Cruinkshank licenziò Ian Kendall su ordine di Winston Frost.[409]

name: Cruz
description: "Crusher" wanted badly to become a heavyweight boxer, and when his manager mentioned that a new company was making pills that made you put on weight instantly, he decided to break into their lab and steal the pills.

name: Cruz
description: Crusher was a wrestler who once trained with Captain America, but preferred to go back to the wrestling ring rather than doing another workout with Cap.[411]

name: Cruz
description: Crusher was hired by Kingpin as a training partner, but he couldn't compete against him and was eventually fired.[412]

name: Crystal
description: Cruz was in a position of command at the Power Broker, Inc. and he underwent the treatment of Dr. Karl Malus thus obtaining a super strength. When Steve Rogers infiltrated the corrupt boxing round, Cruz attempted to capture and subject him to Power Broker's empowerment treatment, but Steve revealed himself and defeated Cruz despite his super strength.[413]

name: Cuchillo
description: Crystal was a nurse at Mercy Medical Center. She was on duty at the station outside Tempest Monroe's hospital room when Cecelia Monroe came to visit her comatose daughter.[414]

name: Curly
description: Cuchillo was the boss of a Colombian cartel who was killed along with many of his Roxxon Oil allies by El Dragon to take over the Cuchillo Cartel.[415]

name: Curtis
description: Namor carried out the mundane task of helping a man named Curly catch a fish so his friends would stop laughing at him.[416]

name: Curtis
description: Curly was a janitor at Centerville Junior High in Centerville, California.[417]

name: Curtis
description: Curly went out with Patsy for a date to please her father who could not bear that she go steady with Buzz and wanted her to date someone else.[418]

name: Cutter
description: Curtis was one of the ball court punks who were reprimanded by Spider-Man.[64]

name: Cutter
description: Curtis was attacked by the Anti-Venom in the Brooklyn Navy Yard.[419]

name: Cuvvers
description: Mr. Cutter was a prison inmate in which Loki was also imprisoned when he was immortalized in Jake Olson's body. Cutter acted like a boss inside the prison and was about to punish Loki when he was released from Karnilla.[420]

name: Cynthia
description: Cuvvers was Senator Ernest McJavit's assistant.[421]

name: Cyril
description: Cynthia was one of the many jet-set girls to whom Tony Stark accompanied himself to forget Pepper Potts and who by the way wrongly called her Sandra.[422]

name: Cyril
description: Cynthia was one of Sat-Yr-Nin's amazonian guards.[423]

name: Dagoo
description: Dagoo was a pagan necromancer who cursed Bloodscream.[1]

name: Dahl
description: Secretary Dahl was meeting with Nick Fury to discuss his concern when Captain America revealed his true identity to the public. During the conversation, Captain America arrived during the meeting, with Dahl trying to get him kicked out. Fury was more accepting and gave him the information he wanted. Secretary Dahl told Fury he was going to make his life hell for doing so.[2]

name: Daisy
description: Daisy was Max's mother.[3]

name: Dakota
description: Dakota assisted Two-Gun Kid in the killing of a ruthless boss of the town Jericho.[4]

name: Dalca
appearences: Black Panther: The Man Without Fear Vol 1 516
description: Dalca was a henchman in the Vlad Dinu crime family. Vlad ordered Dalca to create chaos in Hell's Kitchen but Black Panther learned about it and forced Lupei to leave the city.[5]

name: Dale
description:
Dale was a Hawkeye cosplayer who met Lance Hunter aboard the Diamond Porpoise cruise ship.[6]
He was called as a witness in the Garfield Edsal murder case.[7]

name: Dallas
description: Mentions: Venom: Lethal Protector (Vol. 2) #5

name: Dalmus
description: Dalmus was a Gunderman who was humiliated by Conan in front of Commander Metrius. He was eventually killed by the Cimmerian during the battle of Venarium.[9]

name: Dan
description: Dan was a non-commissioned officer who ordered to switch on red alert as soon as an unidentified blip was plunging toward Midtown, approaching from inland.[10]

name: Dan
description: Dan was one of the best Taskmaster students and was hired with others for a sparring partner session dressed as Captain America. The opponent turned out to be the Red Skull who killed Lenny and the other sparring partners in an extremely simple way.[11]

name: Dan
description: Dan was A.J. Patton's husband. Dan questioned his husband's decision of inviting Flash Thompson, his high school bully, to their house for closure, but A.J. said that looking at Thompson only made him feel pity now.[12]

name: Dan
description: Dan was a policeman in Annapolis who spotted Elizabeth Ross.[13]

name: Dan
description: Dan was Brandon's stepfather who worked as a janitor at the Ravencroft Institute. He subconsciously transported Carnage Symbiote to his home and bonded with Brandon. Due to the verbal abuse that Brandon had suffered from Dan, the symbiote was able to control the boy who took revenge on Dan by killing him.[14]

name: Dana
description: Dana was touched by Rogue in downtown Salem Center.[15]

name: Dana
description: Dana was a reporter for the online tabloid newspaper Unexpected Truth who posted a post fanning the idea that Captain America / Barnes's death was a hoax and this infuriated Black Widow who went to the newsroom and quarreled with the various members.[16]

name: Dani
description: Dani was Anya dorm roommate at Empire State University and he was unaware that she was Spider-Girl and as such he thought she always stayed up late just to have fun not imagining that she patrolled the city instead in her secret superhero guise.[17]

name: Daniel
description: Daniel was one of the colonials who spotted a flying man above Philadelphia in 1775.[18]

name: Daniel
description:
Daniel was the wing commander of the ocean liner upon which Carol Danvers noticed the battle between Spider-Man, the Human Torch and the Super Skrull.[19]
He then witnessed the Super Skrull attacking the cruise ship.[20]

name: Daniel
description: Daniel was an old man who was accidentally hurt by Daredevil while he was fighting against Sabretooth.[21]

name: Daniel
description: Daniel was a homeless kid met by Mary Jane Watson-Parker on her roof.[22]Mary Jane then visited Daniel in his home and found he was tended by an old hermit.[23]Daniel was eventually adopted by Mr. Hernandez.[24]

name: Daniel
description: David was Japheth's brother. When Japheth decided to flee so as not to be a burden to his family, David secretly followed him hiding in the jeep in which Japheth was fleeing. Left stranded in the desert, Japhet and Daniel nearly died but were saved by Magneto.[25]

name: Daniela
description:
Daniela was a girl from São Paulo. At the announcement that the mutants had gained immortality, she thought it would be nice to be a mutant but she had to change her mind when Druig announced that the Eternals would eliminate all the mutants.[26]
Daniela learns of the struggle between the Avengers and the Celestial and she thinks that the job of a superhero must be similar to having to do a dozen jobs at the same time.[27]
Daniela is judged worthy by the Progenitor after thinking that they would survive anyway and texting her mother that she would return home.[28]
In the moment of judgment by the Progenitor, Daniela's mother asks why people are on the street in revolt instead of being with their family, and Daniela in response kissed and hugged her, not wanting to leave her for the little time she had left.[29]
Daniela decides to go through the portal of the Eternals, taking her mother with her on the day of judgment. At the end of the day of judgment, Daniela returned to her usual routine.[30]

name: Daniela
appearences: Captain America: Sentinel of Liberty Vol 2 4
description: Daniela was Steve Rogers' neighbor and mother of Amari, a young boy Steve befriended and taught how to defend against bullies, and she was glad that Steve offered to take Amari to school even though she told him he preferred Sam Wilson as Captain America.[31]

name: Daniels
description: Mr. Daniels was the father of Willie, a boy on whom Dr. Donald Blake operated and who successfully removed a tumor and then assured his parents that Willie would be completely cured and would return to playing basketball with his friends in a few months.[32]

name: Daniels
description: Mr. Daniels was the mother of Willie, a boy on whom Dr. Donald Blake operated and who successfully removed a tumor and then assured his parents that Willie would be completely cured and would return to playing basketball with his friends in a few months.[32]

name: Dann
description: A. Dann was the vice president of the Wayde tennis academy who together with the principal and the student development officer summoned Mill Collins about her with the intention of expelling her from the academy due to her poor ability in tennis.[33]

name: Danny
description: Danny the Dud had just been arrested, however after stashing away six-hundred thousand dollars and double crossing Sam the Barber, his critically ill accomplice, he was happy to be locked up for the next five years as he stood to be filthy rich upon release and would be safe from Sam while in jail. However, Danny the Dud was delivered some poetic justice when his prison barber turned out to be Sam, who, no longer caring about the money, slit Danny's throat with a straight razor.[34]

name: Danny
description: Danny was the boyfriend of the famous actress Rita Worth. After Rita was murdered, Danny revealed to the Human Torch that she was being blackmailed because someone had discovered that she had legally changed her name to hide that she was the daughter of a murderer.[35]

name: Danny
description: Danny was kidnapped by Morton Marion Maximillian Muse and hypnotized so that he would have abstract visions that he would then paint on canvas. Then Muse would have pass the paintings off as his works and sell them to rich people.[36]

name: Danny
description: Danny was Patty Pin-Up's boyfriend and photographer of the modeling agency she worked for.[37]

name: Danny
description: Danny operated the spotlight in a theater. An actor killed Danny when he found out his girlfriend was seeing Danny. The actor was condemned to the chair and escapeed, but the spotlight pinned him to the wall and the cops open fire. Only after his lifeless body slumps to the ground do the cops realize that there was no one at the spotlight.[38]

name: Danny
description: When a man entered a bar and, as a gag, offered to Danny a contract for his soul for one million dollars. Being a skeptic Danny signed it. No one saw the stranger leave, but a coincidence left Danny a one million dollar inheritance. As time went by, the contract worried away at Danny, distorting his personality from likable to hostile. His employees hated him and his family left him. One day he received a visitor and it turned out to be the man with the contract looking for work. Danny was so angered that his life had been changed so dramatically by a practical joke that he seizes a heavy candlestick and killed the stranger. Now he felt that he had sold his soul to the Devil in actuality and walks out into the dark for Satan to claim him.[39]

name: Danny
description: Danny was a young boy who imagined that he had a rich uncle who suddenly appeared, but when he began to doubt, the uncle faded away.[40]

name: Danny
description: Together with another agent of the Organization, Danny was instructed by Number One to go to Lawson (secretly Mar-Vell) to threaten him and take possession of the Cyberex.[41]

name: Danny
description: Danny couldn't let Christine fall from a collapsing terminal building.[42]

name: Danny
description: Danny was a henchman of Señor Suerte who warned his boss that Rocco the Gimp had just called saying that a guy from Los Angeles had opened a casino in the area he controlled.[43]

name: Danny
description: Danny was one of Stevie Hunter's students. He and his family were followers of Reverend Stryker, and thought little of sharing his anti-mutant sentiment in class, unaware two of his classmates -- Kitty and Illyana -- were mutants and associated with the X-Men. This eventually led to a fight between him and Kitty, which was broken up by Illyana's brother, whose presence intimidated Danny enough not to continue the fight.[44]

name: Danny
description: Danny was a client of Wide-Load Annie and Poppa Wheelie's Short Stop Diner and was among those who participated in the brawl against police officers who wanted to arrest Annie but in the frantic phases of the fight Danny wrongly struck U.S. Archer with a chair without causing too much damage.[45]

name: Danny
description: Danny was the foreman of the construction site of the Four Freedoms Plaza. Immediately after showing the progress of the works to the Fantastic Four, he was attacked by Basilisk and frozen with his optical beam.[46]

name: Danny
description: Danny was an henchman of Morris "The Snake" Diamond.[47]

name: Danny
description: Danny was a security guard at the Guggenheim Museum and was there on duty during an attempted theft by Absorbing Man and Titania.[48]

name: Danny
description: Danny and his colleague Jim were on guard at the Alaskan pipeline when they were attacked and killed by the omnivirus released by Zarathustra upon his arrival.[49]

name: Danny
description: Danny was a henchman of Vincent Tannen and participated in the kidnapping of Detective Jacob Raven, but along with all the kidnappers he was stopped and beaten by Ben Reilly.[50]

name: Danny
description: Danny is one of three children of a single Brooklyn mother who Steve asked to vote for Andrew Bolt.[51]

name: Danny
description: Danny was a radio DJ discussing a plague that hit New York City. He talked to a listener of the program who was very radical in wanting to deal with the problem and then Danny tried to dampen the discussion by saying that competent people were already at work to address it.[52]

name: Danny
description: An acquaintance of Elektra who stored her belongings in secret places.[53]

name: Danny
description: Danny was one of Cassie Lang's schoolmates.[54]

name: Danny
description: Danny was a construction worker who was buried in a collapse on a building site while Ben Grimm was visiting there in search of work.[55]

name: Danny
description: Danny was a design student and he was Janie Chin's boyfriend.[56]

name: Danny
description: Danny was a prison guard at H.A.M.M.E.R. Federal Holding Facility in Colorado that got angry because of Brock Rumlow's ironic comments on the news about Captain America's death and for that it hit him with the taser but Rumlow reacted by killing Danny and starting his attempt to free Sin.[57]

name: Danny
description: Big Danny was a man who had moved to Key Largo in Florida following the mob relocation program and there he met John King who had just moved there.[58]

name: Danny
description: Danny was a Roxxon security guard who was stunned by Moon Knight secretly infiltrating the Roxxon building in Wilmington.[59]

name: Danny
description: Danny worked at the morgue in Lawrenceville, Kansas. When Madrox was summoned to Lawrenceville by local police regarding the murder of a woman who lived in his old house, the police took him to the morgue and asked Danny to show them the body, which Danny promptly did. During the inspection of the corpse the name of the son of the corpse came up and she woke up screaming his name. At the sight of the awakened corpse Danny fainted.[60]

name: Danny
appearences: Ghost Rider X-Mas Special Infinite Comic Vol 1 1
description: Danny was a student at the Patrick Wellman Development Center and a classmate of Gabriel Reyes.[61]

name: Danny
description: A theater employee, he smoked a cigarette during a Cats performance and was rebuked for this by a colleague of his, and also by Spider-Man who was chasing Electro into the theater. After Electro was captured by Spider-Man he boasted to the actresses of the show that he had taken care of the capture.[62]

name: Danny
description: Danny suffered a head injury in a car accident where his mother was driving the car and was frightened by the sudden appearance of an evil spirit seeking revenge. Dr. Strange intervened first by chasing away the spirit and then he was forced to use a forbidden spell to regain his neurosurgeon skills and thus succeeding in saving Danny's life.[63]

name: Danny
appearences: King in Black: Planet of the Symbiotes Vol 1 1
description: Orphaned by the onslaught of the Knull-controlled Symbiotes, Danny was about to be devoured by the symbiotes but was saved by Scream.[64]

name: Danny
description: Danny was an inmate who along with two other inmates attacked Neil Rivait in the prison showers because he tried to make friends with Daredevil.[65]

name: Danny
description: Danny was a mercenary in the service of Wilson Fisk who attempted to arrest Boomerang, while it was in effect a way to distract him and get Bullseye's task done.[66]

name: Dante
description: Dante was a technician of the Shadow Consortium and was in charge of the construction of the robotic tactical unit called Armada.[67]

name: Danzen
description: A Latverian scientist who assisted Dr. Doom during his imminent discovery.[68]

name: Daphne
description: Daphne was a student in Miss Bliss's class at Centerville Junior High in Centerville, California.[69]

name: Daphne
description: Daphne and Reg were attacked on their speedboat by Cyber.[70]

name: Darby
description:
Vice president of Scarmore Inc. and right hand man of Charles Evans. On his boss's orders, he hired Black Tom and Juggernaut to deal with the people involved in the lawsuits against Scarmore.[71]
He still hired the two super-villains to deal with the Beck Underwood issue, even though he avoided her being eliminated.[72]
Eventually Darby delivered the evidence involving Evans and Scarmore regarding the Mercurial Virus and Underwood's kidnapping to both the law and the newspapers.[73]

name: Darcia
description: Darcia was a child who had been caught in the crossfire between the Hawks and the Aryan Dreams street gangs and was rescued thanks to Thor's intervention.[74]

name: Daria
description: Daria was one of the older girls in the Black Widow Ops Program. During a training session she was easily defeated by Natasha, and for this she tried to take revenge on Natasha.[75]

name: Darice
description: Darice was a restaurant patron who was injured by an unnatural cyclonic blizzard in Calgary.[76]

name: Darla
description: Darla was one of the friends of Nate who, following the passage of a destructive tornado in Redfield, asked to Captain America if he wanted to go with them to see if there was still someone to help.[77]

name: Darlene
description: Darlene was a starlet invited by Harold H. Harold to a theatrical performance focused on Dracula in the same theater where the real Dracula and his daughter Lilith clashed.[78]

name: Darlene
description: Darlene was a model who was accompanied on the platform during a fashion show in Manhattan by Iron Fist.[79]

name: Darlene
description: Darlene was a manicurist who worked in the beauty salon of Rae LaCoste.[80][81][82]

name: Darlene
description: While Darlene was in a mall with her husband Frank, she approached a Woman's Action Movement feminist stand to read one of their pamphlets. That made her husband so angry that he started shouting at people on the stand, including Mary Walker[83]

name: Darlene
description: Darlene was a nurse at the New York Hospital who disliked Captain America's decision to oppose the Superhuman Registration Act.[84]

name: Darlene
description:
Darlene never had a boyfriend.[85]
After being secretly visited by Emmael and Vraniel, she became pregnant overnight.[86]
She then gave birth to both angels and took them close to Ghost Rider.[87]

name: Darlene
description: Darlene was the master mind behind a county-wide gas station and tour bus robbing circle across Mason County. The criminals had the misfortune of robbing a bus that Deadpool happened to be on. When Deadpool tracked the other criminals back the the Mason County Sheriff's Department, Darlene tried to convince him that she had been trying to stop the other corrupt police, and asked Deadpool to kill them. However, Deadpool saw through her trick and locked her up, while he went to look for the others.[88]

name: Darlene
description: Darlene and her family were inhabitants of Broxton, when her husband Bill lost his job they lost their home to the banks and were forced to move to Wichita, to his sister's house who would host them for a while.[88]

name: Darlene
description: The declaration of marriage that her boyfriend Brad was doing to her was interrupted by the violent release of Shiklah from a local who demolished a wall causing it to collapse on Brad, taking Darlene from an embarrassing situation for her.[89]

name: Dario
description: Dario was the Cap'n Oz movie special effects wizard.[90]

name: Darren
description:
Head writer on the soap opera Heartbreak Hospital, he came up with the idea of making it live.[91]
When She-Hulk was killed in action, he suggested P. Isadora, from the Sensational She-Hulk movie be used instead, but Greg Hallerhand told him that wouldn't work.[92]

name: Darryl
description: Darryl was a member of the Bodybaggers, a paintball team made of the best bouncers and doormen in New York City; he was killed by the Psycho-Cops.[93]

name: Daryls
description: The Daryls attacked Patch and Jessica Drew, but they were eventually killed by Sabretooth.[94]

name: Dave
description:
Dave was a security guard who mistook the Masked Marauder's approaching aircraft for one of the company's advertising blimps.[95]
Many years later, Dave witnessed Spider-Man breaking into Mayor Jameson's office.[96]

name: Dave
description: Dave was a bodybuilder who witnessed the Inhumans landing on a private beach.[97]

name: Dave
description: Dave was Barb's boyfriend at the time she was kidnapped by Count Nefaria, whom he tried to stop him, but he was easily knocked off by the villain.[98]

name: Dave
description: Dave was a customer at the motel where Ben Reilly was staying in Rachel, Vermont, and an acquaintance of Seward Trainer.[99]

name: Dave
description:
Dave was a scientist at the Institute of Seismoharmonic Research who witnessed the Swarm attack the research facility.[100]
Dave was taken hostage by Swarm until he was defeated by Spider-Man (Ben Reilly).[101]

name: Dave
description: Dave was a college student at Penn State.[102]

name: Dave
description: Fox News anchor Dave exposed Sharon Keller's hoax against Spider-Man.[103]

name: Dave
appearences: Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 2 5
description: Dave was a fellow scientist of Sa'ida Zebari on the Darkforce Project who gave her the powers of Noir.[104]

name: Dave
description: Dave was Alice Hu's cameraman. When the helicopter of the television station where he and Alice were to report live on Attuma's attack on Vancouver was shot down by Nerkkod's hammer thrown by Attuma, the two reporters plus the pilot were saved from crashing by Guardian and Vindicator and while the two heroes carried them to the ground, Alice yelled at Dave to keep filming.[105]

name: Dave
description: Dave was a O*N*E technician who fell for the pretense of Alison Blaire suffocating in her containment cell and freed her despite the warnings of his colleagues.[106]

name: Dave
description: Dave was a paramedic who helped the wounded inside a shelter during the battle between the Avengers and a giant robot.[107]

name: Dave
description: Dave was Connie's cameraman and recorded the massive explosion at the Tower of London caused by Steve Darwin.[108]

name: Dave
description: Accompanying Gus to his new job in the Damage Control postal department, Bart Rozum made Gus believe that the people who worked there were all happy as if they were family and tried to involve Dave who already worked there, even though he called him Chuck, but Dave replies sharply, not being happy at all.[109]

name: Davenport
description:
Dr. Davenport was the Snow Valley School for Girls physician who treated Emma Frost after she passed out during a fencing class and to whom Emma revealed she had severe headaches for which Dr. Davenport prescribed pain relievers thinking they were due. to a stressful situation, not imagining that instead they were due to the emergence of Emma's mutant powers.[110]
Dr. Davenport revealed Emma about her from the sickness he received using her salts and after waking up he asked her if she still had severe migraines.[111]

name: Davey
description: Davey found a book with a spell for summoning up a genie. He read the words aloud and was astonished when a Genie actually appeared. The Genie could grant any wish the boy thought of. He wished himself to be a giant and that everything other than Earth disappear so he would be the greatest of all. When the Earth began to careen he realizes that without everything else, Earth no longer has its place in gravitational attraction and would be destroyed. He panicked, and wished that "everything was back the way it was right before I found you." The genie obliged.[112]

name: Davey
description: Davey was one of the bank robbers who were confronted and defeated by the Great Lakes Avengers.[113]

name: Davey
description: Davey was rescued by Daredevil when he was hit by his father.[114]

name: David
appearences: Warlock and the Infinity Watch Vol 1 12
description: David and his girlfriend mistook Drax the Destroyer for the Hulk.[115]

name: David
description: With Don devised and led the terrorist attack of Terror Unlimited on the World Trade Center.[116]

name: David
description: While visiting the Statue of Liberty under a heavy rain, David and his family were approached by a crazed Joseph Perrett, who after having massacred his family and a waitress in a diner, wandered around the city. Perrett released David and his family after David's wife sobered him a little 'making him look carefully at her children and the father of her children.[117]

name: David
description: David was one of the journalists who attended the press conference at the Xavier Institute for Higher Learning.[118]

name: David
description: Exposed to the red cloud from Mount Rushmore, David warned his wife Gail and his son Paul to run away.[119]

name: David
description: David was a TV anchor who reported the massive no-bid contracts awarded to companies dealing with the Superhuman Registration Act.[120]

name: David
appearences: Captain America: Sentinel of Liberty Vol 2 1
description:
David was an art classmate at Community College that Steve Rogers befriended. He jokingly told Steve for how he was using the tablet if he was going to pierce it with one of his powers.[121]
Going out for a drink with his new friends, Steve mulled over the attack he had avoided and not knowing the origin of his shield, but David connected to the internet and discovered that the creator was a certain Dr. David Agboje.[122]
During a drawing lesson, where they were to play Cap's shield, cap asked his three new friends what Captain America's shield meant to them and David replied that it was as if he were saying help was on the way.[31]

name: Davidson
description: In a space center he points out the wrong trajectory of a Hall Industries satellite and can not correct it without the right authorization that was promptly given by Michael Hall in person.[123]

name: Davidson
description: Davidson was an investigative reporter to whom Gyrich revealed and handed evidence of government involvement regarding agreements with known super-villains.[124]

name: Davidson
description: Davidson welcomed Curtiss Jackson aboard the Leader of Pack auction yacht.[125]

name: Davies
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 3
description: The son of Charles Davies, the CEO of a pharmaceutical company implicated in various cases of malpractice. The child was struck by meningitis but the car where he was about to be transported to the hospital was attacked by rioters. Cardiac intervened, but wasted time taking revenge on his father and by the time he took him to the hospital it was too late.[126]

name: Davis
description:
Dr. Davis assisted Seward Trainer after his mind was lost into the cyberspace.[127]
She told Ben Reilly that all Trainer's life signs were strong, but there was absolutely no brain activity.[128]
Dr. Davis attempted to stop Dr. Octopus from stealing Trainer's body.[129]

name: Davis
description:
Davis was an assistant of Jonas Harrow.[130]
He was ordered to control Dragon Man, but Spider-Man and Will O' the Wisp removed its chip.[131]

name: Davy
description: Davy was one of the millions of kids attracted by Xemnu to come to him in Cape Canaveral.[132]

name: Dawson
description: A member of Exchange, Dawson was found and knocked out by Rachel Alves in North Creek.[133]

name: Deakins
description: Officer Deakins of the Atlantic City Police and his partner received an alert of the presence of a prowler in a building which turned out to be Venom. Upon their sudden arrival, Venom reacted by throwing them against the wall, stunning them and then fleeing the place.[134]

name: Dean
description: Dean was Mill Collins' tennis instructor, but he was completely uninterested in her and tried to trick Maya Benjamin's mother into coaching her daughter.[33]

name: DeAngelo
description: D'Andre DeAngelo's wife was hit with her children by a beam of Pym Particles addressed to Scarlet Beetle by Ant-Man. The beam reduced them to microscopic levels by transferring them to the Microverse where they were saved by Kljt-Man. They were later brought back to normal thanks to Ant-Man and Nadia Van Dyne.[135]

name: DeAngelo
description: D'Andre DeAngelo's son was hit along with his mother and sister by a beam of Pym Particles addressed to Scarlet Beetle by Ant-Man while on a trip to Lido Beach. The beam reduced them to microscopic levels by transferring them to the Microverse where they were saved by Kljt-Man. They were later brought back to normal thanks to Ant-Man and Nadia Van Dyne.[135]

name: DeAngelo
description: D'Andre DeAngelo's daughter was shot along with her mother and brother by a beam of Pym Particles addressed to Scarlet Beetle by Ant-Man while they were on a trip to Lido Beach that D'Andre granted to his family for not attending his dance recital. The beam reduced them to microscopic levels by transferring them to the Microverse where they were saved by Kljt-Man. They were later brought back to normal thanks to Ant-Man and Nadia Van Dyne.[135]

name: Debbie
description: Debbie was a ranch girl at Cheery-O's Dude Ranch who met Clinton Barton and Two-Gun Kid.[136]

name: Debra
description: Debra was a TV reporter at WNBC who publicly announced the major libel suit brought by Roxxon Oil against the Daily Bugle.[137]

name: Debrow
appearences: Breaking Into Comics the Marvel Way! Vol 1 1
description: Doctor Debrow was killed by Bullseye at a maximum security prison for criminally insane.[138]

name: Dec
appearences: King in Black: Captain America Vol 1 1
description: Dec was saved from the onslaught of the Symbiote Dragons by the intervention of Captain America, Falcon and Winter Soldier and eventually Cap congratulated her on being alert and protecting her cousin Adrienne.[139]

name: Decker
description: Decker fought Daredevil alongside his partner Turk.[140]

name: Dee
description: Dee was Elsie's mother and Frank's wife, a homeless family. The pair of parents mistreated the child, until Elsie was possessed by the Symbiote Carnage, who cured the child of the burns caused by the abuse suffered by her parents, after which she killed first Frank and then Dee.[141]

name: Del
description: Del served as Chicane County police officer. It was not revealed whether he also was a psychopath who had been brainwashed or if he was a caretaker of Psychoville project.[142]

name: DeLeon
description: Miss DeLeon was an elderly native who won the biggest pumpkin contest at a county fair. The county sheriff's son attempted to rob her of the $500 she had won by having her nephews, one of whom was a mutant, come to her defense.[143]

name: Delfina
description: Delfina belonged to a family of mercenaries and participated firsthand in the apparent assassination attempt on Dracula hired by the Contessa and other accomplices, but instead of killing Dracula, a member of the Vampire Council, Corvis, was killed, therefore given the failure of the attempt fled and asked Blade for help getting out of Vampyrsk.[144]

name: DeLong
description:
DeLong was Heather Hudson's research team's biologist.[145]
DeLong eventually managed to survive the Hunter in Darkness' assault.[1]

name: Delores
description: Delores decided to attack New York City's water supply out of revenge, as she was raped in the city, and the rapist was put on probation due to belonging to an ethnical minority.[146]

name: Delores
appearences: Ghost Rider: Kushala Infinity Comic Vol 1 4
description:
When Olivia Obtera traveling to 1946 Los Angeles, she screamed in the rain at Delores who was crossing the street and was about to be hit by a car saving her life, so she drove her to her home where Delores warned her that her husband Kenneth was asleep and could be a little jumpy.[147]
Delores was discovered to be an aunt of Olivia and witnessed the revelation that the holder of a lamp in her house was the horn of the Leviathan which, during a mission of her husband Kenneth along with Captain America, she had severed from the sea monster and which turned out to be actually one half of the sixth Wand of Watoomb.[148]
Delores's spirit came to Kushala's aid to fight Doctor Doom.[149]

name: Delphino
description: Mr. Delphino was a local newsagent.[150]

name: Dennis
description: Dennis was a member of the Flying Tigers hired by the owner of an alley buildings to go on a rampage against the homeless who lived there. Along with another gang member he forcibly took a small dog off a homeless man but they were intercepted by Prowler who knocked out Dennis and the other Flying Tiger freeing the small dog.[151]

name: Dennis
description:
Dennis was a botanist / zoologist who worked on the Raft as an ecosystem overseer where Man-Thing lived.[152]
During the Fear Itself crisis, Dennis reported that there was something wrong with the Man-Thing.[153]

name: Dennis
description: Dennis was a member of the racist group of Friends of Humanity who participated in a reality show where Lila Cheney pretended to be an ordinary person and the two would have a blind date, but during the date Dennis showed all his contempt towards the mutants and together with the other members of the Friends of Humanity, he stormed the meeting room until Lila transported them to an alien planet light years away from Earth.[154]

name: Dennison
description: Dennison was one of the Owl's lieutenants until he was crippled by Daredevil. Together with Todd and Mosley, they ended up working for Wilson Fisk, who ordered them to inform the Owl that they were going to take over his territory, to keep Fisk in the shadows. When the three of them briefed Fisk about the outcome of the situation, Dennison revealed his intentions to work for himself, believing Fisk to be powerless, but Fisk gave a simple order to Lady Bullseye, who quickly killed Dennison.[155]

name: Denny
description: Denny was saved by the Defenders when his car was pushed off a ledge.[156]

name: Denny
description: Denny was a college student at Penn State.[157]

name: Denton
description: Ms. Denton thanked Iron Man for his assistance at the Avalon Trading Company.[158]

name: Derek
description:
Derek was Walter Barrett's personal assistant and took Sophia, Barrett's mutant daughter, to heart when she came to the United States from Venezuela after the death of her mother.[159]
During a business trip to New York, Walter forbade Derek from meeting Sophia, but both were taken hostage by the Reavers.[160]
After being released by the Reavers because they were not mutants, Walter ordered Derek not to go to Sophia's aid but Derek refused to obey him by sending him to Hell.[161]
Some time later Derek went to visit Sophia at the Xavier Institute and she got furious after realizing that he was there to meet Walter and get his old job.[162]

name: Derek
description: Derek was a guy Carol Danvers met at the speed-date arranged by her friends. He told her that she looked like a superhero because she was incognito, and when she replied that some people confused her with Captain Marvel, he replied that he didn't think about her and by the way he didn't like her short hair making Carol angry.[163]

name: Derrick
description:
A college classmate of Peter Parker's, during the funeral of a mutual acquaintance of theirs, Derrick kept making sarcastic comments.[164]
After Kelly's overdose and her amnesia, Derrick went to visit her at the hospital.[165]

name: Deruge
description: Deruge and Lawson were two subordinates of Nguyen Ngoc Coy, who were ordered to watch over Leong and Nga Coy Manh, but they were easily defeated by Spider-Man.[166]

name: DeSalle
appearences: Darkhold: Pages from the Book of Sins Vol 1 2
description: DeSalle was one of the hitmen sent by the Darkholders to kill the Darkhold Redeemers Agent Sam Buchanan and Dr. Louise Hastings at Washington. He was killed in the fire caused by the battle, possibly made to burn himself by Modred.[167]

name: Destiny
description: Destiny was one of Snapdragon's strippers.[168]

name: Devel
description: Devel was one of the former workers at Brombline Cross Mining who was interviewed after the mine closed and the Virago arrived.[169]

name: Devereaux
description: Devereaux was a Project Echelon superhuman with E.M.P. ability living in Annapolis.[13]

name: Dewey
description: When one of the entries in the confidential access file just disappeared, Dewey couldn't check back-ups, because they were all blanks.[170]

name: Dex
description: Mentioned: Spider-Man: The Darkest Hours

name: Dex
description: Dex was the best friend of Camille Benally at her hometown of Coot's Bluff, Alaska.[176]

name: Dex
description: Dex was a security guard at Millard Wellfield. He was killed in the same incident where Lucy Cervantes died.[177]

name: Dex
description: Dex was an agent of the O.N.E. who was assigned to the Omaha, Nebraska office.[169]

name: Di
description: Di was the assistant in the photo studio of fashion photographer Darcy Cortini.[178]

name: Diana
description: Diana was a resident of Salem Center. She met members of the New Mutants at the Salem Center Mall.[179] Diana invited the group to attend a dance at Salem Center High School.

name: Diane
description: Diane was once a member of the Bacchae. When she met and fell in love with Jack, a member of rival gang Golden Horde, they left their life of crime behind. Diane and Jack got regular jobs, working at the Coffee Shop. The Bacchae caught up to her and took her away. But both Spider-Man and Bounty, who helped fake Diane's death, helped Diane and Jack to start their new life together. They eventually had a child.[180]

name: Dick
description: Dick was a light-sleeping neighbor who complained with Terry Martin for the noise coming out his apartment.[181]

name: Dickens
description: Mrs. Dickens asked Cage to find her daughter's killer.[182]

name: Dickerson
description: Dickerson was one of the security guards at the Ravencroft Institute who was responsible for the surveillance of Cletus Kasady.[183]

name: Dickie
description: Dickie was Whitey's kid brother, living in Coits Neck, New Jersey.[184]

name: Dietrich
description: Dietrich and Elsa returned to the Norwegian fishing village to meet the parents of Elsa who they hadn't seen since their wedding day, but once they arrived at the village they found it completely destroyed and abandoned.[185]

name: Dillon
description: Dillon was a security guard at the Wackyworld theme park.[185]

name: Dimitri
description: While looting the wrecked temple of Mitra, Dimitri saw the Devourer's sword and against his friend’s warnings seized it, thinking only that such an ornate, well crafted weapon would bring a good price. Lightning suddenly crashed down from the heavens, and the villages fled as a terrible transformation begins. Dimitri was struck dead instantly, but in his place, the Devourer lived again.[186]

name: Dimitri
description: Dimitri was one of the operators who died during the Chernobyl Disaster.[187]

name: Dimitri
description: Dimitri was a soldier assigned to feed Nikolas in Province 13.[188]

name: Dimitri
description: Dimitri was a fence on which Spider-Man unleashed all his anger after Betty Brant was injured in a robbery whose proceeds were sold to him.[189]

name: Dina
description: Dina was Kirsten McDuffie's roommate.[190]

name: Dinah
description: Dinah was a talk show host who interviewed Peter Parker while he was in Las Vegas promoting his book Webs.[191]

name: Dingbat
description: After killing a man for his money, Dingbat and Clyde chased Ghost Rider, but, after trapping him in an alley, they were shocked by his flaming skull and ran away.[192]

name: Dio
description: Dio was a henchman of Roderick Kingsley and accompanied him to the meeting his boss held with Norman Osborn to get all his financial assets back, but during the meeting a mysterious Hobgoblin intervened and slaughtered Dio and Kingsley's other henchmen.[193]

name: Dion
description: Dion was a student of Raga who was confronted and defeated by Iron Man.[194]

name: Dirk
description: Dirk and Louis were ordered by Tommy "Peach" Cullen to dispatch Jimmy Pierce.[195]

name: Dirk
description: Dirk was a divorce lawyer who was introduced to J. Jonah Jameson by his wife.[196]

name: Dirk
description: Dirk was one of the boys deceived and imprisoned by Dark Beast to experiment with Connors' serum.[197]

name: Dis
description: Dis was a gang member who was attacked by the Night Terror.[198]

name: DiStefano
description: DiStefano was a detective from the Philadelphia Police and together with her partner Molina investigated the disappearance of the newborn son of Stinger and Paulie Provenzano, and did not want Cable to meddle in the investigation.[199]

name: Dixie
description: Dixie reported an attempt to capture Deathlok in Coney Island, being saved when Harlan Ryker ordered Ian Wajler to destroy the news helicopter.[200]

name: Djaba
description: Djaba was a goat who got lost during the earthquake that struck the City of Wonders. A child who was looking for her was eventually rescued from a landslide by King Kull and Brule.[201]

name: Djo
appearences: Darkhawk: Heart of the Hawk Vol 1 1
description: Djo was an alien living on the Kortaki Colony which was invaded by the Brood until the Colony was freed by Darkhawk. At the end of the fight with the Brood, Djo asked Darkhawk if he had now destroyed them too and after he told her that they were now free from the threat of the Brood, she without a minimum of gratitude accused him that she had demolished their premises.[202]

name: Dmitri
description: Dmitri detected very bad solar forecasts after observing a solar flare with a direct course for Earth.[203]

name: Dmitri
description: Dmitri and Gennady were two soldiers who were tasked to located the Mandarin's body amid the wreckage of his sky dragon aircraft, with Dmitri handling a corpse-locating dog. Instead they found a badly beaten Iron Man, who tried to explain what had happened inside the aircraft but then collapsed.[204]

name: Dmitri
appearences: Black Panther: The Man Without Fear Vol 1 516
description: Dmitri was present at the underworld bosses' meeting in SoHo called to question Vlad Dinu's conduct.[5]

name: Doc
description: Doc was the Guardsman Alpha Squad's medical specialist and was the first to succumb to the Project P.E.G.A.S.U.S. rescue operation when he was killed by the zombified Hyperion clone.[205]

name: Dolph
appearences: X-Men: Children of the Atom Vol 1 2
description: Dolph was a member of Jack Winters' gang.[206]

name: Dom
description: Dom was one of Captain America's neighbors in Red Hook.[207]

name: Dominic
description: On Fifth Avenue, Dominic was rescued from Trapster by Spider-Man.[208]

name: Dominic
description:
Dominic was one of the teachers at Midtown High School.[209]
He used to spend the holiday break trying to find something to earn some money.[210]

name: Don
description: Don was working in his sporting goods shop when the Thing, trapped by a water elemental sent by Diablo, thrashed about the store, asking for a scuba tank.[211]

name: Don
description: Doctor Don worked at the burn ward in the South Queens Hospital for Sick Children: he solicited Janet Darling the Thomas H. Hanson's case report and, when the Human Torch came to visit the kid, he told him the he was very near the end.[212]

name: Don
description: With David, Don devised the terrorist attack of Terror Unlimited on the World Trade Center.[116]

name: Don
description: Don was among the scientists sent by the Atlanta Control Center for Disease Control and Research to evaluate the nanocontagion epidemic in Springville.[213]

name: Don
description: Don was a regular of Fogwell's Gym who told Bullseye where to find Tyrone.[214]

name: Don
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 5
description: Don was the sheriff of Bleachville who met the leaders of the Navajo reservation and told them that the mayor intended to have a meeting with them. He was later killed by removing his scalp with the intention of blaming the Indians of the reservation.[215]

name: Donald
description: Donald was one of the managers of Revenge Inc. who offered Diana Simon money in exchange for experimenting with her psychic powers. Donald killed Simon's father after he killed the Revenge general manager but he himself was killed by a holographic representation developed by Diana's powers.[216]

name: Donald
description: Donald was Eddie Brock's lawyer.[217]

name: Donald
description: Mister Negative had Donald watch over the Wraith. During a robbery committed by the Circus of Crime, Donald stole what they were attempting to steal, a ten million dollar watch, but was captured and killed by Wraith.[218]

name: Donato
description: Mr. Donato replaced the plaque on Daimon Hellstrom's door from the previous one that indicated "Daimon Hellstorm" and while he was mimicking Hellstrom when he asked him to replace it, not realizing that Hellstrom was watching him, he was frightened when Daimon suddenly appeared behind him.[219]

name: Donda
appearences: Ka-Zar: Lord of the Savage Land Vol 1 2
description: Donda, a member of the Savagelander race of the Botor, welcomed Ka-Zar and his family into his forest abruptly threatening them with a bow until another member of his race told him that they were friends with the Botors.[220]

name: Donna
description: Donna and Cass were rescued by Lizard from the Pipers. They then died on their way back to Lubbock.[221]

name: Donna
description: Donna reported the battle between the Thunderbolts and the Wrecking Crew on Liberty Island.[222]

name: Donna
description: While Steve Rogers and Bucky were investigating saboteurs at a Carnival, they met two girls, Donna and her friend Rachel, whom they fraternized with and used as a cover for their investigation.[223]

name: Donnar
description: Donnar was a scavenger during the Great Cataclysm, who was killed by Red Sonja when he and his band of raiders attempted to harass her.[224]

name: Donnie
description: Donnie saw Fortress Null approaching Broxton.[225]

name: Donnie
description:
Donnie was a member of the Tombstone gang. He was present as Tombstone beat up Spider-Man in an abandoned subway tunnel. When Donnie asked tombstone where he was to put the box full of roses he was carrying, he told him to take them upstairs to the gang.[226]
Donnie was stopped by Kareem moments before he shot Spider-Man in the head, in gratitude for saving his life earlier.[227]

name: Dooley
description:
Dooley bought Peter Parker's stolen credit cards from Sean Boyle at the Blind Spot.[228]
He killed him when he later tried to retrieve them.[229]

name: Dora
description: Dora was the waitress and owner of the Flying Finish in London.[230] Dora also liked to play matchmaker, pointedly suggesting to Brian Braddock that he should ask Courtney Ross out on a date.[230]

name: Dora
description: Dora worked as a maid at the Schaefer Theater.[231]

name: Doran
description: During a dinner at her parents' house, after Kaylie Doran's father complained that her daughter came to visit them no more than once every six months telling her they didn't even know what job she did and whether it was a job involving the military or if he worked for the President.[232]

name: Doran
description: During a dinner at her parents' house, Kaylie Doran's father complained that her daughter came to visit them no more than once every six months telling her they didn't even know what job she did and if it was a job involving the military or if she worked for the President, her mother told her they asked her this because they were concerned about her.[232]

name: Doran
