description: While Kaylie Doran's parents asked her what job she did to keep her so away from home and why she couldn't talk about it, her younger brother asked her if she was a spy and she jokingly replied that they had taught her to kill with a spoon while she was about to throw food at him with her spoon.[232]

name: Doreen
description:
Doreen worked as a secretary at Nelson and Murdock law firm.[233]
She introduced Agent Guida to Mr. Murdock.[234]

name: Dorian
description: Dorian worked as an assistant for the Latverian scientists Dr. Weber and Dr. Danzen. He was imprisoned for interrupting Doctor Doom. Soon after, Dorian was freed by the future Doom who had traveled back in time.[235]

name: Doris
description: Doris was killed by Manny.[236]

name: Doris
description: Doris and her husband Willy were attacked by Bloodscream in Logan, Alberta, Canada.[237]

name: Doris
description: Doris was Stephen's mother.[238]

name: Doris
description: Doris was tasked to take photos of Logan while he was trapped in the pit.[239]

name: Doris
description: Doris was socializing with mailman Willie Lumpkin when a school-bus driven by a child placed there by Deadpool crashed near them, seriously injuring Willie. Doris then helped the injured Willie.[240]

name: Dottie
description: While being controlled by the soul of his unborn twin sister Roberta, as a young boy Robert Gross pushed his Auntie Dottie down the stairs.[241]

name: Dottie
appearences: Immortal Hulk: Time of Monsters Vol 1 1
description: Dottie was a residence of Verdigris, Kansas and was one of the townspeople whose fear the Scarecrow fed on. She and the other townspeople were able to flee when the Hulk broke the Scarecrow's power over them.[242]

name: Doug
description: Doug interviewed Mr. Stark outside the Stark Industries complex.[243]

name: Doug
description: Doug and his girlfriend Debbie were in Time Square during the clash between Luke Cage and Stiletto and Discus. Doug was advised by Cage to leave the place immediately because of the situation and Doug accepted the advice but thought that the New Yorkers were ... weird.[244]

name: Doug
description: Doug was a member of the Washington DC Police; he and his partner Ron fired and killed Gorn after he threw at them with his sword drawn, after which they were magically hit by a vindictive Elfqueen who plunged them into the ground.[245]

name: Doug
description: Doug was the cameraman for Linda Wei of News At Six Channel and was the first to film the new Ghost Rider with a camera.[246]

name: Doug
description: An agent of the D.E.A., Doug spotted Osaku in Port Newark.[247]

name: Doug
description: Doug was the producer of the TV show It's Amazing and removed the astronaut John Jameson from programming to broadcast Spider-Man.[248]

name: Doug
description: Doug was a salvage yard worker working in the dump when the Freak emerged from the rubbish and clashed with Spider-Man.[249]

name: Doug
description: After a Halloween party, Doug and his friend Eric brought home a stunned Spider-Man thinking he was their drunken friend Ronnie who wore a Spider-Man costume for the occasion.[250]

name: Doug
description: Doug was an assistant to Dr. Emmet at the Putnam Psychiatric Hospital during the period Marc Spector was hospitalized there.[251]

name: Doug
description: Doug was one of the reanimated corpses revived by Doodkill's mayor necromancer.[252]

name: Doug
description: Doug tried to buy the van Great Lakes Avengers Headquarters.[253]

name: Dover
description: Ms. Dover was a secretary in the district attorney's office in Foggy Nelson's time as D.A.. When Matt Murdock shows up at the office, she asked Ms. Dover if Foggy could receive and she replied that Mr. Nelson was in the inner office but he could enter.[254]

name: Doyle
description: Doyle was one of two Knights who Shyla ordered him to follow her to capture the Human Torch.[255]

name: Doyle
description:
Member of the Continuiteens, who took care of intervening if the continuity of the Marvel Universe was affected by unrecorded events.[256]
He became a member of F.A.C.T., the government agency charged with assembling the new Thunderbolts teams.[257], [258], [259], [260]

name: Doyle
description: Doyle is a teenager and one of The Inventor's henchman in charge of the Greenville House.[261]

name: Drake
description: A Deputy in a town in New Mexico, Sheriff Cole ordered him to intercept and eliminate Matt Murdock.[262]

name: Drayson
description: Mentions: Marvel Mystery Comics #3

name: Drumm
description: Mrs. Drumm was the mother of two sons with completely opposite character, while Paul was a judicious man and worker Harry was lazy and with criminal tendencies.[264]

name: Dubinsky
description: Dubinsky was one of Dr. Neutron's agents who captured Logan.[264]

name: Dubois
description: Dubois was one of Doctor Doom's servants.[265]

name: Dubowsky
description: Dubowsky was an office boy and an acquaintance of Ben Urich.[231]

name: Ducret
description: Ducret was killed by Paibok in order to set an example for the citizens of Coot's Bluff, Alaska.[266]

name: Duff
description: Duff was a street thug who was confronted and defeated by Puma.[267]

name: Duk
description: A member of the Wild Tiger Mob, on the Chow Yun Woo's boat that transported drugs, he collided with Shang-Chi facing him with a chain and hook but was easily defeated by the martial artist..[268]

name: Duke
description: After being beaten by Electro, Spider-Man was surrounded by the crowd and among those who wanted to expose him was Duke, but was stopped by Stan Carter who threatened the crowd with a shotgun, which they didn't know was a toy. Duke walked away but threatened Carter by telling him he wouldn't forget the insult.[269]

name: Duluth
description: ATF's Agent Duluth was responsible for stopping the moonshine operation ran by the Mason County Sheriff's Department.[88]

name: Dum-Dum
description: When Hurricane tried to frame Piggy Perroni by introducing himself to him saying that he wanted to be part of his gang, Piggy joined him to one of his henchmen, Dum-Dum, with whom he would have to extort money from a person, but Hurricane was furious and attacked Piggy, disarming Dum-Dum and stunning him.[270]

name: Dumpling
description: During a ride in a quiet place where Carol wanted to teach Binary some things about humans, Binary met a group of kids in a diner who gave her a kitten called Dumpling. Soon after, they collided with a Snatmen, and Binary learned his first lesson in the frailty of life when Dumpling was a victim in the fight.[271]

name: Duncan
description: Duncan was at Yancy Street when he was was saved by Spider-Man from being forever trapped in the Negative Zone.[272]

name: Duncan
description:
Duncan took Josh Foley to a Reavers recruitment meeting. Immediately after, they attacked Sofia Mantega, but he was wounded and Josh healed him, discovering his a mutant status.[160]
Duncan later met Josh returning home, accusing him of being a mutie along with others, and beat him up.[161]
Sometime later he helped Donald Pierce escape and rallied the Reavers asking Pierce to kill Josh for taking him to the Reavers, but when they attacked the New Mutants, Duncan was easily subdued and was about to be killed by Wolfsbane but he implored her to not kill him and Rahne let him go.[273]

name: Duncan
description: Duncan was the Owl's driver.[274]

name: Duncan
description: Duncan was Randy and Janice's chauffeur who accompanied Peter Parker to California during his studies at the E.S.U. of Pasadena. Peter was accompanied to the Santa Monica Pier and arrived at the destination Peter turned to Duncan telling him to be careful that the local highways were not a joke.[275]

name: Dundee
description: Dundee was an acquaintance of Joseph Pike.[276]

name: Dunn
description: Mr. Dunn was the manager of the building in Mid-Manhattan where the office of Nelson & Murdock was located. He approached Karen Page to discuss the rent, but as she fainted in front of him, he rushed the girl to a hospital and then told Mr. Murdock about it.[277]

name: Dunphy
description: Dunphy was an I.N.S. agent who was stopped by Matthew Murdock from arresting Haitian refugee Yves Chapoteau.[278]

name: Durnis
description: Durnis and his twin brother Clemson were poaching in Azania when after Durnis hit a zebra with the shotgun, Deadpool cut his left arm. Later on during their return with their private jet they were assaulted by Jack O'Lantern who threw a pumpkin bomb into the jet that made him explode killing them both.[279]

name: Durst
appearences: Widowmakers: Red Guardian and Yelena Belova Vol 1 1
description: Dr. Durst was the warden of the prison, once a secret site for the black ops of the SHIELD, who in agreement with the person who had taken over the site, experimented on the inmates there prisoners making them their mercenaries and with a ruse they had them tested against Yelena Belova.[280]

name: Dusty
appearences: Avengers Origins: Ant-Man & the Wasp Vol 1 1
description: Dusty was one of the first ants befriended by Henry Pym.[281]

name: Dwayne
description: Dwayne was a boy from Harlem who warned Sam Wilson that he had sighted non-neighborhood people in skin-tights and heavily armed.[282]

name: Dylan
description: Dylan turned against his best friend after discovering he was a mutant.[283]

name: Earl
appearences: Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man Vol 1 42
description: Earl and Roy were two night watchers who were ambushed and defeated by the Frightful Four when they came to Liberty Island in a bid to lure Spider-Man.[1]

name: Earl
description: Earl was a news anchor who announced that Michael Reese and Melvin Potter were dead ringers.[2]

name: Earl
description: Many years later, Earl was knocked down by one of Armanda's mechanical pets when he infiltrated the Neural Port Complex.[3]

name: Earl
description: Earl was a security guard at Briggs Chemical LLC and intervened during the confrontation between the Avengers Academy students and Jeremy Briggs, but it was now useless as Briggs had already defeated them.[4]

name: Earl
description: Earl was one of the undead pirates who refused to ally with the Phantom Rider.[5]

name: Earl
description: Earl was the pilot of a propeller plane who was rescued by U.S.Agent after his plane was destroyed when it was hit by a dragon.[6]

name: Earle
description: Earle was the leader of an isolated community of accursed murderers, who were confronted and defeated by the Ghost Rider.[7]

name: Ebbhart
description: Prof. Ebbhart was one of the atomic experts kidnapped by the Living Eraser.[8]

name: Eddie
description: Eddie was ordered to throw the Painter out.[9]

name: Eddie
description: Eddie and Charlie attempted to capture the X-Men, and became shocked when they suddenly vanished.[10]

name: Eddie
description: Big Eddie, together with Charlie and Rocky, was caught stealing fur coats by Yellowjacket, who defeated them and delivered them to the police.[11]

name: Eddie
description: Eddie accidentally poisoned himself with Turhan's ring.[12]

name: Eddie
description: Eddie was one of Floyd Donahue's henchmen.[13]

name: Eddie
description: Eddie was one of Electro's henchmen who helped him escape from a NYPD paddy wagon.[14]

name: Eddie
description: Eddie was a hunter from Hope who was saved by Wolverine from the Wendigo.[15]

name: Eddie
description: Eddie was told to take the box containing Cylla down to overseas air-freight to Tokyo.[16]

name: Eddie
description: Eddie and another thug attacked Bishop, only to be rescued by him from Mountjoy's assault.[17]

name: Eddie
description: Eddie was one of Mr. Shockett's henchmen who was kidnapped, interrogated and beaten to death by Mr. Brazo.[18]

name: Eddie
appearences: Spider-Island: I Love New York City Vol 1 1
description: Eddie, an out-of-work accountant, and his wife Melinda attempted to rob an apartment during the confusion created during the Spider-Virus infection, but after tying up the two spouses who own the apartment were confronted by their six-year-old daughter of the couple, also infected by the Spider-Virus and therefore had acquired powers similar to those of Spider-Man, who defeated them by humiliating them and captured them.[19]

name: Eddie
description: Eddie and two of his accomplices were on the run from the police after stealing until they were stopped by Elektra in her new role as Daredevil.[20]

name: Edgar
appearences: Ghost Rider: Kushala Infinity Comic Vol 1 5
description: Mentioned: Ghost Rider: Kushala Infinity Comic #1, Ghost Rider: Kushala Infinity Comic #2

name: Edith
appearences: Mighty Marvel Holiday Special – Halloween with the Rhino Infinity Comic Vol 1 1
description: Edith and her brother James, after seeing Iron Man's public service message not to dress up for Halloween as a supervillain, decided to dress up as Spider-Man using only one costume for two with Edith carrying James on her shoulders, but during around the streets the two were misunderstood as the real Spider-Man by the Rhino who attacked them, but fortunately the real Spider-Man intervened who rescued them and in the meantime made the Rhino come to his senses by convincing him to follow the straight path with the enthusiasm of the two children.[24]

name: Edmund
description: Editor of the Guardian, the newspaper owned by Worthington Industries, he was to meet with his reporter for a scoop involving Warren Worthington. He reported this to Warren himself but he met him and killed him.[25]

name: Edmundson
description: General Edmundson tried to deceive Guardian into believing that he knew nothing about the betrayal of Department H but when Edmundson approached him he had him hit with the weapons at his disposal, however, not taking into account the intervention of the other members of Alpha Flight.[26]

name: Eduardo
description: Eduardo was a television reporter.[27]

name: Eduardo
description:
Eduardo was one of the custodians of the Baxter Building. Sue Richards introduced her to Zoe Golding to tell her that they were all a big family there and that he had been there ever since her eldest son was born. Eduardo enthusiastically responded by saying that there was nothing better than working at Baxter. Fortunately he was still with Sue when Exterminatrix bombed the Baxter Building, saving her from a fatal fall from the elevator.[28]
Eduardo later manages to track down Ben Grimm still trapped under the rubble.[29]

name: Edward
description: Edward was one of Angus MacWhirter's coworkers. Edward (identifiable by his wool cap) was coaxed to keep moving along by his friend St'urt as MacWhirter argued over the leasing of his hydrofoil to the American X-Men.[30] Sometime later, both he and St'urt noticed that MacWhirter had not been seen in awhile and discussed taking up his disappearance with the local police, unaware he'd been killed by Proteus.[31]

name: Edward
description: Edward and Jeff were two twin boys who escaped their house and fell down into a Morlocks' tunnel in Westchester County. They both were eventually rescued by their babysitter Kitty Pryde and Spider-Man.[32]

name: Edward
description: Edward was Evelyn Stanzler's partner.[33]

name: Edwards
description: Edwards was a Vietnam veteran who was seen discussing with the owner of a diner.[34]

name: Edwards
description: Mr. Edwards was one of the members of the US Senate who voted for the election or not of Tony Stark as Secretary of Defense.[35]

name: Edwards
description: Mr. Edwards was the adoptive father of Ethan Edwards who with his wife found the little Ethan just arrived on Earth with a spaceship launched by the Skrull parents of the newborn to save him from the destruction of their planet by Galactus.[36]

name: Edwards
description: Mrs. Edwards was the adoptive mother of Ethan Edwards who with her husband found the little Ethan just arrived on Earth with a spaceship launched by the Skrull parents of the newborn to save him from the destruction of their planet by Galactus.[36]

name: Edwards
description: Ethan's father made his son believe that his sister had mental retardation as divine punishment for his mother because she had had sexual relations before marriage.[36]

name: Efferson
description: Professor Efferson was a scientist who worked for Argno Gwace and was supposed to create a serum from Namor's blood that would immunize the inhabitants of the underwater fortress of Gwace, but he too was captured and brought to the surface to face justice after Namor defeated Gwace and its allies.[37]

name: Egg
description: Egg was confronted and knocked out by Cage.[38]

name: Egon
description: Egon was a human that was integrated into the Phalanx collective. He and other members of the Falange collective were sent by Cameron Hodge to clash with the X-Men but were defeated and perished in the fight.[39]

name: Eiko
description: Eiko was one of the children of a group of friends who witnessed a dragon appear in the sky, headed to attack Tokyo.[40]

name: Einar
description: Einar and Trygve, were Vanir warriors under the command of Hakon. They met Conan of Cimmeria on the battlefield among the corpses where the Vanir and Aesir had clashed, and being Conan an ally of the Aesir they confronted him, but the Cimmerian easily defeated them by killing all three.[41]

name: Eka
description: Eka was a member of the Chthonic Brotherhood in Jakarta.[42]

name: Elaine
description: Elaine was the manager of a Boston boutique who intervened during a discussion between Emma Frost, who was a shop assistant for the boutique, and a wealthy client about the physiological needs of the client's dog within the boutique itself and for which Elaine gave reason to the client by threatening Emma to fire her if she didn't clean up, which Emma didn't do by quitting her job.[43]

name: Elio
description: Elio was a construction worker at the George Washington Bridge who met Spider-Man (Peter Parker) after the Spider-Island event.[44]

name: Eliot
description: Eliot was a survivalist who met Longshot when he first appeared in Upstate New York.[45]

name: Elizabeth
description: Elizabeth was the mother of John the Baptist. Despite her husband and her old age, the Archangel Gabriel announced to her husband, a Jewish priest, that Elizabeth would have a child and that he would call him John.[46]

name: Ellen
description: Ellen was Johnny Storm's date for a big charity masquerade ball.[9]

name: Ellen
description: Ellen and her husband Chuck with their small newborn Bobby gave Eddie Brock a lift, stopping at a diner, where they were held hostage by a gang of robbers. When one of the robbers began molesting his newborn, Chuck fought back but the robber shot him in the shoulder. Later responding to the taunts of the bandits, Eddie decided to intervene and eliminated the entire gang.[47]

name: Ellie
description: Ellie was bitten and killed by Dracula in London.[48]

name: Elliot
description: Mr. Elliot was an A.I.M agent, he was the director of Alden's Department Store, which figured as an front for a secret A.I.M. base.[49] A wounded Elliot told Ms. Marvel about the plans they had for the Cavorite crystal.[50]

name: Elliot
description: Elliot worked as a clerk at the motel where Ben Reilly was staying in Rachel, Vermont.[51]

name: Ellis
description: Ellis was a Project Echelon superhuman injured by the Red She-Hulk.[52]

name: Elron
description: Elron was one of the security men at the Smith Building serving the Red Skull. After receiving authorization from Brice, he welcomed the five sparring partners provided by Taskmaster and elucidated them of what they could do during the training session without ever telling them that the opponent would be the Red Skull.[53]

name: Elsa
description: Dietrich and Elsa returned to the Norwegian fishing village to meet the parents of her who they hadn't seen since their wedding day, but once they arrived at the village they found it completely destroyed and abandoned.[54]

name: Elvis
description: Elvis was the son of a woman who used to hang with Cletus Kasady.[55]

name: Elvis
description: Elvis was Professor Pinter's dog, and whenever he took him for a walk on campus, Elvis enjoyed terrorizing pigeons until the day Astrid Bloom mentally controlled the pigeons who instead attacked Elvis and his master.[56]

name: Emilio
appearences: Fantastic Four: ¡Isla de la Muerte! Vol 1 1
description: Emilio was among the festive crowd in San Juan that celebrated Ben Grimm as El Morrito and was recognized by Ben and greeted by him.[57]

name: Emily
description: Emily was one of Reed Richards' co-worker.[58]

name: Emma
description: Emma was Jim's mother, who perished, along with her husband, in the artillery shelling during the American Civil War.[59]

name: Emma
description: Emma was the first ant ever to be used by Scott Lang, the second Ant-Man. She helped Scott during his first battle against Darren Cross.[60]

name: Emma
description: Emma was a tourist in Los Angeles who, together with her husband Henry and their son Nico, became caught up in a fight between the Sensational She-Hulk and the Incredible Hulk.[61]

name: Emmy
description: Emmy's father welcome a young Johann Schmidt to their house.[62]

name: Emory
description: Professor Emory went to the village of Wollanston Edge to study the alleged Wollanston Curse and to do this he went to the abandoned Wollanston Mansion together with a local girl who had agreed to be her assistant not imagining that the girl's intention was that to rob him, but as soon as he entered the mansion the girl's violent intention turned against her and suffered the curse right in front of Emory's eyes.[63]

name: Enok
description: Enok was a scavenger during the Great Cataclysm, who was killed by Red Sonja when he and his band of raiders attempted to harass her.[64]

name: Enri
description: Baron Enri of Nemedia was Evlena's father, who reacted against Count Trocero, believing he was mistreating his daughter. Before he could shed blood, he was calmed down by King Conan.[65]

name: Enrico
description: Enrico warned May Parker that the F.E.A.S.T. shelter was already at full capacity.[66]

name: Enrique
description: Enrique was a Tacos peddler in the Los Angeles Fashion District of which Humberto's cousins were customers.[67]

name: Epstein
description: Epstein was defeated by Elsie-Dee.[68]

name: Eric
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 2
description: Eric was one of the Stamford residents who participated in the lynching attempt against Robert Baldwin.[69]

name: Eric
description: Eric had rented an apartment in the U-Foes, not fully knowing who they were. When May Parker and Otto Octavius were looking for who had injured Peter and sent him into a coma, they located the apartment and asked Eric about the tenants.[70]

name: Erin
description: Erin was a member of M.O.R.D.OC.'s Cult who, after accidentally summoning Soldier Supreme, commented that he was much more beautiful than she had imagined, mistakenly believing they had been successful in invoking Satan instead.[71]

name: Ernie
description: Ernie pilot the mini-helicopter used to escape Charlie Samson. He was killed by the Punisher during the escape and consequently the helicopter crashed without his piloting.[72]

name: Ernie
description: Ernie was a policeman from the small town of Fortune in New Jersey. When a colleague of his spotted a confrontation between Spider-Man and armored agents of Target Technologies, he felt that it was beyond his possibilities to intervene and that he could not even ask for backup as Ernie was on holiday.[73]

name: Ernie
description: Ernie was a member of the rival gang of Red Fever who he got the tip from Scooter that Red Fever was in Riverdale and he gathered all the gang who ultimately clashed with against the Punisher.[74]

name: Errol
description: Errol was a member of the enhanced thugs of the Sweat Shop; he was on guard at the Smith Building in Washington, D.C. when he glimpsed Spider-Man and immediately alerted the Red Skull of his presence.[75]

name: Esmeralda
description: Esmeralda was a maid, who worked in the hotel where Carol Danvers stayed, who had recently lost her apartment.[76]

name: Esperanza
appearences: Captain America: Symbol of Truth Vol 1 4
description: Esperanza and another prisoner helped Falcon escape certain death from the Crossbones mercenaries. When Joaquin heard her name he jumped, thinking of his missing mother by the same name as her.[77]

name: Esteban
description: Esteban purchased Louis Richter's arms and ammunition.[78]

name: Esteban
description: Esteban took a picture of the Ghost Rider at Hillrock Heights in East Los Angeles. He was interviewed by Patricia Himmler and showed the picture on live television.[79]

name: Esther
description: Esther was at the F.E.A.S.T. Center when May Jameson distributed the American Science Journal where an article had been published by her niece Peter and Esther told her that she must be very proud of him.[80]

name: Ethel
description: Ethel and Albert attended a lecture on yoga given by Chondu the Mystic.[81]

name: Ethias
description: Ethias was chosen by Kull to venture with him, Brule and Akreon in southern Verulia looking for the amulet of Ka. In the bottom of a jungle pool used as a final resting place for mammoths, Ethias discovered plenty of ivory and bones. He was then murdered by the traitorous Akreon, who pretended he drowned while diving for bones.[82]

name: Eugene
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 1
description: Eugene was an elder from the town of Broxton who was arguing in the city diner, in the midst of a crowd of tourists who wanted to see the Asgardians, about the difficulties that their town and its inhabitants were going through.[83]

name: Eugevnia
description: Mr. Eugevnia was a jeweler in Manhattan. D-Man prevented a robbery in his store, but he ended up robbing a couple of jewels himself. As soon as he discovered Mr. Eugevnia informed Ben Urich, who was investigating D-Man.[83]

name: Eunice
description: Eunice attended Alicia Masters' sculpture exhibit.[84]

name: Eustace
description: Eustace's body was possessed by Mountjoy.[85]

name: Eva
description: Eva was the German shepherd of Edmund Heidler, the unaware clone of Adolf Hitler.[86]

name: Evans
description: Evans was one of the henchmen of the Power Elite who was attacked and eliminated by the Winter Soldier during the assault by Captain America and his allies on Madripoor.[86]

name: Eve
description: Eve was a fashion designer who was a guest on the Regis Philbin TV show where she presented her collection of hers and among the models that paraded was Mary Jane.[87]

name: Eve
description: Eve was a classmate of Gwen Stacy's at Empire State University. She invited her to hang out with her, Vic, and their other two friends at Stews 'n' Sammies. Gwen initially declined, but ended up arriving up late to their get-together.[88]

name: Eve
description: When Kerry met Eve with her dog Buddy, Eve asked Kerry where the cookie was for Buddy and Kerry replied that as soon as she had a place of her own and a bakery she would prepare them, also eve asked kerry how his life was going. amorous.[89]

name: Evie
description: Evie was a Stark Resilient employee and was hired by Pepper Potts to get a checkbook and give three wishes to the Eastland Consultancy. After telling Pepper that she would, she asked that she knew there were problems with Eastland and that they weren't thrilled to know that Stark was involved with their work.[90]

name: Evlena
description: Daughter of Baron Enri of Nemedia, Evlena was Count Trocero's bride. She was cursed by a magical ring, gifted by her former suitor Rovlok, which forced her to assassinate her husband, until King Conan stole the ring and eventually turned it against Rovlok.[65]

name: Ezmeralda
description: A seer and owner of the Full Moon Mystic shop. Marc Spector visited her shop while looking for the Sapphire Crescent, and he paid her a large sum of money for the item that she kept as a simple decoration.[91]

name: Fagan
description: Mr. Fagan was a hospital ward at Ryan Mental Hospital killed by the Master of Vengeance.[1]

name: Fairfield
description: Congresswoman Farfield reported to Captain America Lord Templar's appearance in Washington, D.C. They briefly discussed repercussions of Templar’s statements at the time and the media’s reaction before Cap was called away by an appearance by Pagan in New York.[2]

name: Falco
description: Falco was a gladiator who battled in Nova Roma's Julian Circus. He and his colleague, Rogier, battled against Samuel Guthrie and Roberto Da Costa in the gladiatorial ring.[3]

name: Faline
description: Faline was Cara's cat.[4]

name: Farisa
appearences: Decimation: House of M - The Day After Vol 1 1
description: Farisa was employed at MI-13. In the aftermath of M-Day, Farisa went to Pete Wisdom telling him that he had a meeting in which he had to inform the director of the MI13, the prime minister and finally Buckingham Palace of the situation. She also told him that he had to find Captain Britain as the country needed him.[5]

name: Farley
description: Farley decided to go hunting in the swamp.[6]

name: Farouk
description: Amahl Farouk's father was a 16th century Egyptian merchant. He was very proud of his son and of the gifts he protected the market with, but Farouk's father died of the plague when he was still young leaving him alone and at the mercy of the Shadow King.[7]

name: Faroun
description: Colonel Faroun attempted a coup in Idnshar by kidnapping King Iba-Taub, not imagining instead that he kidnapped Bob Brant, who looked very much like Iba-Taub. The real king together with Bob's friends freed him and defeated the rebellion, while Faroun attempted to escape on his private plane but was confronted by Bob and during the scuffle Faroun fell from the plane in flight going towards his death.[8]

name: Faulkner
description: Mrs. Faulkner was the manager of the Royal Riverboat Casino that discovered, thanks to the cameras, Emma Frost's attempt to defraud the casino by mentally believing that they had made a big win and were about to collect it when they were caught and as such the manager first fired the cashier for complicity even though she was actually innocent and thus kicking Emma and Troy Killlkelly out of the casino.[9]

name: Fawkes
description: One of the robotic members of Madame Masque's Inner Guard. It was destroyed in a battle between the Avengers and Count Nefaria.[10]

name: Fede
description: Fede was an ex of Loki, who along with other exes decided to take revenge on him not believing he had reformed into the God of Stories. Loki used this opportunity to re-meet his teammates in the Young Avengers.[11]

name: Feducio
description: Feducio was a greedy preacher of Mitra who was entrancing his followers. After Conan attempted to free his friend Redondo from Feducio's control, the priest told his worshippers the Cimmerian was a rain demon. Feducio was eventually killed on the spot by Conan.[12]

name: Feduniwicz
description: Feduniwicz was an agent in the government organization Project Wideawake. He was monitoring the movements of the New Mutants at Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters.[13]

name: Feinman
description: Jacob Feinman's brother refused to contribute hospital costs for the healing of his brother.[14]

name: Felden
description: Mr. Felden was a landlord from Staten Island who met the Fantastic Four while they were looking for a new home.[15]

name: Felicia
description: Felicia was the waitress of the Frost family whom Winston Frost fired, blaming her for Emma's illness at school for which she claimed it was due to not having breakfast and that it would be Felicia's duty to ensure that her children ate breakfast.[16]

name: Felicity
description:
Felicity was a researcher studying dinosaurs in Savage Land. She introduced Charlie Moon to Ka-Zar to alarm him at trying to make Savage Sand a territory open to exploitation by multinational corporations.[17]
Felicity accompanied Charlie Moon to persuade the Savage Land tribes to strike a favorable deal with foreign companies that wanted to exploit their lands.[18]
Felicity, after the Roxxon "Pangean Horizon" oil rig accident, is concerned about the preservation of the nest of super-giant turtles rather than helping populations in need.[19]
Seeing only Roxxon's intervention in healing the Tubanti tribe, Felicity wonders if this is a fortuitous opportunity or if it was all calculated and asks Shanna if by chance Torran is right.[20]

name: Felix
description: Felix witnessed Iron Man fighting against Charles Gray when he was possessed by Lucifer.[21]

name: Felix
description: Felix was one of the human beings infected by Lenz, whose cellular decay was advanced by Cuckoo's attack, to the point of death.[22]

name: Felix
description: An henchman of Angelica Rojas, Felix confronted Logan at the gate of Rojas' mansion.[23]

name: Felix
description: Father Felix held Julio Rodriguez.[24]

name: Fenley
description: Mrs. Fenley was the ghost owner of a boarding house, where Lester Barnett attempted to marry a wealth resident. After he tried to kill George Roberts Lester learnt about them all being ghosts.[25]

name: Fenrik
description: Fenrik was a Cimmerian of the ice-leopards clan. He was persuaded by Rion of the Laughing Visage to join him in the battle of Venarium against the Aquilonian invaders.[26]

name: Fenster
description:
Judge Fenster held court in Burt Corrigan's mental insanity case.[27]
When the hearing was swarmed by a horde of vampires, Fenster called the authorities to get them to help.[28]

name: Fenton
description: Fenton was a security guard at Stark's casino.[29]

name: Fenton
description: Fenton was the significant other of X-Statix member Myles Alfred who encouraged him to become Vivisector again in order to increase his book sales.[30]

name: Ferdinand
description: Ferdinand was a taco stand owner who was interrogated by Logan.[31]

name: Ferguson
description:
During the interview following the disappearance of the artifacts relating to the Korean witch of the 15th century, Dr. Ferguson told Cindy Moon the history and legend of the manyeo, and the frustration at the exhibit he had set up on her.[32]
Silk tried to contact Dr. Ferguson after she became old because of the Manyeo. He contacted her from the museum telling her that the Manyeo was there at that moment and was getting ready to perform a ritual, Silk joined him at the museum along with J. Jonah Jameson, but did not have time to warn Dr. Ferguson to escape from there and he was apparently killed by the Manyeo.[33]
After Silk's defeat of the Manyeo, Dr. Ferguson was revealed to be still alive although extremely confused about what had happened to him.[34]

name: Fernandez
description: Fernandez was a Guardsman serving at the Vault. He had to rush to Eddie Brock's cell with a sonic weapon following an alarm that had gone off but upon arriving at the cell he found Eddie in full crisis and the alien Symbiote apparently dead.[35]

name: Fernandez
description: A friend of Martinez-San, Señor Fernandez was killed by Eliza Martinez in the autumn of 1592.[36]

name: Fernando
description: Fernando was one of the guards at Buktir Van Tranh's estate, who was ordered to hand his gun to Frank Castle, so that Castle could kill Señor Valencia and prove his loyalty. However, Castle killed Fernando instead.[37]

name: Ferol
description: Ferol was Yatha's right hand, who was slain by Conan during his one-man raid on the warehouse.[38]

name: Ferranti
description: Ferranti was part of the Air Force and was stationed at them same base as Carol Danvers and Michael Rossi. He took pictures once when Danvers and Rossi kissed.[39]

name: Ferret
description: Ferret was Doctor Faustus' assistant. Replacing the bellboy of the building where Captain America lived, Ferret handed him the nightmares tablet given to him by Dr. Faustus pretending that they were the prescriptions that the psychiatrist gave him to counter his nightmares.[40]

name: Fife
appearences: United States of Captain America Vol 1 2
description: Fife was a Deputy Sheriff in Harrisburg and was guarding Nichelle Wright's cell when Captain America and Sam Wilson visited her and being opposed to Nichelle's arrest he allowed the two heroes to question her.[41]

name: Filbert
description: Mr. Filbert was one of Tad Carter's teachers.[42]

name: Fillmore
description: Dr. Fillmore assisted J. Jonah Jameson when he was hospitalized at the New York University Medical Center after being attacked by Jack O'Lantern.[43]

name: Finchley
description: Miss Finchley taught a music appreciation class at Centerville High School.[44]

name: Fine
description:
Doctor Fine gave Peter Parker a chance to find the money for his aunt's hospital bill.[45]
A while later, Dr. Fine asked Foggy Nelson to talk with the children hospitalized in the Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center.[46]

name: Fishhead
description: During Knull's invasion, Fishhead was one of the monsters that volunteered to join Deadpool's Special Ops team to protect their land.[47]

name: Fitzwater
description: Fitzwater was an assistant to Mayor Jameson who, after breaking into the hospital where Betty Brant was staying, yelled that he was now in charge and that he should have Betty moved to Mt. Sinai.[48]

name: Fiver
description: Fiver was a thug who was knocked out by Daredevil.[49]

name: Flaherty
description: Flaherty, from the mayor's office, attempted to calm down Mr. Dibbs.[50]

name: Flaherty
description: Sean Cassidy's solicitor, Flaherty was assassinated in Dal'Roon by Black Tom Cassidy.[51]

name: Flannigan
description:
Mr. Flannigan was the school's counselor of Midtown High School. Shortly after Peter received his spidery powers and the subsequent death of his uncle for which he felt responsible, Aunt May made arrangements with Mr. Flannigan that she could speak to Peter every Tuesday after school to deal with the pain of losing his uncle.[52]
When during a fight with Peter, Flannigan saw him with a black eye (obtained from being hit by the Thing), he blamed Flash Thompson by threatening to get him off the High School football team.[53]
During the confrontation between Spider-Man and the Clash at school, Mr. Falannigan ministered Aunt May getting involved in a breakdown.[54]
After Peter stole school gear to face Clash, he was charged with theft and Flannigan said there was no way to support him.[55]
Even after Peter paid the school, Flannigan told May that he would no longer attend Peter and May replied that she should never have her trust in him.[56]

name: Fletcher
description: Mr. Fletcher was one of the sailors who journeyed with Benjamin Franklin to Boston.[57]

name: Fletcher
description: Fletcher and Arnie were two workmen authorized by Raymond Sikorski to find and confiscate the circuitry used by the Vision in the Avengers Mansion.[58]

name: Fletcher
appearences: Silver Sable and the Wild Pack Vol 1 31
description:
Dr. Fletcher was the Sablinova family doctor and advised Silver Sable of her pregnancy and that she had taken steps to terminate it. This infuriated Silver who told her it was up to her to decide.[59]
Shortly thereafter, during a physical checkup, Dr. Fletcher informed Silver that there had been a computer error and that she was not pregnant and abruptly reiterated that she was not eligible to become a mother because of her activities.[60]

name: Fletcher
description: Fletcher was an employee of the Beyond Corporation who reported Maxine Danger that there was a full-scale containment breach at their site on Staten Island, which Maxine was already aware of, and ordered Fletcher to prepare the recovery team to be sent to the site to retrieve Ben Reilly and to keep the wet work squad ready.[61]

name: Flint
description:
Rocky Flint's father, he went to visit his daughter in the apartment she shared with Anya Corazon and while she came back he repaired her bookcase.[62]
Mr. Flint and his daughter Rocky were kidnapped by the Raven Society to force Anya to join them, but Anya regained her powers and freed him and his daughter.[63]

name: Flo
description: Flo was the receptionist of Horizon Labs. When Carlie went there asking for Peter to apologize, she told her she had no news of Peter and that Horizon Labs hadn't sent him anywhere.[64]

name: Floyd
description: Floyd was a news anchor who announced that Michael Reese and Melvin Potter were dead ringers.[65]

name: Folendahl
description: Miss Folendahl wanted to sue Dr. Strange for malpractice.[66]

name: Foley
description: Foley told the Wild Pack to change their name due to trademark laws of the Symkarian government.[67]

name: Folsome
description:
Dr. Folsome assisted Mary Jane Watson-Parker in delivering her baby at the New York Hospital.[68]
Folsome then immediately kidnapped her husband Peter Parker.[69]

name: Ford
description: Father Ford was the priest of the Church of St. Joseph. Upon Frank's return from the war, his wife Maria confessed to Father Ford telling him of the dreams she had about Frank, and Father Ford told her that she was worried about Frank's soul and it would be enough to send Frank to him to confess. But when Frank went to confession, Father Ford was shocked by what he told him.[70]

name: Foss
description: Foss was Korr's brother.[71]

name: Foxtrot
description:
Foxtrot was a member of the mercenary team known as the Kill Crew.[72]When Ben Reilly sent the Kill Crew after his fellow clone, the other Scarlet Spider, Foxtrot and Tango ambushed him while he was looking for clues in Ben's old office building.[73]
Scarlet Spider protected himself from Foxtrot and Tango's fire with a web-shield, and escaped through a window. Foxtrot tried to stop him by shooting a webline from which he was swinging, but Scarlet Spider escaped nonetheless.[72]

name: Frame
description: Frame was the local sheriff from Rain, New Hampshire.[74]

name: Fran
description: Fran was a nurse working in the veterans administration hospital where Abraham Kieros was being treated.[75]

name: Francine
description: Francine was a classmate of Emma Frost at Snow Valley School for Girls and from whom she obtained the answers for her midterm exams by reading her mind unconsciously not yet knowing she was a telepathic mutant.[16]

name: Francis
description: Francis was Miss Natchios' butler.[76]

name: Francis
description: Francis was a frog who was stomped to death by Juniper's father, Josiah.[77]

name: Francis
description:
Sister Francis was called by Tyger Tiger to take care of the boys and girls held as sexual slaves by Petrus and freed by her.[78]
Sister Francis advises Tyger Tiger that the kids they rescued and cared for told her they experimented on them leaving deep physical injuries.[79]

name: Franco
description: Franco was one of Jonah's henchmen who were confronted by Iron Man.[80]

name: Frank
description: Frank was a fan of the Human Torch.[81]

name: Frank
description: Frank was a soldier at Cape Canaveral and the driver for General William Bridges.[82]

name: Frank
description: Frank and his partner Jeff stopped Tony Stark and warned him about the local speed laws.[83]

name: Frank
description: Frank and Mickey, members of the Metropolitan Police Department, arrested Warlock's followers in Washington, D.C..[84]

name: Frank
description: Frank was a resident of Salem Center. He met members of the New Mutants at the Salem Center Mall.[85]

name: Frank
description: Frank was a talk show host who invited Moonstone as the America's newest idol.[86]

name: Frank
description: Frank was one Simon Steele's men, who arrested Dominic Fortune when he sneaked inside the Mississippi Queen.[87]

name: Frank
description: Frank was a sewer worker who witnessed the Abomination wandering the New York sewers.[88]

name: Frank
description: Frank was one of three Dreadnought 2000 controllers who were sent to oppose Spider-Man and the New Warriors when they entered the Target Technologies plant, since Dreadnought 2000 were new automatons not yet programmed for autonomous functions and needed someone to handle them. maneuvered. When Spider-Man realized they were being remote controlled, he burst into the control room and knocked out Frank and the other two controllers so the Dreadnoughts started acting randomly and the New Warriors could destroy them.[89]

name: Frank
description: Frank was a Osborn Industries security guard who confronted Shadrac.[90]

name: Frank
description: Frank helped Mister Fantastic assembling the Anti-Galactus Suit.[91]

name: Frank
description: Frank was a customer of Bill's diner.[92]

name: Frank
description: Frank was a cameraman who covered the violent outbursts in New York City which followed the manhunt for Curt Connors.[93]

name: Frank
appearences: Incredible Hulk and the Human Torch: From the Marvel Vault Vol 1 1
description: Frank was a policeman from a little town in southern Virginia. He was called to the rescue by a diner owner due to the presence of the Hulk in his local.[94]

name: Frank
description: Frank was part of Amanda Armstrong's security staff.[95]

name: Frank
description: Frank was Elsie's father and Dee's husband, a homeless family. The pair of parents mistreated the child, until Elsie was possessed by the Symbiote Carnage, who cured the child of the burns caused by the abuse suffered by her parents, after which she killed first Frank and then Dee.[96]

name: Frankie
description: Frankie worked for Hook and was one of several who attacked the business ran by Mr. Martin. On one such attack he was captured by the Ferret but before he could be interrogated, the Hook shot at the pair, allowing Frankie to escape. When a bomb goes off at another facility Frankie is spotted by Ferret, which allows the Hook to capture him.[97]

name: Frankie
description: Frankie was a pedestrian who was rescued by Iceman from a falling piece of the Champions Headquarters defensive devices.[98]

name: Frankie
description: Frankie was one of the young junkies who attacked Storm when she entered an abandoned apartment building in Harlem.[99]

name: Frankie
description: Frankie was a long time affiliate of Phillipe Bazin's. He sided with Nico to stalk Bloodshed, but he was eventually defeated by Spider-Man.[100]

name: Frankie
description: Frankie fled as soon as he witnessed the Zombie climbing out the East River.[101]

name: Frankie
description: Frankie was a Canadian Army soldier who had to drive a truck to transport evacuees due to the attack of Nerkod and the Atlanteans but the truck was unable to leave and was attacked.[102]

name: Frankie
description: Frankie was a child of a career soldier who lived on the military base where Bucky also lived and often fought with him.[103]

name: Franklin
description: He was the driver of Raymond Osworth.[104]

name: Franklin
description: Franklin was a weapons specialist who worked for various criminal and terrorist organizations including Mr. Negative, for him he managed to replicate and build the Fistigons, but Mr. Negative discovered that Franklin had sold information about his clients to various government agencies in exchange for the immunity and for this Mr. Negative killed him.[105]

name: Fred
description: Fred noticed Doctor Strange and Clea walking by the street.[106]

name: Fred
description: Fred was driving the express train hijacked by the Controller; he was immediately enslaved like the rest of the crew and passengers.[107]

name: Fred
description: Fred and his wife Alma were awakened in the middle of the night when the Angel attacked the X-Men in his apartment.[108]

name: Fred
description: Fred and his partner found Hulk's sunken space capsule.[109]

name: Fred
description: Fred and his family watched the news about the Cosmic Hulk.[110]

name: Fred
description: Fred used to work together with Phil Sheldon.[111][112]

name: Fred
description: Fred noticed the Avengers in a famous jazz club. He grew anxious over their presence, as two of them he recognized as being mutants, but was chastised for his attitude by his date, who was more curious about what they could be discussing.[2]

name: Fred
description: Fred was one of the inhabitants of the village in British Columbia where Logan established himself with Rose O'Hara. He ended up respecting Logan as he got to know him, and together with his friend Bert, defended Logan when Cookie Malone started to insult him.[113]

name: Fred
description: He was one of the reporters who attended Senator Bianco's press conference.[114]

name: Fred
description: Fred was a salesman for Brain Damage, Inc.[115]

name: Fred
description: Fred was a bartender who told his client Moondark if he knew the President was coming to town.[116]

name: Freda
description: Freda is the one of the housekeepers/cooks to Hedy Wolfe and her family.[117]

name: Freddie
description: Freddie was a Bronx Morgue guardian, he was paid by Paladin to investigate inside the City Morgue for an hour but Freddie only gives him 15 minutes.[118]

name: Freddie T
description: Freddie T delivered a message by Joe Fixit to Jimmy Delfini.[119]

name: Freddy
description: Freddy witnessed the Hulk, accompanied by Jim Wilson, enter the studios.[120]

name: Freddy
description: Freddy was Shiela Whittier's boyfriend. Freddy accompanied Shiela to her mansion which she had inherited from her uncle Alestar Dunwick. Despite Shiela's discomfort, Freddy convinced her to visit her mansion and as they were about to go down a flight of stairs, a hand from the shadow pushed Freddy behind him, knocking him down the stairs and killing him.[121]

name: Freddy
description:
Freddy was a friend and stunt partner of Simon Williams.[122]
He came to visit him while he was moving out to the Avengers Compound.[123]

name: Frederick
description: Frederick was a highly autistic mutant, and when his mutant powers developed, his whole body mutated into an arachnoid. The quadriplegic mutant Martin Strong developed a symbiotic relationship with Frederick using his arachnoid body as a means of locomotion, and thanks to this symbiosis, Frederick developed a new sensory input.[124]

name: Fredrick
appearences: Breaking Into Comics the Marvel Way! Vol 1 1
description: Fredrick was killed by Bullseye at a maximum security prison for criminally insane.[125]

name: Fritz
description: Fritz was one of Carl von Harbou's patients that was quickly scared out of his office at the news of Dracula's return in combination with a scream outside.

name: Fritz
description: Fritz was one of the pseudo-patriotic terrorists who were defeated by Cosmic Spider-Man after they threatened to blow up the Statue of Liberty.[126]

name: Frosty
appearences: Spider-Man/Black Cat: The Evil That Men Do Vol 1 5
description: Frosty and Gooch Herbert hassled the teenage Francis Klum for using the sophomore washroom. Before they could pummel him, Francis' older brother Garrison intervened, beating up Herbert and smashing his face into a urinal.[127]

name: Funzlobe
description: Mr. Funzlobe was an employee of Timely Inc. to whom Rocket Raccoon delivered the mail telling him that he had to sign to receive it and he made fun of him asking that he certainly had a miniature Raccoon pen suitable for that.[128]

name: Fuwadh
description: Fuwadh was one of Sheik Ali Maksoud's men, who was called to investigate the attack of a werewolf in the tribe's camp.[129]

name: Gabe
description: Gabe was a drunk who was ambushed by Grizzly when the bar closed.[1]

name: Gabi
description: Gabi was a Mexican girl who together with her friends Javier and Miguel found a deep hole and on the outside what remained of the pupal state of one of Maggott's endosymbiotes and were terrified when they saw the slug grown to gigantic size.[2]

name: Gabriel
description: Vinnie's son, Gabriel was rescued by Spider-Man from Hydra agents.[3]

name: Gail
description: Exposed to the red cloud from Mount Rushmore, Gail managed to take her son Paul to Keystone.[4]

name: Gail
description: Gail was shown on TV attending a maggot-eating contest.[5]

name: Gaius
description: Gaius was a colleague of Marcus Gallio in Nova Roma.  He warned him about the dangers if the New Mutants were to turn on them.[6]

name: Gales
appearences: America Chavez: Made in the USA Vol 1 3
description: Gales was a millionaire scientist who owned an island with magical characteristics, on which he invited the mothers of America Chavez with the intention of finding a cure that plagued the child with experimentation that was not entirely ethical.[7]

name: Gallus
description: As Gallus was about to marry Talena, he accidentally fell from a tree in the orchards of Valusia and died. Talena begged Kull to use the amulet of Ka to revive him, but, being already dead, he awoke as a manifestation of death and was finally laid to rest by the king.[8]

name: Gamal
description: Gamal was a guard at Farnoq Dahn's Fortress (and possibly a soldier in the Trans-Sabalian Army). While guarding X-Factor's leader Havok (came as US support to Trans-Sabal but captured by Farnoq Dahn to be used in their nuclear program), he, Stahn and two other guards were taken down by Hulk.[9]

name: Gamble
description: Mr. Gamble was a vampire under the Navarro regime. He participated in the kidnapping of Summer Klein and while he was feeding on her intervened Hannibal King, hired by Summer's parents, who saved the girl and killed Gamble and the other vampires with him.[10]

name: Gammal
description: Gammal was a soldier (and possibly a platoon leader) in the Trans-Sabalian Army. At their position guarding the way to the Sendara Pass (and their lines of supply), they were met with the Hulk who offered them to surrender and avoid violence, to which they replied with their weapons before getting neutralized by Hulk's knock-out gas. The Trans-Sabalian Air Force immediately dropped bombs on the position, killing the soldiers while leaving the Hulk unharmed.[11]

name: Gantlebanter
description: Mr. Gantlebanter was an employee of Timely Inc. who, seeing Rocket running in the offices fleeing the wooden Clown, was frightened by saying that the Clown would kill them all.[12]

name: Ganz
description: Ganz was an henchman of Pablo Espinosa who was confronted and knocked out by the Zapata Brothers.[13]

name: Gar
description: Twin brothers Gar and Larry stabbed each other to death over jealousy for a Gehenna Stone fragment.[14]

name: Gardel
description: Gardel was the owner of a bodega in Brooklyn and when Miles Morales walked into his shop to buy some flags, Gardel gave him some Dominican flags but a friend of Miles who was present in the bodega corrected Gardel telling him that Miles' mother was Puerto Rican, and Gardel apologizing, he replaced them with the exact ones.[15]

name: Gardner
description: Mr. Gardner was Heidi's father.[16]

name: Gargantax
description: Gargantax was the giant champion of Baron Mort-Pointard, who, thanks to his prowess in armed combat, managed to perpetuate the baron's tyrannical reign for a dozen years. For all his ferocity in battle, Gargantax was, at heart, a bashful childlike man, who fell in love with a peasant girl named Giselle. Despite his attempts to win her admiration and affection, Giselle simply couldn't love him and she ran away. Since the titan was inconsolate and would not fight, the baron sent his men to recapture her and then arranged the duel with Fafnir. Gargantax quickly overpowered both him and the intervening Conan, but Giselle rushed down in the arena to stop the giant from killing his opponents, distracting him enough so that Conan could wound and then skewer and kill Gargantax.[17]

name: Garn
description:
One night, Garn found an unconsciously wounded Conan just outside his house in Cimmeria, supposedly left by a goddess.[18]
Some time later, while Garn was working as a slaver for a band of yellow lotus smugglers, their camp in was raided by Fafnir and Conan, who set free the squad's slaves, allowing him, Fafnir, and Noirelle to escape.[19]

name: Garrison
description: Dr. Garrison was about to deal with a Rick Jones transfusion because of his radiation exposure when a nurse was accidentally infected by a syringe containing corrupted blood from Dire Wraiths and turned into a monstrous creature that assaulted Dr. Garrison and killed her.[20]

name: Garrison
description: The boss of one of the New York crime families summoned by Hobgoblin and killed by him for not taking him seriously.[21]

name: Garrison
description: A psychiatrist staff member of the Ravencroft Institute, accompanied Dr. Mueller by Martha Paterson of which he claimed to be one of his patients.[22]

name: Garrity
description: Minor: Fear Itself: Uncanny X-Force #2

name: Garson
description: Garson was one of the guards of Department X who apparently caged Wolverine in Calgary.[25]

name: Garth
description:
Garth was Paxton and Penelope Page's butler.[26]
He was actually a government agent tasked to protect Paxton Page secretly from his real enemies.[27]

name: Garth
description: Garth was an actor who was running a scene with Julie Angel at the Village Theatre.[28]

name: Garth
description: Garth was one of Mary Jane Watson-Parker's bodyguards while walking through Fifth Avenue.[29]

name: Garvin
description: During the absence of Thaddeus Ross's father who had gone to war, Mr. Garvin took care of the Ross farm,[30] but he also had a love affair with Thaddeus's mother.[31]

name: Gary
description: Gary quickly left the Washington Square Park as soon as he noticed the Hulk walking by.[32]

name: Gary
description:
Gary was a Centennial University student who used to hang out at the Daily Grind.[33]
He was often seen with Desiree Winthrop.[34]

name: Gary
description: Gary was John Pillinger's cameraman.[35]

name: Gary
description:
Given the difficulty of extrapolating John Steele's thoughts at the time of his past where he was persuaded to join the Shadow Council, Gary suggested that Steve join the experimental session by sharing Steele's thoughts.[36]
After Steele wakes up and takes another assistant hostage, Hank McCoy has him believe that his assistants are LMDs leaving Gary baffled. Hank later revealed it was a bluff.[37]

name: Gary
description: Gary was a hot-dog vendor from which Peter and his homeless neighbors usually went to.[38]

name: Gavin
description: A reporter for the Daily Globe, Gavin and hie colleague Jay were told by Barney Bushkin to cover the Sentinels' story.[39]

name: Gavin
description: In high school, when Gavin was a "Mr. Popular Super-Jock," he spread an unmentionably horrible rumor about Tanya Patterson that made her great-guy boyfriend dump her and cost her all her friends. She ended up marrying some loser and having awful kids. Nine years later, she hired Deadpool to kill Gavin for $500. Deadpool broke into some guy's house and ordered a pizza. When Gavin, now a pizza delivery man, showed up, Deadpool ate the pizza (pineapple and black olive), then killed Gavin.[40]

name: Gayle
description: Gayle was a news anchorwoman who during a series of interviews with street people about the Progenitor's doomsday, was asked by her colleague on the news that fortunately they were lucky not to have to make a moral judgment but only report the news but she replied that they reported violence on average and by accepting money with the ads meant that they monetized the violence.[41]

name: Gene
description:
Art Director for Woman Magazine, presents the project of two covers to Carol, for the magazine but Carol refuses both of them considering them pathetic.[42]
Gene bursts into the office of associate editor Tracy Burke screaming that Carol had forced him to layout a new cover of the magazine for lunchtime and then she did not find herself at that time to be able to approve it.[43]

name: Gene
description:
Gene was a school friend of Chris Powell. He was in the small group of friends who went on a fishing trip to make male bondings.[44]
After skipping yet another meeting at the Radio Club, Gene thinks that even if Chris is a good guy he should be kicked out to teach him a lesson.[45]
While at the diner with Chris and the other friends, Chris says he was in the space, leaving Gene and the other stunned, and then declaring that he was joking.[46]
Gene is at Headset's house celebrating with Chris's whole family.[47]
Gene and the other guys meet Chris after a long time, but Chris quickly walks away saying he had to work.[48]
Gene was at the Powell home to celebrate the return of Chris' father.[49]
Gene and the other kids welcome Chris back to the school cafeteria.[50]
When asked by one of Chris's friends if he would return to their group, Gene replies that he has patience since Chris had just returned to school.[51]

name: Gennady
description: Gennady and Dmitri were two soldiers who were tasked to located the Mandarin's body amid the wreckage of his sky dragon aircraft. Instead they found a badly beaten Iron Man, who tried to explain what had happened inside the aircraft but then collapsed.[52]

name: Genuardi
description:
Mr. Genuardi was a greengrocer and neighbor of Steve Rogers. Passing him on his way home, Steve asked him what his bad mood was, and he complained about building a skyscraper in their neighborhood.[53]
When he met Steve and Sharon walking together, he asked him what he thought of the new candidate Bolt as he was being supported by Captain America. After talking to Sharon too, Mr. Genuardi invited them both to dinner for Saturday night, as he always did with Steve.[54]

name: Geoff
description: Geoff was a sailor who met and married Cheryl Porter. During their honeymoon, he was serving on the smuggling ship used to bring the Titanium Man in the United States.[55]

name: Geoff
description: Geoff was an Executive Member of Stark International's Board of Directors. He tried to invite Tony Stark into leaving to someone else his C.E.O. role in favor of a Chief Technologist title, in order to have a more skilled manager leading the company, without obtaining result.[56]

name: Geoff
description: Geoff was the bartender of Don's Bar & Grille on the planet Markus-Centauri, the place where Odin had holed up after giving the throne to Thor to enjoy his beer.[57]

name: Geoffrey
description: Geoffrey was a bouncer at the Hotel Inferno who attempted to stop Doctor Strange from going to visit Mephisto but was soundly knocked down by the sorcerer.[58]

name: George
description: Kidnapped his cousin Hal in Cuba with the intention of killing him so as to become the sole heir. The murder was thwarted by Namor who captured George and handed him over to Cuban authorities.[59]

name: George
description: Mr. George was the owner of a fishing boat company and discovered that his partner used the boats to smuggle diamonds and for this he was killed and tried to put the blame on an immigrant.[60]

name: George
description: George was a scientist friend of the Human Torch intent on building a spaceship to carry out explorations on other worlds but after observing the behavior of men towards a benevolent alien race George destroyed his plans for the spaceship thinking that man did not be worthy of the stars.[61]

name: George
description: Fed up with the constant questions of the son Johnny, George answered him with absurd answers and to the question of how he had arrived, George replied that the stork had brought him using a magic horn, but when Johnny used the horn in effect a flock of storks arrived to his home, each carrying a newborn baby.[62]

name: George
description: George met a little man who was looking for his green hat and his glasses, only that the hat could only seen by who had the gift from the Green Goddess and George discovered that he had it because he could see the hat, even though initially he did not believe that story. After the little man recognized George as one those who possessed the gift asked him to help him find the glasses, but George with various excuses tried to mislead the man in the following days until the day, looking for the place where he had to have a job interview, he met a charming girl who was a cashier in a pub and discovered that she was the daughter of the little man and then resigned himself to his role as a person who possessed the gift of the Green Goddess.[63]

name: George
description: George was a bandit who bullies his innocent sister into ambushing Kid Colt, but she takes pity on the Kid and he gets the chance to face her brother again. He tries not to hurt him, but in their struggle the bandit falls from a cliff.[64]

name: George
description: George was the good, humble and helpful gardener of Lucius Farnsworth's estate who refused to start his own business despite Farnsworth's financial help, among other things without his knowledge he saved mankind when he uprooted the mutated plant The Weed thinking it was a simple weed.[65]

name: George
description: The second witness to the attack by the Cyclops (A-Chiltarian Robot) and he sold Hank Pym and Janet van Dyne a boat to lead them to site of the attack. He also manned the dock radio communication and had just heard another disappearance as they were talking. [66]

name: George
description: George believed that Captain America had robbed a bank.[67]

name: George
description: A short time later, George and his wife witnessed the Hulk suddenly appearing in the middle of Times Square.[68]

name: George
description: George, a member of the Committee, discovered a chemical that could bring temporary blindness so that the band could use it during their raids and thefts without being able to be identified and stopped.[69]

name: George
description: A while later, George's car was hit by the Jackal's bus.[70]

name: George
description: George was one of the tourists who witnessed Dormammu standing over the Grand Canyon.[71]

name: George
description: Some time later, one night in the Greenwich Village, George and his family saw Spider-Man fighting against strange four-armed creatures.[72]

name: George
description: George was one of the Purifiers who were watching over the X-Men, part of a team who trailed Colossus, his sister, and Ariel from Stevie Hunter's dance school back to the X-Mansion. He wanted to use the opportunity to kill Hunter before doing so but was dissuaded by his partner, who reminded George that the X-Men were the priority, and "race traitors" would be dealt with later. He may or may not have been among the Purifiers who later kidnapped Ariel and Illyana, and wound up fighting the X-Men and Magneto aboard a subway train in the South Bronx.[73]

name: George
description: George and Harry went to the destroyed parking lot where the Silver Surfer defeated Doctor Doom.[74]

name: George
description: George was a member of the terrorist group of the Bartovian Liberation Front who stormed Orly International Airport in Paris just as Hawkey, Silver Sable and Sandman were arriving who confronted and captured them.[75]

name: George
description: An elderly native who owned a gas station in the Nevada desert, George came to the aid of Marlo Chandler when she had a car accident in the desert. George accompanied Marlo to his gas station and there they were both attacked by the Werewolf who blocked George under Marlo's car hood.[76]

name: George
description: George was Mazzilli's chauffeur, a businessman and drug runner.[77]

name: George
description: George was a suicidal jumper who climbed the Rand Building, but was eventually rescued by Spider-Man (Ben Reilly).[78]

name: George
description: George was a client of the Chez Paul restaurant that was suffocating from having swallowed badly food and had to intervene the ambulance of Jake Olson and Christine Collins to save him.[79]

name: George
description: George was a vampire who in the company of Ian's uncle and another vampire attacked the boy and his friend Michelle in her father's shop where they went to retrieve the bag that Ian had hidden inside with the material to fight Ian's uncle who had become a vampire, but only Blade's intervention saved the boys who eliminated the vampires.[80]

name: George
description: George was one of psychopaths who was brainwashed in the Psychoville project to make him a perfect assassin but was one of the first who the treatment gave disorders, making him once again psychotic trying to kill the woman who acted as his wife Alice.[81]

name: Georgia
description: Georgia was one of Bill Hollister's assistants.[82]

name: Georgie
description: Georgie was saved by Karkas from Attila the Hun.[83]

name: Georgie
description: Georgie was one of the circus workers at "Mr. Mike's One-Ring Traveling Tent Show" in Sullivan County.[84]

name: Georgie
description: Georgie and his partner Richie were two burglars provided hi-tech equipment by Doctor Doom, as part of an elaborate ruse to steal Mjolnir.[85]

name: Georgie
description: Georgie and Larry were ordered by Hammerhead to get rid of Peter Parker.[3]

name: Georgina
description: Georgina was a counter woman for a fish and chips shop near the GPO Tower. She was serving a police officer at the takeaway window when he told her to keep his order warm while he checked out a suspicious sound, having managed to faintly hear Iron Fist breaking into the tower.[86]

name: Georgio
description: Georgio knew Heather Glenn at a cocktail party in SoHo.[87]

name: Gerald
description: Gerald was a teaching assistant in Miss Finchley's music appreciation class at Centerville High School.[88]

name: Geraldine
description: Geraldine was a resident of Crooked Market in Otherworld and was a contact of Gambit to whom she revealed a passage to a tavern where all undesirables under Merlyn's rule were hiding .[89]

name: Gerard
description: Gerard was the director of a science fiction movie which was being filmed in Sudan.[90]

name: Gerry
description: Gerry was an underground arms dealer in London who was interrogated by Captain America and Spitfire.[91]

name: Gervase
description: An old man to whom the Mask of Death by Koala Mumba guaranteed youth along with four other men to the detriment of various teenagers without their knowledge. They were forced to become members of the very successful boy-band among the teenagers of the Podunk Slam by Mr. Appletree, the one who had made them rejuvenate using the mask. But when Moon Knight showed them what was happening to their fans, they all gave up their success and youth by destroying the mask.[92]

name: Gezdbadah
description: Mr. Foley, personal assistant of Mr. Tolliver gave Mr. Gezdbadah a disc for safekeeping, which contained information regarding Tolliver's will. Chased by several mercenaries, Mr. Gezdbadah's briefcase was eventually stolen by Black Tom and the Juggernaut.[93]

name: Gibbs
description: Gibbs was hired by The Rose to capture Spider-Man. Pretending to be a member of Mayor Wilson Fisk's Thunderbolt Units, he arrested Spider-Man right after the Human Torch and the Thing helped him escape, putting him on a power-inhibiting collar. While being transported to the Rose's lair, however, Spider-Man realized they weren't cops and escaped their capture, much to the Rose's chagrin.[94]

name: Gibson
description: Gibson was a Canadian border guard who was assigned to watch over if he caught a glimpse of the members of Alpha Flight and in that case to shoot on sight.[95]

name: Gilbert
description: At the head of a criminal operation led by a video station for the Kingpin, his operation was opposed and dismantled by Spider-Man and as a punishment the Kingpin broke both his legs.[96]

name: Gilda
description: Gilda witnessed the Invisible Woman and the Thing run to rescue the Human Torch and Mister Fantastic.[97]

name: Gillian
description: Dr. Gillian agreed to finance Professor Harker's design project.[98]

name: Gina
description: Gina was Lucien Goff's first love.[99]

name: Gina
description: Gina came across Daredevil during a fight against Bullseye. She then talked to him until he recovered about both of them's motivations to fight each other.[100]

name: Giselle
description: Giselle was the daughter of a peasant, who was sold to Baron Mort-Pointard to be given as a gift for his champion Gargantax. Despite the giant's attempts to win her admiration and affection, she simply couldn't love him, so she ran away. Since the titan was inconsolate and would not fight, the baron sent his men to recapture her, but Giselle was eventually saved by Conan and Fafnir. Conan left with Giselle in an effort to take her to safety in the countryside, but they both ended up caught by the baron's men, while Fafnir was chosen to challenge Gargantax. In the arena, Giselle rushed down to stop the giant from killing his opponents, distracting him enough so that Conan could wound and then skewer and kill Gargantax.[17]

name: Gish
description: Gish was a street thug who was confronted and defeated by Puma.[101]

name: Giuseppe
description: Giuseppe was a pastry chef whose famous cannoli were highly coveted by Thing and Spider-Man.[102]

name: Gladys
description: Gladys spotted the Beast outside the Regency theatre.[103]

name: Gladys
description: Gladys screamed in alarm to her husband Henry that there was a 300-foot flying dragon flying over the city, unable to distract him from reading her newspaper with Henry telling her that there was always something odd to hear her.[104]

name: Gleason
description: Gleason was part of the Mutant Response Division's squad who ambushed X-Factor while they were tracking Titania.[105]

name: Glen
description: Glen was the leader of a gang that tried to rob the Queen City Bank in Charlotte, North Carolina, but was beaten by Kaine and arrested along with his gang.[106]

name: Glenda
description: Smitty's mother, Glenda was a crack addict.[107]

name: Glenn
description: Glenn and Mark witnessed a group of ninjas rob a grave in broad daylight at Cypress Hills Cemetery.[108]

name: Glenn
appearences: Black Panther: The Man Without Fear Vol 1 521
description: Josh Glenn's wife was an apathetic woman with chronic fatigue syndrome who ignored her husband's complaints about his work and what was going on under his concept of justice. After losing his job and his constant racist ranting, she kicked him out of the house with a restraining order.[109]

name: Glorana
description: Glorana was a girl of the Greybear Clan, who met Conan while Hakar was escorting her to her uncle. When Grimm attacked them, she was eventually rescued by Conan.[110]

name: Gloria
description: In an East-Side night club, Hawkeye showed Gloria his fascinating-looking Avengers signal ring.[111]

name: Gloria
description: Some times later, Gloria became John O'Shea's lover.[112]

name: Gloria
description: Gloria was Senator Ricky White's assistant.[113]

name: Gloss
description: Dr. Gloss ran the Midtown Hospital. She informed Nick Manolis and Daredevil of Bullseye's growing brain tumor and his increasing obsession with Daredevil.[114]

name: Gnut
description: Gnut was the mute man-servant of Avoosl Wuthoqquan, who was sent after Conan to kill him and get his master's money back, but he was swiftly killed by the Cimmerian.[115]

name: Goff
description: When he was a child, Lucien Goff's father pointed the gun at him and his mother served as a shield.[99]

name: Goff
description: Lucien's mother stood between her son and her husband who pointed his gun at him when Lucien was still a child.[99]

name: Gold
description: Melissa Gold's father had already been dead for two years when Jack Monroe, using an image inducer, appeared as Melissa in his trailer and his neighbor Tim McConnaghey told him/her about what had happened.[116]

name: Golightly
description: Miss Golightly was eventually rescued from Athabasca Ike by the Hunter in Darkness.[117]

name: Gomer
description: Gomer was the leader of the Fist of Freedom paramilitary group. Gomer's aim was to make America great again by removing the immigrants from the country and aimed to start this process by bombing the capital. The group was defeated by the Scorpion who squired acid onto Gomer's eyes.[118]

name: Gomez
description: Mentioned: Werewolf by Night (Vol. 3) #1

name: Gomez
description: Mentioned: Werewolf by Night (Vol. 3) #1

name: Gonzales
description: Mr. Gonzales was harassed and beaten by the Sons of the Serpent.[120]

name: Goodwin
description: Mr. Goodwin was a research scientist from Mesa Verde who was used as a test subject for the Venom symbiote.[121]

name: Gordo
appearences: Spider-Island: I Love New York City Vol 1 1
description: Gordo and three other criminals, after being infected by the Spider-Virus and having acquired powers similar to those of Spider-Man, disguised as Spider-Men, robbed a bank killing various hostages until the Punisher intervened who first eliminated Gordo who was doing the pole during the robbery after which using Gordo's disguise he eliminated the other gang members.[122]

name: Gordy
description: Gordy spotted a flying sink over Bowery.[123]

name: Goro
description: Goro was a heroin drug dealer affiliated with Clan Yashida who was defeated by Wolverine.[124]

name: Gort
description: Gort was hired by Frank Drake to remove Dracula's tomb.[125]

name: Goulart
description: Mrs. Goulart was the shopkeeper at Sal's Costume Shop in Rio de Janeiro. Members of the New Mutants came to purchase costumes at the shop. The shop was damaged when the students battled Axe.

name: Grace
description: Grace was a prostitute whose body was possessed by the spirit of a Wicca belonging to the ancient Celtic tribe of the Iceni who woke up when Satana arrived in London, convinced that she was the mighty matriarch they had been waiting for and that would guide them.[126]

name: Gracie
description: Gracie was a homeless veteran who stood at the corner of the Third and the Bowery, and to whom Peter always gave a little financial help.[38]

name: Grainger
description: Mrs. Grainger was the homeowner of Dr. Whitby. Upon returning home after a few days of sleeping at her workplace in Crossmore, Mrs. Grainger politely asks her if she were to stay out of the house for any longer periods of time to empty the trash and empty the fridge because some tenants had complained about the smell.[127]

name: Grayson
description: He turned to Sheriff Blaze Carson, fearing for the life of her husband Harry as he went to the village saloon to discuss with Ace Dorman.[128]

name: Greene
description: Greene was an agent of the S.W.A.T. who broke into a house in Ann Arbor to capture what they thought was a terrorist.[129]

name: Greepy
description: Mr. Greepy is the CEO of the alien Living Corporation Hexus and could take any physical appearance of his choice. He and the whole Corporation was defeated and eliminated by Noh-Varr as ordered by Plex.[130]

name: Greg
description: Greg was one of Moses Magnum's Deterrence Research Corporation workers.[131]

name: Greg
description: In a television station near the Adirondack Mountains, Greg received a remote broadcast from the Thunderbolts, while they were fighting Arnim Zola inside Doctor Doom's Castle.[132]

name: Greg
description: Greg and Josh were two senior jock bullies at Antigo Senior High who took pleasure in tormenting Juston and his friends.[133][134]

name: Gregor
description:
Gregor was a soldier who captured Wolverine while he was hunting in the woods.[135]
He was later assigned to watch over Omega Red in Province 13.[136]

name: Gregori
description: Gregori lived in the monastery where an unidentified woman left a trio of Hellbent infants, who would be known as the Cadre. Gregori raised the children, until, like the rest of the Knights Templar, he was slaughtered by the hellbents sent by Seth. His body was then found the next day by the Hellbent trio.[137]

name: Gregson
