description: Mrs. Gregson was the wife of Robert Gregson, a real estate agent who carried out a massacre in a shopping mall under the control of an alien weapon and was killed by Wolverine before he could even kill his son Alex. Finally, Mrs. Gregson and Alex were crying over the memory of their loved one.[138]

name: Green
description: Dr. Green was one of the three skeptical scientists of the 'Twelfth Hour' television program, who were sucked into the Sixth Dimension by the Screaming Idol. They were eventually freed by Dr. Strange, who defeated Tiboro and cast a spell of forgetfulness so that knowledge of other realms and magic were still an unknown to the common man.[139]

name: Greene
description:
Greene was a researcher investigating mysterious signals with Walter Langkowski at the Mount Logan Cosmic Ray Research Station in Yukon for the Canadian government. While there, one such signal manifested itself as an injured Thing who the team rescued and attempted to treat. Greene was ultimately killed by an explosion when the Thing turned out to be the Super-Skrull and sabotaged the base.
[140]

name: Gretchen
description: Gretchen and Harold witnessed Daredevil and the Vulture crashing through their windows.[141]

name: Gretchin
appearences: Giant-Size Chillers Featuring Curse of Dracula Vol 1 1
description: Gretchin was a gypsy who took care of Lilith after her mother's death.[142]

name: Griff
description: Griff was one of Taskmaster's trainees whom he unleashed to flush out and eliminate Tyrone McQuaid after he dared to flee Taskmaster Academy. In defense of Tyrone intervened Falcon who defeated all Taskmaster's students while testing his new costume.[143]

name: Gringukk
description: After being housed with the other refugee aliens by the Fantastic Four, he betrayed them by communicating to the Griever that Franklin Richards no longer possessed his powers and that it was the right time to strike. Lyja discovered Gringukk's betrayal and warned the Fantastic Four who prepared a plot that temporarily blocked the Griever and captured Gringukk.[144]

name: Grizette
description:
Ms. Grizette was the fencing teacher at Snow Valley School for Girls and from which Emma Frost guessed, not knowing that she was still a telepath, that during the lesson she would have confronted her with Matilda Brant.[145]
During her fencing class after the midterm exams, Mrs. Grizette again compared Emma Frost and Matilda Brant after catching them chatting during the class.[146]

name: Gudrun
description: Daughter of Ahirn and Hylda, Gudrun was kidnapped and killed by a band of Zamoran slavers.[147]

name: Gui
description:
Captain Gui was the chief of police of Madripoor and worked in agreement with Tyger Tiger.[148]
Captain Gui participated in the Tyger Tiger ploy to steal the briefcases of the corrupt bankers. Following the EMP provoked by Daken he moved on the streets of Madripoor to avoid the consequent unrest that would occur.[149]

name: Guido
description:
Mrs. Gui was the wife of the Madripoor police chief, and was concerned about the relationship between her husband and Tyger Tiger.[148]
Mrs. Gui stayed home with her children when Daken took all kinds of energy out of the EMP.[149]

name: Guiness
description: Guido was a Calabrese window washer who was saved from a falling platform by Rogue.[150]

name: Guinevere
description:
Mr. Guiness was Bruce Banner's high school principal.[151]
He locked Bruce in the boiler room when he unwillingly set up a bomb inside the school.[152]

name: Gurko
description:
Born in Baltimore, Maryland, Guinevere was neglected by her parents -- particularly her father -- and eventually ran away from home. Winding up on the streets of Manhattan, she began staying at the F.E.A.S.T. Center under the care of May Parker.[153]
Noticing a new girl, Andi Benton, had begun staying at the shelter, Guinevere was intrigued and eventually introduced herself. Not put off by Andi's standoffishness and refusal to give her own name, Guinevere figured it out on her own and left a note inviting Andi to meet her at Coney Island. When Andi arrived, Guinevere - seeking to get to know her better - told Andi how she had come to live in New York; and when Andi inquired whether her parents had tried to find her, Guinevere bitterly remarked that as far as her father was concerned she was a waste of space. When Guinevere turned the question around on Andi and asked if she had anyone looking for her, Andi shut down the conversation and left, leaving Guinevere confused and dismayed.[154]

name: Gus
description: Gurko was a member of the band of slavers who killed Ahirn and his family; he was in turn killed by Conan.[147]

name: Gustav
description: Gus was a doorman at Fogwell's Gym.[155]

name: Gustav
description: Mentions: Hulk (Vol. 2) #31

name: Gustave
description: Gustav was a Latverian soldier on guard at Checkpoint E. He passed the one he thought was a Symkarian fortune teller, while in fact it was Deadpool in disguise who killed Gustav and another guard there.[158]

name: Gustavo
description: In a remote city in the heart of Europe, Gustave witnessed Dr. Doom turning the skies pitch black using Silver Surfer's powers.[159]

name: Gypsy
appearences: Fantastic Four: ¡Isla de la Muerte! Vol 1 1
description: Gustavo was among the festive crowd in San Juan that celebrated Ben Grimm as El Morrito and was recognized by Ben and greeted by him.[160]

name: Gywnella
description: When Bruno came to hide in her shop from the police, she trapped him inside her crystal ball. [161]

name: Hackman
description: Hackman was an associate of Simon Garth (before he became the Zombie) who worked in Port-au-Prince in Haiti, supervising the coffee plantations. When Simon brought his daughter, Donna Garth, to visit the plantations, Hackman discussed the natives' love of music while they work. After Simon became the Zombie, Hackman was looking for experimental subjects for Professor Richards when he found Donna, who had returned to island looking for answers on her father's location. Returning to Professor Richards, he witnessed the Professor's first nearly successful transformation of a woman into a human-spider hybrid. After the creature died, Hackman kidnapped Donna in hopes that an American girl would survive longer due to more "preservatives" present in their food. The process was a success, but Donna was not to be controlled, and killed Professor Richards as Hackman fled.[1]

name: Haddie
description: Haddie accompanied her niece Jane Miles to take possession of the ranch left to her by her grandfather.[2]

name: Haggard
description: Owner of a bazaar on Fringeworld, the Starjammers turned to him for repairs to their spaceship. As soon as he saw them, Haggard recognized them and told them that there was an immense bounty on them from the Shi'ar Empire, but at the moment he was not interested.[3]

name: Hagnar
description: Hagnar was a friend of Uller and Wilf.[4]

name: Hajeti
description: Dr. Hajeti revealed to Peter and Mary Jane Watson-Parker that their baby was a girl.[5]

name: Hajii
description: Hajii

name: Hakar
description: Hakar met Conan while he was escorting Glorana to her uncle Svenno. He was eventually killed by Grimm when the hellish warrior attacked them.[7]

name: Hakon
description: Hakon was a Vanir warrior leader. Hakon along with two Vanir warriors met Conan of Cimmeria on the battlefield among the corpses where the Vanir and Aesir had clashed, and being Conan an ally of the Aesir they confronted him, but the Cimmerian easily defeated them by killing all three.[8]

name: Hal
description: Hal was the neighborhood's local newsdealer.[9]

name: Haley
description: Haley was the lawyer who read Alestar Dunwick's last wishes to her relatives, including assigning the Dunwick Mansion to her niece Shiela Whittier.[10]

name: Halliday
description: Dr. Halliday was an astrophysicist who Carnage had seen a talk about on TV where she talked about Einstein-Rosen Bridges and how to send particles through dimensions, so Carnage went to the observatory where she worked and was sent to space where he intended to meet Venom and to kill him.[11]

name: Ham
description: Ham was shot and killed by James Woo for sheltering Nick Fury in the sewers beneath the Grand Central Station.[12]

name: Hamilton
description: Hamilton was the government agent in charge of security for project gladiator, who was murdered by A.I.M..[13]

name: Hammer
description: Hammer was a boxer who was beaten by Eddie March in his last ring match.[14]

name: Hamshanks
description: Mr. Hamshanks was a Musculan and the supervisor of Prince Otherone when he became an apprentice paper clip sorter. He berated Otherone for sorting a 5B paperclip with the 5Cs again, and also scolded him for eating jelly beans at his desk.

name: Han
description:
Han was a Chinese refugee who approached the F.E.A.S.T. homeless shelter.[15]
He then joined the Inner Demons and was attacked by the Anti-Venom.[16]

name: Han
description:
Ambassador Han was the Chinese representative to the United Nations Security Council who attended a closed session of permanent members regarding an incident in China involving Nick Fury and his Howling Commandos.[17]
As a representative of China, he was accused by SHIELD officers that his country was appropriating Helicarrier technology.[18]
During the UN Security Council interrogation, Ambassador Han pointed out that the Chinese armed forces arrived at the scene of the Hydra-Howling Commandos clash after the fighting had already stopped.[19]
Ambassador Han was forced to accept Senator Robert Ralston at the head of the organization against external threats.[20]

name: Hancock
description: Mrs. Hancock was a teacher who took over from Ian Kendall at the Snow Valley School for Girls after he was fired.[21]

name: Haney
description: An elderly landowner who, when overcome by financial difficulties, allowed the terrorists of A.I.M. to build a secret underground laboratory beneath his land in exchange for economic aid.[22]

name: Hank
appearences: Kent Blake of the Secret Service Vol 1 1
description: Hank was one of the two pilots of the American passenger plane B-17, which was shot down by Soviet enemy planes.[23]

name: Hank
appearences: Ghost Rider/Wolverine/Punisher: The Dark Design Vol 1 1
description: Hank hit Ghost Rider, but he was eventually shot by Norma Jean.[24]

name: Hank
description: Hank was a derrick worker who was confronted and knocked out by Bruce Banner after he tried to harass Nadia.[25]

name: Hank
appearences: Deadpool: Merc with a Mouth Vol 1 6
description: Hank was a hillbilly fisherman who accidentally met Deadpool with the Zombie Deadpool's head near Citrusville.[26]

name: Hanks
description: Mr. Hanks was knocked down by one of Armada's pets when he infiltrated the Neural Port Complex to steal the DIT-chip.[27]

name: Hannibal
description: Hannibal was one of Tombstone's ghetto pigs.[28]

name: Hanniker
description: One of the security guards at GARID, under the command of Calvin Falconer they tried to capture Tendril but Hanniker was killed while he attempted to free some people abducted by Tendril himself.[29]

name: Hans
description: Hans and his fellow mountaineers witnessed a flying saucer coming down and some alien-looking Inhumans setting up a camp in the woods, before being chased off by a rock slide caused by Gorgon, one of them.[30]

name: Hans
description: Hans came across the master while walking along the stone ramparts of his castle.[31]

name: Hans
description: Hans was one of the pseudo-patriotic terrorists who were defeated by Cosmic Spider-Man after they threatened to blow up the Statue of Liberty.[32]

name: Hans
description: Hans was killed by Ajax while investigating the ruins Ilaney Brukner's residence.[33]

name: Hanson
description: Mr. Hanson was the attorney for Frank Castle when he was arrested for hunting the Full Moon Killer.[34]

name: Hantmarr
description:
Hantmarr was a Latverian scientist who created nanodroids that could work to eliminate the five senses at a microscopic level.[35]
He tested them on Daredevil after he was captured in Latveria.[36]

name: Harakk
description: Sigurd was a Viking who managed to return home in time of Midwinter's Feast.[37]

name: Harald
description:
In the year 912 A.D., Chief Harald used to wear a piece of Thor's hammer on a thong.[38]
Chief Harald fathered no sons, but he had a daughter named Dalla.[39]

name: Hardeep
description:
Hardeep was a scientist who was part of Peter Corbeau's team.[40]
They observed people on the surface of the Sun.[41]

name: Hardiaken
description: Mentioned: Hyperion #4

name: Harleen
description: Harleen was found by Ben Reilly in his apartment of the Lower East Side with Jimmy-6.[5]

name: Harlow
description: Harlow was a thief who stole some test tubes from Stark Enterprises Headquarters, and was later captured by Ant-Man.[43]

name: Harolan
description: Mrs. Harolan was a patient at the McCarthy Medical Institute, and she was briefly Peter Parker's roommate. She was one of the many victims of a flesh-eating moster that stalked the hospital disguised as an orderly. The monster would routinely take unwitting patients to a secluded section of the hospital's second subbasement, where it changed to its true form and devoured its victim's flesh. Mrs. Harolan was was the monster's final victim before it was stopped.[44]

name: Harold
description: Harold and Louise mistook Edwin Jarvis for a bum, when he was looking for help after escaping from the Masters of Evil's hideout.[45]

name: Harold
description: Harold was a kid who noticed Iron Man battling the White Dragon's forces over the East River.[46]

name: Harold
description: Harold witnessed the Blank attempting to rob a Wells Fargo armored truck.[47]

name: Harold
description: Harold and Gretchen witnessed Daredevil and the Vulture crashing through their windows.[48]

name: Harold
description: Harold and his wife were scared by the Thing in the Rue de Yancy in Paris.[49]

name: Harold
description: Harold and Carol witnessed Mr. Hyde getting out the elevator at the ballroom level reserved for Joe Robertson's farewell party.[50]

name: Harold
description: Harold was Ambassador Huxley's assistant.[51]

name: Harold
description: Young Harold was one of the stable hands at the Howlett Estate.[52]

name: Harold
appearences: Spider-Man/Black Cat: The Evil That Men Do Vol 1 1
description: Harold was working at the Uptown hotel where Felicia Hardy booked a reservation.[53]

name: Harold
description: Harold was the doorman of the place where Mary Jane Watson was living during the production of Lobster Man: The Movie.[54]

name: Harold
appearences: United States of Captain America Vol 1 2
description: Harold was a Harrisburg resident, who he told Captain America and Sam Wilson as they investigated the attack on the town's drinking water pipeline for which Nichelle Wright was accused and arrested, whom he had overheard fighting two nights earlier and thought that Nichelle was involved.[55]

name: Harrigan
description: Mr. Harrigan was acquitted of serial killing charges, moved against him by F.B.I. agent Carson.[56]

name: Harriet
description: Harriet was a U-Man that attended John Sublime's public event that highlighted the Third Species.[57]

name: Harriet
description: Harriet was a security guard of the Baxter Building. When Susan Richards passed her at her entrance, she asked her how many days had passed since she had quit smoking. She replied by telling her that when thirty days passed, her wife would bake her a cake but soon afterward she told her that she was concerned about Progenitor's judgment.[58]

name: Harriman
description: Harriman was one of the guards of the Vault, who was confronted by the escaping Starstealth.[59]

name: Harris
description: Mr. Harris was threatened by Tony Sardo that if the company didn't buy his fire insurance, they wouldn't have any steel left. He refused the offer and kicked the man out his office.[60]

name: Harris
description: Mister Harris was Johnny Storm's teacher.[61]

name: Harris
description: Harris was an electric lineman who got in trouble on high tension pole. His co-worker Max Dillon agreed to save him, for a fee, gaining in the process super powers when he was struck by lightning while in contact with power lines still connected to their spool.[62][63]

name: Harris
description: Harris begged FrankenCastle to help him against his wife.[64]

name: Harris
description: She was the wife of scientist Reginald Harris, who simulated his death and that of his family to escape the alien mercenaries who wanted to kill him. The whole family was saved from Deadpool.[65]

name: Harris
description: He was the son of the scientist Reginald Harris, who simulated his death and that of his family to escape the alien mercenaries who wanted to kill him. Deadpool was going to kill him because Reginald blamed Deadpool for the death of his family, but at the last moment the boy stepped in between the two and Deadpool did not kill Reginald but helped all the family by defeating the alien mercenary.[65]

name: Harris' secretary
description: She was secretary of Mr. Harris when Anthony Sardo came to demand a protection fee.[60]

name: Harrison
description: Mr. Harrison, of the United States Attorney General's office, went to Japan to negotiate with Wilson Fisk.[66]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a member of the Limpy Savoy gang who after killing their former member Happy Nolan were chased, beaten and captured by the Angel.[67]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a truck driver carrying lease-lend material and was sabotaged by the Nazi Lord of Death and his Hollow Men.[68]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a henchman of Gore who, together with his companions, was forced by the Thunderer to take him to his boss's den. Once there, Harry and the other two henchmen were killed in the fire that followed a short circuit caused by their leader.[69]

name: Harry
description: Harry and his colleague were collecting clams when they thought they saw a flying saucer that later turned out to be a gigantic flying clam that devoured them both.[70]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a Hollywood talent scout who noticed Betty Bliss and offered her a film audition.[71]

name: Harry
description: Harry receives a package where there was the spaceship of an alien ambassador en route to Mars and decides to help him, but at some point he wakes up and realized that it was all a dream.[72]

name: Harry
description:
Harry was with his friend Pete when they watched as the Human Torch rushed back to the Baxter Building. They were then accidentally knocked over by the Invisible Girl as she followed.[73]
Some time later, Harry was among the crowd who watched the advertisement paid by the Committee to regain America's Principles against Captain America.[74]

name: Harry
description: Harry was one of the citizen hypnotized by Trago's music.[75]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a hunter who, aiming at ducks, fired some shotgun blasts against the Silver Surfer, and when the alien fired back, he fled the scene, believing the place was haunted.[76]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a soldier stationed at Cape Canaveral, he and his comrades responded to an attack of Quasimodo at the base.[77]

name: Harry
description: Harry was with Irene in Times Square when Tagak and his leopard appeared, scaring the crowd of civilians.[78]

name: Harry
description: Harry and other bodybuilders were on a Californian beach when they glimpsed the Werewolf and tried to attack him. Harry was the first to grab him but the Werewolf reacted by throwing Harry very easily as if he weighed nothing.[79]

name: Harry
description: Harry and another thug were sent by the Committee to kidnap Jack Russell. After being successful in the kidnapping they had the unfortunate idea of transporting it after it had gone dark. During transport Jack turned into the werewolf while the car ran on the road and the scared driver crashed with the car and the two criminals perished in the clash.[80]

name: Harry
description: Harry was hunting with a friend of his in an area where hunting was forbidden and he killed a deer female in the company of his cub that infuriated Hulk who was admiring them to the point that he twisted the shotgun around Harry's neck.[81]

name: Harry
description: Harry and Joe witnessed Joshua Stragg transform into the Reaver, upon taking the Sword of Might. They both fought against Captain Britain in Darkmoor, but they were quickly defeated.[82]

name: Harry
description: Harry was one of the many bathers who witnessed the appearance of Eson off the coast of Miami Beach.[83]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a city maintenance guy and was working in tandem with a colleague when power went out when Luke Cage divested a high-voltage pole with which to hit Zzzax.[84]

name: Harry
description: An orderly from the Central City Sanitarium assists Dr. Spaulding to quell and contain the patient in Room Zero after he wakes up.[85]

name: Harry
description: A henchman of the Silver Samurai, commissioned by his boss to regain possession of a ring that ended up in the hands of one of the actors of Saturday Night Live. While Harry and another henchman sneaked into an actress's dressing room, they were intercepted and stunned by Spider-Man.[86]

name: Harry
description: A Saturday Night Live spectator who was almost overwhelmed by Spider-Man when he fell because of his cobweb cut by the Silver Samurai's blade, but Harry told his girlfriend that it was all part of the show.Marvel Team-Up #74

name: Harry
description: Harry was one of the movers who transported furniture to the Wakandan Embassy.[87]

name: Harry
description: Harry and his wife's apartment at Brooklyn Heights was destroyed by Dragon Man.[88]

name: Harry
description: Harry was the member of a gang of thieves who in cahoots with Professor Thatcher tried to steal the college computer system but were stopped by Iceman.[89]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a prison guard at Ryker's Island who watched over Bullseye. Harry was killed by Bullseye when he escaped from Ryker's during a live broadcast interview.[90]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a construction worker who witnessed Spider-Man (Peter Parker) survive the wreckage of the old Hotel Schlitz building.[91]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a henchman of Nguyen Ngoc Coy in charge of building security where there would be a secret meeting between his boss and the Kingpin but failed in his assignment as assassins managed to sneak inside the building.[92]

name: Harry
description: Harry and George went to the destroyed parking lot where the Silver Surfer defeated Doctor Doom.[93]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a stuntman who acted in a scene with Simon Williams.[94]

name: Harry
description: Harry and his three other accomplices attempted to rob a liquor store but were spotted by a policeman. In the ensuing confrontation, Harry took a girl hostage but was defeated by Spider-Man with an old Fantastic Four costume and a paperbag mask .[95]

name: Harry
description: Harry was bathing in his tub ignoring that Rotgut was poisoning the palace water.[96]

name: Harry
description: Harry noticed Marlo Chandler walking down the street in Las Vegas.[97]

name: Harry
description: Harry was an henchman of Morris "The Snake" Diamond.[98]

name: Harry
description: A soldier of the Pantheon, during the campaign in Trans-Sabal was stuck under a heavy weapon that not even his comrades could move and the Mandroids were approaching. Just when he had lost hope and accusing the Pantheon of having abandoned them, the Hulk showed up and freed him from the heavy burden.[99]

name: Harry
description:
Harry was a security guard who faced the Spider-Carnage.[100]
Some time later, his partner Sid was attacked by Flesh.[101]

name: Harry
description: Harry told Ben Urich what he knew about the Black Tarantula.[102]

name: Harry
description: Harry was the owner of the Melrose Pawn shop that refused to buy watches stolen from Manny, but when Manny offered him a bracelet (which was actually a Nega-Band that Manny had taken from a faint Rick Jones), Harry bought it giving Manny Much money. Immediately afterwards, however, Manny felt guilty about what he had done to the one he thought was a homeless man and then he returned to Harry making the bracelet come back and giving him back the money.[103]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a gangster killed by the Punisher.[104]

name: Harry
description: Harry was a guard at Infinite Solutions. During a sortie by Dr. Octopus to get a sample from X-Ray, the latter told Harry to turn off his dampeners so that he would help him against Octopus, but as soon as Harry turned off the dampeners, X-Ray killed him with one of his radioactive bolt.[105]

name: Hart
description: Mr. Hart was the owner of a loft in Hell's Kitchen which Butch Pharris offered a sum to purchase. After seeing how much the offer was, Mr. Hand was shocked to say that such a price was not even worth for the Bronx, and in return Butch replied threatening that if he wasn't too greedy he would stay alive.[106]

name: Harv
description: Harv awaited the arrival of Captain America at the Avengers Mansion, trying to interview him.[107]

name: Harv
description: Harv was a prison guard working at the United States federal maximum-x security penitentiary located outside Deming.[108]

name: Harv
description: Harv was one of the gunmen who tried to kill Spider-Man.[109]

name: Harvey
description: Mayor Harvey was the mayor of Centerville. He was once found in a ditch and rescued by Patsy Walker and Nan Brown.[110]

name: Harvey
description: Harvey and his partner organized a set-up to get the Avengers to leave the sanctity of the Avengers Mansion so they could give them a summons.[111]

name: Harvey
description: Harvey and Barney chased the Ghost Rider on the Long Island Expressway for having exceeded the speed limit, but he eventually managed to escape them.[112]

name: Harvey
description: Harvey was a driver who worked for Michael Berengetti. He aided "Mr. Fixit" when he was investigating Berengetti's death by transporting the Hulk and his Pantheon allies into the car and carrying out his commands.[113]

name: Harvey
description: Harvey was one of the crooks hired by Wilson Fisk to release a canister of poison gas in Manhattan and collect a ransom from the mayor, but he was stopped by Spider-Man.[114]

name: Harvey
description: Harvey was a mental patient in a psychiatric hospital who could not utter meaningful words but only vocalizations. During one of his fits, a nurse calmed Harvey by telling him that no one would harm him.[115]

name: Hassan
description: Hassan was the cousin of Fadi Fadlalah. Together with his brother Husayn, he ran the juice bar Habibi in Jersey City. The three and their grandmother lived together, and were aware of Fadi's inherited duty as the super hero Amulet.[116]

name: Hastings
description: Hastings was the banker of Gold Creek, the village destroyed by a horse stampede radio controlled by a group of Chelsa City crooks intent on forcing Gold Creek residents to sell their property.[117]

name: Hastings
description: Mrs. Hastings was Normie Osborn's babysitter.[118]

name: Hastings
description: Hastings was one of the pilots training for NASA under Commander Lisa Chang.[119]

name: Hatch
description: After being hit in the head by Deadpool to get rid of her, Dr. Ella Whitby was treated in an emergency room by Dr. Hatch. Noticing bruises on her face in addition to the head contusion, which she said was caused by a fall, Dr. Hatch asked Ella if by chance she had a boyfriend and if by chance he was the violent type.[120]

name: Haversham
description: Mrs. Haversham was a resident whose life was saved by Shang-Chi.[121]

name: Hawkins
description:
Hawkins was a Park Warden who came to Keystone to help the citizenry.[122]
He visited the rescue camp in the Custer State Park with Warbird.[123]
As the red cloud began spreading through South Dakota, they then moved to St. Mary's Hospital.[124]
Hawkins then helped Warbird rescuing the remaining Avengers below Mount Rushmore.[125]

name: Hazel
description: Mentions: Wolverine: The Origin #1

name: Heather
description: Heather was the girlfriend of Ballard who was killed in a terrorist attack carried out inside Rome's DaVinci Airport, to cover up a hit against her boyfriend and John Greene, both former business partners of shady businessman Giancarlo Gelberto.[127]

name: Heather
description: Heather and Don Winston were abducted by a group of extradimensional clowns during their date in a carnival and were rescued by Slapstick.[128]

name: Heather
description: Heather studied information security systems. She was one of the volunteers who were put together in the Carol Cadets by Becky St. Jude to put Ulysses' knowledge to good use.[129]

name: Heather
appearences: Spirits of Vengeance: Spirit Rider Vol 1 1
description: Heather was a friend of Kushala's. She was having breakfast with her and Tanya when Doctor Strange and Johnny Blaze showed up asking Kushala for her help.[130]

name: Hector
description: Hector witnessed Jasper confront the Incredible Hulk.[131]

name: Hector
description: Hector was a politician who met Caleb in 1867.[132]

name: Hector
description: Hector was a scientist at Cosmic Concepts who gave John Jameson a Space Age riot gear.[133]

name: Hector
description: Hector is a gang leader. His arm was broken by Kiden Nixon when her mutant powers first manifested. He tried to shoot Kiden out of revenge, but she moved while the bullet was shot, and he ended up hitting one of Kiden's teachers.[134]

name: Hector
description: An henchman of Angelica Rojas, Hector told Logan where to find Rojas and was killed by Felix.[135]

name: Hector
description: Hector was a ghost living in Atlanta who was held in place by a couple who wanted to experiment on him but he reacted by taking possession of the girl until he was exorcised by Brielle Brooks and to whom he peacefully told his story.[136]

name: Heinrich
description: Heinrich was one of Prince Rudolfo's loyalists.[31]

name: Heisenberg
description: Dr. Heisenberg was Jane's director in Austin.[137]

name: Helen
description: Helen was one of Johnny Storm's dates.[138]

name: Helen
description: Sister Helen was Mary Elizabeth O'Koren's teacher.[139]

name: Helen
description: Helen was a nurse at a New York hospital where Rick Jones was admitted after he passed out for no apparent reason on the street. She and the doctor who treated him assisted as Rick phased through the stretcher where he was positioned.[140]

name: Helena
description: Helena was a waitress in a diner where Robert Goldman stopped undecided about what to order and asked her about the differences in the products she served.[141]

name: Helm
description: Since Weapon X had failed to deal with the Hulk on schedule, Captain Helm ordered Logan to retreat after which he hit the Hulk with gas, stunning him and immediately bragged to Logan about Corps Commandos' ability to take care of any problems by having to take everything back soon after as the Hulk woke up and easily escaped capture.[142]

name: Heloise
description: Heloise was in full labor but was stuck in traffic following the blackout caused by Electro. Fortunately, Spider-Man intervened and personally took Heloise to the hospital.[143]

name: Hendricks
appearences: Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 2 4
description:
Hendricks was a guard for the Penance Corporation. On Joseph Duffy's orders, he arrested Víctor Álvarez and Tyowa Bryant on false murder charges.[144]
During the fight between Iron Fist and Ryker's inmates, he was ordered by Joseph Duffy to shoot Iron Fist as soon as he was sure to hit him.[145]

name: Henri
description: Henri was the referee of the Great Game, a competition in which various wealthy individuals placed bets on the outcomes of battles between various superhumanly powerful individuals.[146]

name: Henri
description: Henri was a servant of Baroness Adelicia von Krupp.[147]

name: Henri
description:
Henri was Countess Stephanie de la Spiroza's personal butler.[148]
When her chalet was blasted to smithereens by the Dreadnoughts, Henri and the countess hid in a saferoom behind the wine-cellar and survived the attack.[149]

name: Henri
description: Henri was one of the soldiers who eradicated and plundered Pystoroka.[150]

name: Henry
description:
Henry and his wife witnessed the Sons of the Serpent assaulting Mr. Gonzales.[151]
A few days later, Henry and his family watched the news about Captain America's alleged bank robbery.[152]

name: Henry
description: Henry witnessed Locust's giant insects devouring his wheat field.[153]

name: Henry
description: Henry was a super-hero fan who met the Silver Surfer and Spider-Man.[154]

name: Henry
appearences: Giant-Size Chillers Featuring Curse of Dracula Vol 1 1
description: Minor Appearances: Tomb of Dracula #23

name: Henry
description: Henry was a police officer who took in custody the members of the Dragon's Circle defeated by the Black Panther.[132]

name: Henry
description: Henry and his wife Martha saw Daredevil swinging through the air overhead, and he groused that J. Jonah Jameson was right about the super-heroes in New York City being nuisances to be outlawed.[156]

name: Henry
description: Henry used to play chess with Aunt May at the Restwell Nursing Home.[157]

name: Henry
description: Henry was a member of the crime gang who kidnapped Vanessa Fisk.[158]

name: Henry
description: An old man to whom the Mask of Death by Koala Mumba guaranteed youth along with four other men to the detriment of various teenagers without their knowledge. They were forced to become members of the very successful boy-band among the teenagers of the Podunk Slam by Mr. Appletree, the one who had made them rejuvenate using the mask. But when Moon Knight showed them what was happening to their fans, they all gave up their success and youth by destroying the mask.[159]

name: Henry
description: Henry was a tourist in Los Angeles who, together with his wife Emma and their son Nico, became caught up in a fight between the Sensational She-Hulk and the Incredible Hulk.[160]

name: Henry
description: Henry was one of the five Crusader knights rendered almost immortal to protect the Spear of Destiny.[161]

name: Henry
description: Henry brought a package to Judith, and it was the third in a week, but knowing what she had gone through, he wished that it must have been really nice to be back on her feet.[162]

name: Henry
description: The doorman of a Tony Stark's mansion in New York City. Welcomed a bewildered Tony Stark from an alternate future who traveled to the past to prevent the destruction of Earth, mistaking him for the real Tony Stark who was in fact already in the apartment and completely drunk.[163]

name: Henry
description: Henry was a childhood friend of Thaddeus Ross in New Hampshire with whom he played war games, but whose mother of Thaddeus did not want to be played with loaded weapons even if toys.[164] He had to witness the death of his father returning from the war who crashed with the plane he had taken to go home and surprise his son.[165]

name: Henry
description: Henry was Christopher Bach's doorman.[166][167]

name: Henry
description: Henry was one of the Owl's security guards.[168]

name: Henry
description: Henry acted as a bodyguard for Odessa Drake and tried to stop Dave McCauley from disturbing her but was stopped by Odessa herself.[169]

name: Henry
description: Henry was one of the former workers at Brombline Cross Mining who was interviewed after the mine closed and the Virago arrived.[170]

name: Henry
description: Gladys screamed in alarm to her husband Henry that there was a 300-foot flying dragon flying over the city, unable to distract him from reading her newspaper with Henry telling her that there was always something odd to hear her.[171]

name: Henryk
description: Henryk was a vampire who revealed during an analysis session that he had never wanted to become a vampire, recounting that he had simply gone to take out the trash one night and been attacked, only to wake up a few hours later as a vampire.[172]

name: Henshaw
description: Henshaw was Doctor Druid's assistant at New York's Plaza Hotel.[173]

name: Herb
description: Herb witnessed the Avengers coming by bus to Forest Hills Gardens.[174]

name: Herb
description: Herb was a robber stopped by the Archangel in the West Village.[175]

name: Herb
description: Herb was knocked out by Spider-Man after coming to New York City to take her wife home by force.[176]

name: Herb
description: Herb was an agent of the Shadow Consortium, tasked with hijacking and retrieving a secret United States defense surveillance satellite. He was confronted by Nova, who convinced him and his partner Leo to surrender, but died in the explosion of the ship he was travelling in.[177]

name: Herb
description: Herb and his partner Marty barely escaped with their lives when their armored car was attacked by Electro.[178]

name: Herb
description: Herb was interrogated by Spider-Man about the Bull's whereabouts.[179]

name: Herb
description: Herb was a guy Carol Danvers met at the speed date organized by her friends. When she asked him what his profession was, he replied that he was a professional online troll.[180]

name: Herbert
description: Herbert and his wife witnessed the Unholy Three capture Foggy Nelson right before their eyes, but he decided to get out and don't get involved.[181]

name: Herbert
description: Herbert was a VIP guest at the Hellfire Gala, to whom his partner advised that he had drunk too much scotch and hadn't danced yet. On his way to the restroom he was attacked by Terra Verdean terrorists. He returned to the dance shortly after completely wet.[182]

name: Herbie
description: Herbie was one of the patrons who fled when the Satan's Saints stormed the Coffee A Go-Go.[183]

name: Herbie
description: Herbie was one of the students demonstrating against the Stark Industries.[184]

name: Herbie
description:
A member of the Harlem gang of Thunderbolts, Li'l Herbie stole the Sonic Disruptor from Klaw.[185]
After being defeated by the Avengers, Herbie was arrested by the police.[186]

name: Herbie
description:
Herbie used to work in a local pub where Harrison Thompson used to go drinking.[187]
One of his patrons was also a small-time thief named Charlie Buchanan.[188]

name: Herman
description:
Herman and Mabel witnessed the Blob and Unus the Untouchable rob an armored car.[189]
A short time later, Herman and Mabel witnessed Spider-Man battle the Tarantula across the street in Manhattan.[190]

name: Herman
description:
Herman was a cab driver who took Doctor Strange and Clea from Central Park to the Greenwich Village.[191]
He was deceived by the Sons of Satannish to reveal Clea's whereabouts.[192]

name: Herman
description: Herman was an henchman of Nick Scarpa, who died in a helicopter crash after having been rescued by the Black Panther.[193]

name: Herna
description: Herna was a member of the Blue Krüe gang; he was one of Guero Valdez's friends from Lincoln High School. He helped Guero steal Gabe Reyes' wheelchair only to mock him.[194]He continued helping Guero with his dealings until the new Ghost Rider gave him and his friends a beating.[119]

name: Hernandez
description: Mr. Hernandez was a client of the Stillwell Adoption Agency who eventually agreed to adopt a homeless kid named Daniel.[195]

name: Hershey
appearences: Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man Vol 1 14
description: Hershey and his owner Sammy were saved by Spider-Man after their building caught fire.[196]

name: Hester
description: Hester was a young mother whose baby was saved by Longshot.[197]

name: Hidalgo
description: She received a visit from Bonita Juarez to see if the youth recovery program adopted in the area was working with his son Juan.[198]

name: Hideo
description: Hideo was one of Heiji Shigematsu's henchmen, who was defeated by Wolverine.[199]

name: Higgens
description: Higgens was a driver who stopped by a local orphanage where the Invisible Girl had just entertained the children.[200]

name: Higgins
description: Higgins was one of Marianne Rodgers' coworkers.[201]

name: Hildico
description: Brythunian slave girl Hildico was ordered by her master Atalis the Far Seeing to bring Conan back to him. She arrived at the battlefield near the River Nezvaya just as the Devil-Beasts of Nergal swooped down and fleeing, riderless horse nearly trampled her. She was then found unconscious by the Cimmerian, who agreed to come with her to the house of Atalis. When the barbarian confronted the evil satrap Munthassem Khan in his palace, she managed to summon the power of the Heart of Tammuz.[202]

name: Hildy
appearences: Jane Foster & the Mighty Thor Vol 1 1
description: Hildy was a waitress at a diner in Ohio where Rūna and Michelle had a first date and to whom she served decaf coffee due to the late hour.[203]

name: Hill
description: General Hill was an American espionage officer. He met Nick Fury in the 1950s in a bar in Bayamo, Cuba, telling him that the President of the United States had asked about him to expose the Avengers Initiative project to him.[204]

name: Hillary
description: Hillary[205] detected a solar flare with a direct course for Earth.[206]

name: Hiram
description: Hiram and his wife Matilda spotted the Sub-Mariner while touring New York City.[73]

name: Hiroshi
description: Hiroshi was Trish Tilby's sound engineer.[207]

name: Hitch
description: Hitch was a movie director who hired Longshot as a stuntman. When he fell down horribly injured and seemingly dead during a stunt, Hitch, fearing charges of manslaughter, dumped him in a river.[208]

name: Hizzoner
description: Judge Hizzoner took pity on the Molten Man and let him go without any punishment since he had agreed to pay for damage he had caused.[209]

name: H'nah
description: H'nah was a member of the Empowered, the former slave caste freed after the fall of Emperor N'Jadaka. After yet another terrorist attack by the Pride of Ghekre, the Empowered began to clash against the Stewards of the Gift, the former slave owners, and when one of the Stewards called her nameless scum during a demonstration, she yelled her name at her telling him that she was now free, and free to stick the knife where she pleased.[210]

name: Hockins
description: Mr. Hockins, of the department of public works, was a frequent guest at Dr. Connors' lectures.[211]

name: Hodges
description: ATF's Agent Hodges witnessed a battle between the New Avengers and the Agents of Atlas.[212]

name: Hoffsteader
description: Dr. Hoffsteader told Dr. Bell the story about Barry Bauman.[213]

name: Holderidge
description: Holderidge was a Weapon X project government official, who worked at a secret Canadian military complex.[214]

name: Holland
description: Mrs. Holland was such a fan of the Secret Hospital soap opera, she immediately recognized Mary Jane Watson aboard the Skyways express flight 4918, bound for Pittsburgh.[215]

name: Holland
description: Nurse Holland was one of Dr. Basel's assistants at the Basel Stress Clinic.[216]

name: Hollis
description: Warden Hollis was the warden of the prison where Daredevil was imprisoned and was also the father of Mason Hollis, aka Crime-Wave, whom Daredevil had defeated and arrested in the past.[217]

name: Hollister
description: Hollister was an officer on the ship captained by Captain Xavier, and to whom the captain asked how the morale of the men on board was. During the verbal exchange between the two, Hollister was possessed by Omega Red in an attempt to eliminate an ancestor of Charles Xavier so that he could not be born.[218]

name: Holloway
description: Holloway was one of the nurses who took care of Peter Quill after his mother died.[219]

name: Hollowell
description: Hollowell was a sorcerer whom Bruce Carmody turned to to recover his father's treasure from which he had been disinherited leaving everything to his younger brother Joe. Hollowell and Bruce devised a plan using the wizard's beautiful daughter Laurie to get a potion for Joe that would give him visions that would lead him to the treasure, but the girl fell in love with Joe and tricked Bruce to drink the potion instead, who for seven years guided by visions, set about on a wild goose chase, meanwhile Joe and the girl were married, starting a family and welcoming his sorcerer father-in-law into his home.[220]

name: Homer
description: Homer was Bertha's husband, whose family possessed Ozarr's lamp.[221]

name: Honcho
description: Brother Honcho found Donald Blake's cane by showing it to girls and saying it would be the right scepter for the president of the Street Kings. When Blake attempted to reclaim the staff, Honcho refused and tried to hit Blake with the same, but the simple contact of the stick with Blake gave way to Blake's transformation into Thor scaring Honcho and putting him to flight.[222]

name: Honda
description: Honda was one of Jotaro Isuzu's assistants.[223]

name: Honey
description:
Honey was a guest at the 40 Motel where Peter Parker was staying with his family.[224]
She soon recognized his face as the one on the front page of the Daily Bugle, and called it in to a friend.[225]

name: Honeywell
description: Lord Mayor Honeywell surrounded Plunder Castle with a small militia, trying to force Ka-Zar to give himself up.[226]

name: Honir
description: Honir was the leader of an Aesir raiding party who crossed into Cimmeria to fall upon the Vanir from an unforeseen direction. He recruited Conan into his band and soon befriended him. When he was captured in Vanaheim, Conan freed him and also rescued him from Ixastophanis' slaying snow spell.[227]

name: Hood
description: Ms. Hood was a member of O*N*E and a former Marine lieutenant while secretly also a member of the Shadow Council and after being exposed by Commander Steve Rogers and his Secret Avengers, Hood told Steve of the experiments performed by the Shadow Council in South America to get Super-Soldiers and the survivors of such experiments were in the basement of the O*N*E building that she intended to blow up. At the end of his mission he committed suicide by shooting himself in the head with a gun.[228]

name: Hope
description: Hope was Detective Bolt's girlfriend.[229]

name: Hope
description: Hope was an anchorwoman who voiced the opposing views of Silhouette and Jake Oh in a televised debate about Kamala's Law.[230]

name: Hopper
description: Dr. Hopper is a local general care physician in Centerville, California.[231][232]

name: Hopper
description: Dr. Hopper was part of a research team who was guided by Ka-Zar through the Savage Land.[233]

name: Horace
description: Horace was a renowned prankster who was eventually captured by the Martians for their zoo.[234]

name: Hortense
description: Hortense was a classmate of Hedy Wolfe in Centerville, California.[235]

name: Horst
description: Horst was one of Prince Rudolfo's loyalists.[31]

name: Horst
appearences: Uncanny X-Men: First Class Giant-Size Special Vol 1 1
description: Horst was a robber who was confronted and defeated by Nightcrawler.[236]

name: Horton
description: Horton was the captain of the Caspian Sea freighter.[237]

name: Horwitz
description: Mrs. Horwitz was a neighbor of Sky's in the Soho neighborhood, whom Sky often helped to reattach the clothesline that kept falling off.[238]

name: Hoskous
description: Hoskous worked for the Bureau of Latverian Antiquities.[239]

name: Hotchkins
description: Hotchkins was the butler of Falsworth Manor.[240]

name: Howard
description: Howard was a member of the Mainstream Motors Board of Directors. He was present during a conference meeting with the other board director until they were suddenly attacked by Chemistro.[241]

name: Howe
description:
Howard was Jonathan Storm's agent.[242]
He offered him a role in the 'Who Wants to Marry a Super Hero?' reality TV series.[243]

name: Howell
description: Mrs. Howe was one of Dr. Foster's patients.[244]

name: Howes
description: Mr. Howell warned the police that the Impossible Man was robbing a bank.[245]

name: Howie
description: Howes was one of Major Del Tremens' men at Tranquility Base outside of Liberty, New Mexico. He was tricked into releasing Spider-Man, who claimed to have taken photographs of the devastated town.[246]

name: H'ral
description: As a child, Howie used to play with his friend Billy in front of Stephen Strange's Mansion.[247]

name: H'ral
description: Howie was one of the ball court punks who were reprimanded by Spider-Man.[248]

name: Hrulo
description: While Magneto tried to negotiate with the Grad Nan Holt rebels on the space station where they had taken control, Lieutenant H'ral pointed out to his superior officer that a cargo bay at the station was already damaged and a salvo would be enough to totally destroy the barriers, plunging the station into the void of space.[249]

name: Hruzz
description: Hrulo was Hassan I'Shammar's bodyguard. After the Great Khan's children were assassinated, he was sent to kill Conan, but the Cimmerian defeated him and chopped his head off.[250]

name: Hu
description: Field Marshall of the Imperial Army, declared that it was not the task of the Omega Confederation to decide who was the just ruler of the Krook and as such the Imperial Army would send peacekeeping forces to repel the Confederation forces and restore order.[251]

name: Hubert
description:
Minor Apparances: Deathlok (Vol. 2) #21
Mentions: Deathlok #4

name: Hubert
description: Captain of the ship "The Crow" who offered to transport Conan for a fee to ports more suited to him. He perished along with other members of his crew during a powerful storm that he smelled of mysticism and curse.[258]

name: Hudson
description: Television newscaster Hubert announced the top story about the Exemplars' giant stone construct over New York City.[259]

name: Hughes
appearences: Captain America: Sentinel of Liberty Vol 2 1
description:
Hudson was an art classmate at Community College that Steve Rogers befriended. He suggested to steve in class that he should look at the model even though she was naked. They later met in a bar remembering things from the past.[260]
Steve, went out for a drink with his new friends from school, but Hudson saw him thoughtfully and asked him what the problem was and Steve mulled over the bombing he had avoided and not knowing the origin of his shield.[261]
During a drawing class, where they were to draw Cap's shield, Steve asked his three new friends what Captain America's shield meant to them and Hudson replied that it was a symbol of hope.[262]

name: Huike
description: Mr. Hughes was Shirley Washington's insurance agent.[263]

name: Hulme
appearences: Silver Sable and the Wild Pack Vol 1 33
description: Mentions: Thunderbolts Annual (Vol. 2) #1

name: Hundolph
description: Mr. Hulme endorsed Dr. Hudson's idea to create a super-powers department.[266]

name: Hunny
description: Hundolph was an Ophirean mercenary who tried to defend Conan when his captainship was replaced by Milo, but he was suddenly slain by Zorka.[267]

name: Hunt
description: Hunny, who for the young people on the reservation was simply Uncle, was teaching the children to ride when a giant robot appeared from underground and he had the children run away, but luckily a group of mutant Native Americans from Krakoa came to help attacking the robot destroying it.[268]

name: Hunter
description: Mr. Hunt was the father of Molly and was one of the victims of radiation fallout that was housed in the Colony from NORAD.[269]

name: Hunter
description: Mrs. Hunt was the mother of Molly and was one of the victims of radiation fallout that was housed in the Colony from NORAD.[269]

name: Hunter
description:
Mr. Hunt worked for the Second Shadow and was one of the main authors of the kidnapping and poisoning of Rikki Barnes until the intervention of the Black Widow who beat Mr. Hunt loudly.[270]
After Rikki was rescued by the Black Widow, she violently interrogated Mr. Hunt but he replied that his authority in Second Shadow had been revoked and that he was ready to die immediately after his daughter died.[271]

name: Hunter
description: Mr. Hunter was an associate of Tan Kim Seng, a Madripoor crime boss who was killed by Daken when Seng refused to submit to Daken's rule.[272]

name: Husayn
description: Hospital administrator Ms. Hunter couldn't release any information regarding Dr. Trainer to Peter Parker.[100]

name: Hyacinth
description: Husayn was the cousin of Fadi Fadlalah. Together with his brother Hassan, he ran the juice bar Habibi in Jersey City. The three and their grandmother lived together, and were aware of Fadi's inherited duty as the super hero Amulet.[116]

name: Hylda
description: Hyacinth was a tailor who lived in the underwater fortress of Argno Gwace and made a tuxedo for Namor.[273]

name: Hyman
description: Gudrun's mother and Ahirn's wife, Hylda was religiously devoted to Mitra. Like the rest of her family, she was killed by a band of Zamoran slavers.[274]

name: Hyman
description: Hylda was a Chooser of the Slain and a follower of Borri the Grey God. She brought Skalla back to their realm.[275]

name: Ian
description: Ian was a member of the Pipers, a biker gang who used to terrorize drivers along the Colorado southern border. Ian was one of the first Pipers to be wasted by Lizard.[1]

name: Ian
description: Ian was one of Amanda Strong's bandmates.[2]

name: Ian
description: Ian went with Michelle to her father's shop to retrieve the bag within which Ian had hidden materials to fight Ian's uncle, who had become a vampire. Only the intervention of Blade saved the boys who eliminated the vampires.[3]

name: Ichiki
description: Mentions: Astonishing X-Men (Vol. 3) #36

name: Ichiki
description: He was the only brother of Hisako's dad who died when he was young.[4]

name: Iggy
description:
Iggy was a reporter and a friend of Phil Sheldon.[6]
Years later, he was running a deli in the Baxter Building.[7]
He was introduced by Phil to Marcia Hardesty.[8]

name: Igor
description: Igor was a mercenary hired by Marcia Black to steal Mickey Morris' boat and kidnap Patsy Walker and Hedy Wolfe. Black's plans were thwarted by the arrival of Mickey Morris and Burt Chesney.[9]

name: Igor
appearences: Fear Itself: Book of the Skull Vol 1 1
description: Igor was a priest of the Thule Society and he was ordered to ready the protection spells to keep the Hammer of Skadi hidden.[10]

name: Ilsa
description: Ilsa was Manuel Eloganto's assistant and bodyguard when he pretended to be a therapist to create a series of scams. When Daredevil confronted Eloganto in his office, Ilsa lunged at him but Daredevil easily defeated her by crashing her into a wall and stunning her.[11]

name: Ilyan
description: After the battle against the Free Companions, Ilyan returned to the village of the Bahari Kozaks to his wife and son.[12]

name: Imagawa
description: Inspector Imagawa agreed to release Kagenobu Yoshioka into Ishiyama-sensei's custody and care.[13]

name: Imelda
appearences: Moon Girl and Devil Dinosaur Vol 1 8
description: Nurse Imelda works at Public School 20 Anna Silver. Coach Hrbek brought Lunella Lafayette to her office when the fourth grader was acting erratic, as unbeknownst to everyone, her body was accidentally inhabited by the mind of Devil Dinosaur.[14]

name: Inez
description: Inez was Theo's wife with whom she begged to pay the phone bill otherwise they would cut her off and do the same with the electricity bill.[15]

name: Inez
description: Inez was a partisan revolutionary and an old flame of Eugene Judd.[16]

name: Indi
description: Indi was a police informant who was to give him news about pirates. Discovered by pirates he was captured and tortured. Gambit and Laura tried to save him but didn't make it in time and the pirates killed him.[17]

name: Inga
description: Inga was one of Madame Joy's girls.[18]

name: Ira
description:
Ira was a robber stopped by Cyclops and Spider-Man in the West Village.[19]
The same night, Ira was stopped by Peter Parker from harassing a girl on the subway train.[20]

name: Iridites
description: Iridites was a palace guard who announced Sedrick to King Kull.[21]

name: Irving
description: Mr. Irving from Pilsburg was interrogated by Captain America and Agent 13.[22]

name: Isaac
appearences: Amazing Spider-Man: Soul of the Hunter Vol 1 1
description: Isaac was a kid who fell in a hole while playing in a construction site and was rescued by Spider-Man.[23]

name: Isdel
description: Isdel, one of Jones' men, was confronted and defeated by the Ghost Rider.[24]

name: Ishenko
description: Ishenko was one of the three businessmen who tried to exploit the mineral resources of Kamchatka.[25]

name: Ishiguro
description: Ishiguro was embarrassed when he was forced to ask his friend Logan to leave his establishment, since his other customers were feeling uncomfortable.[26]

name: Isolde
appearences: Uncanny X-Men: First Class Giant-Size Special Vol 1 1
description: Isolde was an acrobat of the Winding Road Circus.[27]

name: Issa
description: Issa was the first human killed and eaten by Rune after he fell to Earth.[28]

name: Ito
description: Mentions: Venom: The Mace #3

name: Ivaan
description: Mentions: Silk (Vol. 4) #3

name: Ivan
description: Ivan witnessed the Hulk coming to his village with a small child, whom he turned over to the villagers before suddenly vanishing before their own eyes.[33]

name: Ivan
description: Ivan was an actor who was stunt-doubled by Longshot.[34]

name: Ivan
description:
Ivan was a member of the Black Cat's Gang.[35]
He was confronted by Hawkeye and Deadpool.[36]
Ivan was later reprimanded by the Black Cat for failing to find Jeremy Ellsden's hard drive.[37]
Ivan was eventually caught and arrested by the S.H.I.E.L.D..[38]

name: Ivan
description: Ivan was Trish Tilby's cameraman.[39]

name: Ivga
description: Ivga was the woman of Marcios and was really jealous of him. The night that the Shemites entered in the town she heard something about the disorders but was surprised to see Marcios wounded. She listened to him about the story of the betrayal by Taramis, then hid him and cured his wounds.[40]

name: J.A.
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 1
description: J. A. was an elderly retired man from Broxton who found himself in financial difficulties and was forced to work as a waiter in a diner in the town, having to serve the multitude of tourists who visited Broxton to see the Asgardians.[1]

name: J.B.
description:
JB was a TV network executive who accepted Spider-Man's offer to appear on one of his late night talk shows.[2]
Some time later, JB attended a Glenn Industries board meeting.[3]

name: J.C.
description: J.C. was a friend of Devon Lewis.[4]

name: Jack
description: Jack was murdered by Moonstone in a small Midwestern university.[5]

name: Jack
description: Jack was a classmate of Richard Rider at Harry S. Truman High School and played for the same basketball team. Jack blamed Rider for having missed aa block, causing their team to lose the game.[6]

name: Jack
description: Jack was acting as Gregor in Metamorphosis on Broadway with Nadia Dornova, when he suddenly disappeared in thin air.[7]

name: Jack
description: Only eight miles outside Lubbock, Jack and Rog noticed a vehicle in trouble. While they were investigating the scene, the Lizard slithered on board of their truck. The two truckers, who were working for 'Louisiana Leathers', were allegedly slaughtered by the villain near the Mississippi border.[8]

name: Jack
description: Jack and his partner were caught by Spider-Man after they tried to rob a church collection box at gunpoint.[9]

name: Jack
description: Jack was a member of the troops sent by the United Nations as part of Operation Metalstorm to free Slorenia from Ultron.[10]

name: Jack
description: Jack witnessed a terrorist attack in Centerville on Easter Sunday.[11]

name: Jack
description: Jack and his companion Yagar went an expedition to find his lost father. After finding a trinket, Jack experienced a vision of events that took place centuries ago where Jack's ancestor led a group of warriors to kill many innocent people, including a witch who cursed the warrior's family line until the end of time. After coming out of the vision, Jack turned to see Yagar bearing the face of the witch woman killed so long ago. The woman smiled and repeated her original curse, at which point Jack turned into a skeleton and died.[12]

name: Jack
description: Jack was among the reporters who came to the H.A.M.M.E.R. press conference.[13]

name: Jack
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 2
description: Jack was a citizen of Stamford who participated in the posse who captured Speedball for wanting to execute him by suffocating him with a plastic bag,[14] until the intervention of Miriam Sharpe, and when Jack was surprised that she of all people took the defense against their kind, Miriam retorted in rhyme, making fun of the kind.[15]

name: Jack
description: Jack was the bodyguard of a United States senator who attacked Storm.[16]

name: Jackie
description:
A member of the Harlem gang the Thunderbolts, Jackie used the Sonic Disruptor against the Black Panther while he was under Klaw's influence.[17]
After being defeated by the Avengers, Jackie was arrested by the police.[18]

name: Jackie
description: Jackie was a talk show host who invited J. Jonah Jameson and Kraven the Hunter onto her show.[19]

name: Jackson
description: Jackson was one of the men sent by Frank Cortese to protect Mister C. He and his squad were all defeated by Spider-Man in Central Park.[20]

name: Jacob
description:
Jacob and Jeff were filmmakers who were making a documentary about the Jersey Devil (Cryptid).[21]
They approached and entered an alien spaceship.[22]
They both were eventually rescued by the Fantastic Four.[23]

name: Jacques
description: Jacques fought in Fort Souville with Orson Randall.[24]

name: Jacquet
description: Mrs. Jacquet was the mother of Doris Jacquet and mother-in-law of Phil Sheldon. She was very excited about the marriage between her daughter and Phil.[25]

name: Jada
description:
Cameo: Immortal X-Men #7
After the revelation that the mutants had found a way to overcome death, Jada found herself in the crowd protesting outside the Treehouse, as her daughter was dead and thought it unfair that she could not come back to life.[26]
However, after Druig's announcement that he would eliminate all mutants, Jada, despite being among the protesters who rejoiced at the announcement, did not find genocide right.[27]
Listening to Captain America on television telling her to stay calm, Jada wanted to believe those words even though she was convinced that sincerity and reality were rarely good friends.[28]
Jada is judged worthy by the Progenitor after witnessing a crowd singing "Death to Mutants" but which she thought they were actually singing "Death to Ourselves"[29]
In the moment of the Progenitor's judgment, Jada walks the streets in revolt realizing that she was right even though she would have liked to be wrong. Then he meets Captain America and talks with him about the goodness of the world or not.[30]
Jada passes through the portal of the Eternals on the day of judgment after being offered to her by Captain America and once through it she took in her care the little Kenta who could not find her parents. At the end of Judgment Day Jada received a message from Cap and they met in the post-judgment ruins sharing a coffee together.

name: Jake
description: Jake was a Piggy Perroni henchman. When Mike Curry went to Perroni pretending he wanted to become his henchman, Jake and another henchman stopped him with a gun. After making sure Mike wasn't a cop, they started making fun of him for his appearance and Mike spinning at super speed, laid Jake and the other henchman on the ground.[31]

name: Jake
description: Jake was one of Moses Magnum's Deterrence Research Corporation workers.[32]

name: Jake
description: Jake was a teenager who attempted to occupy the Alley after the Morlocks were gone.[33]

name: Jake
description: Jake was a member of a gang of robbers who decided to rob the weekly deposits of a local bank from a cash van. Knowing that the driver of the armored car usually stopped at a local diner, the gang entered the diner and took everyone present as hostages waiting for the driver, but Eddie Brock entered that diner with a small family who had given him a lift. Initially not intervening for fear that some innocent people could get hurt, he later responded to the provocations of the criminals and decided to face them by killing them all.[34]

name: Jake
description: He was among the members of the Sword of Liberty who tried to flush out the Punisher but was easily overwhelmed by him when he first broke his leg and finally killed him giving him the coup de grace with the gun.[35]

name: Jake
description: Jake was a farmer who witnessed the Goddess' epiphany.[36]

name: Jake
description: Jake was a member of the Pipers, a biker gang who terrorized drivers along Colorado's southern border. He was one of the first Pipers to be killed by the Lizard.[8]

name: Jake
appearences: Spider-Island: I Love New York City Vol 1 1
description: After two would-be robbers broke into Jake's house, whose windows he had left open to let in fresh air, they tied him and his wife to chairs to rob their apartment. The two robbers, however, were opposed by Jake's six-year-old daughter Charlotte, who had acquired Spider-Man-like powers after being infected with the Spider-Virus.[37]

name: Jake
description: Jake was a rock climber who dated Kirsten McDuffie.[38]

name: Jakes
description: Jakes was Burt Corrigan's chauffeur.[39]

name: Jaleel
description: Jaleel was one of the students from the Cresskill School for the Blind who were rescued by Matthew Murdock when their bus crashed during a snowstorm in the Catskill Mountains.[40]

name: Jaime
description: Jaime was a falangist kid who was taken prisoner by Eric Blair.[41]

name: Jaime
description: Jaime was the son of Marta, a woman who met and started a relationship with Wilson Fisk when he tried to start a new life in Spain. Fisk became a father figure for Jaime and his sister Adriana, who called him "Uncle Wheelie". However, Jamie and the rest of his family were slaughtered by the Hand and Lady Bullseye.[42]

name: Jamaal
description: Jamaal was a taxi cab driver who took Spider-Man to Battery Park.[43]

name: Jamal
description: Luis was a neighbor of Sky in the Soho neighborhood.[44]

name: Jamar
description: Jamar was a gangster confronted by the Punisher.[45]

name: James
description: After a string of mysterious murders of local doctors, Dr. James saw a patient that insisted that there was something wrong with his eyes (even though his nurse warned him that the patient was suspicious). The man turned out to be a vengeful intern who was fired for unauthorized medical procedures and who had spent years mastering the art of hypnosis and was now hypnotizing the doctors who fired him. Dr. James resisted the man's hypnotic commands to walk into traffic, and managed to capture the man and bind him for the authorities.[46]

name: James
description: Professor James was an archaeologist who discovered the Tomb of Bodeo in Bolivia and the cursed Cup of God, and who in spite of the curse drank from the Cup and went mad thinking he was Bodeo himself.[47]

name: James
description: A knight from Camelot, Sir James welcomed Jason Grubb when he arrived from the future, and awaited the magic promised by Grubb who intended to use the technology of the future as "magic", not realizing that his tech did not work in the past. After repeated failures, Sir James got tired of Grubb and his clumsy attempts.[48]

name: James
description: James was Simon Sledge's driver.[49]

name: James
description: Mr. James was the director of the Twelfth Hour television program. When the three panelists were sucked into the Sixth Dimension by the Screaming Idol, he immediately asked Dr. Strange to rescue them. Once done, Dr. Strange cast a spell of forgetfulness so that no one could remember what happened.[50]

name: James
description:
The circus trapeze artist captured by Dr. Wallach, whose brain was imprisoned in the body of the Frankenstein's Monster, in order to use his body, but the brain transfer did not succeed in killing Wallach.[51]
Still passed out, James' body was used by the zombified Derek McDowell who was killed afterwards by the Monster, leaving James in the zombie body.[52]
After recovering James tells the Monster about his past of how he had become a trapeze artist, entering into sympathy for the Monster.[53]
James then in his zombie body was magically controlled by the Master using it to get the Monster and once he got what he wanted he stopped control over James and his body collapsed.[54]

name: James
description: Doctor James from Fleming-Gardner Memorial Hospital was killed by the Gael.[55]

name: James
description: James worked at the Symkarian Embassy when Silver Sable got delivered flowers. The flowers had a bomb that was send by Jack O'Lantern.[56]

name: James
description: Doctor James treated the Angel after he was taken to Saint Vincent's Hospital.[57]

name: James
description: James was the autist of the Auctioneer and also served as his henchman.[58]

name: James
description: James was a fan of Rick Jones and saved his life when a man who wanted to take revenge on Rick tried to run him down with a truck.[59]

name: James
description: James was the chauffeur who drove the limousine that accompanied Warren and Charlotte for a date.[60]

name: James
description: Mrs. James was a motor-mouthed neighbor of Jennifer Hardesty.[61]

name: James
appearences: Marvelous Adventures of Gus Beezer: Hulk Vol 1 1
description:
James was a friend and classmate of Gus Beezer. When there was unusual excitement at school, James told Gus that the Hulk had been spotted outside the school.[62]
James participated in a representation of the X-Men in the class created by Gus and later they really met the X-Men.[63]

name: James
description: James was Screwball's young cousin who was kidnapped by the Mad Hacker, who endangered the child for internet contacts and money. James was saved by Spider-Man's intervention.[64]

name: James
description: James called Mr. Murdock from the Nelson and Murdock Law Office as soon as the verdict for Mr. Pampolos was in.[65]

name: James
description: Father James conducted Meredith Quill's funeral.[66]

name: James
description: James was Tombstone's driver. His boss ordered him to take him to Peter, Randy, and Fred's apartment where he would took care of Randy.[67]

name: James
description: James learned of the lesbian relationship between Irene Adler and Raven Darkhölme and blackmailed Irene into telling her that he would keep the secret if she turned over Raven for scientific studies on her condition and she would become his wife, but he did not imagine that his interlocutor was actually Raven who revealed herself and killed James.[68]

name: James
appearences: Mighty Marvel Holiday Special – Halloween with the Rhino Infinity Comic Vol 1 1
description: James and his sister Edith, after seeing Iron Man's public service message not to dress up for Halloween as a supervillain, decided to dress up as Spider-Man using only one costume for two with Edith carrying James on her shoulders, but during around the streets the two were misunderstood as the real Spider-Man by the Rhino who attacked them, but fortunately the real Spider-Man intervened who rescued them and in the meantime made the Rhino come to his senses by convincing him to follow the straight path with the enthusiasm of the two children.[69]

name: James
description: James was one of the guests of the Resort Chapiteau mentally controlled by Pascale Tiboldt and forced to attack Kate Bishop. Kate managed to bring him to his senses when she threatened to harm his girlfriend.[70]

name: Jamie
description: Jamie was the son of one of Warlock's followers.[71]

name: Jamie
description: Jamie was a Burning Blade gangbanger.[72]

name: Jamie
description: Jamie was Sarah Chan's cameraman.[73]

name: Jamie
description: Jamie interviewed Steve Rogers during a riot at Ground Zero.[74]

name: Jamilah
description:
Jamilah was a schoolmate of Miles Morales at Brooklyn Visions Academy, who met with Miles early and told him that the Champions were about to make an official statement regarding Kamala's Law, which prevented young people, under 21, from continuing to act as superheroes. After the statement, Jamilah said that the Champions were liars and that she was about to start a C.R.A.D.L.E. Junior League and this made her fight with another student who supported the Champions.[75]
Jamilah participated in the counter-march organized in Chicago against the law that banned underages from being superheroes along with others who were in favor of the law.[76]

name: Jan
description: Jan gave the Thing a scuba tank when he crashed into the sporting goods store where she was working, allowing him to breathe during a fight against a water elemental sent by Diablo. Jan was then trapped by the same water elemental and was in turn rescued by the Thing.[77]

name: Jane
description: Jan was a U-Man who attended John Sublime's public event to highlight the "Third Species".[78]

name: Janet
description:
Jane was the twin sister of the criminal known as Vegas.[79]
She was a scientist who used to work with Dr. Heisenberg.[80]

name: Janet
description: Jane was saved by fireman David Walker during the Human Torch's first appearance in New York City. 75 years later, Jane requested Jessica Jones's assistance in finding Walker, in order to properly thank him for saving her life.[81]

name: Janey
description: Janet worked in San Francisco for the Law Office of Broderick, Sloan, and Cranston and would continue working for the firm after Cranston's death.[82] Janet was still working at the the law office when Matt Murdock was made a partner.[83]

name: Janey
description: Janet decided to attack New York City's water supply system to avenge her father, who had warned about the dangers of the antiquated system but was fired for it.[84]

name: Janey
description: Janet was Greg Hallerhand's Personal Assistant at CBC.[85]

name: Janey
description: Janet and her friend Davy were saved by Doctor Strange from the Bottle Imp.[86]

name: Jangles
description: Janey was saved by Karkas from Attila the Hun.[87]

name: Jangles
description: In a television station near the Adirondack Mountains, Janey decided to send to her network a remote broadcast from the Thunderbolts, while they were fighting Arnim Zola inside Doctor Doom's Castle.[88]

name: Janice
description:
Jangles was one of Stoneface's henchmen.[5]
He was confronted by the Black Panther and Falcon.[89]

name: Janie
description: Janice was a fashion model working for Kingsley Ltd.[56]

name: Janie
description: Janice was an interior designer who advised how to furnish the Frost House in preparation for a party hosted by Winston.[90]

name: Janie
description: Janice was a homeless woman from whom Astrid Bloom read her mind to discover that she found herself living on the street when her husband died.[91]

name: Janos
description: Janie was a hospital receptionist from Las Vegas who met Bruce Banner.[92]

name: Janssen
description: Janos escorted Havok and Scarlett across the Soviet border in the western Carpathian Mountains.[93]

name: Jarl
description: Doctor Janssen's hospital was attacked, and she survived barely long enough to tell Wonder Man that his brother, the Grim Reaper, had been attacked and kidnapped by robots.[94]

name: Jasmine
description: Jarl was an Aesir raider who was about to kill Conan, but he was suddenly stopped by his partner Honir.[95]

name: Jason
description: Jasmine was a baby girl who was taking a carriage ride with her parents in Central Park when the carriage that was crossing a small bridge was hit by a car thrown by Venom who wanted to hit Spider-Man. The carriage overturned and the baby was thrown out of the carriage and fell into the stretch of water under the bridge, but surprisingly it was Venom himself who saved her by pulling her out of the water and handing her over to her parents.[96]

name: Jason
description: Jasmine was a slave of the grey lotus who Conan in a smoke-and-rum stained tavern, but the Cimmerian rejected her. Needing money for Yatha's lotus, she then attempted to ambush him in the night streets of Shadizar the wicked, but she was accidentally killed by her own husband.[97]

name: Jasper
description: Jason was a looter arrested by the West Coast Avengers.[98]

name: Jasper
description: Jason was Annie's son.[99]

name: Jasper
description:
Jason was Debbie Green's ex-boyfriend.[100]
He was threatened live on television by the Thing.[101]

name: Jasper
description: Jason was freed from the McCarthy Medical Treatment Center by the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants.[102]

name: Jasper
description: Jason helped Maria Hill and Thor during the Siege of Asgard.[103]

name: Jasper
description: Jason was Wilson Fisk's personal trainer who had a dissertation with Fisk during a training session about his unusual good mood.[104]

name: Jassim
description: Jasper was renowned throughout the county for his stubbornness and hair-trigger temper.[105]

name: Jassim
description: Jasper and Tierra were two twin Under-Yorker children whose mother, Leilani, hid in the laundry basket of her neighbor, Peter Parker, so that Spider-Man could protect them.[106]

name: Javi
description: Jassim was one of Mordad's men.[107]

name: Javier
description: Javi was one of the students from the Cresskill School for the Blind who were rescued by Matthew Murdock when their bus crashed during a snowstorm in the Catskill Mountains.[40]

name: Jaxon
description: Javier was a member of the Cartels of Calavera. He and another member of the Cartels were on guard and debated about the power of calavera and how it gave him nightmares when Matt Murdock broke in and hit him stunned.[108]

name: Jaxon
description: Javier was a Mexican boy who, together with his friends Gabi and Miguel, found a deep hole and outside what remained of the pupal state of one of Maggott's endosymbiotes and were terrified when they saw the slug grown to gigantic size.[109]

name: Jay
description: Jaxon was the boyfriend of Jennifer Kale. He became possessed by a demon, under the orders of Thog the Nether-Spawn, and was used to seemingly bring Jennifer, Joshua, and Andrew Kale, along with Man-Thing, to Sominus (but it was actually just a vast psychic mirage). The plan was to get Man-Thing to kill all three Kales but when it failed and the five were released from the illusion, Man-Thing burnt the spirit from Jaxon's body, freeing Jaxon from demonic control.[110] Jaxon continued to date Jennifer until one night, after he'd brought her home and was leaving, when she hallucinated seeing something on his back.[111] The two subsequently broke up, and Jaxon was later hired by Doctor Strange to guide him and Madeleine St. Germaine to the Kale place where they were attacked on arrival by the Man-Thing who was being controlled by Baron Mordo.[112] Jaxon, Jennifer, Joshua, Andy, and Madeleine were among the twelve people who died at the hands of the demon summoned by Mordo but were restored to life when the Man-Thing, the intended thirteenth sacrifice, was able to break the spell before it could be completed.[113]

name: Jayce
