description: A reporter for the Daily Globe, Jay, and his colleague Gavin were told by Barney Bushkin to cover the Sentinels' story.[114]

name: Jayce
description: Jay was crippled by the Black Widow after he tried to harass Sally Anne Carter.[115]

name: Jayce
description: Jay was a robber who confronted the Young Masters during one of their self-recorded "heroic acts". However, he was brutally killed by Big Zero, who simply grew up in size and stomped on him.[116]

name: Jayden
description:
Jayce was a member of the Hammer Battle Group, a group of men in armor under the command of Sasha Hammer. The Group traveled to Paris during the Fear Itself crisis to retrieve the Detroit Steel Armor and the body of Lt. Johnson and there they collided with the Grey Gargoyle possessed by Mokk.[117]
While recovering the Armor, they encountered Rescue in Paris and were about to attack her when Grey Gargoyle possessed by Mokk appeared, transforming one of the members of the Hammer Battle Group into a statue. During the battle, the three remaining members, given the difficulty in dealing with Mokk, withdrew, being accused by Sasha of being cowards.[118]
During the fight against Mokk, Sasha Hammer ordered Jayce and the other member survivor of the Hammer Corps to retreat, leaving Rescue at Mokk's mercy even though one of the two members of the Hammer Corps told Sasha they should not leave her, but Sasha didn't care.[119]

name: Jaz
description: Jayden was the birthday girl at a bachelorette party in Las Vegas during the clash between Venom and Carnage with the latter causing a blackout, ruining the party, and she complaining that she would settle for a pizza and a movie night.[120]

name: Jean
description:
Jaz was a woman in the service of Tyger Tiger and was among those who dealt with the release of the boys and girls held as sexual slaves by Petrus.[121]
Jaz pretended to be condescending with a corrupt banker in order to slip him a drug that caused symptoms similar to a heart attack, a ploy designed by Tyger Tiger to appropriate the banker's briefcase.[122]
Jaz was later killed by Daken so that Tyger could not manage his men.[123]

name: Jean-Pierre
description: Jean was a flower seller from Paris who knew Yvette Avril.[124]

name: Jean-Pierre
description: Mr. Jean was the owner of a shop in Boston. He was helped by Ironheart to oppose a further request for extortion by a gang of criminals, and despite the heroine's intervention, he felt resigned to yield to the demands of the criminals.[125]

name: Jeanette
description: Jean-Pierre was a teenager who was stopped by Cloak from taking Ecstasy's drug.[126]

name: Jeanie
description:
Jeanette was a friend of Phillip Bliss.[127]
She witnessed Steve Bergen and Gene Gretch follow him home.[128]

name: Jeanie
description: Jeanette and her family were killed by Neuri rebels.[129]

name: Jeanne
description: Jeanie is an overweight, married, middle-aged woman.[130]

name: Jeb
description: Jeanne was a romantic interest of Tony Stark when he first became Iron Man. She told Tony that she wished he would come to Monte Carlo more often, so she could see more of him.[131]

name: Jed
description: In 1921, Jeb was confronted and defeated by Logan in Kansas City.[132]

name: Jeeves
description: Jed and his gang were attacked by the Snakeroot.[133]

name: Jeff
description: Jeeves was one of the many people who helped Peter and Mary Jane Watson-Parker move into their Bedford Tower apartment.[134]

name: Jeffrey
description: Jeff and his partner Frank stopped Tony Stark and warned him about the local speed laws.[135]

name: Jeffrey
description: Jeff was a reporter who was attacked and knocked out by Michael Reese in Alphabet City.[136]

name: Jeffrey
description: Jeff was saved by the Valkyrie from the E-Street Jukes.[137]

name: Jeffrey
description: Jeff and Edward were two twin boys who escaped their house and fell down into a Morlock tunnel in Westchester County. They both were eventually rescued by their babysitter Kitty Pride and Spider-Man.[138]

name: Jeffrey
description: Jeff was a security guard at the GARID Laboratories and, with his colleague Joey Klein, became one of the first victims of Tendril.[139]

name: Jeffrey
description: Jeff was part of Ambassador Hazram Chaliz's security detail.[134]

name: Jeffrey
description:
Jeff was abducted by the Sewer Killer.[140]
Some time later, Jeff became one of Jonathon White's followers.[141]

name: Jeffrey
description:
Jeff and Jacob were filmmakers who were making a documentary about the Jersey Devil (Cryptid).[21]
They approached and entered an alien spaceship.[22]
They both were eventually rescued by the Fantastic Four.[23]

name: Jeffrey
appearences: Captain America: Man Out of Time Vol 1 5
description: Jeff and his father were following a Dodgers game in an area of the stadium separated from the stands where the whites were. They were approached by Steve Rogers, but Jeff's father, fearing the consequences due to the proximity of a white man, preferred to go away asking Steve not to put strange ideas into the head of the child as baseball was a sport for white people.[142]

name: Jeffy
description: Jeffrey was saved by Ben Reilly from a truck accident.[143]

name: Jeffy
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 2
description: After the assault of the escapees from the Raft with the intervention of Speedball in defense of citizens of Stamford threatened by criminals, Jeffrey was one of the few to take Speedball's defense and warned Leonard of the situation that was creating.[14]

name: Jen
description: Jeffy was a child whose father worked as a security corporal at the Los Diablos Missile Base during the first Gamma Bomb test.[59]

name: Jenkins
description: Jen was saved by Spider-Man (Ben Reilly) from an out of control truck.[144]

name: Jenner
description: Jenkins was the butler for a business associate of J.P. Fiance.[145]

name: Jenner
description: Jenkins was one of Henry Gyrich's security assistants at the National Security Council.[146] Years later, he had quit the NSC and joined the security department of Project P.E.G.A.S.U.S..[147]

name: Jenner
appearences: Darkhold: Pages from the Book of Sins Vol 1 2
description: Jenkins was one of the hitmen sent by the Darkholders to kill the Darkhold Redeemers Agent Sam Buchanan and Dr. Louise Hastings at Washington. He was killed in the fire caused by the battle, possibly made to burn himself by Modred.[148]

name: Jenner
description: Jenkins was a member of the United States Hulkbuster Force. During the fight between the Hulkbusters and Skaar he was baffled when he saw the members of Gamma Flight who appeared to have disintegrated while attempting to teleport.[149]

name: Jenni
description: Jenner was a police officer who went down to the Thames to investigate a homeless camp. His partner, Alice Cavanaugh, was killed by The Metamorph. Jenner escaped and ran into Death's Head and revealed the full story to him.[150]

name: Jennifer
description: Jenni was a member of the mercenary organization known as Model Soldiers.[151]

name: Jennings
description: Jennifer was one of the many party guests aboard Bushmaster's yacht.[152]

name: Jennings
description:
Jennifer was a runaway teenager who was taken by the Sisters of Sin to brainwash her for their army of teenagers. when she was taken to the camp she was locked up in a niche which started her claustrophobia. Captain America, currently turned into a teenager, freed her but they were both captured and Hoodwink using his mental powers made Captain America believe that he killed her by breaking her neck.[153]
After regaining his normal form, Captain America defeated Scarbo and freed Jennifer.[154]

name: Jennings
description: Jennifer heard on the radio that the Living Lightning was causing damage in the vicinity of Fullerton.[155]

name: Jenny
description: Jennings was Gordon Van Stone's butler and it was he who delivered the letter where it was written that Van stone's nephew had been kidnapped.[156]

name: Jensen
description:
TV news reporter Jenny documented the Skrullian witch hunt which affected the United States during Captain America's absence.[157]
Some time later, she interviewed Norman Osborn at the Dark X-Men press conference.[158]

name: Jensen
description: Jenny was named after her grandmother Jenny Grimaldi. Steve Rogers met Jenny at an auction where she was selling a photograph of Captain America, her grandmother and Kerwin Stockwell.[159]

name: Jensen
description: Jenny was a child who during the evacuation of Vancouver due to the attack of Nerkod and the Atlanteans, was separated from her mother but the army truck that would have brought her to safety was unable to leave and suffered the assault, but Jenny was saved by the intervention of Alpha Flight.[160]

name: Jensen
description: Jenny was the police dog of the Department of Omaha, came into pack conflict when he felt the presence of Wild Child and was put to heel by his master Carl.[161]

name: Jensen
description: Jenny was in Anchorage Providence Hospital during the assault by Erik the Red and the Crystal Claws.[162]

name: Jensen
description:
Jenny was Sentry and Scout's co-worker at a restaurant as a waitress, her appearance is similar to Sentry's partner in Sentry World.[163]
She witnessed Sentry/Void's fight against Scout that ended with the latter's death. She confronted Robert in tears and told him he was a monster, only to hear that she was sorry he felt this way and perhaps in another life things would have been different between them and then flew away from Earth.[164]

name: Jensen
description: Jenny was the girlfriend of a boy who was previously rescued by Rick Jones. When the two met him on the street, she Jenny jumped on Rick's neck hugging him and thanking him for saving her boyfriend's life and just as she hugged him, Rick passed out.[165]

name: Jenson
description: Jensen was one of Klaue's soldiers who attempted to invade Wakanda in the 19th century. After Klaue had shot all the local Africans he had hired for not wanting to invade Wakanda, the European soldiers had to move the equipment. Jensen fell over from exhaustion and was crushed by a cannon.[166]

name: Jenson
description: Jensen was an assistant of Mayor J.J. Jameson.[167]

name: Jeph
description: Mrs. Jenson was Deadpool's landlady.[168]

name: Jeremy
description: Jeff was an ex of Loki, who along with other exes decided to take revenge on him not believing he had reformed into the God of Stories. Loki used this opportunity to re-meet his teammates in the Young Avengers.[169]

name: Jerome
description: Jeremy was a kid who noticed the Fantastic Four's spaceship landing in Central Park.[170]

name: Jerry
description: Jerome was a friend of Eugene Patilio.[171]

name: Jerry
description: After talking with Bruce Banner about responsibility, Jerome became a top-honor freshman at Missouri State.[172]

name: Jessa
description: Jerry was one of the many suitors Patsy Walker briefly dated under the advice of her Aunt Liz.[173]

name: Jessa
description: Jerry and Ray warned Adam Warlock about a bomb test.[174]

name: Jessa
description: Jerry appeared in Doctor Strange Vol 2 6[175]

name: Jessa
description: Jerry provided security for the New York nightclub Club D, owned and operated by Nick Damiano. He tried to throw Rachel Summers out of the club, assuming her to be a vagrant or junkie on the run, but was overruled by Nick. When Nick took Rachel back to his apartment, Jerry decided to call and report this incident to Nick's father.[176]

name: Jessa
description: Jerry was a homeless thief who had several encounters with Moon Knight. Moon Knight convinced Jerry not to kill a woman outside a church as he believed Jerry was better than a killer.[177]

name: Jessa
description: Jerry was among the handful of henchmen of Geraci Crime Family who did not accept Frank Castle at the head of the organization and fought against him without weapons as ordered by Don Mario Geraci. Jerry was the first to be defeated by Castle.[178]

name: Jessa
description: Jerry recognized Ben Urich as a hotshot New York reporter.[179]

name: Jessa
appearences: Immortal Iron Fist: Orson Randall and the Death Queen of California Vol 1 1
description: Jerry was one of Adam Simon's bodyguards.[180]

name: Jessa
description: Walter, his granddaughter and Jerry were fishing in the Everglades when they were attacked by the Vellus-Kar hunters. Gerry managed to kill one of the hunters but when all three were about to be overwhelmed by the other two aliens, Man-Thing and Jennifer Kale intervened who rescued them by killing one and putting the other hunter to flight.[181]

name: Jessa
appearences: Defenders: From the Marvel Vault Vol 1 1
description: When Jerry found himself in the body of the Silver Surfer, thinking it was a dream he flew on the surfboard and thinking about what he could do with those powers including doing a loop-de-loop in front of Sharon Kemp's house.[182]

name: Jessa
appearences: Spider-Island: I Love New York City Vol 1 1
description: Jerry was a colleague of Jane Rathsome, and he too, like her, became infected with the Spider-Virus and acquired powers similar to those of Spider-Man who used, as did Jane, to climb the walls of the building where he worked avoiding the crowded elevator ride.[37]

name: Jessa
description: Jerry was a prison guard who accompanied Daredevil to a meeting with psychotherapist Dr. Hayes at her  request.[183]

name: Jessa
description: Jerry was a scientist for the Beyond Corporation. Following Ashley Kafka's mutation into the Queen Goblin, he was one of the scientists that outfitted her and programmed her brain. In the process, she bit Jerry in the hand, and he was taken away to get medical attention.[184]

name: Jessa
description: Jerry was a St. Estes orphan who survived the orphanage fire caused by Cletus Kasady. Years later he found a homeless girl outside the ruins of the orphanage whom he advised to move away from that place because it was cursed, not imagining that later that same little girl would be possessed by the Symbiote Carnage.[185]

name: Jessa
description: Jerry was a friend from Wade Wilson's school days. He shared adventures and jokes with Wade and Miles Allison until their graduation day.[186]

name: Jesse
appearences: Ghost Rider: Kushala Infinity Comic Vol 1 6
description: Auntie Jessa was the shaman who taught Kushala. Kushala, in the body of her ancestor Olivia Obtera, traveled to the Fifth Dimension where she met the spirit of Auntie Jessa who instructed her about the danger that would pass out if Dr. Doom had obtained all of Wands of Watoomb.[187]

name: Jessie
description: Jesse was a guy who, through the Champions forum, contacted them while they were on the run from C.R.A.D.L.E. and offered him a temporary hiding place on his tree house.[188]

name: Jill
description: Jessie met Daredevil at the Lazy Dayz Motel.[189]

name: Jill
description: Jessie was a senior at Antigo Senior High during Juston's sophomore year. The two developed a friendship, and although Juston harbored some romantic feelings their relationship remained platonic because of Jessie's boyfriend who had just moved to Madison to attend college.[190][191]

name: Jillian
description: Jill was DC-10 pilot who transported the X-Men from Japan to Canada.[192]

name: Jillian
description: Jill reported live outside the building where Martin Bastelli was taken hostage.[193]

name: Jillian
description: Jill was the daughter of the owner of the Incantesimo witchcraft shop, and in which a circle of friends who had the same tastes and mentality were formed, supporting each other and in which Patty Prue also entered, overturning her belief that she would remain alone after the loss of her family.[194]

name: Jim
description:
Jillian was a friend of Karen Page.[195]They both stopped a businessman outside a porn shop on East 83rd Street.[196]
Jillian later witnessed Karen being stalked by Artie O'Farrel.[197]
At a charity bachelor auction, she won a date with Johnny Storm for Anne Calderstock.[198]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim and his accomplice Sandy attempted to rob a train using dynamite they had stolen from Steve Burnette. After Steve understood Jim and Sandy's intention, he used subterfuge to assault and defeat both evildoers.[199]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was a taxi driver who refused to pay protection to Clip Walton. Jim was kidnapped by Walton and was rescued by Thin Man.[200]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was an airline pilot who was forced to make an emergency landing in the jungle of Mexico because of an apparatus designed by the Nazi Mad Gargoyle to reduce the air force of the United States should they decide to enter the war.[201]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was one of the workers who was building the gallows for hanging a murderer in the courtyard of the federal court building.[202]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was a Benson & Co. driver charged with carrying a box containing a skeleton to Dr. Platt, but was stopped by Dr. Foster and killed by him to be able to replace him with his henchman Stone and deliver Dr. Platt one robotic skeleton to kill him.[203]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim and his colleague Phil were attacked by two criminals on their observation station. Thinking that Jim's plane was a real one, when they discovered that he was instead a model in a rage, they beat Jim almost to make him dying, but with the little energy left Jim managed to start his model plane with a aid message that reached its goal by making their neighbors rush to save Jim and Phil from certain death.[204]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was the new neighbor of the Walkers who Patsy fell for. She did everything to get noticed by Jim, but when she finally got his attention, she discovered that he was already married.[205]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim and his wife Martha adopted a small child after the death of his adoptive parents Bill and Jenny Carter, not imagining that the binbo had killed them because he was actually an alien who had taken over the body of the newborn.[206]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Together with his girlfriend Ellen, Jim came across the race of beings called Were-Rats and was captured by them. Jim agreed to be turned into a Were-Rat in exchange for freedom for Ellen but then Ellen revealed that she was already a Were-Rat, biting Jim and telling him that this was the only way they could marry.[207]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim discusses with his friends if it is possible that supernatural phenomena occur involving the Devil.[208]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was a train engineer who was mobbed and robbed by Crowley and his gang disguised as Indians.[209]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was the sheriff of Mosstown and was in love with Mary Temble. When Mary's family was massacred except for her father, Arrowhead was accused of the massacre even if he was the one who had saved her while the accusers were the true performers of the massacre. Not being aware of the truth, Jim arrested Arrowhead who was still helped to escape from Mary's father.[210]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was a boy who worked on a movie set and befriended an alien. The alien gave Jim suggestions to improve the fuel mixture used for the rocket in the film.[211]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was a nice guy from Centerville who loved dogs and got acquainted with Patsy Walker when she took Mrs. Smith's dog a walk, much to the chagrin of Hedy Wolfe who did not like dogs but who changed her mind because of what had just happened.[212]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was a surveyor whose wife was saved from a mountain lion by her magical teddy bear.[213]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim's parents perished in an artillery shelling during the American Civil War.[214]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim met Kathy when he was working a salesman for the Heartbeat greeting cards, but he soon quit his job to work with her, wishing to marry her.[215]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was one of team of workers on the Upper East Side who attacked the Brotherhood of Mutants as they were perpetrating a crime, but were easily chased away by an illusion generated by Mastermind.[216]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was a man who during the Second World War was reformed because of his heart condition and while he was leaving a theater with his girlfriend suffered an attempted robbery by a criminal who was however thwarted thanks to the intervention of Whizzer.[217]

name: Jim-Bob
description: During an unnatural cyclonic blizzard in Calgary, Jim and his friends helped get people off the street.[218]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was Phillip le Guin's best friend, and when Phillip returned to Lakewood after everyone thought he was dead, Jim told him that even though his appearance and his voice was that of Phillip, he was dead and could not come back and so he had to go away.[219]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was one of the doctors who cured Tyros.[220]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was a worker at the Big Apple Supermarket where Jack Monroe had just been hired and warned Jack that the store manager was furious with him for leaving the store for two hours and in fact Jack was fired and after telling it to Jim he asked him if he knew where Carmela had gone and Jim told him that they had taken her to Roosevelt Hospital.[221]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was a security guard of the building that the Beyonder turned into gold. Jim was trapped the enormous weight of a plastic palm tree also turned into gold and was freed by Spider-Man.[222]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim went to the roof of his building armed with a rifle convinced that they were addicted to making noise instead the noise was due to the clash between Spider-Man and Chance and the latter exploited Jim's presence as a diversion to escape Spider-Man.[223]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim and his colleague Danny were on guard at the Alaskan pipeline when they were attacked and killed by the omnivirus released by Zarathustra upon his arrival.[224]

name: Jim-Bob
appearences: Tales of the Marvel Universe Vol 1 1
description: Jim was a friend of Cabbie.[225]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was an electric plant worker who met the robots impersonating the Avengers.[226]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was a security guard who was working at the bank robbed by Luke Carlyle.[227]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was a policeman who helped Dixie kill Lucifer.[228]

name: Jim-Bob
appearences: Adam: Legend of the Blue Marvel Vol 1 5
description: Jim was an astronaut who was analyzing an anomaly on the space station just when Blue Marvel hit Sentry and sent it crashing into the station and destroying it.[229]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was one of the Warhawks under the control of Kyknos, powered by the power of Hecate. With the death of Kyknos and Hecate leaving, Jim and the other Warhawks came to their senses and were stunned by what they had done.[230]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Jim was the manager of a bank in Jersey City that Collision tried to rob. Jim remained a prisoner locked in his office and when the bank was about to collapse only Shuri's providential intervention prevented him from being buried in the rubble.[231]

name: Jim-Bob
description: Salty Jim was a sailor who attempted to pester a beautiful girl who had gone to the saloon to deliver an invitation to Namor. Namor intervened in defense of the girl and Jim recognized him, then called to attention all the patrons of the saloon who started a fist fight where everyone was against Namor but from which only Namor got out standing.[232]

name: Jimmie
description: Jim-Bob was a member of Barnaby Stone's motorcycle gang. While ambushing Andrew Kale, they saw the Man-Thing appear from the swamp and fled on their bikes.[233]

name: Jimmie
description: Jim-Bob was a worker on an Oracle oil rig in Louisiana. He says that there had been an accident on the platform but that it had miraculously settled down by herself, not knowing that in fact those who had solved the problem had been Namor.[234]

name: Jimmy
description: Jimmie was a gangster who was confronted the Human Torch and was defeated.[235]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy was one of the young people protesting outside the Stark Industries plant against weapons production and for peace.[236]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy and his gang were knocked out and defeated by Daredevil in Alphabet City.[136]

name: Jino
appearences: Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 105
description: Jimmy was a kid who hired Crime-Buster to stop a bully from taking his lunch money. He offered thirty dollars for the job but Crime-Buster insisted he would only do it for fifty.[237]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy was a henchman of the Master Programmer who warned Joe Wade that Dawton was looking for him.[238]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy was a client of Vanessa.[239]

name: Jino
description: WNYX radio host Jimmy was Chucky Diamond's partner.[240]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy was freed by Doctor Strange from Dormammu's influence.[241]

name: Jino
appearences: X-Men: Children of the Atom Vol 1 1
description:
Jimmy was a Freeport High School student and a friend of Hank McCoy.[242]
He began to hate McCoy once he realized McCoy was a mutant.[243]
A while later, Jimmy was among the students demonstrating against Stark Industries.[236]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy and Lonnie were caught by Spider-Man (Peter Parker) when they were about to drop Francis from a thirty-story building.[244]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy and Joey, two of Hammerhead's henchmen, confronted the Lizard at St. Mary's Hospital.[245]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy was Lori Ann Flanders's driver.[246]

name: Jino
description: During the Siege of Asgard, Jimmy, a photographer living in Broxton, and his family were rescued by Captain America and Bucky.[247]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy was one of the friends of Nate who, following the passage of a destructive tornado in Redfield, asked to Captain America if he wanted to go with them to see if there was still someone to help.[159]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy was a member of the Gorankians of the Savage Land who helped Felicity. He was run over by an ichthyosaur, which emerged from the water due to oil poisoning, breaking his leg. Ka-Zar rushed to his aid asking others for help, but the other members of the tribe were reluctant to help for fear of being overwhelmed themselves.[248]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy was held at the 17th Precinct Station House. He broke free of his handcuffs, took an officer's gun, and took a hostage. Unfortunately for him, Spider-Man (Miguel O'Hara) was present, disarming and knocking Jimmy out.[249]

name: Jino
description: Jimmy was a baby who was kidnapped by the Austin Monster.[250]

name: Jino
description: At the end of the Reckoning War and with the return of the Moon in the sky and the consequent tides, Professor Jeffers and his team studied the consequences of the event and Jimmy, a member of his research staff, wondered who knows what damage had happened.[251]

name: Jiro
description: Jino used a mystical gem to take revenge on boys who were bullying him, but when Tamba, one of the boys, was imprisoned inside the gem, Jino's father had Dr. Strange intervene. However, Jino heroically helped Strange to save Tamba, and the two boys eventually reconciled.[252]

name: Joan
description: Jiro was one of the group of children who witnessed a dragon appear in the sky, headed to attack Tokyo.[253]

name: Joanie
description: During the AmeriAid concert she asked the Super-Patriot why he was hiding behind a mask if he represented freedom and liberty.[254]

name: Joanne
description: Joanie witnessed the X-Men battle the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants out of the Capitol Building and wondered if Senator Kelly's committee was all right.[255]

name: Joanne
description: Joanie was a street hooker whose boyfriends included some of the city's biggest gang leaders.[256]

name: Joao
description: Joanne was Paul "Paulie" Falcone's girlfriend.[257]

name: Jochebed
description: Joao was Victor von Doom's assistant.[258]

name: Jock
description: Jochebed was a dead girl who Alicia met in the Death's Netherworld when she was kidnapped by Lady Death to force the Thing to become her concubine. When the Thing, along with Alicia and the Watcher Bobby Spector fled Death's Netherworld to return to the land of the living, they brought Jochebed with them, which Bobby then kept with him.[259]

name: Jocko
description: Jock was hired by Hydra to kill Deadpool.[260]

name: Jodi
description: Jocko was an old classmate of Matt Murdock, whom he used to bully.[261]

name: Joe
description: Jodi was a mutant who was taken to Krakoa by Pixie and Wolverine to learn how to control her powers.[262]

name: Joel
description: Joe filmed the alien ambassador who was driven away from Earth because of its monstrous appearance.[263]

name: Joel
description: Joe's girlfriend was harassed by Karl Kragg.[264]

name: Joel
description: Joe was an editor at NOW magazine who was threatened with dismissal by J. Jonah Jameson when he couldn't produce an actual photograph of The Vulture for the next edition of the magazine. Later, he witnessed Jameson purchase photos of the flying criminal from Peter Parker.[265]

name: Joel
description: Joe was a security guard working at the Glenville National Bank.[266]

name: Joel
description: Joe was a dock worker who witnessed the appearance of the creature from Kosmos.[267]

name: Joel
description: Joe and his partner, two officers of the New Mexico State Police, mistook Bruce Banner for a bum who was running out the back of a truck.[268]

name: Joel
description: While a cameraman for the Twelfth Hour television program in Manhattan, Joe witnessed the three panelists disappear into the Sixth Dimension, sucked in by the Screaming Idol. Once Dr. Strange rescued them, he also cast a spell of forgetfulness, so that no one could remember what happened.[50]

name: Joel
description: Joe was a helicopter pilot who was robbed by Stilt-Man while he and his mates were delivering their payrolls.[269]

name: Joel
description: Joe managed to spot and film the Cat Burglar as he was attempting to escape the police.[270]

name: Joel
description: In Washington, D.C., Joe and Bill filmed the battle between Iron Man and Titanium Man, so that all, including the US Senate and President, could see Iron Man fighting off this menace.[271]

name: Joel
description: A regular customer of the Coffee Bean, Joe envied Peter Parker's success with Gwen Stacy and Mary Jane Watson.[272]

name: Joel
description: Joe was a neighborhood garage workshop mechanic who was commissioned by Johnny Storm to fix his race car.[273]

name: Joel
description: Joe heard Jonathan Powers declare at the NYPD 11th Precinct that he was going to announce Daredevil's secret identity in the center of the George Washington Bridge, so he decided to check him out and witnessed Daredevil apparently commit the callous murder of Powers.[274]

name: Joel
description: Joe was the doorman of Nelson and Murdock Law Office building.[275]

name: Joel
description: Joe was a 747 jet pilot whose plane was damaged by the Hulk.[276]

name: Joel
description: Joe and Harry witnessed Joshua Stragg transform into the Reaver, upon taking the Sword of Might. They both fought against Captain Britain in Darkmoor, but they were quickly defeated.[277]

name: Joel
description: Joe and Morris came across the Hulk while fishing by a trout stream in the Rocky Mountains.[278]

name: Joel
description: Joe was the MPDC detective who interrogated the Black Knight after his arrest for the murder of the two petty thieves who tried to rob a church and who were killed with a sword. Ultimately the culprit turned out to be the Crusader.[279]

name: Joel
description: After his helicopter crashed into a nearby skyscraper while hovering around the Rand Building, Joe and the television crew were rescued by Spider-Man (Ben Reilly).[280]

name: Joel
description:
Joe was one of two over-worked cooks at the Daily Grind when Ben Reilly worked there.[144]
Joe and Lou later met the new waitress Alison Mongrain.[281]

name: Joel
description: Joe was a gang leader who was shot by a Spider-Man impostor.[282]

name: Joel
description: Joe was an electric plant worker who met the robots impersonating the Avengers.[226]

name: Joel
description: Joe took May Parker and her friends out for her birthday.[283]

name: Joel
description: Joe was a member of the National Force and the bartender at the bar that served as their front and meeting point.[284] He accompanied Tank to threaten the sheriff in order to make him reveal the name of the person who was investigating them, Tatiana Arocha.[285] Joe then drove Frank Castle to his first mission when he infiltrated into the organization but was quickly killed as he discovered that Castle was actually the Punisher.[286]

name: Joel
description: Joe was Eddie Brock's editor at the Daily Globe.[287]

name: Joel
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 1
description: Joe was an elder from the town of Broxton who was arguing in the city diner, in the midst of a crowd of tourists who wanted to see the Asgardians, about the difficulties that their town and its inhabitants were going through.[1]

name: Joel
description: Joe was a Beyond scientist working on making improvements to Spider-Man's costume after the incident with Morbius. [288]

name: Joel
description: Joe was Dungeon guard 1-4-4; "Dungeon" was a superhuman prison built on a modified Helicarrier. Joe was given the assignment to make a summary of what had happened previously. [289]

name: Joey
description: Joel was Jimmy Carter's science advisor.[290]

name: Joey
description: a cameraman for Heartbreak Hospital, Joel followed the She-Hulk and the Hulk to film their fight from a helicopter with Greg Hallerhand.[291]

name: Joey
description: Joel was one of the doctors who assisted Peter Parker when he collapsed without any warning.[292]

name: Joey
description: Joel spotted Captain America passing by the Great Falls during the Fourth of July fireworks, just before he was attacked by a group of terrorists.[293]

name: Joey B
description:
Like many other New Yorkers, Joey was concerned that Spider-Man (Peter Parker) had quit his superhero career, after the Daily Bugle reported that Spider-Man's outfit was found in a trash can.[294]
Some time later, Joey spotted Peter Parker climbing over a tree.[295]

name: Joey B
description: Joey was one of T'Challa's students at Andrew Jackson High School, when T'Challa was working there as teacher "Luke Charles".[296]

name: Joey B
description: Joey was a robber, who tried to rob an old man, only to be stopped by Rick Jones and Mar-Vell.[297]

name: Joey B
description: Joey was a kid who came across Thunderball's Gamma Bomb.[298]

name: Joey B
description: Joey was an angel dust drug user.[299]

name: Joey B
description: In New York City, Joey and Robert Dennehy interviewed Johnny Storm at the grave of Matt Murdock.[300]

name: Joey B
description:
Joey was the Club Noir manager.[301]
His attitude made J. Jonah Jameson look like a saint.[302]

name: Joey B
description:
Joey, one of Hammerhead's henchmen, was hit by Don Fortunato's men.[303]
He later confronted the Eel, but was easily defeated.[304]
Joey and Jimmy also confronted the Lizard at St. Mary's Hospital.[245]

name: Joey B
appearences: X-Men: Children of the Atom Vol 1 1
description:
Joey was a Freeport High School student and a friend of Hank McCoy.[242]
He began to hate McCoy once he realized McCoy was a mutant.[243]

name: Joey B
description: Joey was one of Lavender's goons. He was confronted by Captain America after their boss managed to shoot at Bucky.[305]

name: Joey B
description:
Joey was Bridget's new boyfriend, Lewis Green's ex-girlfriend. When Lewis returned from the excavations in Troy to retrieve an amulet for the General, he went to Bridget's house, defying the General's orders to go directly to him, but when he was at the door of his house Bridget told him that things during the her absence had changed and she was now with another man, then Joey appeared and threw Lewis down the stairs.[306]
After acquiring the powers of Achilles, Lewis returned to Bridget wanting to win her back and heavily beat up Joey, but Bridget refused him in spite of everything, telling him that she had never loved him.[307]

name: Joey B
description: Joey and Sam arrived out of breath on bikes to warn Mike Murdock that his brother Matt had been in an accident and was in hospital.[308]

name: Joey B
appearences: Free Comic Book Day 2021: Spider-Man/Venom Vol 1 1
description: Joey was the seventh New York private detective who had been killed. On his deathbed, Joey reveals to Jessica Jones that Fisk is cleaning house.[309]

name: Joey the Bone
description: Joey B was one of the flight attendants who were saved from a crazy gunman by Venom.[310]

name: Johann
description: Joey the Bone was thrown into the East River by the Zombie.[311]

name: John
description:
Johann was Prince Baran's aide.[312]
He invited in Jessica Drew and brought her to the prince and his guest Ba'al.[313]
Johann was attacked by Ba'al when he tried to steal the Gehenna Stone.[314]

name: John
description: Johann was Vanessa Fisk's butler at Les Diablerets villa. He told her that Wilson Fisk had been stabbed.[315]

name: John-John
description: John, a member of the Legion of Loyalists, faced the Sub-Mariner with a flamethrower.[316]

name: John-John
description: Black John was one of the escaped prisoners that Professor Dorn mutated to have the same powers as the Sub-Mariner, including the ability to breathe underwater. He and all the other mutants were easily defeated by Namor.[317]

name: John-John
description: John was the Millstone police chief. He was abducted by Calcium Master and in his place a statue was placed that represented him minutely, so Calcium Master pretended that he had turned John into a statue with a solution of his own invention and that if he were paid a ransom he would restore him to life.[318]

name: John-John
description: Old John was the groundskeeper of Colonel Carter's estate and it was he and the colonel's daughter Susan who found the General's body, but while the Susan believed her father's death was due to an accident, Old John harbored suspicions and indeed it was he who raised doubts after finding a gun and the true identity of Corso Lenori, looking inside Lenori's car, but just as Old John was peeking into the car, Corso attacked him behind him, stunning him.[319]

name: John-John
description: John was a scientist who, after removing a grain from his eye, hypothesized that the grain could be a world, a world so small that its inhabitants would have been completely unaware of his existence. In fact, the grain was indeed a world inside the Microverse.[320]

name: John-John
description: John was the chauffeur of Mr. Benson, a wealthy man who had an extreme fear of heights.[321]

name: John-John
description: A "Dream" from Nightmare's realm, by mistake, induced a nightmare to John while he was asleep; this made John suddenly wake up shouting, which fortunately frightened a thief who was robbing his safe.[322]

name: John-John
description: After mocking the local tales of a haunted lighthouse with his friends, John finds himself sheltering inside it after his fishing boat capsizes during a storm. He searches the lighthouse from top to bottom but finds no evidence of "haunting" until just before midnight when the main light is turned on revealing a mysterious ship coming towards the lighthouse. The ship has a strange glow and lowers several smaller boats containing ghosts into the water. John hides as the ghosts come through the walls and discuss their plans. At one point the ghosts seem to feel his presence but dismiss the feeling as they are sure none of the locals would dare risk being killed by the ghosts. In the morning, John is telling his friends of his ordeal. They laugh at him until he shows them a life-preserver from the "Flying Dutchmen", left behind by the dead sailors.[323]

name: John-John
description: When his son Billy went missing in the swamp, John went out to try and find him. John found his son but then Monstrom appeared and the family fled to town when bullets didn't stop it.[324]

name: John-John
description: While John and Derek were on a hunting expedition in Africa they came into possession of a medallion which depicted a mastodon. Derek believed the find meant they were close to the presence of a legendary elephant graveyard where the two could find immense riches of ivory. They started their search, spotting a nearby elephant and chose to follow it. They followed the elephant to a glowing forest where the guides ran off in fear while Derek was seized by greed, choosing to shoot John in one leg to appropriate all the ivory he would find for himself. Fortunately one of the African guides, Monga, heard the gunshot and returned to John's side bringing him to safety. John never learned Derek's fate but was glad he didn't accompany him further as some things are better left undiscovered. [325]

name: John-John
description: John and his wife Martha gave up their business to retire to Florida. There they helped an alien to return to his ship and to thank them for their kindness, the alien bathed them (without their knowledge) with the waters of the swamp, which were the fountain of youth. John and Martha lost some memory and they both found themselves rejuvenated, not remembering that they had been elderly and that they had met the alien.[326]

name: John-John
description: John is intimidated by his acting regent uncle with a toad shape birthmark upon his brow who wants to be king. The regent finally gets the idea to bring the boy to Romani to take away so that he can pretend the prince is dead and seize power. When he wakes the boy in the dead of night, the boy is frightened and refuses to be cowed into submission so the regent falls back upon his threat to use his black magic to transform the prince into a toad. However, the regent's spell backfires on him and the prince laughs at his new toad companion saying that "you forgot that fairy tales always have happy endings."[264]

name: John-John
description: After being turned into a frog by a sorcerer, the king tyrant Zakkim fell asleep in a trance that would last 1000 years, but once awake Zakkim could reverse the spell. Upon his awakening Zakkim met John and his friend dressed in frog costumes for a party and, thinking he had awakened in a land where humans has evolved into giant frogs, Zakkim went back into his trance to never have to wake up again.[327]

name: John-John
description: John was a henchman of Señor Suerte, who was killed by Suerte himself to try his new power.[328]

name: John-John
description: John was member of the National Security Commission who discussed with Captain America the incident with the Epsiloni aliens and the Captive.[329]

name: John-John
description: John and his lover were walking when there was the onslaught of the Living Monolith on the streets of New York.[330]

name: John-John
description: John was the doorman at Tony Stark's apartment building in Manhattan.[331]

name: John-John
description: John was one of two physicians who, analyzing the blood of Barry, son of the movie star Robert Starr, after being bitten by a rat found that he had been infected with the plague virus.[332]

name: John-John
description: Chief John met the Hulk and greeted him fearlessly. They befriended and tried to reassure the Hulk but also became involved with the Hulk's diatribes with the army and with an aspiring candidate for the US presidency. After convincing the Hulk to remedy the explosion of a dam that would have flooded the burial place of his ancestors, he himself drowned during the rescue operation.[333]

name: John-John
description: John was playing frisbee with his friends in Grant Park when one of his clumsy shots hit Dr. Don Blake in the back. John immediately apologized for the incident.[334]

name: John-John
appearences: Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man Vol 1 113
description: John and three other young thugs tried to take revenge on Ernie Popchik for shooting them during a robbery attempt. They went to the house of Aunt May, which served as a boarding house where Ernie lived, and took all the pensioners, including Aunt May and Ernie, hostage until the timely intervention of Spider-Man. John was killed by special police squads who intervened to rescue the hostages.[335]

name: John-John
description:
John was Sir Guy Cross-Wallace's partner for smuggling. He was present when Cross-Wallace tried to marry Shanna and could not stand the theatricality of that ritual.[336]
Annoyed by Cross-Wallace's behavior, John reminded him that they were building a smuggling fortress and all those tribal rites had nothing to do with it, where Cross-Wallace asked him menacingly if he wanted to take his place.[337]
He led the Cross-Wallace warriors against Shanna, but did not tell him to carry her blood as Cross-Wallace had ordered.[338]
During Shanna's assault on the Cross-Wallace fortress, John was killed by her by throwing a knife to his throat.[339]

name: John-John
appearences: Wolverine and The Punisher: Damaging Evidence Vol 1 2
description: John was a victim of a shoot-out between the Punisher and a criminal, when the criminal fired towards the street where there were several passers-by including John who was shot to death.[340]

name: John-John
description: John was one of the five Crusader knights rendered almost immortal to protect the Spear of Destiny.[341]

name: John-John
description: John was one of the two psychiatrists who were treating Typhoid Mary.[342]

name: John-John
description: John was the mail delivery officer at the KLX-TV building.[343]

name: John-John
description: John was the former boyfriend of Mary Walker.[106]

name: John-John
description: John was a henchman of Tombstone. He was killed by the Punisher.[344]

name: John-John
description: John was the Snow Valley mailman.[345]

name: John-John
description: After two years of struggling with multiple sclerosis and then being fired, John thought of suicide so that his savings would be enough for his family, but just as he was about to commit suicide the rapist "Mad Dog" crashed into his car and simultaneously John was handed a wanted poster with a corresponding reward for Mad Dog, so John turned the gun with (with which he intended to commit suicide) on Mad Dog to capture him and collect the reward.[346]

name: John-John
description: While John was about to show his new sports car to his friend Greg, Tyrus Krill landed with his spaceship right on the car destroying it.[347]

name: John-John
description:
John was a mutant with little control over his powers. On one occasion, he blew up his house.
Confused, homeless, and alone, John rampaged in his monster form through Detroit, where he encountered Deadpool and Garrison Kane, who had been sent in by Weapon X to bring him in.[348]
Deadpool calmed John down by telling him jokes, but the moment John powered down, he was killed by Kane, who believed him to be too dangerous to live. Enraged, Deadpool attacked Kane.[349]

name: John-John
description:
John was a pilot who was possessed by the Gremlin.[350]
He was killed as soon as his plane landed in Pennsylvania.[351]

name: John-John
description: Father John ran the terminal ward at St. Mary Hospital. He witnessed the healing of some terminally ill patients by the Asgardians, refusing to recognize them as deities.[352]

name: John-John
description: John was a survivor of a plane crash that helped Juston Seyfert.[353]

name: John-John
description: John, a member of the Ararat Corporation, was killed by Venom symbiote's clone when it was released into the facility.[354]

name: John-John
description: John was the husband of Gabriela Pertuz and Dante's brother-in-law, who died just when his wife became pregnant.[355]

name: John-John
description: John was one of the doctors who medicated Robbie Baldwin after his involvement in the Stamford tragedy.[356]

name: John-John
description: John was guarding the site of the attack by Atlantean terrorists of Cell-13 in Bentonville when Namor appeared and without hesitation John fired at him futilely.[357]

name: John-John
description: John was present in the Unocorp Building when there was a terrorist attack by Cell-13 that used the Atlantean Extractor to kill people in the building by suffocating them.[358]

name: John-John
appearences: World War Hulk: Front Line Vol 1 4
description: John was the barman in a bar in New York where Sally Floyd was a regular customer and where even aliens were being served.[359]

name: John-John
description: A man at a service station in Eastern Australia who advised Rogue not to go further because he would have faced only six hundred miles of desert while his bike could at most go through 200 to 250 miles.[360]

name: John-John
description: John and his wife Peggy were in Basinville National Forest for a picnic when there was the assault of Ultimo / Morgan Stark and were saved thanks to the timely intervention of War Machine.[361]

name: John-John
description: John was one of the victims of a madman posted on top of the roller coaster at San Diego's amusement park who fired his rifle through the crowd.[362]

name: John-John
description: John was the bodyguard of a San Francisco corporation manager who was blackmailed by two fake A.I.M. agents.[363]

name: John-John
description: John was the bus driver for the Cresskill School for the Blind, who died in the Catskill Mountains after the bus crashed during a snowstorm.[40]

name: John-John
description: John's son, Tommy, intervened during a robbery attempt trying to help Spider-Man who had always been an example for him but was hit in the back by a gunshot fired by a robber. Initially, John was furious at Spider-Man as the culprit of his son's injury, but after Tommy died of his injuries, John handed Peter Parker a comic book designed by Tommy starring Spider-Man telling him to give it to Spider-Man since he knew him and to tell him not to blame himself.[364]

name: John-John
description: John was the personal security guard of Harrison Snow.[365]

name: John-John
description:
John was a prison guard on duty in the prison where Killgrave was incarcerated using a special equipment not to be controlled by him. Inconsiderably John made an agreement with Killgrave that if he had influenced a woman, Melissa, whom John liked, John in return wold grant perks to Killgrave.
Killgrave agreed, but when John brought Melissa to Killgrave without protection, Killgrave ordered Melissa to love John to death until Melissa killed John and then freed Killgrave always under his commands.[366]

name: John-John
description: John was the assistant to the mysterious man responsible for creating Chimera and upgrading Mister Fear. John handed over to his boss the covert footage of the fight between White Tiger, Chimera and Mister Fear and they watched the footage together.[367]

name: John-Johns
description: John-John was an American soldier who during the Vietnam War asked one of his fellow soldiers Bubba if it was the case that he continued to abuse the heroine, and feeling judged Bubba came out of the trench where they had repaired, at which John-John chased out from the trench Bubba telling him that it was not safe to get out of the shelter and just in that while he was hit by enemy fire and was killed.[368]

name: John-Johns
description: John-John was a runaway who was welcomed into the community created by Callisto, now simply human after M-Day, in the Morlock's The Alley. John-John in turn found Angie Williams sleeping in the subway and told her he knew a safe place and took her to the Callisto's community.[369]

name: Johnnie
description: A native foreman, he poisons his cruel boss for his beatings of the laborers but the boss promises to turn over a new leaf if he is given the antidote. The boss is led to a group of trees and he carves an 'X' into one of the healing trees. When he recovers, he goes back to being sadistic, so John-Johns poisons him again. The boss just laughs and kills John-Johns, but when he returns to the trees, he finds John-Johns has had his revenge from beyond the grave for they are all marked with an 'X'.[370]

name: Johnny
description: Johnnie was one of the young junkies who attacked Storm when she entered an abandoned apartment building in Harlem.[371]

name: Johnson
description: Johnny was a Toronto-Dominion Mall shopper who witnessed the Vindicator attacking Banshee and Storm.[192]

name: Johnson
description: Johnny noticed the alarms went down when Longshot and Jinx infiltrated the power plant.[372]

name: Johnson
description: Johnny was among Dominic Fortune's men who followed the killer sent by Simon Steele toward the docks.[373]

name: Johnson
description: Johnny witnessed a terrorist attack in Centerville on Easter Sunday.[11]

name: Johnson
description: Johnny is a small child infected with the Spider-Virus and began to climb the walls just as the Hunter Wasps of the Society of the Wasp were raging who wanted to eliminate all the spiders, including little Johnny but luckily Spider-Girl intervened and defeated the Hunter Wasp and brought Johnny to safety by leaving him in his mother's arms.[374]

name: Johnson
description: Johnny was ordered by the Dark Tongji to deal with the Scarlet Witch and the Wu, but died as a result.[375]

name: Jolel
description: Minor Appearances: Mutant Misadventures of Cloak and Dagger #4

name: Jolel
description: Johnson was one of Doctor Octopus's henchmen who detonated the world's first virtual reality bomb on Fifth Avenue.[378]

name: Jolel
description: Johnson was a corrupt officer of the Connecticut State Police who was killed by the Punisher.[379]

name: Jolel
description: Johnson was a prison guard in Bedford Falls Correctional Facility where Elizabeth Tyne was being imprisoned and not knowing her, as he had been working there for a short time, he was about to treat her roughly but was stopped by a more experienced guard.[380]

name: Jolel
description: Operator Johnson belonged to the intervention team of the Beyond Corporation who intervened to rescue Spider-Man at the request of the Langston artificial intelligence after the assault by Morbius.[381]

name: Jolene
description: Jolel was a staunch supporter of Farnoq Dahn, and meeting Wolfsbane stunned after being thrown away by the Hulk, he took her prisoner while waiting for Dahn's men to take her away. During their captivity, Rahne and Jolel had a heated discussion about their beliefs. When Rahne was about to flee, Jolel's sister Sandah helped her by hitting Jolel with a bottle. When Jolel recovered from her he killed her sister with a knife infuriating Wolfsbane who in return killed Jolel.[382]

name: Jonah
description: Jolene untied Arnulfa Gonzales, who had been confined to her bed after one of her fits, as a fire had developed in the hospital where she had been admitted. Jolene told Arnulfa that they had to escape but as soon as she left Arnulfa's room, she Jolene was engulfed in flames and perished.[383]

name: Jonathan
description: Jonah studied criminal justice at Rutgers. He was one of the volunteers who were put together in the Carol Cadets by Becky St. Jude to put Ulysses' knowledge to good use.[384]

name: Jones
description: Jonathan was a friend of Neil Gaiman. When Neil went to New York, Jonathan managed to get Neil to meet Steve Ditko with whom he corresponded.[383]

name: Jongor
description: Jones was the janitor of the apartment building where Nellie the Nurse lived. When he went to check on loud sounds and banging coming from her apartment, he found Nellie attempting to break open a particularly hard shell of a walnut for a birthday cake.  Attempting to help, he only wound up breaking his false teeth and smashing Nellie's chest of drawers through the wall of the building. He later helped her throw the cake at the face of her boyfriend Snazzy when he came by the apartment.[385]

name: Jongor
description: Jones was a policeman who managed to repel an alien invasion.[386]

name: Jongor
description: Mrs. Jones was one of Dr. Don Blake's patients.[387]

name: Jongor
description: Mr. Jones was one of Dr. Don Blake's patients.[388]

name: Jongor
description: Jones was a construction worker who was laying down cement where Spider-Man was buried by Brainstorm.[389]

name: Jongor
description: Mr. Jones was one of Rory and Pandora Destine's teachers at the Trumpton Comprehensive School.[390]

name: Jongor
description:
Comptroller Jones held a public ceremony when the Fantastic Four left the Baxter Building.[391]
During Psycho-Man's assault on New York City, Jones asked Reed Richards for the intervention of the Fantastic Four to thwart gargoyles flying out of his window, but Reed angrily replied that the Fantastic Four were already at work and that his problems weren't a priority.[392]

name: Jongor
description: Mr. Jones accompanied prospective Trigger Scent customers to the demonstration site.[393]

name: Joon
description: Jongor was a poacher who was attacked and killed by an invisible creature in Nemedia's Darkwood.[394]

name: Jordan
description:
Joon was a classmate of Emma Frost at Snow Valley School for Girls and from whom she obtained the answers for her midterm exams by reading her mind unconsciously not yet knowing she was a telepathic mutant.[395]
Joon later asked Emma if she used ginseng to improve her intellectual performance.[396]

name: Jordan
description: Joon was a professional escort in Madripoor, of whom a crime boss Cesare thought she was carrying his son. When Cesare learned that Joon was going to terminate her pregnancy he decided to intervene, but to help Joon intervened Elektra, as a favor for Logan. However, who eliminated Cesare was Joon herself who shot Cesare while fighting with Elektra killing him and with his death she decided to carry on the pregnancy, as her son was not his but Ryan's.[397]

name: Jose
description: Jordan was Christopher Bach's bodyguard.[398][399]

name: Josef
description: Jose was one of the former students of Midtown High School that attended the Midtown High School's Pre-Reunion Bash.[400]

name: Josef
description: Member of the terrorist group Terror Unlimited, he was in charge of the detonator transport but was hit and killed by a diligent security officer.[401]

name: Josef
description: Jose was Guillermo's driver, who got killed by the Punisher after he let the bomb inside the taxi explode, killing him in the process.[402]

name: Josef
description: Jose was a homeless veteran who stood at the corner of the Third and the Bowery, and to whom Peter always gave a little financial help.[403]

name: Josef
description: Jose was one of the guys who participated in the march in Chicago against the law that banned underages from being superheroes.[76]

name: Joseph
description: Josef was a minister of Queen Ursula in European principality Castile D'or. In the late 1930s, he schemed with his queen to start a war with the neighbouring Attania.[404][405]

name: Joseph
description: Josef was a communist spy who played the double game; in Cairo, he introduced himself to Rick Davis as his informant who pretended to be a communist spy to get hold of documents he would hand over to Rick, but in fact he was a real communist spy trying to appropriate the documents for himself but he was unmasked by Rick who defeated him and thus obtained the documents.[406]

name: Joseph
description: Josef was the burgermeister of Doomstadt and one of the main opponents of the Zorba regime. He rejoiced at Dr. Doom's return to Latveria and made himself available to overthrow the Zorba government and put Doom himself back on the throne.[407]

name: Joseph
description: Josef was a worker on an Oracle oil rig in Louisiana. He says that there had been an accident on the platform but that it had miraculously settled down by herself, not knowing that in fact those who had solved the problem had been Namor.[234]

name: Joseph
description: Josef was the head of a drug traffickers organization that lost a load of cocaine due to the Punisher. Wounded after the assault on the traffickers, the Punisher took refuge on the farm of Joan the Mouse and there confronted him Josef and his henchmen but the Punisher eliminated them all leaving as last Josef slowly killing him with a small Swiss knife.[408]

name: Josh
appearences: Captain America: What Price Glory? Vol 1 2
description: Joseph was a barman working at the Reef hotel and casino.[409]

name: Joshua
description: Josh was taking Heloise in full labor to the hospital and was stuck in the traffic jam created following the blackout caused by Electro. Spider-Man intervened and offered to take Heloise to the hospital, but Josh told them he didn't trust to leave his son's safety in his hands, at which point Heloise blurted out telling him to trust and Josh accepted.[410]

name: Joshua
description: Josh was a friend of Normie Osborn.[411]

name: Joshua
description: Josh was a reporter for the online tabloid newspaper Unexpected Truth who posted a post fanning the idea that Captain America / Barnes's death was a hoax and this infuriated Black Widow who went to the newsroom and quarreled with the various members.[412]

name: Josie
description: Joshua was a politician who met Caleb in 1867.[413]

name: Josie
description: Joshua was one of Judith's two children; she had recently been discharged from the hospital but was about to stumble on the stairs where Joshua had left his toys and she asked the kid if he was happy when she was at the hospital getting from him a negative answer and apologizing for leaving toys around.[414]

name: Josip
description: During World War II, Josie was interrogated by the Angel about the Phantom Bullet's death.[415]

name: Joten
description: Josip was a muslim soldier who helped the Punisher, Dragunov and Microchip find the nuclear warhead sold by Viktor Vikady to the Serbian People's Army in Sarajevo.[416]He helped to find the UN truck used by Vikady to transport the bomb.[417]

name: Joyce
description: Joten couldn't stop Betty Ross from knocking down Martens in Annapolis.[418]

name: Juan
description: Joyce and her group of friends managed to control Simon Garth using his medallion, forcing him to kill their enemies for revenge, including Mambo Layla. Layla, despite being seriously wounded, managed to tear the medallion from Garth's neck freeing him from their control and in full rage Garth killed Joyce and all of her friends.[419]

name: Juan
description: Joyce ran scared to her husband Edward screaming she saw a winged monster, actually a hawk mutated by a Brain Parasite.[420]

name: Juan
description: Joyce and her friend Doreen were walking under a thunderstorm when the monstrous Sidney Crumb appeared on the road, causing confusion among passersby.[421]

name: Juan
description: Joyce was a regular student at the prestigious and exclusive Massachusetts Academy directed by Emma Frost who crossed her in the school yard with her classmate Peggy.[422]

name: Juan
description: Joyce was an activist who, together with Karen Page, tried to get a petition signed against pornography.[423]

name: Jude
description: Juan lived with his grandad. He helped Kid Colt hide from a bandit, however when the bandit found Colt and threatened to shoot Juan's granddad, Juan killed the bandit.[424]

name: Jude
description: With his slingshot, Juan helped Kid Colt defeat Boyle and his gang. The Kid gave Juan the reward for the capture and recovery of the stolen goods that the boy shared with his poor village.[425]

name: Jude
description: Juan was one of the peasants who heard Kukulcàn's call.[426]

name: Jude
description: Juan was a rebel who fought against the Avengers when they came to stop the Living Laser; he managed to knock down Captain America, striking him from behind.[427]

name: Jude
description:
Juan was one of the revolutionary guerrilla members in Delvadia.[428]
Who later joined Tarantula when he fled Delvadia.[429]He was confronted and defeated by the Punisher.[430]

name: Jude
description: Juan was one of the first to notice the arrival of the Changers.[431]

name: Jude
description: Juan was the gardener of Tony Stark's mansion in Los Angeles.[432]

name: Jude
description: Juan was a henchman of Hector Ramone who tried to kill the Punisher by shooting him from a helicopter but he himself was killed after the helicopter crashed when the Punisher hit the pilot with precision and killed him.[433]

name: Jude
description: Juan accompanied Julia Carpenter's parents and daughter to their lodge in the Amazonian Jungle and there tried to defend them from the Deathweb assault but was killed by Therak's poison.[434]

name: Jude
description: Juan was on guard at the Temple of Tirod when two dead bodies for induced aging caused by the Timespinner were found.[435]

name: Jude
appearences: Fantastic Four: ¡Isla de la Muerte! Vol 1 1
description: Juan was among the festive crowd in San Juan that celebrated Ben Grimm as El Morrito and was recognized by Ben and greeted by him.[436]

name: Jude
description: Juan was instructed to hire the Zapata Brothers to do a job for Mr. Alcantara.[437]

name: Jude
description: King forced Juan and his twin sister to duel with swords and after Juan pierced and injured his sister and she cut her hand cleanly, King interrupted the fight and allowed them both to be treated.[438]

name: Jude
description: Juan met Mark Milton in a diner in Lawton and gave him the inspiration to be a truck driver and be able to travel around the country.[439]

name: Judge
description: Sister Jude was a nun who requested the Avengers to immediately leave her convent after freeing it from Ultron.[440]

name: Judith
description: Judge Judge presided over Veronica Eden's plea proceeding. During the proceeding, she poked fun at his surname before cutting to the chase and pleading guilty.[441]

name: Judy
description: Judith was a friend of Odin, whom she met in San Diego as a common mortal named Orrin. After helping the Ennead defeat Seth, Odin's full memory returned and he immediately left for Asgard, bidding farewell to her.[442]

name: Judy
description: Judith was a news anchor who interviewed H.A.M.M.E.R. Director Osborn at UBC Studios.[443]

name: Judy
description: Judith underwent a very dangerous surgical operation, and as they took her to the operating room she asked that nothing should happen to her as she was the mother of two children and their father was not a good person. The operation was successful and she returned to her children but also started building robots in her garage.[414]

name: Ju-Ho
description: Judy was one of the first victims of Hellverine.[444]

name: Ju-Ho
description: Judy met Peter Parker at the Metropolitan Museum of Art where the Star of Capistan was exhibited and began playing with Peter quoting Beatles song titles, but when the Star of Capistan took possession of J. Jonah Jameson, Judy was among the visitors to the Museum to be enthralled by the Red Rajah.[445]

name: Juka
description: Ju-Ho was a Pict who feared Grimm and captured Conan for him. As soon as the Cimmerian managed to escaped, Ju-Ho and his band were immediately killed.[446]

name: Jukie
description: Juka and her mother were fleeing the onslaught of The Bright and their ethnic cleansing when the United Nations Peacekeeping Forces armored troops came to their aid, but it was futile help as all troop members and Juka himself and his mother were killed by Jack O'Lantern.[447]

name: Jules
description: Jukie was one of the circus workers at "Mr. Mike's One-Ring Traveling Tent Show" in Sullivan County.[448]

name: Julia
description: Jules and her friends were slain by Lucifer in Litwing County.[449]

name: Julian
appearences: America Chavez: Made in the USA Vol 1 2
description: Julia was America's adoptive cousin, whom she met again when America saved the Washington Heights neighborhood where Julia and her family lived.[450]

name: Julie
description: Julian was a small kid who ran away from home in the rain one night, after his mum received his bad report card. Moon Knight tracked him down, convincing him a bad report card wasn't the end of the world, and helped him get home.[177]

name: Julio
description: Julie was part of a Bronx street gang calling themselves the Die Hards, emulating what was the movie's fashion statement in dirty t-shirts, widows peak haircuts and heavy ordnance. They came to Queens to purchase guns from Nino Cortese, but they couldn't reach a deal and came back home.[451]

name: Julio
description: Julie was a waitress at Christine when Scott Lang and Jessica Jones had their first date there.[452]

name: Julio
description: Julie was one of Midtown High School's administrative assistants.[453]

name: Julio
description: Julie was a classmate of Wade Wilson at Surline Elementary School.[454]

name: Julio
description: Julie was saved by Nightcrawler from a fall of construction bricks.[455]

name: Julio
description: Julie was a news anchor who hosted Christopher Bach to talk about Monica Sims's death.[399]

name: Juna
description: Julio worked for Domino, who was ran out of town by Two-Gun Kid.[456]

name: Juna
description: Julio was one of a street gang which Kitty Pryde accidentally came across while fleeing from the Purifiers. When Anne appeared moments later, Julio tried to distract her so Martin could kill her with a switchblade, but only wound up wiped out along with the rest of the gang by the Purifier while Kitty managed to escape.[457]

name: Juna
appearences: Daredevil: The Man Without Fear Vol 1 4
description: One of the Kingpin's men, Julio was knocked out by Daredevil.[458]

name: Juna
description: Herna was a member of the Blue Krüe gang; he was one of Guero Valdez's friends from Lincoln High School. He helped Guero steal Gabe Reyes' wheelchair only to mock him.[459]He continued helping Guero with his dealings until the new Ghost Rider gave him and his friends a beating.[191]

name: Juna
description: Julio is a friend of Miles Morales. He met Miles when the latter walked into a bodega to buy flags for the Portorican festival, but when the owner of the bodega gave Miles some Dominican flags, Julio corrected the owner telling him that Miles' mother was Puerto Rican.[460]

name: Juna
description: Julio was a henchman of Cesare , a crime boss of Madripoor. When Cesare went to Joon trying to prevent her from interrupting the pregnancy of whose baby Cesare thought was his son, Cesare ordered Julio to stand guard at the door, but in that while Elektra arrived to help Joon who easily eliminated Julio by killing him.[397]

name: Jung
description: Juna was an Oracle Adventures hostess, assigned as a personal guide to Rūna to accompany her to the interview with the Oracle.[461]

name: Junior
description: Jung was a poker player who managed to beat a desperate Troy Killkelly despite Troy holding sets, which Jung responded with a royal flush.[462]

name: Justin
description: Junior was a mercenary who worked for Maverick. He was a former member of the US special forces of the Recces of the Seals. With other members of Maverick's Mercs, he extracted Maverick and Wolverine from Madripoor following the clash between the Merchant's forces and the C.I.A.[463]

name: K.O.
description:
K.O. was an old friend of Battlin' Jack Murdock.[1]
He eventually became Fogwell's Gym's janitor.[2]

name: Kadril
description: Kadril blamed the mutants for killing Captain America during Onslaught.[3]

name: Kahlima
description: Kahlima was the daughter of Sheik Ali Maksoud and a demoness. Despite her lycanthropic nature, her father allowed her to live free, while concealing from others what she truly was. After she was eventually captured by Sheik Abdul Zu Fadh, she revealed her true nature and was killed by her own father.[4]

name: Kaidu
description: Kaidu was one of Conan's Kozaks eager to strike against the Turanian army of Commander Grimm.[5]

name: Kaitlin
description: Kaitlin was a little girl saved by Spider-Man from a building on fire.[6]

name: Kaleb
description: Kaleb was a merchant who was reputedly pursued and murdered by Bob.[7]

name: Kaley
description: Kaley was an acquaintance of Fife.[8]

name: Kalish
description: Doctor Kalish was one of the members of a psychiatric commission that was to decide on the recovery of Stan Carter and thus be able to release him at liberty. She was initially dubious about the release as they had a responsibility to society that would not appreciate a homicidal madman being left free to walk among them.[9]

name: Kaman
description: Kaman was a perimeter guard who was knocked out by the Red She-Hulk.[10]

name: Kane
description: Kane was one of Morris Sackett's teammates on the New York Stride.[8]

name: Kantlefarb
description: Mr. Kantlefarb was an employee of Timely Inc. to whom Rocket Raccoon delivered the mail.[11]

name: Kareem
description:
Kareem was a Tombstone henchman. He drove the car that brought White Rabbit to the site of an exchange with the Rose gang to acquire a Goblin Glider. After the intervention of Spider-Man there was a confrontation with Digger who threw a van on the car where Kareem was driving, but thanks to the intervention of Spider-Man he was rescued from the burning car.[12]
Later, when Spider-Man broke into a warehouse on the dock where Kareem and White Rabbit were unloading material on Tombstone's orders, White Rabbit ordered Kareem to shoot him, but Kareem refused, telling her that he had saved him from a burning car.[13]
As a token of gratitude for saving his life from the burning car, Kareem intervened moments before Tombstone's henchmen shot Spider-Man in the head, thus reciprocating his life.[14]

name: Karen
description: Karen and her friend René were camping in the woods and Karen was drinking too much wine when she noticed two fluttering figures she thought she had visions and then stopped drinking and retired to the tent.[15]

name: Karen
description: Karen tried to dissuade her husband from going to the roof armed with a shotgun because he had already notified the police.[16]

name: Karen
description: Karen was at the Lila Cheney concert when Spyder's men arrived to capture her and she screamed for the monsters' arrival but the others told her it was a special effect that Lila had already used in the last New York concert.[17]

name: Karen
description: After Karen and her husband discovered that their son Michael possessed mutant healing powers she dared not interfere whenever Michael's father beat him every time he used his powers to the point that Michael felt compelled to run away from home.[18]

name: Karen
description: Karen was a sound engineer and helped Detective Sykes identify the phone voice to prove it was indeed Dwayne Taylor's.[19]

name: Karen
description: While chasing Deadpool, Wolverine broke into Karen's cafe, breaking the front door window and making Karen so infuriated that she made no fuss about Logan punching him in the jaw but only damaged his own hand.[20]

name: Karen
description: Mentioned: Uncanny X-Men (Vol. 3) #19.NOW

name: Karen
description: Karen and her accomplice Carl were robbing a trendy shop convinced that no costumed heroes were on patrol that night, but instead they were wrong as Silk was on patrol and having spotted them she easily defeated them and handed them over to the police.[23]

name: Karen P.
description: Mentioned: Civil War: Front Line #7

name: Karen T.
description: While Joe Robertson ordered the employees of the Daily Bugle to evacuate the building where Green Goblin had brought a tritium-powered bomb, he also asked if anyone had seen Karen T. where an employee replied that she had called in sick.[24]

name: Karl
description: Karl was one of the guards tasked to watch over Logan while he was trapped in the pit.[25]

name: Karl
description: Karl was an hearing-impaired 77-year-old who was rescued by Spider-Man from being struck by a cab.[26]

name: Karno
description: Together with a group of Greek rebels they took refuge in the mountains to escape the dictatorial troops of the country, and there they were helped by the Olympic gods.[28]

name: Karol
description: Kat and her colleague Leif were two archaeologists from the Stockholm Department of Archeology who identified an underground chamber in which there was a huge treasure, but as soon as they touched the cursed gold present there they turned into dragons and fought against the Valkyrie Rūna that had come to their aid. Runa destroyed the casket containing the curse, probably a trick by Loki for fun, causing Kat and her colleague to return human again.[29]

name: Kat
description: Kate identified Captain America during the Mardi Gras.[30]

name: Kat
appearences: Captain America: What Price Glory? Vol 1 1
description:
Kate was Sal's wife.[31]
She was informed by Steve Rogers about Pasha Sanquino.[32]
Kate actually manipulated Steve to take Pasha away from his father.[33]

name: Kat
appearences: Black Panther: The Man Without Fear Vol 1 522
description: Kate was the mother of the American Panther who was bribed in the past by an immigrant who later killed her husband but who her country's government set free due to legal technicality. This incident affected Kate's son's future racist behavior[34]

name: Kate
description: Katie worked as a waitress at Poppa's Olympian Palace.[35]

name: Kate
description: Katie was a co-worker of Jean Sutherland.[36]

name: Kate
description: On an airplane over the Atlantic Ocean, Katie surprised Nightcrawler in the toilet at the rear of the plane.[37]

name: Kate
description: Katie was a little girl who was saved by Veil from a building collapse caused by Sin's Mech Legion, and later asked Veil if she could save her mother trapped in the collapsed building.[38]

name: Katie
description:
Katrina was a Vancouver girl. At Druig's announcement that the Eternals would eliminate all mutants she began tweeting messages of solidarity towards the mutants hoping that the reply messages would be a shield over Krakoa.[39]
Not having seen the broadcast of Captain America, she later sees the highlights on the network and replies with an ironic comment that does not find much support, leaving her sleepless and anxious.[40]
Katrina meets the Progenitor in the form of her late aunt and is considered unworthy.[41]
In the moment of the Progenitor's judgment, Katrina did not wonder what she had done, but rather what she was about to do and then she took herself to the burning streets.[42]
Katrina during the day of judgment instead of going through the portals of the Eternals to save herself she decides to help people in need by being stuck in a building while she saved some people by perishing inside her. However at the end of the day of judgment she Katrina came back to life.[43]

name: Katrina
description: A native, he told Lorna that the animals she had glimpsed were fleeing to escape two white hunters.[44]

name: Katubi
description: Katy and Chuck reported the news about Bloody Mary's serial beatings.[45]

name: Katubi
appearences: Wolverine: The Best There Is Vol 1 2
description:
Katy was Madcap's deceased sister. During the meeting with Wolverine, after having gouged out his eyes, Madcap went on blindly asking if he had seen Katy, who kept looking for her but couldn't find her and then asked about her from anyone he met, only to declare that it was crazy for a guy to go looking for his dead sister.[45]
