Seeing Yi Yang covered in blood, Madcap says she reminds him of his sister's dead body.[46]

name: Katy
description: Karl Kaufman's father stayed in Germany with his wife during World War I, which was why his son had to fight disguised as the Phantom Eagle in order not to be recognized so that the Germans could retaliate against his parents. When Karl decided to make a night sortie to bring his parents to safety in America, during the boarding phase on his plane, the three were identified by the German pilot Hermann von Reitberger while he was in a solitary reconnaissance flight and killed them.[47]

name: Katy
description: Karl Kaufman's mother stayed in Germany with her husband during World War I, which was why his son had to fight disguised as the Phantom Eagle in order not to be recognized so that the Germans could retaliate against his parents. When Karl decided to make a night sortie to bring his parents to safety in America, during the boarding phase on his plane, the three were identified by the German pilot Hermann von Reitberger while he was in a solitary reconnaissance flight and killed them.[48]

name: Kaufman
description: Kaylee was a student at the Brooklyn Visions Academy and after hearing Ms. Marvel's statements against Kamala's Law preventing young people under 21 from being superheroes anymore she got into a fight with another student who claimed that the Champions were liars and that she was about to start a C.R.A.D.L.E. Junior League.[49]

name: Kaylee
description: Miss Kearny participated to a talk show with Moonstone.[50]

name: Kearny
description: Mr. Keaton was member of Shaw Industries.

name: Kearny
description:
Keaton was a member of the Hammer Battle Group, a group of men in armor under the command of Sasha Hammer. The Group traveled to Paris during the Fear Itself crisis to retrieve the Detroit Steel Armor and the body of Lt. Johnson and there they collided with the Grey Gargoyle possessed by Mokk.[52]
While recovering the Armor, they encountered Rescue in Paris and were about to attack her when Grey Gargoyle possessed by Mokk appeared, transforming one of the members of the Hammer Battle Group into a statue. During the battle, the three remaining members, given the difficulty in dealing with Mokk, withdrew, being accused by Sasha of being cowards.[53]
During the fight against Mokk's possessed Gray Gargoyle, Keaton was beheaded by a blow from Mokk's hammer.[54]

name: Keaton
description: Keily had an internet channel where he gave news about the latino community including asking the Brooklyn Spider-Man of what Latin origin he was and giving the percentages that people said where they thought he was from.[55]

name: Keily
description: Keith was a beefy henchman of Bruno Markham. When Eddie Brock broke into his neighbor Ernesto Mendez's apartment in his defense he started knocking out Markham's various goons who were beating up Ernesto so the goons brought in Keith as the strongest of them but he too was defeated easily by Eddie who used the strength granted to him by the alien Symbiote by throwing Keith out of the apartment through the wall.[56]

name: Keily
description: Keith was an employee of the Beyond Corporation who worked at Beyond Branch #47, where Doug Siravanta had been transferred. During a coffee break, Doug complained to a bored Keith about being transferred after helping Spider-Man. Shortly thereafter he was taken hostage by Dr. Octopus when he stormed the building to steal a Beyond drive.[57]

name: Keith
description: Kelli was a childhood friend of Mallory Aimes.[58]

name: Kelli
description: Kelly and Watson were on the staff of St. Mabyn's Hospital in London when Misty Knight was a patient there.  When Knight collapsed while trying to leave, her doctor ran out into the corridor and ordered them to fetch a crash team for her.[59]

name: Kelli
description: Kelly was a Toronto-Dominion Mall shopper who witnessed the Vindicator attacking Banshee and Storm.[60]

name: Kelli
description: Kelly played with Rick Jones and Miggy at the concert held in Jim Wilson's clinic for AIDS patients.[61]

name: Kelli
description: Kelly was a little girl who lived in the Somerville neighborhood of Boston and to whom Emma Frost asked if Mr. Kendall lived there, to which Kelly replied that he did indeed live there but was gone.[62]

name: Kelli
description:
A fellow student of Peter Parker's, she was rescued by him after ingesting a new drug.[63]
Upon awakening after being rescued from the overdose, Kelly became amnesiac, not even remembering who she was herself from brain damage.[64]

name: Kelli
description: Kelly was a inmate in Bedford Falls Correctional Facility where Elizabeth Tyne was also there and like other prisoners she was afraid of Elizabeth, whom she known as Janine Godbe.[65]

name: Kelly
description: Kelvin was the bodyguard of a man that Kingpin had ordered the elimination and for which he had Elektra sent to perform the action. Kelvin was killed by Elektra who slit his throat.[66]

name: Kelvin
description:
Ken was one of Bruce Banner's schoolmates.[67] He beat him up when Bruce tried to protect Carla from Ken.[68]
Many years later, was assaulted by Morbius.[69]

name: Kelvin
description: At the F.E.A.S.T. center Ken told May Parker that Martin Li was in the workout room.[70]

name: Kelvin
description: EGL News anchor Ken interviewed Norman Osborn after he was targeted by the Punisher.[71]

name: Ken
description: Kendra was the daughter of Patrick, a man who Silhouette met in a dating scene and for whom Patrick always showed himself on his cell phone during the date making Silhouette think that he was not very interested but who later discovered that he was on his cell phone in looking for a babysitter for Kendra so he can dedicate himself to her.[72]

name: Kendra
description: Mentions: Hawkeye: Kate Bishop #1

name: Kennedy
description:
Kenner was posing as a henchman of Doctor Doom but in reality he had replaced the real Kenner. The imposter Kenner was sent to infiltrate Doom's henchmen by his master to put him in a position to destroy Namor. Kenner struck Doom from behind with an energy blast.[74]
Kenner's real identity nor that of his master was ever revealed. Doctor Doom did warn Namor that Kenner had tampered with his records and that he was not the man Doom hired.[75]

name: Kennedy
description: Kenner was one of Taskmaster's trainees whom he unleashed to flush out and eliminate Tyrone McQuaid after he dared to flee Taskmaster Academy. In defense of Tyrone intervened Falcon who defeated all Taskmaster's students while testing his new costume.[76]

name: Kenner
description:
Mr. Kenneth was the butler of the Howlett family and it was he who accompanied Rose as a young girl to the Howlett estate to be company to the young and sickly James.[77]
Mr. Kenneth and Rose worried about finding James, who had been hiding with his puppy in a farmhouse, believing that if he delayed the church function the old Howlett's anger would fall on them.[78]
Mr. Kenneth forced Thomas Logan from the estate after he threatened John Howlett. Logan later kicked Mr. Kenneth in the back with a shotgun to sneak back into the estate.[79]

name: Kenner
appearences: Ghost Rider: Kushala Infinity Comic Vol 1 4
description:
Kenneth participated in a black ops during the Second World War with Captain America to discover the lost city of Atlantis, but at the end of the mission he did not remember anything other than having nightmares and only a photo proved the veracity of the mission with Cap.[80]
Kenneth turned out to be a grandson of Kushala who participated with Captain America during World War II in the mission to defeat Leviathan and they succeeded, with the help of Kushala who possessed Kenneth's body, severing his horn which turned out to be a half of the sixth Wand of Watoomb.[80]
Kenneth's spirit came to Kushala's aid to fight Doctor Doom.[81]

name: Kenneth
description: Kenny was killed by Punisher for abusing his wife.[82]

name: Kenneth
description: Kenny was Megan McLaren's assistant.[83]

name: Kenneth
description: Kenny was one of Jonathon White's followers, who was confronted and defeated by Doctor Strange.[84]

name: Kenneth
appearences: Captain America: What Price Glory? Vol 1 1
description: Kenny was one of the mobsters who were confronted Captain America for roughing up Jimmy Sanders.[31]

name: Kenneth
description: Kenny was the counterman at the Sweet Stuffs shop in Fairwoods Mall in Croton-on-Hudson.[85]

name: Kenneth
description: Kenny was a chauffeur who accompanied Mary Jane back to New York. While Mary Jane joked with Kenny asking him to go to a bakery, their car was hit by another car launched by the possessed Order of the Web.[86]

name: Kenny
description: During the fight between Omegex and Red Hulk, Alan radioed Kent who was in a helicopter asking for updates on what was happening. Kent reported that the creature was the same creature that had disrupted communications on a global scale and that it was somehow connected to the Red Hulk.[87]

name: Kent
description:
Kenta was a boy from Yokohama. During the Eternals' assaults on the mutants, his parents were worried that a tidal wave would hit them, but that left Kenta totally numb. When he managed to take a blurry photo of Captain Marvel hitting a tidal wave, he thought it was a good day for him.[39]
Kenta tries and avoids doing his homework with the excuse of the End of the World but his father replied that everyone would be judged and he might be judged by his homework.[40]
Although Kenta still does not do her homework, Progenitor does not judge him as he thinks she is still too young.[41]
In the moment of the Progenitor's judgment, Kenta finally realizes that what was about to happen was real and was frightened by that.[42]
Kenta after passing through the portal of the Eternals on the day of judgment did not find his parents and was taken into care by Jada. At the end of the day of judgment Kenta returned to his parents telling them about the strange place where he had been and his parents did not tell him that they had died on the day of judgment and had returned to life at the end.[43]

name: Kenta
description: Kerry was a paramedic who recently moved to New York. During an emergency caused by the clash between the Avengers and a giant robot, Kerry despite being off duty helped to assist the people and the injured and during the emergency met a policeman with whom he fell in love.[88]

name: Kerry
description: Keshawn was shot dead by Clifto.[89]

name: Keshawn
description: A doctor from Carefree, Arizona, who treated Sam Alexander following his head injury and temporary blindness.[90] After his recovery, he told him that he was concussion symptom free.[91]

name: Kettlewell
appearences: Wolverine, Nick Fury: The Scorpio Connection a Marvel Graphic Novel Vol 1 1
description: Kevin and his brother Scott were seen by Nick Fury meeting their father.[92]

name: Kettlewell
description: Kevin told Elias Wirtham where to find Stone.[93]

name: Kettlewell
description: Kevin and Terry were both attacked by Morbius.[94]

name: Kettlewell
description: Kevin was a painter friend of Rocky who painted a portrait of his mother on canvas for her.[95]

name: Kettlewell
description: Kevin was a colleague of Sonny Ocampo in his catering job. He drew Sonny's attention, saying the guests were pissed about the lack of drinks, while sonny was arguing with Lily Hollister.[96]

name: Kettlewell
description: Kevin was a realtor in Brooklyn who sold a brownstone to James Hudson in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood.[97]

name: Kevin
description: Khalid was an agent of Ahmad Azis who was sent to poison the expected top bidder Hiram Gowdy of the statue of Khonshu with cyninide gas. He was later sent to kill Moon Knight, to prevent him from interfering with the next stage of his plan, but Spector defeated him and seemingly killed him.[98]

name: Kevin
description: Khalid was the leader of the Black Dawn Fighters that was killed by the Punisher.[99]

name: Khalid
description: When Miles' clones attacked the hospital where Miles' mother Rio worked, she realized they were looking for her and so she told her fellow nurse Khalida that they were definitely looking for her and that therefore Khalida should trust her and get everyone out of the hospital. room.[100]

name: Khalida
description: Cousin of Queen Ialamis, Lady Khashtris hired Conan to work as her bodyguard. She allied with the Cimmerian to unmask Baron Sabaninus and uncover his plot to assassinate Taramis.[101]

name: Khashtris
description: Lord Khovan was the commander of Fort Ghori and protector of the border. Khovan, in disfavor because he had not stopped the Kozak raids, visited the temple of Tarim, where he received a vision from the Master of the Black Circle. He was eventually beheaded for his failure to wipe out the Kozaks.[102]

name: Khovan
appearences: Uncanny X-Men: First Class Giant-Size Special Vol 1 1
description: Khristina was a childhood friend of Piotr Rasputin.[103]

name: Khristina
description: Khumbanigash was a General of the mercenaries. He was a normal human, probably from Shem. He seemed taller and heavier than the average size of the soldiers. Khumbanigash was one of the reliable men of Salome. He was one of the few men to know the secret of Salome. He also abused of Taramis. Seven months after the conquer of the Khauran city, a night, Khumbanigash escorted Salome to the secret prison of Taramis, to torture her with the sight of the dead Krallides' head. He stayed outside the cell, but heard Taramis' screams. Outside the prison, Khumbanigash suggested to Salome to kill Taramis in front of her people and to declare herself the Queen, sure of the military supremacy of his troops over the Khaurans. Taramis wanted to wait. She threw the head of Krallides to a deaf-mute, who actually was Marcios in disguise, looking for information. Khumbanigash, gesticulating, sent him away. A week later, Conan led his Zuagirs near Khauran and Khumbanigash left the town to fight with the rest of Constantius' army. Khumbanigash died in the battle.[104]

name: Khumbanigash
description: Mr. Kilgore hires Deadpool to retrieve his son Julian who appears to be on a martial arts reality show where participants actually die. After discovering that Julian was in fact the host of the show and killing him, Deadpool returns to Kilgore telling him that his son was dead and he also knew that it was all a maneuver to get Deadpool to participate in the show to increase the popularity and for this he did give Kilgore a million dollars more than agreed.[105]

name: Khumbanigash
description: Dr. Kilgore was suffering from an incurable tuberculosis but found a way to heal thanks to the milk of the vampire cow Hellcow, but when the beneficial effects of milk also began to fade, then he thought of using Deadpool's pituitary gland to heal definitively. So he kidnapped Deadpool and pulled HGH hormone out of the gland and injected it but the results weren't as expected. Eventually Hellcow and Deadpool together defeated Kilgore and dissolved it in acid.[106]

name: Kilgore
description: Kim was Matt Murdock's secretary at the Nelson and Murdock Law Office.[107]

name: Kilgore
description: Kim was Dr. Keith Wilmott's surgical assistant.[108]

name: Kilgore
description: Kim, daughter of Jimmy and Susie, was rescued from Razorfist by Captain America and Bucky.[109]

name: Kim
description: Kincho was a mercenary in the pay of General Coy who commanded a team of dogs trained to attack. When Patch got rid of Dai Kumo's men, Kincho fought the dogs against Patch thinking he had an easy field, but Patch initially frightened the dogs after which he turned against Kincho and General Coy's men.[110]

name: Kincho
description: Mrs. King was a woman from Leadville, she offered to give Ichabod an oatpie that she had baked for him because she saw him starved.[111]

name: Kincho
description: King and his partner Denning were two bullies who continued to rough up a quiet man named Bob Daly until Kid Colt's intervention that initially roughed up the two bullies and later in complicity with Bob's nephew made King feel humiliated even by Bob and the two bullies were forced by Kid Colt to leave the town.[112]

name: Kincho
description: Because of a malignant gossip, Judy's mother forbade her to invite her friends to their house on Friday to dance like they used to, but thanks to a subterfuge from one of Judy's friends, it was revealed to her mother the truth oon the real behavior of the one who had spread the gossip making her change her mind.[113]

name: Kincho
description: A welfare case worker through whom the X-Men, in their civilian guises, tried to acquire the funding to travel to Europe in pursuit of Professor X and Factor Three. She turned them away, believing that with Warren Worthington III among them, they already had access to funds and that their request was some sort of college prank.[114]

name: Kincho
description: King and Duke were the two doberman owned by David Tamblin and who escaped his control as he changed the tire of his car by attacking little Jacqueline McDonald who was playing on the nearby beach.[115]

name: Kincho
description: Mr. King was the father of Carl King, the Thousand, and became the second victim of his son when he went to bed with his wife in the evening, not knowing that she had become the first host of the Thousand.[116]

name: Kincho
description: Mrs. King was the mother of Carl King, the Thousand, and became her son's first host and as such his first victim as well.[116]

name: King
description: Kioga was a poacher who witnessed his partner Jongor being attacked and killed by an invisible creature in Nemedia's Darkwood.[117]

name: Kioga
description: Kira announced on television the mysterious new owner of the Buffalo Geoducks.[118]

name: Kira
description: Kitty was a housecat rescued by Spider-Man.[119]

name: Kitty
description: Klauz was the guildmaster of the local thieves' guild, who fenced all the loot taken by Conan and Fafnir from the Temple of the Dragon. When he went to show Conan the guest room, Klauz discovered that his daughter Nadine was gone, and the Cimmerian set out in search of the missing girl.[120]

name: Klauz
description: When Tombstone attacked Nick Kaska's club, Nigel confronted him with a bazooka.[121]

name: Kleiner
description: Klingbaum was a schoolmate of Frank Castle. When he bullied a friend of Frank's, Frank confronted him by beating him and all his accomplices, threatening Klingbaum that if he touched his friend again he would tear out all his nails.[122]

name: Klingbaum
description: Under threat of killing her daughter Helen, the mobster Killer Ryan forced Dr. Knight to create an antidote to the effects of the gas chamber. After giving Ryan the antidote, the mobster killed the scientist but did not read the note that had left him where it was written that after taking the antidote would not be able to breathe the regular air.[123]

name: Knight
description: Kobe's cocaine refining and processing facility was torn down by the Hulk.[124]

name: Kobe
appearences: Tomb of Dracula Presents: Throne of Blood Vol 1 1
description: Determined to eliminate the infection that had developed in his house, not knowing it was in fact vampirism, Raizo Kodo also killed his mother who also became a vampire.[125]

name: Kodo
description:
Komali visited the body of her dead husband Arjun behaving with dignity despite her pain and then despairing from knowing the Day of Judgment as for her the end of the world had already occurred with the death of her husband.[40]
Komali is visited by the Progenitor while she is crying in her bed for the loss of her husband and he thinks there is no need to judge her.[41]
In the moment of the Progenitor's judgment, Komali does nothing but wait.[42]
Komali decides not to go through the portals of the Eternals on the day of judgment, remaining to think about her late husband. However at the end of the day of judgment Katrina returned to her life and a giant Eternal appeared to her apologizing for the death of her husband.[43]

name: Komali
description: Kooba was a warrior of the Ichiribu who trained with Conan in the northern ways of war.[126]

name: Kooba
description: After the incident of the Roxxon "Pangean Horizon" oil rig, Ka-Zar, seeing him absent, asked Koor if he was not well and he replied that he was praying and that having no other resources he too would set fire to their forest to allow the palm oil cultivation of foreigners.[127]

name: Koor
description: Koris was Ygok's personal bodyguard. He was killed by Ormon when he defected instead of confronting Conan.[128]

name: Koris
description: Korr was a winged ant who Ant-Man used to travel around the city on, and Korr gave up his life to protect him and the Wasp from a menacing garden snake. Henry Pym was visibly disturbed by Korr's passing and Korr's willingness to lay down his life for him.[129] Later Pym used Korr's sentience as a base program for the Rover.[130]

name: Korr
description: Kortgaard was a researcher investigating mysterious signals at the Mount Logan Cosmic Ray Research Station with Walter Langkowski. Kortgaard was killed by an explosion caused by the Super-Skrull who had disguised himself as Thing.

name: Kortgaard
description:
Kosinski was a construction contractor who had some drawing problems in the construction of one of the buildings but unable to find the architect in charge Eric Masterson, he told the foreman that Masterson was licensed and someone else would finish the job.[131]
After getting a meeting with Kosinski and promising him that there would be no further delay in the construction of the building, Eric received during the interview a call on his Avengers ID Card, which infuriated Kosinski who kicked him out of his office.[132]

name: Kosinski
description: Kraggos delivered the fatal blow who knocked down Conan and allowed Milo, as the new captain of the Free Companions, to capture the Cimmerian.[133]

name: Kraggos
description: Son of Acrallidus, Krallides was one of the Queen's counselors. He was a normal human, honest and faithful to the throne and probably a sage. He was considered trustworthy by Taramis, and the people listened his words. After Salome took Taramis identity, Krallides understood that something went wrong, and, after many months of odd behavior of the false Taramis, he started to believe that Taramis wasn't the real one but a false. Krallides tried to convince the Khauran population that the Queen was not Taramis but Salome had him captured and beheaded. Then Salome used Krallides' head to torture Taramis. Khumbanigash gave the head to Marcios, who was disguised as a deaf-mute and who learned that both Conan and Krallides were right and started his plans for the liberation of the Queen.[104]

name: Krallides
description: Professor Kraut was the Professor of Destruction and Sabotage of the School for Sabotage to indoctrinate the boys in Germany where the Young Allies went, causing havoc inside.[134]

name: Kraut
description: Mr. Krautmann (sometimes referred to as "Pops") is the owner and operator of Krautmann's Sodas, old fashion ice cream parlor and drug store in Centerville, California.[135][136][137][113][138]

name: Krautmann
description: Krebbs was the first Unlucky Thirteen Gang member to be killed by Two-Gun Kid during their ambush attempt against him.[139]

name: Krebbs
appearences: Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 107
description: Mrs. Kreeger was the mother of Victor Kreeger and grandmother of rockstar Zeno Saturn. She helped her son, alias the Hammer of Judgment, to unmask the Zeno Saturn impostor who had taken over from his nephew after a tragic accident where he was killed.[140]

name: Kreeger
description: Kreuger was a terrorist who participated in the attack on the Da Vinci Airport in Rome to eliminate a specific target. Soon after taking out the target, Solo came teleporting in and killed Kreuger and the other terrorists.[56]

name: Kreuger
description: Kristin was told by her mother about Doctor Doom's mother.[141]

name: Kristin
description: Dr. Krypt is a staff physician at Department H. He was the one to revive Heather Hudson and Eugene Judd after their initial capture by the Epsilons.[142]

name: Krypt
description: Kuljit was the Nelson and Murdock Law Office maintenance man.[143]

name: Kuljit
description: Kumiko accompanied Shigeru Ono's daughter in the car after her little girl and her father had escaped an assassination attempt by Elektra against Shigeru.[144]

name: Kumiko
description: After Marc Spector gave control of himself to Steven Grant's personality, he met Kurt, a man he trusted by asking him, after the high payment, to identify two supervillains, pretending to want to use them to make films about them.[145]

name: Kurt
description: Kwan was knocked down by Wolverine.[146]

name: Kwan
appearences: Shang-Chi and the Ten Rings Vol 1 4
description: Kwok was a corrupt businessman who appropriated with the strength of Auxier's design and bragged to girls that to get what you wanted you didn't have to be afraid, but suddenly Shen Kuei hired by Auxier appeared and threatened Kwok with a gun after easily getting rid of his security men and then Kwok showed his true courage by surrendering immediately and telling him that he would immediately give him back the stolen design.[147]

name: L.J.
description: L.J. was a gang member who was attacked by the Night Terror.[1]

name: Lacey
description: Lacey co-hosted the show with Tom on the episode that Miguel O'Hara auditioned.[2]

name: Laclos
description: Mentions: Alpha Flight (Vol. 4) #3

name: Lafferty
description: Mrs. Lafferty was the owner of a boarding house.[4]

name: LaGraves
description: LaGraves was on the Sweat Shoppers team sent by the Power Broker on the order of the Red Skull to the federal penitentiary in Virginia to evade Viper from prison, which they successfully accomplished.[5]

name: Lake
description: Lake was an immigrant smuggler who was arrested after being caught by Wolverine.[6]

name: Lance
description: Lance was a friend of Bud Williams and when Bud said he was unable to bring Irma to the prom because his car didn't start, he immediately offered to accompany Irma to the prom as he could not accompany them both because his car only had two places, but Bud's other friend Don offered to repair Bud's car and only if he couldn't do it would he accompany Irma to the prom.[7]

name: Lance
description: A drunkard who met Winda Wester on the road to which he made heavy advances but after Winda defended himself by scratching him, he took his revenge by attacking and beating her.[8]

name: Lance
description: Lance was a kid who during the Uncle Elmer show was on a carousel that was rotated by Simon Williams as Mr. Muscle.[9]

name: Lance
appearences: Marvel Graphic Novel: Emperor Doom — Starring the Mighty Avengers Vol 1 1
description: Lance was a security guard at the entrance gate of the Colossal studios in Hollywood.[10]

name: Lance
appearences: Silver Sable and the Wild Pack Vol 1 19
description: Larry was killed by the Man-Eater.[11]

name: Lance
description: Lance was among the group of mutant haters who lent the mutant Dennis Hogan by killing him.[12]

name: Lance
appearences: X-Men: Children of the Atom Vol 1 1
description: Lance was a Freeport High School student and an acquaintance of Chad.[13]

name: Lance
description: Lance was one of Cassie Lang's schoolmates.[14]

name: Lance
description: Lance was a prison guard in a New York prison and when Thor showed up to interrogate a prisoner Lance told him he had to leave his hammer but his colleague Bill told him to leave it alone so no one would be able to lift it.[15]

name: Lane
description: Mister Lane visited Jane while she was hospitalized at Fleming-Gardner Memorial Hospital.[16]

name: Lane
description: Mrs. Lane let Normie Osborn spend All Hallows Eve with her son Josh.[17]

name: Lane
description: Lane was one of two truck drivers who transported the weapons seized in police actions to be decommissioned, but in fact they delivered them to Sheriff Cole to be able to exchange with the Calavera's heroine.[18]

name: Lansfield
description: He brought his newborn son to his father to introduce him to him and when his father said he was heartbroken for not being able to give anything to his nephew except his love, his son replied that this was the best gift he could give him.[19]

name: Lansfield
description: Together with her husband she brought her newborn son Harry to his father-in-law to introduce him to his grandson.[19]

name: Lara
description: Lara was a member of the Trustees of Hate, a group led by Doctor Vortex dedicated to pushing the nations of Borsia and Gratzia into warring with each other for unrevealed reasons. The group was opposed by the hero the Blue Blaze.

name: Larissa
description: Larissa was a human that was integrated into the Phalanx collective. She and other members of the Falange collective were sent by Cameron Hodge to clash with the X-Men but were defeated and perished in the fight.[21]

name: Larry
description: Larry was one of the underprivileged children assisted by social worker Betsy Beatty.[22]

name: Larry
description: Twin brothers Larry and Gar stabbed each other to death over jealousy for a Gehenna Stone fragment.[23]

name: Larry
description: Larry was a security guard who faced the Spider-Carnage.[24]

name: Larry
description: Larry and Georgie were ordered by Hammerhead to get rid of Peter Parker.[25]

name: Larry
description: Larry was an heroin dealer who was interrogated by the Black Cat about a missing runaway kid.[26]

name: Larry
description: Larry secretly alerted Gen. Thunderbolt Ross that Emil Blonsky quit his job at the library in Duncan and was about to leave town.[27]

name: Larry
description: Larry was a passerby from whom Astrid Bloom read the mind to discover that he was a paranoid schizophrenic who was convinced that his bird was cheating on him with his best friend and that the world would end next week.[28]

name: Larry
description: Larry was a former boxer and the owner of the Cyclone Bar & Grill. He took Daredevil and cared for him inside the bar following a fight against Bullseye.[29]

name: Larry
description:
Larry and his partner Marv pretended to be two repairmen to retrieve a hammer that would save Cimarron's people.[30]
The hammer, which Deadpool appropriated and gave it to the Walrus, believing it to be a fake, was used by Larry and his partner to defeat the werewolves in Cimarron.[31]
Finally, they tell Deadpool that the hammer is in fact a magical object that was used to oppose a group of werewolves who were planning to storm the town of Cimarron.[32]

name: Larry
description: Larry approached Matthew Murdock and told him he knew who was after him.[33] He was really a homeless boy who was paid for medical testing in order to replicate Daredevil's powers.[34]

name: Larry
description: Larry was a sanitation worker at the Fresh Kills landfill.[35]

name: Larry
description: Larry was a public defender who was assigned to defend Johnny Squarejohn, a childhood friend of Matt Murdock.[36]

name: Lars
description: Lars was one of Mary Jane Watson's friends who attended her wedding bash in a private Uptown club.[37]

name: Lars
description: Lars was an oil rig worker under Brom's supervision.[38]

name: Lars
description:
Lars was one of the boys bullied and lured by an internet subterfuge by the Dark Beast and transformed into a Lizard-like being and then placed in the service of Dark Beast to catch other boys to experiment on.[39]
It was revealed that Lars was the victim of a car accident and was consequently mutilated in his arms and legs. Dark Beast used a variant of Connors' serum on him, transforming him into a lizard-like creature.[40]
After Emma Frost and Spider-Man escape, Dark Beast orders Lars to check equipment that could have been damaged during the fight. Shortly thereafter, he struck Emma Frost from behind as she was destroying Dark Beast's equipment, but was quickly defeated by the Lizard.[41]

name: Larson
description: Dr. Larson was a veterinarian working at the San Pedro Cat & Dog Clinic.[42]

name: Lassiter
description:
Lassiter was a New York mobster. Some of his men failed to come to terms with mobster Garrick King, who escaped with the $ 2 million Lassiter would go to the Cult of Kâli for their alliance.[43]
After Shroud clashed with his men, Lassiter contacted the leader of the Cult, Yannroth, who would unleash his killer, Kâli, against Shroud.[44]
After explaining to Yannroth that he was not working with Shroud but that he was his enemy, to show his intentions he arranged a meeting with Garrick King where, however, there was also the Scorpion that captured him.[45]
Lassiter and Scorpion also took King's wife hostage to force him to hand over the money, and after obtaining it they went to meet with Yannroth but after Shroud revealed that the money was counterfeit, Yannroth had Lassiter killed.[46]

name: Latour
description: Miss Latour was a stern French tutor.[47]

name: Laura
description: Laura and her sister Agnes were visited by Mr. Cotton from the Welfare Bureau after receiving complaints about the smell and filth of the house. He threatened to call an exterminator on the rats and attempted to kill one himself, one named Caesar, who attacked and bit him back. After he killed the rat, the women were distraught and lead him to their clean cellar where they chained up Mr Cotton and fed him to the rest of the rats.[48]

name: Laura
description: Laura was the first witness to notice the Demolisher flying towards Tony's private yacht.[49]

name: Lauren
description: Lauren was an employee of O'Connell Daycare attended by Malik, the grandson of Kamala Khan.[50]

name: Laurent
description: Laurent was a mercenary hired to retrieve France's nuclear codes. He died when Black Widow activated a Life-Model Decoy booby-trapped with explosives, in order to kill Laurent and his employers.[51]

name: Lauria
description: Lauria lived in the monastery where an unidentified woman left a trio of Hellbent infants, who would be known as the Cadre. Lauria helped Gregori supervise the children, until, like the rest of the Knights Templar, she was slaughtered by the hellbents sent by Seth.[52]

name: Laurie
description:
Laurie was Harlan Ryker's secretary at Cybertek. When Michael Collins showed up at Ryker's office, Laurie told him that Mr. Ryker was busy with Ben Jacobs in a weapons test and could not be disturbed.[53]
A few days later Laurie warns Mr. Ryker in his office that Mr. Cross had arrived to meet him.[54]
Later, Laurie warns via video, Mr. Ryker that there is Mr. Burr to see him[55]

name: Lawrence
appearences: Shadowland: Blood on the Streets Vol 1 1
description: Lawrence was one of the bouncers at the Eastern Promise, the club owned by Sergey Bulovic. Lawrence usually abused the girls that wanted to become dancers in the club until Silver Sable beat him while she infiltrated into the club.[56]

name: Lawrence
description:
Lawrence was a servant for Justin Hammer.[57]
Lawrence sacrificed his own life in order not to fail trust in his services towards the one he worked for.[58]

name: Lawson
description: Lawson and Deruge were two subordinates of Nguyen Ngoc Coy, who were ordered to watch over Leong and Nga Coy Manh, but they were easily defeated by Spider-Man.[59]

name: Lawson
description: Professor Lawson was a crazed scientist who invented a ray capable of devolving people by restructuring their genetic structure by matching them with a distant ancestor of whom they kept traces in their DNA. He assaulted the campus where he taught and did research, accusing the Chancellor of having never understood his work, he but was opposed and defeated by Marvel Boy.[60]

name: Lawson
description: Lawson was one of the members of the school A.V. Club at Midtown High School.[61]

name: Layla
description: Rayshella's elder sister, Layla was charmed by Conan and approached him out on the balcony, but she ran quickly back to her home as soon as Baron Vjerzak appeared down the street.[62]

name: Leach
description: Leach was a thug who apparently drowned in the East River after being defeated by Daredevil.[63]

name: Leaman
description: Leaman was on the Sweat Shoppers team sent by the Power Broker on the order of the Red Skull to the federal penitentiary in Virginia to evade Viper from prison, which they successfully accomplished.[5]

name: LeBon
description: Mentioned: Amazing Spider-Man Annual #25

name: Lee
description: Lee was a smuggling chieftain who pledged to Jessan Hoan's service.[65]

name: Lee
description: Aiming at Spider-Man, Lee fired his slazer gun and mistakenly hit Aura, almost killing her.[66]

name: Lee
description: Lee was one the mercenaries sent by Mr. Raven to capture Dani Moonstar at 1128 Mission Street.[67]

name: Leez
description: Leez and her friend were travelling to New Orleans during a school break when they met Gambit and asked for directions. During the conversation something exploded and Gambit was attacked by Assassins Guild. Her freind wanted to drive out there but Leez was fascinated by the battle.[68]

name: Lefkowicz
description: Lefkowicz was Jupiter's boss at the Oak Hills Mall.[69]

name: Leftenant
description: In the 19th century, The Leftenant worked with the Ingolstadt jail when several prisoners disappeared. He tried to get Colonel Blackstone to open an investigation but he refused to so the Leftenant began investigating himself. On his way to Castle Frankenstein, he ran into Frankenstein's Monster which the Leftenant attacked but was knocked out. Later, after recovering he found the monster chained up being held prisoner by the Colonel who was killing the prisoners and turning them into his mindless slaves using a Giant Spider. He fought the Colonel but was seemingly losing when the chamber began flooding and the spider escaped. The Leftenant fled begging the Colonel to flee too instead of dying.[70] His fate after the castle crumbled is unknown.

name: Leiberthal
description:
Mr. Leiberthal was the prosecutor in the trial brought against the Red Skull for his war crimes.[71]
During the trial, Leiberthal was taken hostage by Crossbones and released from the fake bioplastoid Avengers created by Arnim Zola.[72]

name: Leif
description: Leif and his colleague Kat were two archaeologists from the Stockholm Department of Archeology who identified an underground chamber in which there was a huge treasure, but as soon as they touched the cursed gold present there they turned into dragons and fought against the Valkyrie Rūna that had come to their aid. Runa destroyed the casket containing the curse, probably a trick by Loki for fun, causing Leif and his colleague to return human again.[73]

name: Leilani
description: Leilani was a neighbor of Peter Parker who asked if Spider-Man knew a super-hero stronger than him to face her problems with very powerful people.[74]

name: Lem
description: Lem was a mechanic from Mount Pressure who repaired She-Hulk's flying car.[75]

name: Lem
description: Lem was one of Lavender's goons. He was confronted by Captain America after their boss managed to shoot at Bucky.[76]

name: Len
appearences: X-Men: Children of the Atom Vol 1 2
description: Len was one of the sportscasters for the Freeport High School Red Devils football team.[77]

name: Len
description: Len was Special Agent Aguinaga's partner.[78]

name: Len
description:
Len was the leader of the motorcycle gang called Hell Hounds that controlled the Californian town of Baywater. He had one of his men killed by him not believing that they had been attacked by a symbiote, after which, convinced that the attack was a well-planned hit against his gang, he ordered all members of the gang to attack the town until someone came forward about who had carried out the hit.[79]
Len threatened Jake Yahkin, saying that his Renegades were to blame for what had happened. To avoid bloodshed Jake told Len that he would challenge him personally, but exacerbated because Jake did not want to give up, Len shot him killing him thus violating the rules of the challenge with the consequent bloodshed that followed one another between the two gangs where they massacred all the members of the Renegades.[80]

name: Lenny
description: Lenny was one of "Lucky Max" Galeno's affiliates in Los Angeles.[81]

name: Lenny
description: Lenny was an enforcer for the ESI and was killed in an explosion within the ESI building while trying to capture Spider-Man and Lee Camino.[82]

name: Lenny
description: Lenny was one of the best Taskmaster students and was hired with others for a sparring partner session dressed as Captain America. The opponent turned out to be the Red Skull who killed Lenny and the other sparring partners in an extremely simple way.[83]

name: Lenny
description: Lenny was one of the two employees of Jason Tso, who were tasered and rigged with explosives by the Pro. Sent into Club Noir to kill Tso, their grenades were slapped away by Ben Reilly.[84]

name: Lenny
description: Lenny was one of the gunmen that Lucky Lobo had trained on Mary Kelleher.[85]

name: Lenny
description: Lenny was part of a contingent of Junior Gates' mob who was defeated in Lower Manhattan by the New Warriors.[86]

name: Lenny
appearences: Shadowland: Blood on the Streets Vol 1 1
description: Lenny was one of the bouncers at the Eastern Promise, the club owned by Sergey Bulovic.[56]

name: Lenny
description: Lenny served as head of the Chicane County police. It was not revealed whether he also was a psychopath who had been brainwashed or if he was a handler of the Psychoville project.[87]

name: Lenya
description: Lenya was Yuri Petrovich's dog, who stayed with his father Ivan when they were forced to leave Moscow.[88]

name: Leo
description: Leo was an inveterate tippler who witnessed Nazis gathering in London with uniforms and guns; he warned the police about it, pleading to be believed.[89]

name: Leo
description: Leo was an agent of the Shadow Consortium, tasked with hijacking and retrieving a secret United States defense surveillance satellite. He was confronted by Nova, who convinced him and his partner Herb to surrender, but died in the explosion of the ship he was travelling in.[90]

name: Leo
appearences: United States of Captain America Vol 1 5
description: Leo was a child who dressed as Captain America went with his mother to the Smithsonian Exhibit where he met Steve Rogers and, recognizing him, asked if he was Captain America. Steve replied, after asking his name, that he could have been, but he too could have been Captain America as everyone present at the exhibit.[91]

name: Leo
description: Leo encounters the Human Torch outside the Baxter Building complaining that the hostage situation inside the building is stalling traffic making him late for his shift. Soon after, he helps Johnny pass through the force field that surrounded the building.[92]

name: Leon
description: Leon was one of Mr. Wilson's social patients.[93]

name: Leonard
description: Leonard cured Ellen Brandt's face after she was burned by Man-Thing.[94]

name: Leonard
description: Leonard was Mr.Canfield's butler.[95][96]

name: Leonard
description: Leonard was Hammerhead's cell inmate in Salamanca.[97]

name: Leonard
description: Leonard was mistaken for a robber by Spider-Man.[98]

name: Leonard
description: Leonard was the Eagleton, Wisconsin police commissioner who broke the news to April Manning that his son had been killed during a police check while driving his car.[99]

name: Lerner
description: One of the security guards at GARID, under the command of Calvin Falconer they tried to capture Tendril but were saved by the timely intervention of Spider-Man[100].

name: Leroy
description: Roy was the owner of Leroy's Tavern in the Pennsylvania time-looped town of Cedar. Now friends with Ben Grimm and his wife Alicia, Roy offered to accompany Alicia to the table, but she replied that she now knew the route.[101].

name: Les
description: Les was a member of the Teen Brigade. He thought that the Army would soon polish the Hulk off.[102]

name: Les
description: Mel was a student who frequented the Incantesimo witchcraft shop, and in which a circle of friends who had the same tastes and mentality was formed, supporting each other and in which Patty Prue also joined, overturning her belief that she would remain alone after the loss of her family.[103]

name: Lesgetti
description: Mrs. Lesgetti was the wife of Gary Lesgetti, an old friend of Paul Duval, who died prematurely.[102]

name: Leslie
description: Leslie worked at Jacqueline Carr's Observatory as a secretary in Denver.[104]

name: Leslie
description: Leslie was a survivor of a plane crash that helped Juston Seyfert.[105]

name: Leslie
appearences: Death of Doctor Strange: Blade Vol 1 1
description: Leslie was a young vampire follower of Dahlia. To upset Dahlia, Dracula promoted Leslie to Dungeon Guard and tasked her with incarcerating the extradimensional being called Fio'ri. During his incarceration Leslie was attacked by Fio'ri and Dahlia who left him helpless in terror.[106]

name: Levon
description:
A member of the Harlem gang of the Thunderbolts, Levon saved the Black Panther's life from Li'l Herbie.[107]
After being defeated by the Avengers, Levon was arrested by the police.[108]

name: Levy
description: Mr. Levy was a pastry chef who served Peter and in his bakery Peter luckily managed to find a pecan pie for his Aunt May even in the afternoon, which is somewhat unusual even according to Mr. Levy.[109]

name: Lewis
description: The night before Christmas, Santa Claus impersonator Lewis from the St. Michael's Hospice for Handicapped Children was robbed and injured by a gang of junkies.[110]

name: Lewis
description: Lewis was a second grade student whose class was guided by Mrs. Platt on the Liberty Island ferry.[111]

name: Liam
description: Lia's motherm was one of the victims of Massacre victims. During the celebration in memory of the victims J. Jonah Jameson promised Liam that Massacre would die.[112]

name: Lichter-Dale
description: Mrs. Lichter-Dale hosted a fashion show in the crystal ballroom of a posh, world famous hotel on Park Avenue.[113]

name: Lieber
description: Frau Lieber was one of the first to notice something strange in Herr Braun, as if he was walking around in trance.[114]

name: Lief
description: Lief was a child who was rescued from Harlow by Ant-Man.[115]

name: Lila
description: Lila was an assistant to Jeremy Briggs. When the students of the Avengers Academy visited Briggs at his headquarters, out of enthusiasm Briggs ordered Lila to bring various refreshments for all of them and to cancel any appointments he had previously scheduled for that hour.[116]

name: Liliana
description: Liliana was an acquaintance of Rigo Zapata.[117]

name: Lin
description: Lin the admiral of the Chinese mega-sub, the Dreadnought.[118]

name: Lily
appearences: Moon Girl and Devil Dinosaur Vol 1 3
description: Lily is a student at Public School 20 Anna Silver. She was one of the girls playing with matches in the restroom that set the school on fire.[119]

name: Linc
description: Linc was a junkie who was confronted and knocked out by Daredevil.[110]

name: Lind
description: Mrs. Lind is an employee of the Beyond Corporation. Upon returning from her lunch break, she greeted the Beyond HQ receptionist and he asked her if she had had a good lunch, to which she replied that she had the best.[121]

name: Linda
description: Mentioned: Osborn #4

name: Linderman
description: Mrs. Linderman was a student pilot. During one of her lessons, Spider-Man (Miguel O'Hara) landed on her plane and used it to launch off.[123]

name: Ling
description: Mr. Ling was an arms dealer who used the little boy Timmy Rice to distract the Punisher and eliminate him, but the attempt turned on him ending with the Punisher killing Ling.[124]

name: Lionel
description: Lionel was saved by the Spider-Man (Ben Reilly) from Hammerhead.[125]

name: Lisa
description: The former girlfriend of Marc Spector, Lisa was killed by Marc's brother Randall.[126]

name: Lisa
description: Lisa was a Carnage victim, killed by him throwing her through a marble wall after kidnapping J. Jonah Jameson just to keep herself in exercise.[127]

name: Lisa
description: Lisa was Tommy Kavanagh's girlfriend.[128]

name: Lisa
description: Lisa was a friend of Jennifer Hardesty.[129]

name: Lisa
description: Lisa was one of the friends of Nate who, following the passage of a destructive tornado in Redfield, asked to Captain America if he wanted to go with them to see if there was still someone to help.[130]

name: Liu
description: Mr. Liu was a cocaine dealer who witnessed the Hulk dismantle a major cocaine refining and processing facility.[131]

name: Liu
appearences: Moon Girl and Devil Dinosaur Vol 1 9
description: Ms. Liu teaches art at Public School 20 Anna Silver.[132]

name: Liu
description: Doctor Liu, a Ravencroft Institute staff member was secretly killed and replaced by Spidercide.[133]

name: Liza
appearences: X-Men: Children of the Atom Vol 1 1
description: Liza was a Freeport High School student and an acquaintance of Chad.[13]

name: Lizzy
description:
Lizzy was a psychiatric patient, cellmate of Elektra, who had been hospitalized after the death of her father, and Mary Walker. Lizzy was obsessed with hypnotizing snakes; when she attempted suicide, Elektra intervened and saved her life.[134]
Years later, during a confrontation between Elektra and Typhoid Mary, Elektra recalled her past in the psychiatric hospital in her cell with Lizzy.[135]

name: Lloyd
description: Lloyd was a waiter who served drinks to the Warzone.[136]

name: Lois
description: Lois' husband shared his popcorn with Spider-Man.[137]

name: Lois
description: Lois was May Parker's personal nurse. After Peter Parker was hospitalized following a fight as Spider-Man, Lois was put in charge of his physical therapy. Despite Peter's initial refusal, he mustered enough will to agree to therapy,[138] and Lois was happy with the progress he eventually made.[139]

name: Lola
description:
Lola was Blackie Ross's girlfriend and an accomplice in his car racing racket.
She tricked the Human Torch into the trap but was later captured by the Torch in Auson City and turned over to the authorities.[140]

name: Lola
description: Lola was one of the organizers of the parade and meeting in Chicago against the law that banned underage from being superheroes.[141]

name: Lombardo
description:
Minor Appearances: Spider-Man Human Torch #3
Mentions: Amazing Spider-Man (Vol. 5) #6

name: Lonnie
description: Lonnie and Jimmy were caught by Spider-Man while they were about to drop Francis from a thirty-story building.[144]

name: Lonny
description: Lonny was one of Billy the Beaut's poker players who were killed by the Punisher.[145]

name: Lopez
description: Doctor Lopez was among the members of a commission of psychiatrists who had to decide on the recovery of Stan Carter and thus be able to release him at liberty. Lopez took the case to Dr. Costello because he hadn't seen the file the previous evening because he had preferred to watch a football game.[146]

name: Lor
description: Lor was the Hangman of Horror Hall, who was on his way to throw more prisoners in the pit, when Blue Blaze rose from a nearby lime pit, frightening Lor so much his heart gave out.[147]

name: Lori
description:
Lori was a friend of Milla Donovan.[148]
She suspected her friend had a crush on Daredevil.[149][150]

name: Lori
description: Lori was the editor of the online tabloid The Unexpected Truth who published a post airing the idea that the death of Captain America / Barnes was a hoax and this infuriated the Black Widow who went to the editorial office and chatted with the various members. Eventually Lori deleted the post.[151]

name: Lorna
description: Lorna was a Target Technologies operative who captured Speedball by hitting him with a weapon that imprisoned him in a kinetic energy dampening field.[152]

name: Lorna
description: Lorna was a colleague of Harvey Elder who pitied him.[153]

name: Lorraine
description: Lorraine was the wife of Musenda, who was attacked by a vampire that created a symbiotic link between them that caused Lorraine to become a vampire during the daytime. The root of the symbiosis was discovered by Rachel van Helsing. The vampire was eventually killed by Blade, restoring Lorraine to normal.[154]

name: Lotapa
description: Lotapa was a Meroan soldier whose horse was stolen by Conan on his way out of the city.[155]

name: Lou
description: Lou was a radar outpost operator who was tricked by the Krill into betraying the Earth.[156]

name: Lou
description: Lou was a member of the crime gang who kidnapped Vanessa Fisk.[157] When they were eventually defeated by the Kingpin, he was forced to sign a written confession.[158]

name: Lou
description: Lou was a prison guard at Ryker's Island who attempted to stop Bullseye from escaping from Ryker's, but he was knocked down and apparently thrown off the copter.[159]

name: Lou
description: Lou was a butler working at the Hellfire Club, first seen welcoming Storm and Colossus when they arrived incognito. He later chatted with one of the maids, Mary, and reminded her to give special attention to the host and presidential candidate Robert Kelly while delivering a tray of drinks.[160]

name: Lou
description: Lou worked as a barman in Broken Cross.[161]

name: Lou
description: Lou was one of the baggage handlers who saw Mr. Fixit's footprints from under the plane.[162]

name: Lou
description:
"Lou" was a handler assigned to the US Agent by the Commission to direct his cover missions. He met the Agent on a drug bust[163] and offered him a mission to collect the Iron Monger Armor.[164]
Later, he directed the Agent to investigate a US/Canada military outpost in Bathurst Inlet for suspected actions by Russian terrorists.[165][163][164]

name: Lou
description: Lou was an editor of the Big Apple Advocate small press newspaper.[166]

name: Lou
description: Lou was the cameraman who worked with Hildy Johnson while she was covering the AIDS protest outside the Theodore Roosevelt School.[167]

name: Lou
description:
Lou was one of the two over-worked cooks and a co-worker of Ben Reilly at the Daily Grind.[168]
Lou and Joe met the new waitress Alison Mongrain.[169]

name: Lou
description: Lou and his co-workers pulled out of Puget Sound a body wearing Whitney Frost's mask.[170]

name: Lou
description: Lou was a journalist who sneaked into the World with a mutant rights activist.[171]

name: Lou
description: Lou was the clerk of the hotel where Emma Frost resided and threatened to kick her out if she didn't pay the rent, but to make up for her missed payments he made very heavy advances but for which Emma refused using her powers to drive him away.[172]

name: Lou
description: Lou was the Blind Spot bartender.[173]

name: Lou
description: Lou was a worker for Damage Control, he was rescued by Peter Parker as he was about to be crushed by the rubble he and his team were taking off the street.[174]

name: Loufek
description: Loufek was persuaded by Emma Frost to do what Wilson Fisk asked by mentally convincing him that otherwise a person not as friendly as her would have intervened, referring to a possible intervention of the assassin Elektra.[175]

name: Louie
description:
Louie told Spider-Man (Peter Parker) where was located the Sandman's and the Enforcers' hideout.[176]
Many years later, Louie was recruited by Dracula to assault the Avengers Mansion.[177]
Some time later, he told Spider-Man where was located the body of Dr. Octopus.[178]

name: Louie
description: Louie shot the Masked Marauder's special truck to slow it down and have the Boss hijack it.[179]

name: Louie
description: Louie and another mobster were about to ask a shopkeeper for protection money on behalf of Crime-Wave, when Daredevil appeared who easily defeated the two criminals, but at the time of arrest the shopkeeper was afraid of reprisals from Crime-Wave. he opted not to report the two mobsters saying that it was all a misunderstanding.[180]

name: Louie
description: Louie was a regular of Fogwell's Gym and was interviewed by Daily Bugle reporter Ben Urich.[181]

name: Louie
description: Louie was reverted to his natural Skrull form by the Wasp's bio-electric sting.[182]

name: Louie
description: Louie was a street thug who attempted to assault Nick Fury at the Grand Central Station.[183]

name: Louie
description: Louie and his associate were two criminals who took advantage of the elders of the neighborhood by creating their own reign of terror at least until the intervention of Cloak and Dagger who attacked them with Dagger who first hit him with his bolts of light and then Cloak who them he wrapped in his cloak sending them into his Dark Dimension and making them re-emerge in the grip of the deepest terror.[152]

name: Louie
description: Louie was Lucky Lobo's bodyguard.[85]

name: Louieville
description: Louieville was defeated by Daredevil and the Punisher.[184]

name: Louis
description: Louis and Dirk were ordered by Tommy "Peach" Cullen to dispatch Jimmy Pierce.[185]

name: Louis
appearences: Breaking Into Comics the Marvel Way! Vol 1 1
description: Louis was a medical attendant at a maximum security prison for criminally insane.[186]

name: Louis
description: Louis was a French parkour enthusiast, he and a friend met Batroc on the roofs of Paris as they embarked on a parkour course.[187]

name: Louise
description: Louise and Harold mistook Edwin Jarvis for a bum, when he was looking for help after escaping from the Masters of Evil's hideout.[188]

name: Louise
description: Louise was Frankie Majors' girlfriend.[189]

name: Louise
appearences: Ghost Rider/Blaze: Spirits of Vengeance Vol 1 3
description: Visions: Ghost Rider: Return of Vengeance #1

name: Louise
description: One of the mercenaries and member of the Model Soldiers.[6]

name: Louise
description: Louise was Man Mountain Marko's aunt and helped criminals cross the border when they fled the United States.[192]

name: Louise
description: Named: Wolverine (Vol. 7) #5

name: Louise
description: Louise was a girl who Bucky met in a dance hall and asked her to dance until a man came who pounced on Bucky asking what he meant with her and hit him by starting a fight in the club.[194]

name: Louise
description: Louise was a New Yorker living in Queens with her husband Carl. One day Louise was chastising him for his lack of domestic help while Carl was trying to watch a baseball game on TV. As their discussion escalated, the cosmically-empowered Iron Man happened to use the Power Cosmic to boost the collective brainpower of the entire city to match his own. This caused Louise and Carl to suddenly become more introspective, allowing them to settle their differences amicably.[195]

name: Love
description: Connecticut Detective Love arrested and interrogated Matt Murdock about the murder of Uri Rosenthal.[196]

name: Lowry
description: Father Lowry was involved in an accident with Prometheus.[197]

name: Lucas
description: Mrs. Lucas was Johnny Storm's landlady in Liddleville.[198]

name: Lucas
description: Lucas was the brother of Julian, a young mutant native, who during the robbery attempt by the sheriff's son against their grandmother, Lucas intervened and was punched, bringing in Julian who used his mutant powers.[199]

name: Lucas
description: Lucas was a worker tasked with cleaning up the toxic protoplasm left over from the clash between the X-Men and D.K.. While arguing with his colleague Matty about the misuse of the term "mutie", what appeared to be one of Maggott's sentient myriapods emerged from the mass of protoplasm, which devoured him.[200]

name: Lucie
description: Lucie was Slasher's and Demitrius' driver.[201]

name: Lucrezia
description: Lucrezia was one of the circle of friends of the Incantesimo witchcraft shop, who for a time had to go away. On her return among the girls was also joined by Patty Prue, who initially thought that Lucrezia would take her predominant place and that she would be left out returning to her belief that she would be alone after the loss of her family, but that after an encounter with the Scarlet Witch made her change her mind and she returned to the group happily accepting Lucrezia.[103]

name: Lucy
description: Lucy was one of Hedy Wolfe's wealthy and elitist neighbors.[202]

name: Lucy
description: Lucy was a nurse at Forest Hills Hospital who helped Dr. Caputo assisting May Parker.[203]

name: Lucy
description: Lucy was the mother of Abigail, a mutant girl who lived on the island of Tristan da Cunha. When Abigail developed her seismic powers, the Krakoa mutants intervened thinking that the inhabitants would turn against the girl because of the damage she had done, but they had to change their mind as the inhabitants protected the girl and Warpath quietly handed Abigail to her mother.[204]

name: Luigi
description: Luigi was an Italian chef and an acquaintance of Matt Murdock.[205]

name: Luis
appearences: Fantastic Four: ¡Isla de la Muerte! Vol 1 1
description: Luis was among the festive crowd in San Juan that celebrated Ben Grimm as El Morrito and was recognized by Ben and greeted by him.[206]

name: Luis
description: Assures Mr. Alcantara that no one will be able to enter his mansion but that would have been better if they had moved away from the windows for further security.[207]

name: Luis
description: Luis was a kid from Cuba who was healed by Babalú.[208]

name: Luis
description: Luis was a boy who was bullied until Spider-Man passed by and he intervened, frightening the group of bullies.[74]

name: Luis
description: Luis was a neighbor of Sky in the Soho neighborhood.[209]

name: Luis
appearences: Ghost Rider: Kushala Infinity Comic Vol 1 2
description:
Luis was the lover of Olivia's mother.[210]
After Kushala rescued Heather Rae, Luis and Olivia's mother went to their house and Olivia introduced them to Kushala, showing them that she wasn't a fictional character.[211]

name: Luis
description:
Luis was the receptionist of Beyond HQ. When a visitor asked to meet Maxine Danger, he replied that he had no scheduled visits for Ms. Danger, so the visitor showed his tentacles revealing himself to be Dr. Octopus and replied to Luis with a cynical smile that it was a visit surprise.[121]
Soon after he was gassed and knocked out by Octopus.[212]

name: Luis
description: Luis was a clerk at a drugstore where Clayton Cortez shopped regularly in his civilian life.[213]

name: Luisa
description: Luisa and Ramon were on board a pickup truck in the town of Beebe, Arkansas when they were hit in full by a tornado but fortunately they were rescued by Red Hulk.[214]

name: Luísa
appearences: Captain America: Symbol of Truth Vol 1 1
description:
After a tip from Misty Knight, Sam Wilson and Joaquín Torres set out on the trail of what they thought was a load of Super-Soldier Serum to trade on the black market, but instead found a load of immigrants from Mexico including Joaquim's cousin Luisa.[215]
After being detained in the Commission on Superhuman Activities Facility, it was discovered that Luisa and the other immigrants had been tested on them in a laboratory by an unknown group. Seeing the attempt to eliminate the evidence, Joaquim made her cousin escape, bringing her to safety.[216]
Luisa, after being taken to safety in an old secret base of S.H.I.E.L.D. by Joaquin, she tells her cousin how she was picked up from her workplace and kidnapped.[217]
Joaquin found Luisa unconscious in the cell where the White Wolf mercenaries had locked her up.[218]
Luisa reveals to Joaquim that White Wolf had come for them looking for the piece of Vibranium that she was hiding in the shoe, so Joaquim took her to her grandmother and there she met one of the boys who was with her on the train.[219]

name: Luke
description: A member of the Smashers, Luke was put on look-out by Bullwhip Grogan.[220]

name: Luke
description: Luke was Belinda Tompkins' ex-boyfriend.[221]

name: Luke
description: Luke was a student of the University of Sheffield who in the game of Truth or Dare among friends revealed a secret desire of his which was to have sex with a mutant. When his roommate Zee activated mutant powers, Luke filmed him on his cell phone and put the images online. Due to that situation Zee committed suicide, and Luke was about to be killed by Zero to avenge him, but he was stopped in time by Wolverine.[222]

name: Lung-Sei
description: Lung-Sei was a peasant who first saw the Inhumans on a desolate shore somewhere on the coast of China.[223]

name: Lupei
appearences: Black Panther: The Man Without Fear Vol 1 516
description: Lupei was a henchman in the Vlad Dinu crime family. Vlad ordered Lupei to create chaos in Hell's Kitchen but Black Panther learned about it and forced Lupei to leave the city.[224]

name: Luther
description: Luther was the owner of Jayroam's private club.[225]

name: Lydia
appearences: Wolverine: The Amazing Immortal Man & Other Bloody Tales Vol 1 1
description: Lydia was a gypsy midwife who adopted Olga's child.[226]

name: Lynbrook
description: Lynbrook worked at the ground control of the Vertex shuttle mission.[227]

name: Lynne
description: Lynne was a fashion photographer who worked with Mary Jane Watson-Parker.[228]

name: Lynskey
description: Mr. Lynskey was an elderly neighbor of Kamala Khan, a former convict who had learned to love books in prison and when he came out of prison he started running a free library, working to get people in the neighborhood to read by donating books and accepting them from those who wanted donate them.[229]

name: M'Gorah
description: M'Gorah was Thutmekri's bodyguard. He was actually possessed by the Thutmekri's enemy Dalboor, who took command of his body to sacrifice Helgi to the golden ape idol. He was eventually killed by the golden fanged ape Zemba.[1]

name: M'Tumbu
description: M'Tumbu's wife helped Conan escape the Sky-Horde. As soon as he recognized the Cimmerian, he attacked him for the bounty placed on his head by Captain Mongo, but Conan quickly knocked him down.[2]

name: Mabel
description: Mabel and Zelda stumbled across the Fantastic Four while shopping in a New York department store.[3]

name: Mabel
description:
Mabel and Herman witnessed the Blob and Unus the Untouchable rob an armored car.[4]
Mabel and Herman later saw Spider-Man battle the Tarantula across the street in Manhattan.[5]

name: Mabel
description: Mabel was having a telephone conversation with a friend, who suddenly reported Daredevil swinging past her telephone booth after foiling a pair of extortionists.[6]

name: Mac
description: Mac was a journalist who was trying to convince a court guard to allow him to take pictures at the trial against Mr. Big of the Underworld by not getting permission as the judge did not allow any cameras in the courtroom.[7]

name: MacAllister
description: Mrs. MacAllister was Alice's mother, the girl who would become Malice. After an argument with her daughter trying to make her understand that her behavior would only lead to unhappiness, she tried to make peace with her daughter but entering her room she found only the lifeless body of Alice, not knowing that her mutation had transformed her into a being of pure psychic energy.[8]

name: Macik
description:
Mr. Macik is the father of Teon Macik, aka Primal. He and his wife tried to secure custody of their son, but it was Theon himself who convinced them that it was best for him to stay with the mutants.[9]
Later, Mr. Macik and his wife were rescued by Northstar from being attacked by the Friends of Humanity, as the parents of a mutant.[10]

name: Mack
description:
Minor Appearances: Wolfpack #3, Wolfpack #6
Mentioned: Wolfpack #2, Wolfpack #4, Wolfpack #7, Wolfpack #9, Wolfpack #10, Wolfpack #11, Wolfpack #12

name: Mack
description:
British officer stationed in Scotland, when asked by Inspector McCleod about the accident with Wolverine replied that they should have insisted with Zoe Culloden to find out why she was so interested in Wolverine.[12]
Investigating with Inspector McCloud on the ambulance accident carrying Cyber, Colonel Mack commented on the folly of the boat tripers on the lake who were unaware of the oncoming storm.[13]

name: Mack
description: Mack was a scientist who worked with Dr. Langkowski at the Project Michelangelo facility in Antarctica.[14]

name: MacMurphy
description: Policeman MacMurphy noticed that his gun (and the guns of the other police he was with) had just rusted away, due to Prodigal's mutant power.[15]

name: MacPherran
description: Titania's father, seeing his newborn daughter declared that she was a small and weak thing without much struggle in her,[16] and also wondered how many double shifts he would have to do to support her too.[17]

name: MacPherran
description: To her husband's negative comment about her newborn daughter's frailty, Titania's mother replied that her life would harden her...or so she believed.[16] Growing up, Mary's mother had to ignore her baby's requests because of her work.[17]

name: MacReedy
description: MacReedy was the sadistic and psychopathic sheriff of Pottsville who killed only for the sake of killing the passers-by, until he met Logan and he was killed.[18]

name: Mad Dog
description: Mad Dog was one of Daredevil's informants.[19]

name: Madeline
description: Madeline interviewed Father Peter Nova.[20]

name: Madeline
description: Madeline was the secretary of Warden Aimes at Crossmoor Prison who could not stop Dr. Whitby from breaking into the Warden office during a meeting with Director-General Swinton.[21]

name: Madison
description: Madison was a manager of Target Technologies who reported to the leaders of the firm that there had been further incidents due to the interference of costumed heroes, who after preventing the test of the wave cannon a fortune was breaking into the Rutherford plant where they were being developed weapons and probably had access to information relating to the location of their secret laboratory.[22]

name: Madison
description: Madison, daughter of Jimmy and Susie, was rescued from Razorfist by Captain America and Bucky.[23]

name: Maheeva
description: Maheeva was emprisoned within the stone walls of his roost by a Yueshi sorcerer's dark malediction. As the magic of the Jewelled Sword of Tem could free him, he told Conan and Veden Kamal the way to reach the artifact, hoping they would get it back to him.[24]

name: Mahud
description: Mahud was Conan's jailer, who was thrown by the Cimmerian into the pit and killed by a giant spider.[25]

name: Maldiz
description:
Maldiz was a blacksmith who met Conan the night before he had slain the winged god of the city's secretive night cult. He helped him melt down his suspicious-looking gold coins into a new shape.[26]
While he was at his forge, he was then attacked by a vengeful pair of night cultists, whom he managed to kill, but his right hand was critically injured and he was forced to abandon his trade. He later purchased the tavern where Conan stopped by many years later, looking for job opportunities for his Free Companions mercenary army.[27]

name: Mallory
description: Dr. Mallory was a psychiatrist who worked in a prison and treated Melvin Potter who accused amnesia by saying that he was not the Gladiator and that he was framed. He then summoned Foggy Nelson and Matt Murdock for the acknowledgment that they confirmed that he was Potter.[28]

name: Malone
description: Malone was hunted by Wolverine for torturing and abusing a Canadian nun in Iraq.[29]

name: Malone
description: Ms. Malone was rescued by the Ghost Rider when she was attacked by the Night Terror in the intelligence station where he escaped from.[30]

name: Mandy
description: Mandy was Darlene's younger sister.[31]

name: Manito
description: Manito was a Cartels henchman to whom Calavera ordered that if Sheriff Cole had still spoken he would have to shoot him in the head.[32]

name: Mann
description: Adam Mann's single mother, when his son was young, filled his head with the stories of the mythological characters and their adventures.[33]

name: Manning
description: The son of the tycoon April Manning was killed by policemen after being stopped driving his father's luxury car which made the policemen suspicious as this car was in the hands of a black boy.[34]

name: Manny
description: Manny was the agent of Joey Goniff, a showman, who was fired by his client after he got bored of the various cheap shows Manny had given him in Cleveland.[35]

name: Manny
description: Manny used to watch Aunt May playing chess with Henry at the Restwell Nursing Home.[36]

name: Manny
description: A researcher at Steyr Security Systems, Manny removed Spider-Man's webbing with his portable laser torch.[37]

name: Manny
description: Manny was caught by Daredevil for killing Doris.[38]

name: Manny
description: The stroller with Manny in it got stuck between the automatic doors of the subway and at the end of the platform he was catapulted into the void and only the intervention of Daredevil who catch him on the fly made sure he was saved and was delivered safely to his parents.[39]

name: Manny
description: Manny was a drug dealer working under Mr. White. Like his boss, he was confronted and defeated by Nocturne and Puma.[40]

name: Manny
description: Manny was Happy Jack Karne's bodyguard and when the Ghost Rider assaulted his boss he bravely came between them shouting that he wasn't afraid of him but the Ghost Rider easily overwhelmed him and killed him.[41]

name: Manny
description: Manny was a petty thief and a homeless man who found a faint Rick Jones on the pavement, who had a bracelet on him, not knowing that it was actually a Nega-Band. Manny took it from Rick and sold it to a pawnshop who offered him a lot of money, but immediately after that bargaining Manny had a crisis of conscience for having stolen something from someone he thought was a poor homeless person and also thought about the reaction his partner Deb would have, then he returned to the pawn shop and had the bracelet returned, giving back the money. He later discovered that the old homeless man had helped Deb give birth and that he had saved their child and then Manny gave him back the bracelet.[42]

name: Manny
description: Manny was a henchman of Marion who was killed in a gunfight in the prison where Logan was being held.[43]

name: Manny
description: Manny was a student at Griffith Park High School who got acquainted with his classmate Gert Yorkes during a school shooting drill. He later ran into her while making his way through the bleachers during a school football game.[44] He later partnered with Gert for a group project.[45]

name: Manoel
description: When Shark Girl went to Brazil to buy some typical dishes of her country, Manoel, after the fright he had at seeing Iara come out of the water with his shark aspect, calmed down and having learned of Iara's intentions he took her to his father who owned a kiosk where he sold traditional Brazilian food.[46]

name: Manuel
description: Manuel was one of the policemen who met the Avengers, when they were looking for Goliath and Dr. Anton.[47]

name: Manuel
description: Manuel was a policeman controlled by Kukulcàn.[48]

name: Manuel
description: Manuel, a member of the Young Watchers vigilante group of Harlem, was a friend of Jim Wilson.[49]

name: Manuel
description: Manuel was grabbed by the Scarlet Spider and stranded on the railing of the observation deck of the Empire State Building.[50]

name: Mara
description: Mara witnessed the Scarlet Spider grab Manuel and strand him on the railing of the observation deck of the Empire State Building.[50]

name: Mara
description: Mara is an employee of the municipality of New York who explains through the Forceworks1 project the functioning of the "Made in NY" program.[51]

name: Marcel
description: Marcel was an antiquity seller from Paris.[52]

name: Marcellino
description: Marcellino was a member of the armored United Nations Peacekeeping Forces stationed in the nation of Nrosvekistan. He was killed in the clash with Jack O'Lantern.[53]

name: Marcia
description: Marcia lived in a building attacked by Crown and Hydra.[54]

name: Marcia
description: Marcia was an adviser to the mayor of New York City. During a crisis, she insisted on refusing to ask for help from the Fantastic Four to the point where the mayor refused to listen to her advice and fired her.[55]

name: Marco
description: Marco was one of the volunteers who were put together in the Carol Cadets by Becky St. Jude to put Ulysses' knowledge to good use.[56]

name: Marco
description: Marco was the owner of a comic shop in Washington D.C. where Phil Coulson used to go to buy his favorite comics.[57]

name: Marco
description: Marco was a member of the heavy metal band Brain Flayer who was killed in the Carnage massacre of the Magpie Club which killed all the band members except Blake Bellman.[58]

name: Marcus
description:
Marcus was a prisoner in the same prison where Daredevil had been incarcerated. He disagreed with Daredevil's right to keep his mask on and believed that this privilege was indicative that he would not be in prison for the time he was sentenced.[59]
During the onslaught of Knull's symbiotes, Marcus helped Daredevil get rid of his symbiote by giving him a jolt in the electric chair.[60]
Daredevil thanked Marcus for helping him, and the two had lunch together, but Daredevil realized he had been poisoned.[61] After telling Marcus, Daredevil left calmly trying to get outdoors.[62]

name: Marcy
description:
Marcy is one of the members of The Offer's squad. She works as The Offer's computers expert and monitors the activities of the field team.[63]
Marcy is ordered by the Offer to contact Wolverine and two of his other agents and warn them that they must leave for Madripoor immediately.[64]

name: Margaret
description: Margaret from the control room of the Target Technologies plant attempted to erase the programming tying Target Technologies to the attempted wave cannon test at Fortune and the kidnapping of Speedball. Spider-Man and the New Warriors storm the control room stopping Margaret's attempt to erase the data, however when Night Thrasher was downloading the data, the system went into a fail-safe dump thus deleting the residual data.[22]

name: Margaret
description: Margaret was one of the reporters who interviewed Senator Tony Bianco after his son was released from captivity.[65]

name: Marge
description: Marge witnessed Captain America avoid the New York City traffic in his own unique way.[66]

name: Marge
description: Marge was George's wife, who was choking on badly swallowing food in a restaurant, and she thought she was having a heart attack. After the intervention of Jake Olson and Christine Collins who rescued George, Marge was still worried and asked if there would be permanent damage.[67]

name: Margie
description: Margie introduced Heather McNeil to Dr. Hudson.[68]

name: Margie
description: Margie was a Channel 9 News announcer who witnessed Peter Parker declaring his mistake of registering his identity, giving his allegiance to the non-registered, and giving a description of the Negative Zone Prison, where the caught superhumans were imprisoned for life during the Civil War.[69]

name: Margo
description: Margo was a student at the Snow Valley School for Girls and was friends with Matilda Brant who asked her what she would wear for dance.[70]

name: Maria
