description: Maria was a political refugee whose boat was rescued by Tony Stark.[71]

name: Maria
description: Maria was one of Agent Nicholas' assistants.[72]

name: Maria
description: Maria was a shop assistant in a Hell's Kitchen bakery, where she served Mike Murdock, pretending to be his twin brother Matt, and to whom he complimented her for her beauty, but taking the place of her brother who was blind, she answered him that he couldn't know she was beautiful but he replied that a man always knows.[62]

name: Maribeth
appearences: United States of Captain America Vol 1 4
description: Maribeth was the best friend and roommate at Arielle's University. Maribeth was mistreated by Elliott, a student considered untouchable, who also stole his cell phone, so Arielle was able to enter Elliott's room recovering Maribeth's cell phone with evidence of threats on it.[73]

name: Marilyn
description: A beautiful blond college student, Marilyn and her beau were planning to attend a dance occurring soon, unaware their relationship was being viewed with envy by Johnny, a crippled student who was too self-conscious of his disability to pursue a social life himself.[74]

name: Marilyn
description: Marilyn was one of Freddy Moyer's models.[75]

name: Marim
description: Marim was a mercenary who worked for Maverick. He was a former member of the Israeli special forces of Shayetet 13. With other members of Maverick's Mercs, he extracted Maverick and Wolverine from Madripoor following the clash between the Merchant's forces and the C.I.A.[76]

name: Marin
description:
Member of the Continuiteens, who took care of intervening if the continuity of the Marvel Universe was affected by unrecorded events.[77]
He became a member of F.A.C.T., the government agency charged with assembling the new Thunderbolts teams.[78][79][80][81]

name: Mario
description: Mario was a circus acrobat, who couldn't stretch far enough to catch a falling mate; the seemingly doomed trapezist was however unwittingly saved by Pietro Maximoff.[82]

name: Mario
appearences: Wolverine, Nick Fury: The Scorpio Connection a Marvel Graphic Novel Vol 1 1
description: Mario was a barman and an acquaintance of Colonel Fury.[83]

name: Marissa
description:
Marissa was Dr. Curt Connors' assistant.[84] Connors grew jealous over Marissa when she flirted with Brian King.[85]
After the massacre at Phelcorp Industries, Marissa was adopted as a human pet by the Lizard.[86]

name: Mark
description: Mark was a henchman of Gore who, together with his companions, was forced by the Thunderer to take him to his boss's den. Once there, Mark and the other two henchmen were killed in the fire that followed a short circuit caused by their leader.[87]

name: Mark
description: Mark wanted to give up his gruesome trade as mugger and killer but he loved his wife and wanted to continue to give her expensive presents. He pulled one last job and resolved to tell her he's broke when he goes through a dark alley and feels a knife shoved deep into his back. It turns out his wife is in the same business for the same reason.[88]

name: Mark
description: Mark and his girlfriend Sharon were in Roxie Gilbert's health food store in Detroit when Rokk, a creature created by Dr. Spectrum, broke into the shop. Annoyed by Mark's reaction during the assault, Sharon decided to break up with him.[89]

name: Mark
description: Mark was sailing on his father's sailboat with his friend Jimmy on Long Island Sound when they were assaulted by Blizzard who used them to distract Iron Man.[90]

name: Mark
description: Mark was an airline pilot who was on board the Boeing 747 carrying Professor Xavier and the X-Men at the International Conference on Man-Made Mutation.[91]

name: Mark
description: Mark was a thug who worked for the Stinger. Under Stinger's orders and armed with Stinger's electric weapon, Mark assaulted a group of homeless people to flush out Stinger's old enemy the Angel. Mark and the other Stinger's other henchmen were defeated by the Angel with the help of Cloak and Dagger.[92]

name: Mark
description: Mark was playing with the racquet with a friend on Lafayette Avenue when an oncoming car with its driver distracted by the cellular just as Mark's was in the middle of the road and was about to be invested by it but thanks to the intervention of Daredevil the tragedy was avoided.[39]

name: Mark
description: Mark was a director on the soap opera Secret Hospital. He had to cut Mary Jane's scene, even if it was her only on-screen appearance.[93]

name: Mark
description: Mark was one of the doctors who assisted Peter Parker when he collapsed without any warning.[94]

name: Mark
description: Mark was a kid and a great fan of superheroes. He was accompanied by his father to watch the arrival of the superhero guests to the wedding of Reed Richards and Susan Storm, but during the Grey Gargoyle's attack he was lost in the crowd, and was rescued by Spider-Man.[95]

name: Mark
description: Mark and Glenn witnessed a group of ninjas rob the grave of Doctor Octopus in broad daylight at Cypress Hills Cemetery.[96]

name: Mark
description: Mark was the first of the board members of the Worldwide Investment Corporation to be killed by the vigilante Mr. Payback when he broke into the boardroom.[97]

name: Mark
description: Mark was a child who idolized Captain America and during play always chose the part of his favorite hero. At the news of the death of Captain America, he was upset to the point of not intervening to defend his classmate who was bullied for being an immigrant.[98]

name: Mark
description: Mark was filming on a tropical island just when Compound D arrived ashore, wrapping up the entire film crew and making them all his thralls.[99]

name: Mark
description: Mark was a patient in a children's hospital built by Wilson Fisk and was very fond of Fisk. He played with Fisk every time he visited.[100]

name: Mark
description: Mark was one of the Skrull/Cow hybrids who became a comic book artist and tried to convey the message with his comics that there was nothing to be afraid of their race.[101]

name: Mark
description: Mark was a telekinetic mutant who was able to move only small objects, but was still chased by Sir James Jasper's team of Beetles to intern him, but Captain Britain came to his rescue.[102]

name: Marker
description:
Marker was a member of the Hammer Battle Group, a group of men in armor under the command of Sasha Hammer. The Group traveled to Paris during the Fear Itself crisis to retrieve the Detroit Steel Armor and the body of Lt. Johnson and there they collided with the Grey Gargoyle possessed by Mokk.[103]
While recovering the Armor, they encountered Rescue in Paris and were about to attack her when Grey Gargoyle possessed by Mokk appeared, transforming one of the members of the Hammer Battle Group into a statue. During the battle, the three remaining members, given the difficulty in dealing with Mokk, withdrew, being accused by Sasha of being cowards.[104]
During the fight against Mokk, Sasha Hammer ordered Marker and the other member survivor of the Hammer Corps to retreat, leaving Rescue at Mokk's mercy even though one of the two members of the Hammer Corps told Sasha they should not leave her, but Sasha didn't care.[105]

name: Markie
description: Markie was a heroin junkie who died from an uncut dose.[106]

name: Marla
description:
Marla was the owner of the technical material for the Only Cake kitchen webshow that was destroyed during the transformation of the star of the show Oliver Constantin into a monstrous being due to a mutogen compound poured on the cake he prepared by the show's cameraman.[107]
While trying to recover some of the material from the recording studio, Marla came into contact with a small part of the offending cake and her hand was also infected and underwent a mutation.[108]

name: Marlon
description: Marlon was one of the best Taskmaster students and was hired with others for a sparring partner session dressed as Captain America. The opponent turned out to be the Red Skull who killed Lenny and the other sparring partners in an extremely simple way.[109]

name: Marlowe
description: Marlowe was a private eye hired by Col. Barney Roberts, Sen. Nathan Carter, and Mr. Josiah Grey to find their children.[110]

name: Marlowe
description: Minor Appearance: Sub-Mariner: The Depths #2, Sub-Mariner: The Depths #3, Sub-Mariner: The Depths #5

name: Marnie
description: Marnie was a bully who with her two friends bullied the boys who left school and passed through their territory.[114]

name: Marta
description: Marta was a tough looking woman who was heading a rival thieves' gang. Believing Conan and Fafnir had stolen the jewel of Thazarra, Marta ordered her men to assault the Cimmerian, but, after she learned that the gem had not yet been stolen, she and her gang set out to get it for themselves. In the Temple of the Dragon, their gang crossed swords with the two barbarians and Marta was eventually possessed by the spirit of Thazarra. Running to escape from the chamber, she darted through a doorway and triggered a bladed trap, which fell from the archway and beheaded her.[115]

name: Marta
description: Marta was a Spanish woman who met and started a relationship with Wilson Fisk when he tried to start a new life in Spain. Fisk fell in love with Marta, as she made him smile at silly things, and because of the way she enjoyed life. Marta eventually allowed Wilson to meet her children, Adriana and Jaime, and even refused to learn about Wilson's past, as she preferred to simply meet the man that was trying to change. However, after some months of a happy relationship, Marta and her children were slaughtered by the Hand and Lady Bullseye.[116]

name: Marta
description: Luis was a neighbor of Sky in the Soho neighborhood.[117]

name: Marta
appearences: America Chavez: Made in the USA Vol 1 2
description: Marta was America's adoptive aunt. Upon her return to the Washington Heights neighborhood she was very happy to meet and hug her niece again.[118]

name: Martens
description: Martens was a Project Echelon superhuman with the power to block Red She-Hulk's transformation for about twenty minutes, who confronted her in Annapolis.[119]

name: Martha
description: Martha and her husband John gave up their business to retire to Florida. There they helped an alien to return to his ship and to thank them for their kindness, the alien bathed them (without their knowledge) with the waters of the swamp, which were the fountain of youth. John and Martha lost some memory and they both found themselves rejuvenated, not remembering that they had been elderly and that they had met the alien.[120]

name: Martha
description: Despite the Daily Bugle's alarming claims, Martha was thankful to Spider-Man for saving her payroll and life, after he defeated the criminals who attempted to rob her office.[121]

name: Martha
description: Martha fainted as she witnessed the Vision disappearing into the sidewalk, as the android was stalking the streets looking for the Black Panther.[122] Some time later, the wall of Martha's home was damaged in a battle between Spider-Man and Captain Britain, forcing her husband to call the police.[123]

name: Martha
description: Martha and her husband Henry saw Daredevil swinging through the air overhead, and grumbled that super-heroes were just showoffs that never did any good for them.[124]

name: Martha
description: WXNK reporter Martha covered the news about an impenetrable cosmic energy bubble which encased a three-block stretch just southeast of a Venturi dockside apartments.[125]

name: Martha
description: Martha was a former lover and colleague of Doctor Strange.[126]

name: Martin
description: Martin was the second officer on board the Super Yacht commanded by Luther Robinson and used to flush out the Sub-Mariner and the Atlanteans.[127]

name: Martin
description: During the Mardi Gras parade on Coney Island, a terrorist threw a flaming bomb at a car in the parade, killing all the passengers except Mr. Martin., who managed to tell the Human Torch that there were smugglers in the tower just before losing consciousness.[128]

name: Martin
description: Mr. Martin was the father of Maisie Martin, an aspiring actress. With his whole family, he went to see his daughter's recitation which turned out to be a comedy success despite sabotage by Maisie's rival.[129]

name: Martin
description: Mrs. Martin was the mother of Maisie Martin, an aspiring actress. With her whole family, she went to see her daughter's recitation which turned out to be a comedy success despite sabotage by Maisie's rival.[129]

name: Martin
description: Dr. Martin ventured in the Endless Caverns to explore them and prove that they are not endless, but he disappeard for months. When he was about to be declared missing, he reappeared at the mouth of the cave totally exhausted, warning everyone to use explosives to close the mouth of the cave because of the being that is inside. Then he collapsed and died.[130]

name: Martin
description: Co-owner of the Martin and Vanna Circus, Martin was assassinated by Darko the Clown after he fired him and accused him of not being able to laugh any more.[131]

name: Martin
appearences: Deadly Hands of Kung Fu Vol 1 26
description: Martin was an actor who participated in Rikki Trane's film shot in Canada where Bob Diamond had an accident and everyone thought he was dead in the snow.[132]

name: Martin
description: Martin was the leader of the street gang eliminated by Anne for interfering with her hunt for Kitty Pryde. Martin managed to wound her with a thrown switchblade when his cohort Julio distracted her, but Anne then opened fire, killing Martin. Julio and the others soon joined them as they tried to gang-up on the wounded but well-armed Purifier.[133]

name: Martin
description: Martin was Frank Castle's weapons supplier and was killed in a shootout while giving information to Frank about a religious cult that was looking for many weapons.[134]

name: Martin
description: Martin was a stooge of Doctor Octopus who acted as his chauffeur and helicopter pilot.[135]

name: Martin
description: Member of the United States Congress and of the Super-Hero Registration Act Subcommittee which was to decide whether to implement the registration of humans with superpowers.[136]

name: Martin
description: Martin was a henchman of Mr. Servido charged with kidnapping Suzie and Ollie Henry but was intercepted by Terror, who sprinkled him with gasoline and set him on fire.[137]

name: Martin
description: Martin was one of the patrons who went to the bookstore to get the photobook "Marvels" signed by its author Phil Sheldon.[138]

name: Martin
description: Martin joined the cult of the Seventh House initially to meet the female cultists, but then stayed as found he could make easy money in the cult. At the service of the Cult, Martin began to follow and spy on Gambit and Anielle, following them to France where he was devoured by demonic insects.[139]

name: Martin
description: Martin was a boy whom Steve Rogers taught to respect the flag of their homeland.[140]

name: Martin
description: Martin was Mary Jane Watson's assistant for a MacBeth rehearsal.[141]

name: Martin
description: Martin was one of the members of the school A.V. Club at Midtown High School.[142]

name: Martin
description: Martin was a television pundit talking about the return of Steve Rogers and consequently the presence of two Captain Americas.[143]

name: Martina
description: Martina was a Slokovian worshiper of Thor.[144]

name: Marty
description:
Marty was driving an armored car which was attacked by Shocker; once Spider-Man defeated the villain and left the dough grabbed from the truck, he truly recognized Spider-Man's bravery.[145]
Many years later, Marty recalled how he used to drive a garbage truck across Manhattan.[146]
A few years later, Marty and Herb barely escaped with their lives when their armored car was attacked by Electro.[96]

name: Marty
description: Marty was one of Santonio's security guards.[147]

name: Marty
description: Marty was a golf player who witnessed the Wind Eagle flying over the Water Crest Country Club.[148]

name: Marty
description: Marty and his partner Ted were two truck drivers who came across Will O' the Wisp on a desolate stretch of the New Jersey coast highway.[149]

name: Marty
description: Marty was one of the kids who attended "Mr. Mike's One-Ring Traveling Tent Show" in Sullivan County, unaware that its star attractions were the X-Men under Mesmero's hypnosis.[150]

name: Marty
description: Marty was part of Samuel T. Underwood's staff; he didn't think they could convince Captain America to run for President.[151]

name: Marty
description: Marty met Spider-Man and Wolverine during a bank robbery.[152]

name: Marty
description:
Marty was Megan McLaren's cameraman.[153]
Marty filmed Thor assaulting news reporters after the battle against the Exemplars by the East River.[154]

name: Marv
description: Marv was one of the policemen called by Henry after his wheat field was razed by the Locust's giant insects.[155]

name: Marv
description:
Marv and his partner Larry pretended to be two repairmen to retrieve a hammer that would save Cimarron's people.[156]
The hammer, which Deadpool appropriated and gave it to the Walrus, believing it to be a fake, was used by Larry and his partner to defeat the werewolves in Cimarron.[157]
Finally, they tell Deadpool that the hammer is in fact a magical object that was used to oppose a group of werewolves who were planning to storm the town of Cimarron.[158]

name: Marvin
description: Marvin was a rail worker who witnessed Hercules lifting a fallen sequoia from the tracks and hurling it into the surrounding hills.[159]

name: Marvin
description: Marvin was a boxer who confronted Joe Smith and Spider-Man at the gym.[160]

name: Marvin
description: Marvin was a late night TV show host who briefly interviewed Spider-Man on the Midnight Show, before they were abruptly interrupted by Electro's attack.[161]

name: Marvin
description: While driving on the Long Island Expressway, Marvin witnessed Iron Man lift a two-ton car.[162]

name: Marvin
description: Marvin was an obese child who visited the Wackyworld theme park with his mother.[163]

name: Marvin
description: Marvin was on the subway train with Peter Parker when he was having a severe sinus headache.[164]

name: Marvin
description: Marvin was a drug dealer who was forcibly recruited by the Black Panther as one of his intelligence operatives.[165]

name: Marvin
description: As requested by Matthew Murdock, Marvin installed a voice simulator to help Amos Flood in Redemption Valley.[166]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a bank employee who during a bank robbery was taken hostage by the robbers and immediately rescued by the Angel.[167]

name: Mary
description: When actress Janet Wayne committed suicide, her fellow actresses Mary claimed that somebody had driven Wayne to suicide. This prompted Dr. Gade to invisibly follow Mary to see if there was any merit to her claims. Sure enough a group of thugs came to warn her to keep quiet. When she refused, they knocked her out to take her to their leader, a man known as Fatty. After various vicissitudes, Dr. Gade defeated Fatty and his gang and rescued Mary.[168]

name: Mary
description: Mary was snooping through Boss Dram's office searching for the material that Dram was using to blackmail her father with the truth behind a mistake he made while he was a young doctor. She was caught in the act by one of Dram's men, but she was rescued by the arrival of a new costumed hero, the Challenger.[169]

name: Mary
description: Returning home after investigating a bank robbery, Inspector Crane found his maid Mary tied up and his papers shuffled through. He called Terry Vance to come at once, but when Terry arrived Crane was dead and Mary explained that he dropped dead after answering another phone call.[170]

name: Mary
description: Mary's father was killed by a gang of criminals and to cover up the homicide they set a palace on fire. To prevent Mary from reporting the criminals to the D.A., they tried to eliminate her but she was saved thanks to the intervention of Father Time.[171]

name: Mary
description: Having been named sole heir by a wealthy aunt, Mary's undisclosed relatives decided to eliminate her by hiring a hit man who hides his victims' corpses inside bronze statues.[172]

name: Mary
description: A thief, Charles Marrow, tricks Mary the maid of Dragmoor Castle into helping to steal its priceless art collection. During the robbery he's spotted by Dragmoor's owner Robert Munfrey and kills him. Upon being chased by servants he's saved by Mary and hides inside a room. In the morning Charles finds the door is locked. Mary appears and reveals that everyone in the castle are ghosts including her and he's now staying there with her forever.[173]

name: Mary
description: Mary was the girlfriend of Clint Holden, but the Marshall Jesse Crawl fell in love with her, and so he sent his brother gunman Hal Crawl to eliminate Clint. Clint killed Hal in self-defense, but was framed for Hal's murder and had to flee.[174]

name: Mary
description: Mary was the girlfriend of Ben Trumbull, a former outlaw who, after meeting Mary, redeemed himself and thanks to Matt Slade solved his past problems with the gang he was part of, allowing the couple to live happily.[175]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a child who was frightened by what looked like an alien invasion.[176]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a tenant of the Minos Towers on which he experimented behavioral experiments the scientist Cornelius Webb and was rescued, along with all the other tenants, by Captain Marvel.[177]

name: Mary
description: Mary and three other prisoners escaped from the Bastille, but all four died after their flight. Mary was killed by her aunt where they sought refuge in order to sell their bodies.[178]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a secretary at the Daily Bugle who transferred to Woman magazine.[179]

name: Mary
description: Mary and her friends were making rafting right on the river where were fighting Godzilla and Yetrigar and were thrown out of the boat but they managed to save themselves with many difficulties thanks to the intervention of the Godzilla Squad of S.H.I.E.L.D.[56]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a nurse at the Central City Sanitarium who warned Dr. Spaulding that the patient in the Zero Room had woken up.[180]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a waitress working at the Hellfire Club, serving hors d'oeuvres during a reception. As she was about to deliver a tray of drinks, she was reminded by Lou the butler to give special attention to the host and presidential candidate Robert Kelly.[181]

name: Mary
description: Mary was one of the people in the crowd protesting outside the hospital where a boy who was injured by a policeman in a tragic accident was hospitalized.[182]

name: Mary
description: Mary and her husband Daniel were walking in Central Park when they met Hulk and they approached him with the intention of helping him as he was wounded but he got him back badly by pushing Daniel and knocking him down.[183]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a student at Columbia University and when she met Professor Xavier, she told him that she had enjoyed her seminar very much, to which he replied wittily that in any case her grades would remain the same.[184]

name: Mary
description: Mary was the former girlfriend of Agent Crock. After undergoing experiments from Project: Reptile, Chrock had visions where he saw Mary rejecting him and not saving him from falling off a precipice.[185]

name: Mary
description: Mary was shot and killed by James Woo for sheltering Nick Fury in the sewers beneath Grand Central Station.[186]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a scientist who worked at the Vault and was present during the mass escape attempt by The Wizard in collaboration with Loki during the Acts of Vengeance event.[187]

name: Mary
description: Mary was Congressman Andrew Bolt's secretary. She congratulated him on his brilliant speech during the Congressional campaign.[188]

name: Mary
description: Mary was an inhabitant of the quarry run by Smitty in British Columbia, and after crossing paths with the young Logan, she told her friend that he had donated a side of deer to Jake Walker's widow.[189]

name: Mary
description: Sister Mary was a Catholic nun who worked as a nurse at St. Mary's Hospital and after seeing the miraculous treatments carried out by the Asgardians towards the patients of the hospital she had doubts about her faith approaching the cult of the Asgardians.[190]

name: Mary
description: Mary and other homeless people reclaimed T-shirts with the image of the Human Torch that had been thrown into a dumpster, even though Mary's T-shirt had Spider-Man's picture instead.[191]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a follower of Razorfist and took her place as his favorite after Lulu was hurt.[192]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a waitress at Java Junction who accepted a date with a customer not knowing that he was actually Bullseye and she had involuntarily become one of his pawns.[193][194]

name: Mary
description: Mary and her father were at a celebration parade in Bentonville, Kansas, when there was an attack by a Atlantean sleeper cell and they both were killed.[195]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a colleague of Dr. Benjamin Rabin who intended to summon a Mayan god and then sacrifice his colleagues to the god. Initially Rabin told Spider-Man that he and his colleagues were hunted down by a group of Mayan extremists and that Mary and the others were still outside in the blizzard.[196]But when Spider-Man found Mary, she told him that Rabin was the real culprit and also Spider-Man discovered that she was intended to become the sacrifice to the Mayan god but he rescued her.[197]

name: Mary
description: A member of the Purifiers, Sister Mary was charged with finding the body of Cameron Hodge in the mountains of Tibet.[198]

name: Mary
description: After the assassination of Captain America, Mary interviewed Joseph Paglino, owner of the largest and most valuable Captain America memorabilia collection.[199]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a homeless person whose memory was erased by A.I.M. after she had worked for them in the administrative field in a plot to exploit the homeless.[200]

name: Mary
description: Mary was the biological mother of Leopold Zola. She did not want to have children with Arnim Zola and after discovering his laboratory, she tried to escape but Zola captured her and experimented on her artificially inseminating her and generating the children he wanted.[201]

name: Mary
description: Mary was a traumatized woman who attended the meetings of the St. Mary's Trauma Peer Support Group in which Jennifer Walters also participated.[107]

name: Mary Alice
description: When Daredevil found the body of a recently murdered Gael victim, he heard the sound of heartbeats behind a door, but when he kicked the door, into the room he found only Mary Alice who had accepted the marriage proposal by her boyfriend.[202]

name: Mary Beth
description: Mary Beth was caught underwater by a giant squid commanded by Attuma.[203]

name: Mary Beth
description: The Orb showed up at Ted and Mary Beth's home while they slept and after ranting about his ability to see beyond things, told the couple that he would watch as the two of them killed each other.[204]

name: Mary Catherine
description: After the device that was used to bring back to humanity Ben Grimm malfunctioned, Sister Mary Catherine, a nun and teacher, was among the people who casually acquired momentarily the powers of the Fantastic Four, in this case she turned into the Thing.[205]

name: Mary Elizabeth
description: Mary Elizabeth was the student honor at Norcross University who was given the honor of ringing the bell that was found inside the sea chest that had belonged to the founder of the University, not knowing that ringing the bell would invoke the extradimensional demon Ikonn.[206]

name: Mary Ellen
description: Mary Ellen was the resident adviser at Hayden College who discovered the presence of a boy in Cathy Webster's room and threatened her that she could get her suspended for violating college rules.[207]

name: Mary Lou
description: Mary Lou was in the car with her boyfriend when Iron Cross arrived and overthrew their car with them inside.[208]

name: Mary Lou
description: During an appointment with Johnny Ross their car broke down on the edge of a forest and there they were attacked and killed by two Dire Wraiths who then assumed their identities.[209]

name: Mary Lou
description: Mary Lou was a resident of the village of Pottersville and while walking with her husband through the streets of the village commented on what could have happened in the nearby Project P.E.G.A.S.U.S.[210]

name: Masao
description: Masao, a longtime acquaintance of Logan's, hosted Kenichi Nakadai's sons in his home after his murder, but was unable to restrain Kanaye and reported it to Logan.[211]

name: Mason
description: The father of Mary Mason, the girl of sixteen who was made pregnant by the Architect to procreate the being that was supposed to receive his lifeforce.[212]

name: Matari
appearences: Iron Man & the Armor Wars Vol 1 2
description: Agent Matari reveals that Jim Rhodes quit the Fantasma assault scene soon after but not sure if he did it in the company of Tony Stark. After analyzing the matter, the Director Stone orders Matari to contact all the airports in the area and to get a list of all the departures since Rhodes had disappeared.[213]

name: Mateo
description:
Mateo was a duty guard at New York County Family Court and announced the "Wizard v. Dragon Man" case to Justice Payne.[214]
At Justice Payne's request, Mateo announced the entrance to the Bentley-23 bar to testify.[215]

name: Mathews
description: Mathews was a Weapon X project official, who worked at a secret Canadian military complex.[216]

name: Matilda
description: Matilda and her husband Hiram spotted the Sub-Mariner while touring New York City.[217]

name: Matilda
description: Matilda and Samuel witnessed Scott Summers becoming sick on a speeding super-liner in the North Atlantic.[218]

name: Matilda
description: Matilda was an old woman who fainted when she saw Goliath scaling the building wall to reach Jan's apartment.[219]

name: Matsunaga
description: Matsunaga was a member of Captain Hama's crew.[220]

name: Matsuo
description: Matsuo was one of of Ogun's henchmen, who was defeated by Kitty Pryde.[221]

name: Matsuzaki
description: Dr. Matsuzaki is employed at Mercy General Hospital. When the hospital fell under attack by Claw Sect vampires, she was rescued by Deadpool.[222]

name: Matt
description: He was the first local police officer to intervene during the hostage crisis due to a bank robbery.[223]

name: Matt
description: Matt was one of Juston and Alex's closest friends. He also attended Antigo Senior High with them. The longtime sufferer of bullying, Matt often express a lot of repressed rage and thoughts violent of violent retribution.[224][225][226][227][228]

name: Matt
description: Matt was one of Ben Grimm's co-workers.[229]

name: Matthew
description:
Matthew was a scientist at the Institute of Seismoharmonic Research who witnessed the Swarm attack the research facility.[230]
Matthew was taken hostage by Swarm until he was defeated by Spider-Man (Ben Reilly).[231]

name: Matty
description: Matty was a worker tasked with cleaning up the toxic protoplasm left over from the clash between the X-Men and D.K.. While arguing with his colleague Lucas about the misuse of the term "mutie", what appeared to be one of Maggott's sentient myriapods emerged from the mass of protoplasm, which devoured Lucas in front of Matty's helpless gaze.[232]

name: Matuscek
description: Matuscek was Moses Magnum's assistant.[233]

name: Maureen
description: Maureen was a mutant waitress at a cafe in New York patronized by Magneto and Cassandra Michaels. She had the ability to make objects levitate. It is unknown if this was through telekinesis or some other ability.[234]

name: Mavis
description: Mavis was a roller derby player who with her team, the Broadway Golddigger, met the opponents of the Midtown Maulers, the team where Carlie Cooper played who in a negative period unloaded her frustrations by hitting Mavis violently during the race and got caught an expulsion.[234]

name: Max
description: Max was one of the mobsters who kidnapped Dr. Don Blake and Jane Foster to have them treat Thug Thatcher.[235]

name: Max
description: Max filmed the arrival of Tony Stark at the exclusive alpine lodge where a scientific congress was being held.[236]

name: Max
description: Max was a little kid living in Devlin Shelter who was approached by the evil ninja Tekagi.[20]

name: Max
description: Max was a Channel 9 News announcer who witnessed Peter Parker declaring his mistake of registering his identity, giving his allegiance to the non-registered, and giving a description of the Negative Zone Prison, where the caught superhumans were imprisoned for life during the Civil War.[69]

name: Max
appearences: Wolverine: The Amazing Immortal Man & Other Bloody Tales Vol 1 1
description: Max was Logan's boss when he was working as a circus freak in Greenland.[237]

name: Max
description:
Max was a man who served in Tyger Tiger's organization and was happy with how she had handled the crime situation in Madripoor.[238]
Max used a ploy designed by Tyger Tiger to steal a corrupt banker's briefcase and replace it with a bomb. He immediately betrayed Tyger Tiger after Daken threatened repercussions on his family.[239]
Max was later killed by Daken so that Tyger could not manage his men.[240]

name: Max
description: Max was a companion of Charles Xavier from the past. He accompanied him on some Safari in Kenya.[241]

name: Max
appearences: Conan: Battle for the Serpent Crown Vol 1 1
description:
Max was a friend of Nyla Skin who was killed by Imus Champion because he dared to rob him.[242]
Later it was revealed that Max had robbed from Imus Champion a mystical ring that Conan wore and was momentarily possessed until with his willpower he destroyed it.[243]

name: Max
description: Max was a psychotherapist who took care of Cindy Moon's sessions to replace her psychotherapist who was absent due to a family emergency. It later turned out that he was becoming Cindy's therapist as a favor for Saya Ishii.[244]

name: Maxi
description: Maxi was an acquaintance of the Black Widow who provided her with material she needed and information. Natasha asked him about Apogee and if he inquired of where her son Stevie and her ex fiancé James were located.[245]

name: Maxie
description: Maxie was a little kid playing Captain America against the Nazis.[246]

name: Maxwell
description: Mrs. Maxwell hired Betty Ross to work for an emergency hotline.[247]Later, she witnessed Mr. Hyde's attempted assault against Veronica and Hulk's providential intervention in her defense.[248]

name: Mayhew
description: Miss Mayhew witnessed the tremblings caused by the Earth's sped-up rotation when the Mole Man attempted to increase the speed of the planet rotation on its axis.[249]

name: Mazo
description: Mr. Mazo was an inmate in Costa Rica where the Punisher was taken prisoner. With the intent of creating a revolt in prison, he poured water on Mazo in the canteen expecting revenge in the cell in the evening, which Mazo and his accomplices immediately put in place not knowing who the American was, which promptly and very easily defeated Mazo and his men.[250]

name: McCleod
description:
After the discovery of Cyber's body, when asked by reporters whether it was true that the mutants were involved, Inspector McCleod sarcastically replies that there was a good chance unless some of the locals were imbibing radioactive steroids and have developed claws capable of slicing through steel plates.[12]
McCleod and Colonel Mack investigate the repechage of the ambulance in the Firth that was supposed to transport Cyber's body.[12]

name: McCray
description: Dr. McCray treated Jay Jameson at Mount Sinai Medical Center.[251][252]

name: McGinnis
description: After his death, McGinnis' autopsy was performed by Dr. Templeton.[253]

name: McGuire
description: McGuire was one of the soldiers of the famed Third Armored Division of the U.S. Army who confronted the Hulk at Fort Carson.[254]

name: McHenry
description: McHenry bought Navy rifles and grenades from Joey Gregson. Surprised by Shroud, McHenry fled away, because he mustn't be connected with any crimes in the United States.[255]

name: McKay
description: Dr. McKay was Jean Grey's physician.[256]

name: McKieran
description: Fire chief McKieran advises Mayor Aldrin of the breach at the nuclear reactor and that they are attempting to suppress the level of radioactive exposure by manually cooling with water. Later, together with all the firemen of his department, they intervened to help the mayor when he was surrounded by zombies and together with the whole town, he perished when the city was bombed.[257]

name: McMurdo
description: McMurdo was studying the stars when the arrival of a craft from the future caused him to be engulfed by unknown energies. Tormented by strange visions, he soon encountered first the craft's occupant, a Time Traveler from the far future being pursued by mechanical killers, and then the mysterious Kilgore Slaughter, who had been given great powers by the same event. McMurdo's dog was killed by the Time Traveler's pursuers, but McMurdo himself survived and he and his daughter gave both the Time traveler and Slaughter sanctuary after helping Slaughter to destroy the corrupt future world the Traveler came from. McMurdo hoped to continue to use the killer Droids' time capsule to explore time itself, but it is unknown whether he ever achieved his objective.[258][259]

name: McMurdo
description: Colonel McMurdo was working with Sasquatch at the Mount Logan Cosmic Ray Research Station in Yukon researching mysterious signals detected by the Canadian military. He was particularly critical of Langkowski. The Thing then appeared after a specific signal was detected. He was injured and treated by the personnel at the station but eventually was discovered to be the shape-shifting Super-Skrull and created an explosion that killed all of the station's inhabitants except for Walter Langkowski, including McMurdo.

name: McSweeny
appearences: Civil War II: Choosing Sides Vol 1 3
description: McSweeny covered the story about Hawkeye's trial.[260]

name: Meachum
description: Nurse Meachum was young Bruce Banner's cruel baby sitter.[261]

name: Medvedev
description: Medvedev was one of the government agents who killed Ivan Petrovich's wife and abducted his son Yuri, letting him believe to be held by the Americans in West Berlin. When the boy hated the Westerners enough, Medvedev faked a rescue to take him back across the Wall to Alexi Bruskin.[262]

name: Meg
description: Meg was a Genoshan Magistrate who was involved in a fight in a pub frequented by the Magistrates and in which the son of the Genegineer, Phillip Moreau, had the worst of it and to punish him Meg had the idea of getting him on board the Mutates train.[263]

name: Megan
description: Megan had dinner with Johnny Storm at the Rainbow Room.[264]

name: Mehdi
description: Mehdi and his desert raiders saw Conan intoxicated by the black lotus and decided to kill him but were eventually all slain by the Cimmerian instead.[265]

name: Mei-Li
description:
Mei-Li was working in Randall Crowne's illegal sweatshop before it was destroyed by Menace.[266]
She then joined the Inner Demons and was attacked by the Anti-Venom.[267]

name: Mel
description: Mel was among the White Rabbit Gang members who attempted to rob the Kwikkee Burger.[268]

name: Mel
description: Mel was a student who frequented the Incantesimo witchcraft shop, and in which a circle of friends who had the same tastes and mentality was formed, supporting each other and in which Patty Prue also joined, overturning her belief that she would remain alone after the loss of her family.[269]

name: Melanie
description: Melanie was the wife of Count Tarcas Melphorr. When he began luring weary travelers to satiate his brother's gory lust for human flesh, many times she entertained the thought of reporting Tarcas to local guards, but she was fearful that if she did it, he might kill her too. She nevertheless attempted to warn Conan in vain to leave the manor. When the Cimmerian slayed both Tarcas and his brother, she decided to stay there to mourn and bury them.[270]

name: Melanie
description: Melanie was the girlfriend of Dick Torrance, the man who hosted Bruce Banner convinced he was a mutant so he could report it to X-Factor convinced that he would get a reward that would be useful for the maintenance of the son Melanie had just told him to be waiting from him.[271]

name: Melanie
description: Melanie was a girl who played on the swing of a public park in Ipswich just near the fall of the Wasp after it had become gigantic in size trying to stop an out of control Quinjet.[272]

name: Melanie
description:
Melanie was Jimmy Sweets' lover.[273]
She was caught in a fire set by Bushwhacker.[274]

name: Melanie
description: Melanie and her husband were on holiday in Ireland when they saw a group of Asgardians appear out of nowhere, including Thor.[275]

name: Melanie
description: Melanie was a girl lured into a party by a group of Skrulls that slaughtered her before Ryder had a chance to rescue her.[276]

name: Melanie
description: Melanie was a girl who went into a blind date with Heidi Sladkin.[277]

name: Melantha
description: Melantha ran the House of Women in Nova Roma. She ordered that the drinks served to captives Danielle Moonstar, Rahne Sinclair, and Amara Aquilla be laced with mind altering drugs.[278]

name: Melinda
description: Melinda was a contestant of a web program, unaware that the whole show was controlled by Skrulls and its main purpose was to slaughter human beings as cattle. She was rescued by the Skrull Kill Krew.[279]

name: Melinda
appearences: Spider-Island: I Love New York City Vol 1 1
description: Melinda and her husband Eddie attempted to rob an apartment during the confusion created during the Spider-Virus infection, but after tying up the two spouses who own the apartment they were confronted by the couple's six-year-old daughter, also infected by the Spider-Virus and thus had acquired powers similar to those of Spider-Man, who humiliatingly defeated them and captured them.[280]

name: Melissa
description: Melissa was left catatonic with shock after her significant other Jeff was abducted by the Sewer Killer.[281]

name: Melissa
description: Nurse Melissa allowed J. Jonah Jameson and his wife to visit Mattie Franklin.[282]

name: Melissa
description: Melissa was a staff member of Senator Muffoletto, and witnessed a discussion by her boss about the role of a leader using hamburgers as a metaphor.[283]

name: Melvin
description: Melvin witnessed the Valkyrie walking down the streets in the Village.[284]

name: Mendes
description: Mendes was an immigrant smuggler who killed his partner Ian Ritter.[285]

name: Menskar
description: Menskar used to run a rat-game around various Nemedian towns and hamlets, until his cheating technique was revealed by Conan. Wanting revenge, he and his men ambushed him while the Cimmerian was with Noirelle, but the barbarian quickly defeated them all.[286]

name: Menza
description: Baron Menza was a local hero who died attempting to lay claim to the King of Berthalia's reward.[287]

name: Merce
description: Merce was one of the people who gathered at the Madison Square Garden to listen to Reverend Stryker's sermon; an apparent aide of the President sent in the Commander-in-Chief's stead, Merce diplomatically told a senator also in attendance that Stryker's opinions deserved a hearing. When the sermon turned out to be a ruse to broadcast a telepathic attack against all mutants latent or otherwise in the New York area, Merce watched in fright as the senator was affected, suffering what appeared to be the beginnings of a cerebral hemorrhage.[133]

name: Mercy
description: Mr. Mercy was the father of the twin serial killers Mercy Sisters and he himself was killed and dismembered by his daughters and stored in the basement of their residence.[288]

name: Mercy
description: Mrs. Mercy was the mother of the twin serial killers Mercy Sisters and she herself was killed and dismembered by her daughters and stored in the basement of their residence.[288]

name: Merdine
description: Merdine was Feducio's loyal assistant. He tried to confront Conan, but he swiftly killed by the Cimmerian.[289]

name: Meredith
description:
As a teenager, Meredith declined Howie Barker's advances.[290]
She later met X-Man in Washington Square Park.[291]

name: Merle
description: Merle was an illegal wildlife trader who was killed by the Punisher.[292]

name: Mero
description: Doctor Mero was a sociobiologist, expert in the study of cephalopods. Typhoid Mary kidnapped him by hiding him in a secret place where she could help Mary to make her three personalities coexist without necessarily having to reunite them in a single person.[293]

name: Merrick
description: Merrick was an immigrant smuggler who was killed by Wolverine.[294]

name: Merrill
description: Merrill was a Steyr Security Systems scientist who attempted to analyze Spider-Man's webbing.[37]

name: Merriweather
description: Merriweather complimented with J. Jonah Jameson for hiring back ex-convict Frederick Foswell.[295]

name: Merv
description: Merv believed that Captain America was assassinated.[296]

name: Metrius
description: Metrius was the commander of the Venarium fortress and father of Tamera. After he killed Rion of the Laughing Visage, Conan butchered him so bad that his body was found hacked into many pieces.[297]

name: Meyer
description: Mrs. Meyer was Wade Wilson's teacher at Surline Elementary School.[298]

name: Mia
description: Mia was a news anchor who announced the Avengers' intention to band together in an official capacity.[299]

name: Mia
appearences: Captain America: Sentinel of Liberty Vol 2 1
description:
Mia was an art classmate at Community College that Steve Rogers befriended. She suggested to Steve how to use the tablet correctly for drawing. They went to a baseball game together and Mia asked him why she cheered the Mets, with him telling her because they were underdogs and she commented that he was an impossible type.[300]
While at the bar with her friends from school, Mia saw Steve distracted as he brought the drinks and jokingly asked him if he needed a hand since it "had been a century" since he had gone to take his orders.[301]
During a drawing lesson, where they had to interpret Cap's shield, cap asked his three new friends what Captain America's shield meant to them and Mia replied that it was a comfortable smile but she herself asked steve cova she wanted to represent especially for him.[302]

name: Michael
description: During the WWII Michael was the owner of Mike's Chicago Bar in Marrakesh and helped Sam Sawyer to make escape the German scientist Dr. Steuben from Nazi Germany to the United States, and to hide one of the leaders of the Danish resistance, Josef de Groot, who was the father of his beloved Christine.[303]

name: Michael
description: The secretary of the personnel office at the Delazny Studios, delivers to Johnny Blaze the data related to one of the technicians working for the Stuntmaster TV Show that turned out to be Leopold Stryke, aka the Eel.[304]

name: Michael
description: Not much is known about Michael, save that he was a young man from Genosha who tested positive for the X-gene on his thirteenth birthday, and as such was taken by the Genengineer to be converted into one of Genosha's mutant slave caste. Despite the Genengineer's attempts to calm him down, Michael was understandably upset at this prospect, even moreso when Cameron Hodge, in his grotesque cyborg body, suddenly burst through the floor.[305]

name: Michael
description: Michael was killed by another henchman of The Rose for using an unsecured phone line.[306]

name: Michael
description: Michael was the director of the movie Amazon Annie: Princess of the Jungle starring Mary Jane Watson.[307]

name: Michael
description: Michael, along with Stephan were two Kamtek employees, who were killed and impersonated by Vikady and Taz.[308]

name: Michael
description: Michael and his girlfriend were saved by the Spider-Carnage from a gang of street thugs.[309]

name: Michael
description: Michael at the helm of his Man-Apes tribe asked Shanna to leave their lands as they believed she had released the fury of their gods over them.[310]

name: Michael
description: Along with Scarpetti's other henchmen, Michael assaulted a convalescent MacKinley Stewart to take possession of an object given to him by Sam Lincoln. He and the other henchmen were stopped from carrying out their task due to the intervention of Elektra.[311]

name: Michael
description: Peter Parker meets Michael in a bar and notices that he also wears the wedding ring even though he is evidently alone, and Michael reassures Peter by telling him that many men are in their situation.[312]

name: Michael
description: Michael was a man working for Romany Wisdom.[313]

name: Michael
description: While visiting the Statue of Liberty under a heavy rain, Michael and his family were approached by a crazed Joseph Perrett, who after having massacred his family and a waitress in a diner, wandered around the city. Perrett released Michael and his family after Michael's mother sobered him a little 'making him look carefully at her children and the father of her children.[314]

name: Michael
description: Pastor Michael was one of the first victims of a teenager Lucien Goff.[315]

name: Michael
description: A native Sioux Lakota, he had his newborn son treated by Dr. Waking-Bear, but at the time of payment he told the doctor he could not pay him, whereupon the doctor told him he would pay when he was able to do it.[316]

name: Michael
description: Michael was the editor of Nisa Contreras at the Daily Bugle during the period that Loki tried to get elected to the presidency of the USA.[317]

name: Michael
appearences: Strange Academy Presents: Death of Doctor Strange Vol 1 1
description: Michael was a waiter in a pub where the Enchantress and her son Alvi were discussing the pact she had made with the sorcerer Pulsari about having to give him her firstborn, and during the discussion Amora apologized to Michael and his colleague Christina of the animosity of his son. After the mother and son couple left, Christina pointed out that Amora hadn't paid her bill, and Michael replied that she never does.[318]

name: Michael
description: After Marc Spector gave control of himself to Steven Grant's personality, the first thing he did was to go to his trusted hairdresser, Michael, who trusted him to tell him that he had seen Marines returning from Fallujah who were in better shape.[319]

name: Michelle
description: Michelle went with Ian to her father's shop to retrieve the bag that Ian had hidden with the material inside to fight George's uncle who had become a vampire, but only Blade's intervention saved the boys who eliminated the vampires.[320]

name: Michelle
appearences: Jane Foster & the Mighty Thor Vol 1 1
description: Michelle was an Ohio girl who went out on a first date with Rūna with the intention of getting to know each other better than her and she had the idea of both having "ten questions to ask on a first date." But while they were talking, Mr. Horse came asking for Runa's intervention in defense of Asgard, leaving Michelle speechless.[321]

name: Mick
description: When Braddock Manor was first seen, the Braddocks had a servant called Mick, but it is unclear whether he lived at the Manor. He has never been referred to again (along with an unnamed butler).[322]

name: Mickey
description: Mickey and Frank, members of the Metropolitan Police Department, arrested Warlock's followers in Washington, D.C..[323]

name: Mickey
description:
Mickey was a qualified hitman who got four kills on his credit. When Eric Slaughter sent him to Village Cigars for more of his favorite cigars, Mickey was caught by Daredevil and told him where Alarich Wallenquist was supposed to be.[324]
Some time later, Mickey was also interrogated by Bullseye about the Kingpin's current whereabouts.[325]

name: Mickey
description: Mickey was one of the guards of the Vault, who were transporting Rusty and Skids from the Vault to Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters; their transport was hijacked near Sparta by the Friends of Humanity, who disabled the guards' armors with an Electromagnetic Scrambling Pulse and captured the prisoners.[326]

name: Midas
description: Lady Midas was a real estate businesswoman, whom Wilson Fisk placed under the protection of Typhoid Mary to avoid the involvement of Elektra, who had bought a full block of Hell's Kitchen from under Fisk.[293]

name: Miggy
description: Miggy played with Rick Jones and Kelly at the concert held in Jim Wilson's clinic for AIDS patients.[327]

name: Miguel
description: Miguel was a member of outlaw gang of Hook Tebbs. He got into a quarrel with the Masked Raider.[328]

name: Miguel
description: Miguel was a rebel who was ordered by El Lobo to guard Jane Foster, but he was swiftly fooled and defeated by the captive girl.[329]

name: Miguel
description: A member of the White Rabbit Gang, Miguel was ordered to pull over the White Rabbit's van when they were being tailed by Spider-Man and Frog Man.[268]

name: Miguel
description: Miguel was one of the men kidnapped by the Puppet Master.[330]

name: Miguel
description:
Miguel was Johnny Storm's manager.[331]He organized his reality show.[332]
Miguel also managed to invite the Fantastic Four to the David Letterman's Late Show.[333]

name: Miguel
description: Miguel was among the last to resist the assault on the mansion of Mr. Alcantara but was easily knocked out by Moon Knight.[334]

name: Miguel
appearences: Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 2 1
description: Miguel was fleeing Mexico and took refuge in Brooklyn but the Don of the Dead found him and while he was about to kill him, Iron Fist and Power Man intervened, defeating the Don and his men.[335]

name: Miguel
description: Miguel was a homeless kid who had trouble at home and stood at the corner of the Third and the Bowery and Peter always gave him little financial help.[336]

name: Miguel
description: Miguel was a Mexican boy who, together with his friends Gabi and Javier, found a deep hole and outside what remained of the pupal state of one of Maggott's endosymbiotes and were terrified when they saw the slug grown to gigantic size.[337]

name: Mike
description:
Mike was employed by plantation-owner John Crafton.
In 1939, Mike was with his boss in the Amazon Jungle following Ken Masters when local Indians killed him with a poisoned dart.[338][339]

name: Mike
description: Mike was a police officer from Star City who was one of the victims of the Plant Man.[170]

name: Mike
description: Mike was ordered to get rid of the Painter.[340]

name: Mike
description: Mike was one of Lucky Lobo's men, who fought in vain against Spider-Man (Peter Parker).[295]

name: Mike
description: Mike was saved by Storm from Proteus' powers.[341]

name: Mike
description: He was hunting with his friend Charlie just when landed Galen-Kor and his team of Kree rebels who killed them both.[342]

name: Mike
description: Mike's bar was damaged by Hercules.[343]

name: Mike
description: Mike was a Daily Grind customer.[344]

name: Mike
appearences: Tales of the Marvel Universe Vol 1 1
description: Mike was a friend of Cabbie.[345]

name: Mike
description: Mike was an acquaintance of Flash Thompson during early childhood.[346]

name: Mike
description: Mike was a member of the rock climbing club joined by Natasha.[347]

name: Mike
description: Mike was saved from Kraven the Hunter by Peter Parker.[348]

name: Mike
description: Mike was the driver of the doctor who placed the Arc Reactor in Pepper Potts' chest.[349]

name: Mike
description: Mike was the Lionsgate Hotel owner.[350]

name: Mike
description: Mike was a hot dog vendor and a friend of Detective Bolt.[351]

name: Mike
description: Mike was a friend to whom Mister Immortal paid money to keep an eye on him while he buried himself for an entire year to meditate, so he wouldn't try to escape if he changed his mind.[352]

name: Mike
description: Mike was a grade student who along with two of his fellow students got drunk and on the way back they met Elsie, a homeless child who Mike ruined the drawing she had done. Later, after being possessed by the Symbiote Carnage, Elsie killed Mike and his two companions by making the corpses disappear.[353]

name: Mikey
description: Mikey was a Skrull who infiltrated Earth and pretended to be a high school student and who was killed in class by Skrull Kill Krew's Moonstomp who after his death revealed his true appearance, frightening all the other students.[354]

name: Mikey
description: Mikey and Brad were two bicyclists who were caught by Spider-Man after causing an accident.[355]

name: Mikkel
description:
Mikkel was an oil rig worker under Brom's supervision.[356]
He was rescued by Brom and his father when the platform exploded.[356]

name: Miklos
description: In a hostile nation somewhere in Europe, Miklos and his rebel brigand band attacked Daredevil, but they were easily defeated.[357]

name: Mildred
description: Mildred and her husband witnessed Spider-Man crashing into their apartment's window.[358]

name: Milena
appearences: Year of Marvels: April Infinite Comic Vol 1 1
description:
Milena is a Graphic Designer who works for Graphigrex Inc.
and among her colleagues there is Gene Gray with whom she calls him with various appellations of super heroes of which she is a great enthusiast and expert.[359]

name: Miles
description: Thanks to the good intuition of one of his soldiers, Lieutenant Miles managed to defeat the detachment of the Japanese army located on an island in the Solomon Islands.[360]

name: Milfarb
description: Mr. Milfarb was one of the neighbors who attended Ben Parker's funeral.[361]

name: Miller
description: Mister Miller was a grocery store owner who fired Billy Jones for being late.[362]

name: Miller
description: Miller was the Young Watchers' trainer appointed by Stoneface.[49]

name: Millie
description: Millie was one of the girls who welcome Tony Stark to Los Angeles.[363]

name: Millie
description: Millie was a waitress who served Angel Salvadore and Logan.[364]

name: Millie
description:
Millie was the doorwoman of the illegal red light warehouse in Bushwick.[365]
She met the Punisher when he stormed the brothel.[366]
Millie later came to rescue Tina when she was trapped by the Human Fly.[367]

name: Mills
description: After hearing the screams in the room where Detective Jon Shayde was hospitalized, Nurse Mills hurried inside asking if everything was okay but found no one in the room and immediately gave the alarm that the detective had disappeared and it seemed that he had gone through the window.[368]

name: Milo
description: Milo helped Tony Stark get checked in at the Basel Stress Clinic.[369]

name: Milo
description:
Milo was a henchman of Lucien Goff who went to Troy Killkelly to force him into getting the loan with interest that Lucien had granted to Troy.[370]
Milo and Stu went again to visit Troy for payment with the intention of harming him again, but Emma had mentally sensed their arrival and together with Troy they managed to escape from the fire escape. However they managed to follow them to the restaurant where Troy worked but Emma used her powers to freeze both of them and Troy hit them with a frying pan, stunning them.[371]
Milo and Stu turned Troy's apartment upside down to get him to pay. Soon after they forced Troy and Emma to get into a car threatening them with guns.[372]
Stu and Milo disagreed about Emma's false kidnapping for a ransom, but they had to obey Lucien.[373]
Milo and Stu took care of making Troy's body disappear.[315]
Milo died in the shooting between various members of Lucien's gang after Emma had filled their minds with doubts and suspicions.[374]

name: Milt
description: Milt was a guard in an East coast federal prison; one night, he was ordered to turn the spotlight on the Cat Man's helicopter, which was approaching the prison to release a Blackout Bomb.[375]

name: Mimi
description: Mimi witnessed Maurice Fortuit being attacked and killed by unidentified assailants in St. Moritz.[376]

name: Mimi
description: Mimi was Sprite's manager.[377]

name: Min
description: Min was Phil's wife, who toured the indian reservation where the Red Wolf was born.[378]

name: Minh
description: Minh was an elderly Boston resident excited that Ironheart was in their neighborhood to oppose the gangs of criminals who raged there.[379]

name: Minnie
description: Minnie was Sanford's wife, a man who had the power to rewind time without his knowledge. When Minnie revealed to him that she wanted to break up their relationship, Sanford unwittingly rewound time simply wishing things would return to the way they were before, locking their town of Cedar in a time loop, until Alicia Grimm convinced him to move on with life accepting his separation from Minnie.[380]

name: Minton
description: Sheriff Minton, on orders from the owners of the Board-controlled mining company, savagely beat anyone who dared to oppose the mine's labor regime. When Dr. Rupert Kingsley dared to treat a member of the miners' union who had been beaten by his men, Minton in punishment set fire to Kingsley's house with him inside. The badly burned Kingsley became the vigilante Surgeon and his first action was to avenge of Minton torturing him before killing him by getting a lot of information on the Board.[381]

name: Mirwit
appearences: Moon Knight: Black, White & Blood Vol 1 3
description: Mirwit, according to Khonshu, had the potential to become his avatar and Moon Knight's successor when the time came, and for this an unknown Cult kidnapped her and then sacrificed her with the intent in this way to hurt Khonshu himself. Moon Knight rushed to her rescue by defeating the Cult members in their secret lair and freeing Mirwit.[382]

name: Misha
description: Misha was a night watchman who was surprised and attacked by the Black Widow in the Bolshoi Theatre.[383]

name: Mishi
description: Mishi was hired by Lord Arkhaurus to seduce Conan in the Tavern of Hilides and infiltrate the royal palace as a handmaid to kill the young Princess Taramis. When her plan was thwarted by the Cimmerian and Shubal, Mishi was assassinated by Arkhaurus himself.[384]

name: Misty
description: Misty was defended by her boyfriend when they both were being mugged in the subway.[385]

name: Mitch
description: Mitch and his partner Rafe were sent to rob the grave of Joseph Travers for his voodoo ring by Mr. Six. They began to dig up the grave when the Zombie appeared and killed Mitch by slamming him against the bars, Rafe escaped back to Mr. Six.[386]

name: Mitch
description: Mitch was a security officer who worked at Garwood Industries.[387]

name: Mitch
description:
Mitch was a robber stopped by Cyclops and Spider-Man in the West Village.[388]
Some time later, Mitch enjoyed a drink with Carol Danvers.[389]
A while later, Mitch was defeated by Mr. Fantastic while he was trying to rob a bank.[229]

name: Mitch
description: Mitch is a bartender at Bar with No Name who wanted to get Conan's horse out of the bar.[390]

name: Mitchell
description: Mitchell and Cissy were a couple that were kidnapped in Central Park by the Ludberdites in order to control their minds and offer them an artificial type of peace.[391]

name: Mitar
description: His whole family dead in the war, Mitar's rifle was his brother, and he lived to kill Serbs. He joined Josip, Punisher, Dragunov, and Microchip in their quest to find the nuclear warhead sold by Vikady to the Serbian People's Army in Sarajevo.[392] Mitar eventually sniped down both Vikady and the sniper who killed Dragunov.[393]

name: M'Khail
description: M'Khail was a soldier who served under Conan and alerted him that his men were ready to travel to Bhoraji.[394]

name: Mohammed
description: Mohammed was a terrorist for the liberation of Kashmir whose plane terror attack was thwarted by the X-Men.[395]

name: Mohr
appearences: Punisher Back to School Special Vol 1 3
description: Mohr was the principal of a high school and was also the main drug dealer in his own school. When the Punisher found out about the drug trafficking in the school, he infiltrated as the cafeteria attendant and unearthed the drug trafficking ring that brought him to Mohr and killed him by setting him on fire.[396]

name: Moira
description: Moira was Stanley Stackmeyer's girlfriend, who accompanied him to the Midtown High School's Pre-Reunion Bash.[397]

name: Molina
description: Molina was a detective from the Philadelphia Police and together with her partner DiStefano investigated the disappearance of the newborn son of Stinger and Paulie Provenzano, and did not want Cable to meddle in the investigation.[398]

name: Molinari
description:
After visiting Susan Richards about the progress of her pregnancy, Dr. Molinari and a colleague were perplexed about the mutation of Susan's blood cells and how they might affect the baby.[399]
Dr. Molinari makes Reed Richards aware of the situation for both his wife and unborn child.[399]
Dr. Molinari gives a press conference about Susan's difficulties in childbirth due to the influence of cosmic rays that changed her body when she received her powers, but after Reed gave him the Cosmic Control Rod he delivered the baby without problems.[400]

name: Mollo
description: Mollo was a Genoshan Magistrate who jumped on a spacecraft that flew Genosha's airspace but noticed that nobody was on board the spacecraft.[263]

name: Molly
description: Molly was Jones' wife.[401]

name: Molly
description: Mentions: X-Factor (Vol. 3) #21

name: Molly
description: Molly was a pregnant homeless woman from Las Vegas to whom Father John Priest gave assistance and food. She reported to the priest that the other homeless people were changing after hearing the words of one Mr. Ash. She was later in the demon-possessed crowd who tried to assault the New Fantastic Four and was stopped by Father John.[403]

name: Mona
description:
Mona was a waitress at a diner in Bone, Idaho. When Jennifer Walters went looking for her cousin Bruce, Mona consoled her when she saw her heartbroken.[404]
After the destruction of the town of Bone by an out of control She-Hulk, in the rubble Mona desperately asked for help in finding her son Jonah.[405]
At the end of the conflict between the Avengers and the Hulk, Mona finds her son safe and sound amid the destruction of their village.[406]
Mona was present at a meeting group meeting to support each other following the destruction of their village by She-Hulk.[407]

name: Monahan
description: A staff member of St. Mabyn's Hospital, Dr. Monahan was in his own words "a poor, struggling National Health G.P." when survivors of a plane crash caused by Radion the Ravager were brought in for treatment. He was assigned Misty Knight, who was not only in the plane but was further injured while fighting the Ravager. After she was taken out of surgery, Monahan spoke to Knight's traveling companion Danny Rand and was admittedly perplexed by her cybernetic arm.[408]

name: Monica
appearences: Symbiote Spider-Man: King in Black Vol 1 1
description: Monica was a doctor at the Ravencroft Institute and watched Alystair Smythe self-inject a substance by asking him if it was approved and having in reply that it was her own invention and that she was already pumping her into the ventilation system, and she became the first to be possessed by Mister E.[410]

name: Monique
description: Single mother and She-Hulk's cellmate in Cleveland City lock-up.[411] She was later possessed by Bendigeidfran the Blessed.[412]

name: Monk
description: Monk was a henchman of the Black Talon. After allying himself with the Nazis, they helped him in the kidnapping of Dora Livingstone to find his father who had discovered a new Earth called New America.[413]

name: Monmouth
description: One of the robotic members of Madame Masque's Inner Guard. It was destroyed in a battle between the Avengers and Count Nefaria.[414]

name: Monsteroso's Parents
description: Monsteroso's parents who lost there son who left the spaceship in its lifeboat and crashed to earth. They warned humanity that if any harm had come to the child they would have destroyed the planet.[415]

name: Montoya
description: Montoya was criminal who left Los Angeles and was defeated in San Francisco by the Shroud.[416]

name: Monty
description: Monty was a drug trafficker who secretly got Dr. Allen Hoffman tipping off about his wealthy patients who were addicted to drugs and psychiatric drugs in exchange for money.[417]

name: Moore
description: Mrs. Moore

name: Moose
description: Moose trained once with Crusher and Captain America.[419]

name: Moose
description: Moose was killed by Neuri rebels.[420]

name: Moretti
appearences: Spider-Man: Funeral for an Octopus Vol 1 1
description:
Moretti was hired to replicate Doctor Octopus' Tentacles.[421]
He eventually created an helmet which could simulate Dock Ock's brain-waves and control his arms.[422]
He vehemently complained with Spider-Man when he eventually had to destroy Octopus' arms.[423]

name: Mori
description: Inspector Mori greeted Logan at the airport and told him about the murder of Superintendent Kenichi Nakadai, an acquaintance of Logan's since the war, and reporting the Yakuza's suspicions of guilt.[211]

name: Morley
description: Morley was enjoying a drink after work with his friend Stan, when they were both attacked by the Lizard.[424]

name: Morris
description: Morris and Joe came across the Hulk while fishing by a trout stream in the Rocky Mountains.[254]

name: Morris
description: Reverend Morris was the chaplain who married Bruce Banner and Betty Ross.[425]

name: Morris
description: Morris was a modeling agent, who told Mary Jane Watson-Parker that the job she was expecting had been given to another model.[426]

name: Morris
description: An officer of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, Morris was Sergeant Doolin's partner.[427]

name: Morris
description: Mrs. Morris was one of Bruce Banner's high school teachers.[428]

name: Morrissey
description: Ms. Morrissey was present at the dance that was held at the Snow Valley School for Girls and to which Mr. Kendall introduced Emma Frost.[70]

name: Mort
description: After assaulting and robbing a stagecoach, Mort attempted to blame Matt Slade for the robbery but was unmasked by the sheriff and arrested.[429]

name: Mort
description: Mort was Henry Gray's partner in the airplane model company. When Gray discovered he had powers he tried to scare Mort so that he would give him his share of the business.[430]

name: Mort
description: Together with another agent of the Organization Mort was instructed by Number One to go to Lawson (secretly Mar-Vell) to threaten him and take possession of the Cyberex.[431]

name: Mort
description: A member of a club of wealthy men where there were also J. Jonah Jameson and Norman Osborn, he was offered by Jameson two cigars for the joy of proving that Spider-Man was a phony and had been right about him.[432]

name: Mort
description: Mort was a henchman of Marion who was killed in a gunfight in the prison where Logan was being held.[43]

name: Mortensen
description: Mr. Mortensen was a client of Nelson and Murdock law firm.[433]

name: Mortimer
description: Mortimer was the servant and cook of Sir Harry Everett Barclay who left the service and left the mansion of Bat's Belfry after the strange events took place inside and the constant nightmares that it entailed.[434]

name: Mortimer
description: Mortimer was the assistant of Inky Blott and was in command of the team of psychics used to fight Necrom, but soon after Necrom had easily defeated the psychics, he killed Mortimer just as easily, absorbing all his vital energies.[435]

name: Morty
description: Morty was the Symkarian Embassy's doorman.[436]

name: Mosley
description:
Mosley was one of the Owl's lieutenants until he was crippled by Daredevil. Together with Todd and Dennison, they ended up working for Wilson Fisk, who ordered them to inform the Owl that they were going to take over his territory, to keep Fisk in the shadows. When the three of them briefed Fisk about the outcome of the situation, Dennison revealed his intentions to work for himself, believing Fisk to be powerless, but Fisk gave a simple order to Lady Bullseye, who quickly killed Dennison.[437]
Mosley and Todd then followed Fisk's orders, liberating a convoy of prisoners under the condition of working for their boss and sharing their profits, but making them all believe their boss was The Hood instead of Fisk.[438]

name: Mouth
description: Moss was a sheriff who helped Two-Gun Kid take back his land from Bartell.[439]

name: Mrrsgarn
appearences: Civil War II: Choosing Sides Vol 1 4
description:
Mouth was an arms dealer who was killed by the Punisher for trying to steal the Zodiac Virus from the 
Horizon Labs Medical Branch.[440]

name: Mueller
description: Mrrsgarn was a demon servant at Baron Vjerzak's command. Wielding the misting globe, the tyrant was able to summon Mrrsgarn to let him feed on living beings. The baron also unleashed Mrrsgarn against Conan; however, as the Cimmerian was slashing him to death, he couldn't return him to the safety of the misting globe.[441]

name: Muffy
description: Fraulein Mueller was Kristoff's private teacher.[442]

name: Mug
description: Muffy was one of the bikers who harassed Connie.[443]

name: Muldoon
description: Mug was a member of the Mudsharks street gang and they found Rachel Leighton handcuffed to a subway column and wanted to take advantage of her when Crossbones, the one who had handcuffed her, returned and killed Rob and all the other members of the Mudsharks.[444]

name: Muller
description: Muldoon was one of Mayor J. Jonah Jameson's security guards.[445] He assisted him during the Spider-Island crisis.[446]

name: Mulroney
description: Dr. Muller claimed to have determined the exact location of the Great Refuge.[447]

name: Mundt
description: Mulroney was the bodyguard of the Mayor of New York, J. Jonah Jameson. He accompanied Jameson to the X-Factor Investigations offices.[448]

name: Muñoz
description: Dr. Mundt was a doctor from the County General Hospital in Anchorage who treated Scott and Alex Summers following the accident where their parents seemingly died.[449]

name: Murch
description: Ms. Munoz asks Hercules for help because of a methamphetamine laboratory in the building next to her apartment, and that every time she reports the matter to the police, in the meantime that they intervene the laboratory is dismantled to open it immediately after the search.[450]

name: Murchinson
description: Mr. Murch was the gym teacher at Midtown High School at the time Peter Parker was attending. When Mr. Murch asked Peter if he could help him clean the gym while the others were showering, Peter gladly agreed to stay away from Flash Thompson.[451]

name: Murphy
description: Murchinson reported to Mr. Random at the Absolom College the physical problems related to the memory reconstruction process of the Scarlet Witch.[452]

name: Murray
description:
Murphy witnessed the Avengers coming by bus to Forest Hills Gardens.[453]
He told his neighbors, but they didn't believe him until they watched the Guardians of the Galaxy arriving in Forest Hills Gardens, too.[454]

name: Murray
description: Murphy was hired by The Rose to capture Spider-Man. Pretending to be a member of Mayor Wilson Fisk's Thunderbolt Units, after Spider-Man was arrested by his accomplice Gibbs, Murphy drove the van that would take him to the Rose's lair. However, Spider-Man realized they weren't cops and escaped their captures, much to The Rose's chagrin.[455]

name: Mushbell
description: Minor Appearance: Wolverine (Vol. 3) #15

name: Mushi
description: Senator Mushbell was a United States senator during the 1940s. By 1946 he was providing government secrets to diplomat Signor Korte constant nemesis of the Blonde Phantom.[461][462]

name: Mussorgsky
description: Mushi was a nurse who assisted Dr. Shahrazad Rafiee at the E.R. of the General Hospital on the very day of the Fear Itself crisis with a large number of patients.[463]

name: Mutate 0.3
description: Captain Mussorgsky took command of the Russian forces in Madripoor after Raskalnikov's death tasked with recapturing the mutant family who had fled Russia and bringing them back to their homeland.[464]

name: Mutate 29
description: Mutate 0.3 was one of the many Mutates slaves of Sugar Man.[465]

name: Mutate 31
description: Mutate 29 was among the Mutates involved in the civil war in Genosha that during a confrontation between them and the humans were separated by the intervention of the Avengers.[466]

name: Mutate 55
description: Mutate 31 was one of the Mutates who fought in the civil war as a follower of Phillip Moreau against Genosha's anti-mutant government.[467]

name: Mutate 56
description: Mutate 55 was one of Phillip Moreau's followers.[468]

name: Mutate 71
description: Infected by the Legacy Virus, Mutate 56 was eventually killed by one of Zealot's followers.[469]

name: Mutate 089
description: Mutate 071 was one of Phillip Moreau's followers.[468]

name: Mutate 110
description: During the civil war, like hundreds of other Genoshan Mutates, Mutate 089 was held captive under inhumane conditions by the Magistrate Elite.[466]

name: Mutate 146
description: Mutate 110 was one of the Mutate Streetfighters who during the civil war in Genosha were hiding among their hungry peers thus hitting their opponents in an ambush.[470]

name: Mutate 163
description: Mutate 146 was one of Phillip Moreau's followers.[468]

name: Mutate 167
description: Mutate 163 was one of Phillip Moreau's followers.[468]

name: Mutate 178
description: Mutate 167 was one of the Mutates who fought in the civil war as a follower of Phillip Moreau against Genosha's anti-mutant government.[467]

name: Mutate 201
description: Mutate 178 was one of the Mutate refugees of Genosha during the civil war who found themselves without a safe place to take refuge and hungry.[470]

name: Mutate 227
description: Mutate 201 saved Magneto from a squad of Magistrates.[471]

name: Mutate 238
description: Mutate 227 was one of the many Mutates slaves of Sugar Man.[465]

name: Mutate 243
description: During the civil war, like hundreds of other Genoshan Mutates, Mutate 238 was held captive under inhumane conditions by the Magistrate Elite.[466]

name: Mutate 263
description: During the civil war, like hundreds of other Genoshan Mutates, Mutate 243 was held captive under inhumane conditions by the Magistrate Elite.[466]

name: Mutate 270
description: Mutate 263 was among the Mutates involved in the civil war in Genosha that during a confrontation between them and the humans were separated by the intervention of the Avengers.[466]

name: Mutate 298
description: Mutate 270 was one of Phillip Moreau's followers.[468]

name: Mutate 312
