description: Mutate 298 was among the Mutates involved in the civil war in Genosha that during a confrontation between them and the humans were separated by the intervention of the Avengers.[466]

name: Mutate 317
description: During the civil war, like hundreds of other Genoshan Mutates, Mutate 312 was held captive under inhumane conditions by the Magistrate Elite.[466]

name: Mutate 337
description: Mutate 317 was one of the many Mutates slaves of Sugar Man.[465]

name: Mutate 358
description: During the civil war, like hundreds of other Genoshan Mutates, Mutate 337 was held captive under inhumane conditions by the Magistrate Elite.[466]

name: Mutate 360
description: Mutate 358 was among the Mutates involved in the civil war in Genosha that during a confrontation between them and the humans were separated by the intervention of the Avengers.[466]

name: Mutate 370
description: Mutate 360 was killed by a blast caused by burning power wires.[472]

name: Mutate 376
description: Mutate 370 was part of the same group of Mutate 490.[473]

name: Mutate 503
description: Mutate 376 was being used as a guinea pig by Sugar Man when he was freed by Nate Grey.[474]

name: Mutate 504
description: During the civil war, like hundreds of other Genoshan Mutates, Mutate 503 was held captive under inhumane conditions by the Magistrate Elite.[466]

name: Mutate 512
description: Mutate 504 was being used as a guinea pig by Sugar Man when he was freed by Nate Grey.[474]

name: Mutate 523
description: Mutate 512 was one of Phillip Moreau's followers.[468]

name: Mutate 530
description: During the civil war, like hundreds of other Genoshan Mutates, Mutate 523 was held captive under inhumane conditions by the Magistrate Elite.[466]

name: Mutate 537
description: Mutate 530 was among the Mutates involved in the civil war in Genosha that during a confrontation between them and the humans were separated by the intervention of the Avengers.[466]

name: Mutate 602
description: During the civil war, like hundreds of other Genoshan Mutates, Mutate 537 was held captive under inhumane conditions by the Magistrate Elite.[466]

name: Mutate 628
description: Mutate 602 was one of Sugar Man's slaves.[465]

name: Mutate 633
description: During the civil war, like hundreds of other Genoshan Mutates, Mutate 628 was held captive under inhumane conditions by the Magistrate Elite.[466]

name: Mutate 642
description: During the civil war, like hundreds of other Genoshan Mutates, Mutate 633 was held captive under inhumane conditions by the Magistrate Elite.[466]

name: Mutate 650
description: Mutate 642 was being used as a guinea pig by Sugar Man when he was freed by Nate Grey.[474]

name: Mutate 722
description: Mutate 650 was part of the same group of Mutate 490.[473]

name: Mutate 740
description: Mutate 722 was one of Phillip Moreau's followers.[468]

name: Mutate 742
description: Mutate 740 was being used as a guinea pig by Sugar Man when he was freed by Nate Grey.[474]

name: Mutate 808
description: Mutate 740 was being used as a guinea pig by Sugar Man when he was freed by Nate Grey[474]

name: Mutate 888
description: Mutate 808 was one of the Mutates who fought in the civil war as a follower of Phillip Moreau against Genosha's anti-mutant government.[467]

name: Mutate 911
description: Mutate 888 was one of the Mutates who fought in the civil war as a follower of Phillip Moreau against Genosha's anti-mutant government.[467]

name: Mutate 913
description: Mutate 911 was one of Sugar Man's slaves.[465]

name: Mutate 918
description: Mutate 913 was one of the Mutates who fought in the civil war as a follower of Phillip Moreau against Genosha's anti-mutant government.[467]

name: Mutate 973
description: Mutate 918 was one of Phillip Moreau's followers.[468]

name: Mutate 985
description: Mutate 973 was being used as a guinea pig by Sugar Man when he was freed by Nate Grey.[474]

name: Mutate 1351
description: Mutate 985 was one of the Genoshan Mutates seen working outside the capital when the Magistrates returned from America with captured mutants.[305]

name: Mutate 1585
description: Mutate 1351 was a Sugar Man's Mutate slave who opposed Cable and his allies on his orders.[475]

name: Mutate 1907
description: Mutate 1585 was one of the Mutate Streetfighters who during the civil war in Genosha were hiding among their hungry peers thus hitting their opponents in an ambush.[470]

name: Mutate 3110
description: Mutate 1907 was one of Sugar Man's slaves.[465]

name: Mutate 3801
description: Mutate 3110 was one of Sugar Man's slaves.[465]

name: Mutate 6171
description: Mutate 3801 was a Sugar Man's Mutate slave who opposed Cable and his allies on his orders.[305]

name: Mutate 7875
description: Mutate 6171 was one of the Mutate refugees of Genosha during the civil war who found themselves without a safe place to take refuge and hungry.[470]

name: Mutate 8711
description: Mutate 7875 alerted the Magistrates of X-Factor's arrival.[476]

name: Mutate 8765
description: Mutate 8711 was one of the Mutate Streetfighters who during the civil war in Genosha were hiding among their hungry peers thus hitting their opponents in an ambush.[470]

name: Mutate 9212
description: Mutate 8765 was tested positive for a mutant gene on his 13th birthday and brainwashed into becoming a mutate by the Genegineer. His mother tried to save him, but failed. He was later used by some magistrates who were searching for the escaped Rictor and Boom-Boom as well as their guide, Jubilee. But as Rictor and Boom got the jump on the magistrates, 8765 begged them to not hurt him since he had already been severely abused by the magistrates. Jubilee wanted to ditch him, but Boom-Boom made the decision to bring him along. He helped them escape capture and lead them to the main citadel but he could only do so much because of his programming, after this he ran away from them. As more magistrates were patrolling the area they found Mutate 8765, but he lied to them and did not alert them of the three mutants hiding nearby, thereby allowing them to escape.[477]

name: Mycroft
description: Mutate #9212 was one of the Genoshan Mutates seen working outside the capital when the Magistrates returned from America with captured mutants.[305]

name: Myron
description: Mycroft used brain cybernetic implants to increase his intellect. He was hired by Roxxon to oppose Tony Stark's new ethical business policies.[478]

name: Myrtle
description: Myron was a clerk in a jewelry store who was robbed by Maxwell Dillon. Myron smiled as Dillon pulled out a toy gun not imagining that Dillon would use his powers that electrocuted him and stunned him.[479]

name: Myrtle
description: Myron was a former A.I.M. agent who was forced by Officer Badilino to a special weapon against the Ghost Rider.[480]

name: Myrtle
description: Myron witnessed Norman Osborn being taken away by the Scrier.[481]

name: Nabeel
description: Nabeel was a waiter in a diner where they served Logan's favorite shish kabob. Under threat of killing his parents, Arcade forced him to drug Logan, after which he himself became an Arcade victim whom Wolverine promptly rescued.[1]

name: Nadar
description: Nadar was a member of King Conan's crew during his adventure in the Western Ocean. He was blown out of the ship instants before the ship crashed into the rocks, and was possibly among the horde of non-living who attacked Conan on the cursed Island of Golden Ruins.[2]

name: Nadia
description: Nadia was a pleasure girl from Madame X'arthalla's Pleasure Palace in Shadizar who met Conan after he saved a girl from being killed by a sea monster. Later Nadia warned Conan of a plot between X'arthalla and the captain of the guards to kill the ruler of Shadizar and seize power.[3]

name: Nadia
description: Nadia was a Shemita girl who was also the girl of one of the rebel leaders but was then defeated by wanting material possessions to the point of selling herself to the guards for little money or jewelry, thus betraying her boyfriend and then being discovered by himself.[4]

name: Nadia
description:
Nadia was a scientist who was part of Peter Corbeau's team.[5]
They observed people on the surface of the Sun.[6]

name: Nadia
description: Nadia was a nurse who took care of Daredevil after he was captured in Latveria.[7]

name: Nadine
description: Nadine was the daughter of Klauz, guildmaster of the local thieves' guild. After Conan and Fafnir looted the Temple of the Dragon, the Cimmerian gave her a beautiful mirror. Gazing into her new mirror while brushing her hair, Nadine was possessed by the spirit of Thazarra, who used the girl to reach the Temple of the Dragon and have the magical jewel placed in the pommel of the girl’s mirror, thus liberating the evil witch. Nadine eventually managed to escape with Conan and Fafnir.[8]

name: Nadine
description: Nadine was an aide to Senator Patrick who illustrated to the senator how the teenage hero control system was working so far.[9]

name: Naguro
description: Mr. Naguro was a Japanese explosive dealer who attempted to sell stolen nuclear triggers, but he was eventually defeated by Spider-Man and Bobster.[10]

name: Nails
description:
Skipper, Russ, and Nails were three Life Pharmaceuticals employees who went hunting on the Hopi tribal land, not caring about the warning Molly gave them until they were attacked by Jake turned-werewolf.[11]
The next day, aboard an attack helicopter, they tried to take revenge on Jake by hunting him down.[12]
He is seen on a tape kidnapping Granny Rora.[13]

name: Nakadai
description: Kenichi Nakadai's wife was attacked by the Yakuza that killed her and her husband in the middle of the night at their home.[14]

name: Nan
description: Nan was one of the many jet-set girls Tony Stark went with to forget Pepper Potts. She asked Tony why they had spent a good night with her and could not see each other until the following month, to which he replied that the other thirty girls he was dating would not have liked her company.[15]

name: Nancy
description: Nancy was Marvin Shirkley's secretary at Starnes Bank.[16]

name: Nanna
description: Nanna was Prof. Barry Landers' beloved cat, killed by the Men in Black.[17]

name: Nantakarn
appearences: Black Panther: The Man Without Fear Vol 1 513
description: Minor Appearances: Black Panther: The Man Without Fear #514

name: Naomi
description: Naomi was a Stigyan servant in Kheshatta whom Conan confused with Fionqu'a, and when he asked her where Fionqu'a was she replied that she was going to be sold at the slave mart.[19]

name: Naomi
description: A Shemite girl in Becharadur, Naomi helped Jamal evade the castle guards and plunder the king's treasure tower, but she was accidentally killed by him, who refused to take her with him.[20]

name: Naomi
description:
Naomi was the first nurse who met Johnny Blaze.[21]
After learning the nurse's affiliation with Zadkiel, Naomi left them and tried to warn Lucas Collier, but he ignored her.[22]

name: Naomi
description: Naomi was the bartender of a New York slum pub frequented by Jake Lockley, a Marc Spector personality. When Marc gave Jake control after a long time, he showed up again at the pub, Naomi served him the usual rum and then asked him where he had been all that time. Upon receiving an evasive response, Jake asked Naomi if he had heard anything about vampires.[23]

name: Narang
description: A member of MI-5, he arrogantly ventured into Commander Hammer's base, ignoring Leiko Wu's warnings entirely only to be immediately killed by Hammer's traps.[24]

name: Narita
appearences: Wolverine: Japan's Most Wanted: Infinite Comic Vol 1 3
description: Councilor Narita provided Sabretooth with the contract required to set the Hand on the trail of Wolverine.[25]

name: Nash
description: Mister Nash was salvaging Spanish ships for there treasure when his diver, Bronson decided to murder the crew and keep the treasure for himself, seemingly killing Mister Nash[26]

name: Nash
description: Nash escorted Ant-Man inside the Vision's body, but it was then ordered to leave the android, after his immune system hit Crosby. After Ant-Man exited the revived Vision, he then took it home.[27]

name: Natalie
description: Daniel Rand's assistant, Natalie was killed by H.A.M.M.E.R. agents.[28]

name: Natalie
description: Natalie, worker of the Front Line, watched a video of J. Jonah Jameson while he was being held by the Extremist.[29]

name: Natalie
description: Natalie told Pastor Mike she was worried by Asgard.[30]

name: Natasha
description: Natasha was a follower of the Anti-Priest who seduced Johnny Storm to infiltrate the Negative Zone.[31]

name: Nathan
description: Nathan worked in the insurance office at Damage Control. When Gus was assigned to Search and Rescue, Lenny handed him over to Nathan who took him for a ride in an Action Cart. Arriving at the site, Lenny handed Gus to Nathan as he discussed insurance claims with Black Tarantula.[32]

name: Nathaniel
description: Nathaniel was a drunkard sailor who approached Johnny Storm and gave him advice to seek solace from his friends.[33]

name: Nate
description: Nate sold to Foggy Nelson the Daily Globe edition where Daredevil's secret identity was revealed.[35]

name: Nate
description: Following the passage of a destructive tornado in Redfield, Nate and his friends asked Captain America if he wanted to go with them to see if there was still someone to help.[36]

name: Ndoh
description: Ndoh witnessed how Grumpy mutated and became addict to the pink pills. He then agreed that Grumpy had become too dangerous, and wanted to get rid of him.[37] He abandoned Grumpy when Mister Hyde personally confronted him and subsequently died in a shootout against McCallum's mercenaries.[38]

name: Nebinio
description: Nebinio was a Nemedian tanner who was supposed to meet his good friend Shubal in the Tavern of Hilides but was killed by masked assassins, who didn't want him talking to Conan.[39]

name: Ned
description: Ned was one of Hedy Wolfe's wealthy and elitist neighbors.[40]

name: Needle
description: Needle was hunted and killed by Wolverine for torturing and abusing a Canadian nun in Iraq.[41]

name: Negasi
description: Negasi was a boy from the Ororo gang of orphans in Kenya who stole T'Challa's spear as he traveled across the Serengeti plains. After they met, Ororo ordered Negasi to return the spear to T'Challa.[42]

name: Nehradu
description: Mr. Nehradu was saved by Ant-Man and the Wasp from international criminal Ramond Theis.[43]

name: Nelson
description: A member of the D.A.'s office in Coast City, Nelson desperately wanted to end a brutal series of killings in the city which were committed by Piggy Perroni and Paul Sayden.[44]

name: Nelson
description: Nelson and his family was killed by Neuri rebels.[45]

name: Nelson
description: Nelson was an Agent of the S.W.O.R.D. During the Brood's assault on the Pandora's Box space station, Abigail Brand ordered Agent Nelson to leave immediately so as not to give Brood a chance to leave the station.[46]

name: Neville
description: Neville and his wife were awakened by Joe Fixit's battle against Jimmy Delfini's men.[47]

name: Newsome
description: Defense Commissioner Newsome was a target of Fritz Tiboldt's Circus in the 1940's and was killed when Omir unleashed his poisonous snakes.[48]

name: Newton
description: Professor Newton was working on a Defense installation on the outskirts of New York City. The Chameleon managed to penetrate inside the installation and once inside he took the form of Professor Newton to act undisturbed and steal secret documents to sell to countries beyond the curtain.[49]

name: Nichols
description: Dr. Nichols assisted Mac Gargan in the Raft's infirmary.[50]

name: Nichols
appearences: Doctor Strange / Punisher: Magic Bullets Infinite Comic Vol 1 2
description: Nichols was one of the underlings of the Fusilli Crime Family and was killed by the Punisher outside the restaurant owned by the Fusillis after Nichols had come out of it for having witnessed the evocation of demons inside it.[51]

name: Nick
description: Nick was ordered to throw the Painter out.[52]

name: Nicky
description: Nicky had his spine snapped by the Zombie.[53]

name: Nico
description: Nico was a tourist in Los Angeles who, together with his parents Henry and Emma, became caught up in a fight between the Sensational She-Hulk and the Incredible Hulk.[54]

name: Nico
description: Nico was a lieutenant of Phillipe Bazin's, a quiet looking guy at first glance, but underneath his pretty boy exterior, he was a hundred percent snake. Me made several attempts to end Bloodshed's life before he could testify against them. When he and Spider-Man fought Nico's men at his base, Nico escaped and blew the building up.[55]

name: Nicolai
description: Nicolai is the henchman and bodyguard of Yuri Petrovich in the Gulag where he had been imprisoned for a life sentence.[36]

name: Nieves
description: Dr. Tanis Nieves' mother, when her six-year-old daughter brought home a dog that had only three legs and one eye, Tanis's parents took him to a vet and when he said he would give the dog an injection to make him sleep forever, Tanis rebelled to the point of biting the vet and so the parents surrendered and took the dog home.[56]

name: Nieves
description: Dr. Tanis Nieves' father, when his six-year-old daughter brought home a dog that had only three legs and one eye, Tanis's parents took him to a vet and when he said he would give the dog an injection to make him sleep forever, Tanis rebelled to the point of biting the vet and so the parents surrendered and took the dog home.[56]

name: Nigel
description: Nigel was a bouncer at Nick Kaska's club, which was attacked by Tombstone.[57]

name: Nikki
description: Yuri was a Quark's agent who was killed by Logan.[58]

name: Nikolai
description: Nikolai was a bouncer at the Century Bar in West Hollywood, working directly for Yegor Ivanov.[59]

name: Niles
description: Niles was the Frost's butler, and handed Winston a package that had been delivered to the Frost family during Emma's kidnapping.[60]

name: Nina
description: Nina was Curt Connors' pilot, who arranged with Spider-Man to travel back from New York City to Florida to return the Man-Thing to his swamp. Along the way the plane experienced an explosion and crashed. Only the quick thinking of Spider-Man saved them from permanent damage. Once safe, Nina and her co-pilot were then left behind to get help by Spider-Man, who followed the Man-Thing.[61]

name: Nissa
description: Nissa was a friend of Casey Kinmont.[62]

name: Nix
description: Nix was an acquaintance of Hogman who frequently visited Poppa's Olympian Palace.[63]

name: Njab
description: Njab was Conan's comrade, who was killed by Ormon and Pembrok when he heard about their true intentions.[64]

name: Nkotha
description: Nkotha was a human that was integrated into the Phalanx collective. He and other members of the Falange collective were sent by Cameron Hodge to clash with the X-Men but were defeated and perished in the fight.[65]

name: Noam
description: Noam met Anole (Victor Borkowski) online. They started chatting and were both into each other. Noam knew Anole was a mutant, but never saw a picture of him. Despite that, Noam still agreed to go on a date with Anole; however, Anole never showed up for being afraid of Noam's reaction to his appearance.

name: Nobby
description: Nobby was one of the inhabitants of the village in British Columbia where Logan established himself with Rose O'Hara.[67]

name: Nobu
description: Nobu was one of Amiko's classmates.[68]

name: Noirelle
description:
Countess Noirelle had maintained her youth for a thousands years with the white of an egg from a certain giant, winged creature, and recruited Conan and Fafnir to help her obtain a fresh supply, as her last millennium's worth was rapidly wearing off. Rather than attempt to fight the monstrous creature, Noirelle had them first obtain a sample of the rare Yellow Lotus to drug it into slumber. Conan set free the squad's slaves, who joined the struggle, allowing Fafnir, Conan, and Noirelle to escape. Noirelle went off with Conan to show him her gratitude.
When they approached the nest, the creature swooped down to attack them. Fafnir went for his pouch and only then realized that he no longer had the Lotus to drug the creature. The creature attacked Conan, but Fafnir, taking responsibility for his mistake, drew the creature to attack him instead. It swatted him backwards, and Fafnir fell back onto its egg, shattering it and covering himself in its fluid. The creature then swooped down again and knocked Fafnir off of its nest, and off of the cloud-covered mountain which they had climbed to reach it. Noirelle, desperate for the egg's fluids, leapt off after him.[69]

name: Noonan
appearences: Captain America: Man Out of Time Vol 1 5
description: Noonan met Steve Rogers in a diner after Rogers was catapulted into the past by Kang, and there Noonan recognized Steve by calling him "Rembrandt" and remembering when they were both stationed in Leipzig during the war.[70]

name: Nora
description: Nora was a student in Miss Bliss's class at Centerville Junior High in Centerville, California.[71]

name: Norma Jean
appearences: Ghost Rider/Wolverine/Punisher: The Dark Design Vol 1 1
description: Norma Jean allied with the Ghost Rider, Wolverine, and the Punisher to defeat Blackheart.[72]

name: Norris
description:
Norris was Dane Whitman's traitorous assistant, who accidentally summoned Magneto and Toad back to Earth from space.[73]
He was later locked up in the sombre dungeon of Garrett Castle[74] and later sent to a maximum security prison. Dane Whitman, in his superpowered identity as the Black Knight, once attacked the prison to murder Norris in a twisted sense of justice, but Whitman came to his senses before killing Norris.Uncanny Origins #11

name: Norton
description: Norton worked at a certain private club, which J. Jonah Jameson used to attend with Robbie Robertson.[75]

name: Nong
description: Agent Nong examined the corpse of a dead Watcher with Reed Richards.[76]

name: Nugget
description: Nugget was Ms. Throckmorton's poodle who even though she couldn't enter her boutique, her mistress let her in anyway and inside her Nugget made her the physiological needs in it.[77]

name: Number 23
description: No. 23 was a Spiderling killed during the Goblin Nation's attack on Spider-Island II. He was Spider-Man's favorite among his henchmen.[78]

name: O'Brian
description:
Mayor O'Brian was the mayor of Centerville. He ran "Mayor-for-a-Day" contest that Hedy Wolfe won.[1]
Along with Patsy Walker, Mayor O'Brian ensured that the young Hungarian refugee staying with the Ilona Harkovy was welcomed in Centerville.[2]

name: O'Brien
description: Max O'Brien's mother waited for her son to arrive after he was rescued by Spider-Man and the X-Men.[3]

name: O'Malley
description: O'Malley tricked the Devil into giving him wealth while he was alive, but the Devil was resentful, so after O'Malley died the Devil wouldn't allow him to enter Hell. St. Peter refused to allow him into Heaven because he lived a wealthy and sinful life, so he has nothing to do but wander around telling his story in bars.[4]

name: O'Neil
description: O'Neil was one of Rory and Pandora Destine's schoolmates at the Trumpton Comprehensive School.[5]

name: O'Toole
description: O'Toole was a chopper pilot who was killed by Carnage.[6]

name: Octavian
description: Octavian was a member of the fourth maniple, first cohort, Thunderclap legion of the Nova Roman army. He led the soldiers who captured the New Mutants.[7]

name: Odukoye
description: Dr. Odukoye visited and tested Scott Summers' eyes when he was 6 years old due to his persistent and worsening headaches.[8]

name: Ofira
description: Ofira, wife of Emandax, was a darkly beautiful enchantress who mastered the spell of metamorphosis. His husband introduced her to King Kull to help him solve the great calamity which was cursing the City of Wonders. Ofira, wishing to acquire the king's power, attempted to take him to herself, but Kull eventually rejected her. Ofira then incited Emandax to undermine to black legions within, while she plotted revenge aiding Emperor Varicus of Zarfhaana. Before the battle, she managed to turn Varicus' entire army into beastlike elk-men, but Sen-Dor, sorcerer of Kamelia, eventually transformed her into a harmless mouse, and her own spell was broken.[9]

name: Og
description: Og the One-Eyed was Sligo's former master of arms, although he had a bigger reputation as a thief. He was executed by Sligo as soon as he learned Og's plan to penetrate the citadel of Harach Gnar with Conan and purloin his fabled opal, the Dragon's Egg.[10]

name: Ogadai
description: Ogadai was one of the chieftains, who opposed the false Red Sonja when she wished to kill the Kozak shaman.[11]

name: Ogden
description: Ogden was a high school student who was constantly bullied. Having reached the limit of endurance, Ogden showed up at school armed with a gun to take revenge on Richard Davies, but Richard, having been infected with the Spider Virus, acquired the sense of a spider and the super strength and at the sight of the gun he sprinted forward towards Ogden, not calculating. the force of impact and involuntarily killing Ogden.[12]

name: Okaba
description: A native, he told Lorna that the elephant Killer Rogue was approaching the village.[13]

name: Oleg
description: Oleg was a cybernetic bear killed by the Hulk in the Neverlab.[14]

name: Olga
appearences: Wolverine: The Amazing Immortal Man & Other Bloody Tales Vol 1 1
description: Olga, the lion tamer's assistant, died while giving birth to her child.[15]

name: Ollie
description: Ollie was a professional assassin who was killed by Jude as he was about to murder Amanda Strong.[16]

name: Olsen
description: Olsen was a doctor that worked at a county hospital in Florida located in in the vicinity of Cape Canaveral, that treated Jeremy Logan and came into contact with Captain Marvel.[17]

name: Olsen
description: Doctor Olsen was a physician who lived and worked in Southern California during World War II, a competent enough surgeon who was nevertheless outclassed by Dr. Sam Sabuki. A bigot in addition, Olsen naturally welcomed his rival's removal from the hospital staff and the community too when all Japanese-Americans were interned during the war. His envy was such that, when the Invaders brought a severely injured Toro cross-country for treatment, he kept mum about Sabuki and his whereabouts, which Bucky had to be alerted to by Olsen's reluctant aide, Nurse Gimble.[18]

name: Olson
description:
Mrs. Olson was Jake Olson's mother. When Jake returned to his apartment with Beta Ray Bill, she became frightened at Bill's alien sight and passed out.[20]
When she recovered Jake explained to her mother who Bill was and things smoothed out.[21]
Mrs. Olson goes to Memorial Hospital to meet her son and meets Hannah Fairmont there, and right then Hannah's loyalty comes in saying that Jake is badly burned.[22]
Mrs. Olson was present and shocked at the sight of her severely burned son while he was hospitalized.[23]
Ms. Olson waits for her son to be healed and leaves the hospital but is a little disconcerted that Jake names an "Eddie" cousin whom she knows doesn't exist.[24]

name: Olson
description: Olson was one of the Home Base's security guards.[25]

name: Omar
description: Omar and Whazir tried to hire Conan to slay the city's mysterious wizard and plunder his citadel's treasures, but he wanted to do it in his own way. They later met the Cimmerian in the citadel, but Omar was eventually slain by a cave-bear.[26]

name: Ormon
description:
Ormon was one of the two Aquilonians who persuaded Conan to escort them to Mount Raktavashi, only to kill the Cimmerian's comrade and flee towards the mountain.[27]
Ormon was eventually tracked down and slain by Conan.[28]

name: Orsen
description: Orsen was a student at Midtown High School who was complimented by gym teacher Mike Delladova for his good performance during PE class.[29]

name: Orson
appearences: Symbiote Spider-Man: King in Black Vol 1 1
description: Orson was a child who, in order to chase his balloon that had escaped him, escaped the control of his mother and threw himself into traffic and only the timely intervention of Spider-Man saved him from being hit by the cars.[30]

name: Ortega
description: Mrs. Ortega worked as a cleaner in the Flatiron Building.[31]

name: Ortega
description: Emma unwittingly read the past of her brother Christian's boyfriend, Dante Ortega, and among the images of her past she also saw Dante's mother while she was holding him as a child.[32]

name: Ortega
description: An MPDC officer, he surprised Deadpool infiltrated the district and was stunned by him so that he would kill undisturbed Commander Hydra who was detained there.[33]

name: Ortega
description: Coach Ortega was the coach of Griffith Park High School's football team where Gib became their star player.[34]

name: Ortiz
description:
Ortiz was a prison guard from the Utah State Maximum Security Prison and an informer of the Punisher.[35]
Ortiz and his wife Conchita helped Punisher face Charlie Samson and terrorists from the Underground Liberation Army but Ortiz was eventually killed.[36]

name: Ortiz
description: Mentions: Falcon (Vol. 2) #2

name: Osama
description:
Osama was Colleen Wing's uncle.[38]
On behalf of Japan's Prime Minister, he requested the X-Men's help against Moses Magnum.[39]
Osama bid farewell to the X-Men when they left Japan to return home.[40]

name: Oscar
description: Oscar was a janitor at the Mercy General Hospital and intervened in defense of Dr. Matsuzaki when she was attacked by vampires of the Claw Sect.[41]

name: Oskar
description: Oskar was one of the soldiers who eradicated and plundered Pystoroka.[42]

name: Otilio
description: Otilio, one of Jones' men, was confronted and defeated by the Ghost Rider.[43]

name: Otou
description: Otou was Haan Kaishek's assistant and chauffeur.[44]

name: Otto
description: Otto escorted Frank Drake and his friends to Castle Dracula.[45]

name: Overby
description: Congressman Overby presided over the Congressional interrogation of Roxxon regarding the "Pangean Horizon" oil rig incident.[46]

name: Oza
description: Oza was the daughter of the chieftain of the Night-Fox Clan, who was held hostage by Conan; she was eventually killed by friendly fire.[47]

name: Ozsquerker
description: Ms. Ozsquerker was an employee of Timely Inc. to whom Rocket Raccoon delivered the mail.[48]

name: Pablo
description: Pablo was a member of a gang of robbers who decided to rob the weekly deposits of a local bank from a cash van. Knowing that the driver of the armored car usually stopped at a local diner, the gang entered the diner and took everyone present as hostages waiting for the driver, but Eddie Brock entered that diner with a small family who had given him a lift. Initially not intervening for fear that some innocent people could get hurt, he later responded to the provocations of the criminals and decided to face them by killing them all, Pablo last as he remained in the diner guarding the hostages while the others faced Eddie on the outside.[1]

name: Pablo
description: Pablo was one of the three businessmen who tried to exploit the mineral resources of Kamchatka.[2]

name: Pablo
description: Pablo was a friend of Beto.[3]

name: Paco
description:
Paco witnessed the effects of the pink pills at Grumpy's house when they gave them to a girl, believing it was a common drug.[4]
He died in the first attack of Calvin Zabo's mercenaries, lead by McCallum, who had been assigned to recover the pills.[5]

name: Paco
appearences: Captain America: Symbol of Truth Vol 1 1
description:
Paco was one of the boys who had been saved by Captain America and Falcon from being smuggled to the United States.[6]
Falcon hid him at his grandmother's house and then made him meet again with his cousin Luísa, also among the smuggled people.[7]

name: Paddy
description: Paddy witnessed the evacuation of the streets of London following to the state of emergency declared after the kidnapping of the Prime Minister.[8]

name: Paddy
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 1
description: Paddy was an elder from the town of Broxton who was arguing in the city diner, in the midst of a crowd of tourists who wanted to see the Asgardians, about the difficulties that their town and its inhabitants were going through.[9]

name: Palo
description: Palo was an abused kid who was eventually rescued by Nick Fury.[10]

name: Palos
description: Palos was a hunting dog who was killed by an invisible creature in Nemedia's Darkwood.[11]

name: Pamela
description: Pamela had a date with Tony Stark at one of the East Side's swankiest supper clubs. During their date, Tony accidentally called her Pep (for Pepper Potts). As soon as Stark learned that Happy Hogan was injured and Pepper was taken prisoner by the Unicorn, she was left alone to call herself a cab.[12]

name: Pampolos
description: Mr. Pampolos was a cash-poor storeowner who won a case against Darius Giacomo.[13]

name: Paola
appearences: America Chavez: Made in the USA Vol 1 1
description: Doña Paola was the neighbor of America Chavez's adoptive family and when America created a dimensional passage through the force field that kept the residents of Washington Heights imprisoned, Doña Paola approached America telling her that her family was still locked in a building in flames.[14]

name: Paolo
description: Paolo is a crewmember on Captain Lee Forrester's boat, the Arcadia.[15]

name: Paolo
appearences: Captain America: Sentinel of Liberty Vol 2 5
description: Paolo was one of the many agents of various secret agencies who was put under control by the Outer Circle and forced to attack Captain America otherwise the costume he was wearing would explode killing him. Thanks to Cap's allies, his and the other agents' costumes were defused and Paolo was able to leave without any damage.[16]

name: Papp
description: Mrs. Papp was Mister Zachary's landlady.[17]

name: Parish
description: He was the head of the Parish clan who kidnapped girls to rape and impregnate by him and/or her children. He and all his five sons were killed by the Punisher who knocked an avalanche down on them.[18]

name: Parkinson
description: Parkinson witnessed the Guardians of the Galaxy arriving in Forest Hills Gardens.[19]

name: Parkwell
description: Nurse Parkwell introduced Jane Foster as the new resident nurse to Dr. Kincaid.[20]

name: Pascal
description: Pascal was the male model of the year, staying as a guest at the Gran Hotel Catalonia.[21]

name: Pascal
description:
Lt. Pascal was a member of the Boston Police Emergency Response Unit who along with Lt. Church intervened at the Frost residence during Emma's kidnapping case.[22]
Together with his colleague Church they devised a way to frame Emma's kidnappers.[23]

name: Pat
description: Pat was one of the New Jersey policemen who was searching for the Living Eraser.[24]

name: Pat
description: Pat was Dana's mother.[25]

name: Patricia
description: Patricia was an acquaintance of Janice Lincoln at the Columbia Law School.[26]

name: Patrick
description: Patrick was a childhood friend of Rob Fortune, but he tried to hit on Fortune's girlfriend, Tobi Frye.[27]

name: Patrick
description: Patrick was a friend of Tandy Bowen.[28] He was infected by the Spider-Virus and was transformed into a giant spider.[29]

name: Patrick
description: Patrick was a fellow forensic pathologist of Carlie Cooper, who was supposed to examine the corpses of Peter Parker's loved ones unearthed by Kindred finding no connection between them, not knowing about their relationship with Peter, and for which Carlie told him that he could go and that she would take care of it.[30]

name: Patrick
description: Patrick was a man who Silhouette met in a dating scene and she initially thought he was not very interested as he was always on his cell phone, but later discovered that he was looking for a babysitter for his daughter so he could dedicate himself to her.[31]

name: Paul
description: Paul was one of Henry Pym's colleagues who were imprisoned by Kulla.[32]

name: Paul
description: Paul was an archeologist who asked Tony Stark to help him locate Hatap's Tomb. Stark brought in Iron Man to dig his way into the tomb and discover Hatap's mummy and his grave chamber. When the mummy disappeared, Paul thought that it had been stolen and began searching the area. After Iron Man had returned to the present, Paul discovered a hieroglyphic drawing of Cleopatra embracing Iron Man.[33]

name: Paul
description: Paul was one of Jane Foster's dates.[34]

name: Paul
description: Paul was one of Frank Drake's friends.[35]

name: Paul
description: Paul was on a date with Carol Danvers, but she left during the date.[36]

name: Paul
description: During an unnatural cyclonic blizzard in Calgary, Paul and his friends decided to get people off the street.[37]

name: Paul
description: Working at Great Neck's D.A.'s office, Paul was contacted by Willis Gottfried to propose a deal for Roderick Kingsley.[38]

name: Paul
description:
Paul was brought to Keystone by his mother Gail and rescued by Captain America.[39]
After he recovered, he was visited at the hospital by the Vision and the Scarlet Witch.[40]

name: Paul
description: Paul was a hairdresser who Medusa asked to trim her hair, but as soon as he  tried to cut it, her hair rebelled and he had to give up the cut.[41]

name: Paul
description: Paul was for a short time the human vessel of the Sleep-Stealer. When Spider-Man spotted him, Paul did not want to relinquish power and confronted him but eventually the Sleep-Stealer abandoned his body and Paul disintegrated.[42]

name: Paul
description: Paul is seemingly Mary Jane's latest boyfriend. A father of two, a son and daughter, the latter of whom calls Mary Jane "mommy".[43] Paul tried contacting Peter to cease his late night calls to MJ, but instead met Peter's debt collector for the unpaid medical bills,[44] paying a good chunk himself trying to help.[45] Paul would later directly meet Peter at OsCorp to pick up Mary Jane and invite him to dinner sometime.[46]

name: Paulie
description: Paulie was a Salamanca informer allegedly killed by the Punisher.[47]

name: Paulie
description: Paulie was a store owner who was murdered for failing to pay the Fixer.[48]

name: Paulie
description: Paulie was a bar patron who was confronted by Logan and Spider-Man.[49]

name: Paulson
description: Paulson was one of Mayor J. Jonah Jameson's security guards.[50]

name: Pauly
description: Pauly was a friend of Akasha Martinez.[51]

name: Pavlich
description: Pavlich was the coach of the Woodlawn Height Lions basketball team. He was among the first to know about the illness of his team's star player, Connor Young, and was supportive.[52] He later visited Connor to inform him of his friend, Derek's death.[53]

name: Peabody
description: Deputy of a town in New Mexico, he researched Matt Murdock on the orders of Sheriff Cole.[54]

name: Pearl
appearences: Ghost Rider/Blaze: Spirits of Vengeance Vol 1 22
description: Ms. Pearl was a manager of Children Inc. to whom John Blaze asked for news of the disappearance of Timmy Woods.[55]

name: Pedro
description: Pedro was one of the peasants who heard Kukulcàn's call.[56]

name: Pedro
description: Pedro piloted the Scorpion's aircraft and landed in a Bolivian private airfield.[57]

name: Peela
description: Peela and her owner were murdered by the Full Moon Killer.[58]

name: Peepo
description: Peepo was LLoyd Yarmola's and Princess Gaia's pet dog.[59]

name: Peggy
description: Peggy was one of Johnny Storm's dates.[60]

name: Peggy
description: Peggy and her husband John were in Basinville National Forest for a picnic when there was the assault of Ultimo / Morgan Stark and were saved thanks to the timely intervention of War Machine.[61]

name: Pelham
description: Mr. Pelham was a wealthy businessman and Terry Pelham's father. When he went to pick up his son from school who had received a black eye from Mike Murdock, at the sight of Mike, Pelham turned to his son asking offensively if he was the one who beat him just as Mike hit Terry again and knocked him down.[62]

name: Pembrok
description: Pembrok was one of the two Aquilonians who persuaded Conan to escort them to Mount Raktavashi, only to kill the Cimmerian's comrade and flee towards the mountain.[63] Once secured their prey, Pembrok was eventually betrayed and killed by Ormon.[64]

name: Pender
description: Pender was a security guard at the Fairwoods Mall in Croton-on-Hudson.[65]

name: Pennway
description: Mrs. Pennway was one of Ms. Heck's neighbors at the Garment District.[66]

name: Pepito
description: Pepito was a Mexican bandit who, alongside his bandits, terrorised villagers wherever they went. During a fight with Kid Colt, Pepito was shot by a child who's granddad Colt was hiding with.[67]

name: Perkins
description: Mrs. Perkins was a little old lady who was served by Mr. Smathers just before the Purple Man ordered the teller to fill his case with hundred dollar bills.[68]

name: Perkins
description: Perkins was a security guard at a specialized containment facility tasked with guarding Venom who was being held behind a sound barrier. Perkins enjoyed torturing Venom, but when Venom was free he immediately killed Perkins.[69]

name: Pertuz
description: Mentions: Inhuman #2, Inhuman #3, Inhuman #4, Inhuman #14

name: Pervis
description: During World War II, Pervis was a wire decoding agent in London.[71]

name: Petal
description:
Petal was the girlfriend of Lucien Goff. She gathered information about Winston Frost's fortunes to carry out Emma's mock kidnapping project and obtain a ransom.[72]
Petal complained that Lucien did not treat her too badly, also asked Emma who Gina was.[22]
Petal was killed by Lucien after she was taken as a hostage by Milo considering her a burden to her, however she Petal on the verge of death managed to kill Lucien himself.[23]

name: Pete
description: Pete was a boy whom Patsy thought was a roadster owner, but he was cleaning the car for a wealthy owner and when Patsy went out with him on an appointment she was disappointed by Pete's real car that was a real jalopy.[73]

name: Pete
description: Pete was a Sheriff who helped Two-Gun Kid capture two bandits.[74]

name: Pete
description: Pete killed Raymond Fleet so his friend, Frankie Arno could hide from the police by assuming Raymond' identity. In order to keep this secret Frankie killed Pete.[75]

name: Pete
description: Pete was a policeman who shot at the Thing, but missed him because he was so nervous.[76]

name: Pete
description: Pete was with his friend Harry when they watched as the Human Torch rushed back to the Baxter Building. They were then accidentally knocked over by the Invisible Girl as she followed.[77]

name: Pete
description: Pete witnessed the Avengers turning into stone just after at a press conference, but he believed it was a trick used by them to duck out an interview.[78]

name: Pete
description: Big Pete was a thug who confronted and defeated Daredevil.[79]

name: Pete
description: Pete was a TV host who announced to the world the death of Anthony Stark.[80]

name: Pete
description: Pete was a policeman who immediately died after discovering Speedball in Albie Johnson's wheat field.[81]

name: Pete
description: Pete was a pet shop owner and a Boomerang's affiliate.[82]

name: Peter
description: Peter was the son of the cousin of Blaze Carson and was entrusted to him for a few days just during his candidacy to be re-elected as a sheriff.[83]

name: Peter
description: Old Peter was a wino who was drinking on a pier on the East River when Derek McDowell emerged from the river, mistook Peter for the one who had killed him and thrown him into the river, and for revenge killed him and then realized that he was not the person to take revenge.[84]

name: Peter
description: Peter was an alien member of the Black Knights of the Universal Church of Truth whom was ordered by the Magus to capture the Matriarch.[85]

name: Peter
description: Peter witnessed the Guardians of the Galaxy arriving in Forest Hills Gardens.[19]

name: Peter
description: Peter wanted to take his girlfriend Sarah on top of Christ's Crown; they witnessed the birth of Blackheart, who immediately killed them both.[86]

name: Peter
description: Peter was a TV-News Reporter at the ABC World News Tonight.[87]

name: Peter
description: Peter was the cameraman of the documentary filmmaker Sandra Rains and while they were filming near the Neptune's Eye on the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean, they were assaulted by unknown algae that broke Peter's helmet and killed him.[88]

name: Peter
description: Peter was scolded by his mother for bothering a dog by calling him Devil-Dog and saying it will come for you one night and spirit you away.[89]

name: Peter
description: Peter was the driver of the New York Deputy Mayor Reyes. When he tried to escape from journalists' questions Reyes didn't realize that the Black Widow had taken Peter's place at the wheel.[90]

name: Peter
description: Peter and his family were rescued by Wolverine from the fire set by the Hydra to the woods where they lived.[91]

name: Peter
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 1
description: Peter and his father went to Broxton in Oklahoma hoping to see Thor and the other Asgardians.[92]

name: Peter
description: Peter post a comment after what happened during the internet transmission "Only Cake" saying it was a "Fake".[93]

name: Peter
description: Peter got a job thanks to his uncle Pete to keep him out of trouble but he talked about the job to disreputable people but when Peter refused to leave the doors of the warehouse where he worked open as he was asked by criminals for spitefulness they killed his uncle. Shortly thereafter, Peter exploited the intervention of Spider-Man who broke the gang and was about to kill the man responsible for the death of his uncle but Spider-Man convinced him not to do so even if it failed to erase his guilt for his uncle's death, something they both shared.[94]

name: Peters
description: Dr. Peters is the hospital doctor who tells Mary Jane that her husband Peter's condition is deteriorating[95]

name: Peterson
description: Mr. Peterson was the owner of the Page After Page store.[96]

name: Peterson
description: Peterson worked for Marchand Pharmaceuticals and was killed while, although flanked by Spider-Woman, he attempted to steal a sample of rare spiders for the development of a serum that could have healed Michael Marchand's daughter.[97]

name: Petrov
appearences: Kent Blake of the Secret Service Vol 1 1
description: Petrov was a Soviet guard, stationed at a gulag near Kolyma. He knocked Kent Blake out, and brought him into the gulag.[98]

name: Petrus
description: Petrus trafficked in humans in Madripoor, kept boys and girls as sex slaves and also sold children, until Tyger Tiger discovered him, forcing him to leave the island and appropriating all his possessions.[99]

name: Petruso
description: Petruso was a local smuggler who was instantly murdered by Ferol as soon as he attempted to sell Yatha a black lotus cargo laced with lilies.[100]

name: Pettit
description: Mr. Pettit was the assistant principal at Midtown High. To Lyra's delay and an ironic reply, Pettit delivered Lyra to an after-school detention at 3 pm.[101]

name: Petty
description: Introduced by Mr. Warren, Dr. Petty presented the Living Brain to Peter Parker's classmates at Midtown High School.[102]

name: Phil
description: Phil tried to date Patsy Walker.[103]

name: Phil
description: Phil was a circus owner who found and captured the creature known as Monsteroso to examine the caged animals.[104]

name: Phil
description: Phil was a cameraman who filmed Galactus building an elemental converter atop the Baxter Building.[105]

name: Phil
description: Phil was the coach who assisted Eddie March in his last ring match against Hammer.[106]

name: Phil
description: Phil was Min's husband, who toured the Indian reservation where the Red Wolf was born.[107]

name: Phil
description: Phil was an Air-Traffic Controller at Dallas/Fort Worth Airport. He suggested the Pan Am flight #134 to reroute to Houston, as the airport was still snowed in. When they replied there was another plane entering their airspace, Phil contacted the unidentified aircraft, asking to depart immediately, but Wolverine told him not to worry about it.[108]

name: Phil
description: Phil was in the restaurant where Rachel Summers was eating, right before three armed men entered and told everyone to hand over their money. Rachel ignored them and then finally used her powers to turn their guns into scrap-metal. When she left looking for Franklin Richards, Phil realized she was a mutant, but didn't understand that she actually helped them defeat the robbers.[109]

name: Phil
description: Phil was a policeman who arrived on the scene where the Hulk was spotted.[110]

name: Phil
description: After encountering Eddie Passim, Phil cut off his left arm, his right foot, and and his 3rd and 4th digits on his right hand as a result of being affected by thoughts of About Face.[111]

name: Phil
description: Phil was a man hired by Mysterio to impersonate Spider-Man and reveal his identity to the public to exploit the hero's popularity and earn money, but the real Spider-Man discovered the scam and defeated and captured both Phil and Mysterio.[112]

name: Phil
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 2
description: Phil was a citizen of Stamford and took charge of the posse that captured Speedball for wanting to execute him by suffocating him with a plastic bag,[113] until Miriam Sharpe intervened who blocked him and saved Speedball's life.[114]

name: Phil
description: Phil was a Good Morning UK anchorman who was convinced he could interview Britannia about the Britannia Project, or the formation of a new team of British heroes, but instead found Union Jack as the interlocutor.[115]

name: Philbert
description: Mr. Philbert was the manager of the bank which was robbed by the Blob and Unus the Untouchable.[116]

name: Philip
description: Philip was Linette Martinez's husband. He worked with Lady Octopus on Joe Wade's brain.[117]

name: Phillip
description: Senator Phillip disagreed with Senator Kelly about the Mutant Registration Act.[118]

name: Phillip
description: An old man to whom the Mask of Death by Koala Mumba guaranteed youth along with four other men to the detriment of various teenagers without their knowledge. They were forced to become members of the very successful boy-band among the teenagers of the Podunk Slam by Mr. Appletree, the one who had made them rejuvenate using the mask. But when Moon Knight showed them what was happening to their fans, they all gave up their success and youth by destroying the mask.[119]

name: Phillip
description:
Phillip was one of the Timely Pharmaceuticals's overlords.[120]
After the death of Reginald Pavlish, Phillip and his partner recruited Nicodemus West.[121]

name: Phillips
description: Mr. Phillips worked for the Horizon Labs security.[122]

name: Philly
description: Philly's bike was stolen by Jessán Hoan.[123]

name: Pickles
description:
Pickles was Jeremy Ellsden's pet cat.[124]
A 160 gig drive was found by Deadpool attached to his collar.[125]
Pickles was eventually adopted by Mrs. Horovitz.[126]

name: Pierre
description: Pierre was a soldier who almost fell to his doom due to an earthquake caused by Giganto.[76]

name: Pierre
description: Pierre was Miss Storm's hairdresser and the owner of a chi-chi beauty parlor on Fifth Avenue.[60]

name: Pierre
description:
Pierre escorted Governor Brown to the public dedication of the Champions.[127]
As soon as they were attacked by Crimson Dynamo, Titanium Man, and Griffin, Pierre escorted Governor Brown to safety.[128]

name: Pierre
description: Pierre was Dr. Doom's chef.[129]

name: Pierre
description: Pierre was the cameraman of a television reporter who was doing a live report from Paris after the assault by Gray Gargoyle possessed by Mokk, who had turned the Parisians into statues. Pierre and the reporter were also surprised by Mokk who transformed them into statues and then took Pierre's camera and left a terrifying live message.[130]

name: Pierrie
description: Pierrie was a waiter at the White Cat Night Club where Gloria Jenkins worked. When Gloria had to run away after hearing the news that her grandfather was in danger, she asked Pierrie to report to the club manager that she would be back in about half an hour and if he could call her a taxi.[131]

name: Pieter
description: Pieter was a passerby who told Conan about the king's reward for whoever would rescue the queen, held captive by a wizard upon a nearby mountaintop.[132]

name: Piggy
description: Piggy was one of the beach thugs who attempted to harass Steve Rogers when he was relaxing on the beach with Carol Harding, but they were soon scared off by his great force.[133]

name: Pike
description: An employee of an exclusive department store on Madison Avenue, Mrs. Pike was first distracted by the Avengers coming through the neighborhood while searching for Jocasta, momentarily stopping the Scarlet Witch in a clumsy attempt to hire her as one of the store's models. Minutes later, she returned to a customer she’d left waiting in one of the dressing rooms, only to nearly witness her vanish from the stall. Unknown to Pike, the customer was Carol Danvers, who transformed into Mrs. Marvel to aid the Avengers.[134]

name: Pike
description: Alerted by a waitress, Pike and his henchmen attacked Matt Murdock who was wandering around thinking that he wanted to meddle in his business.[54]

name: Pilar
description: Countess Pilar was one of the Tony Stark's lovers.[135]

name: Pinkerton
description: Pinkerton was a butler for Ms. Drayson. When Namor went to the home of Ms. Drayson, he told him that he could not enter through that door, but to use the back door and to leave immediately. When Namor then rescued Ms. Drayson by extinguishing her burning dress with water spilling from his body, Pinkerton wondered where all that water came from.[136]

name: Pinky
appearences: Nick Fury, Agent of SHIELD Vol 1 1
description: The owner and manager of his own night club in San Francisco, Pinky bemoaned hiring Flip Mason, a stand-up comedian past his prime and down on his luck, as his main attraction. Aware that Mason also had a gambling problem, for which he was always asking for an advance on his pay, Pinky finally up and fired him after he noticed gangsters coming to his club looking for the luckless comic.[137]

name: Pinky
description: Pinky was a former associate of Red Fever before going straight. One day he was called Mel, who asked for his help in setting up shop in Riverdale, but he declined. He was later confronted by the Punisher and he told him about the call.[138]

name: Pitor
description: Pitor was a Slokovian worshiper of Thor.[139]

name: Platt
description: Second-grade teacher Mrs. Platt guided her class on the Liberty Island ferry.[140]

name: Plexico
description:
Detective Plexico asked Anthony Stark to identify the body of Whitney Frost.[141]
Some days later, det. Plexico oversaw some construction workers pull another Madame Masque body out of Puget Sound.[142]

name: Pliskin
description: Deputy Pliskin watched over the stranger while he was jailed.[143]

name: Polly
description: Polly was the aunt of Rick Jones. Rick once visited Polly to wash up and get some food, but he didn't tell her where he had been.[144]

name: Polly
description: Polly was Martin Preston's secretary.[145]

name: Pooch
appearences: Captain America and the Secret Avengers Vol 1 1
description: Pooch was Tatiana's dog which she had to suppress as a form of conditioning for the L.A.S.S.E.S..[146]

name: Poppa
description: Poppa was the owner of Poppa's Olympian Palace.[143]

name: Pops
description: Pops was the owner of Pops' travelling circus where Toro's powers initially activated when it was visited by Human Torch.[147]

name: Popsy
description: Popsy was murdered by a warwolf.[148]

name: Porter
description: Sheriff Porter was in the control room of the nuclear power plant that had suffered the breach and was viewing and informing the mayor of the accident by pointing out that the accident had been caused by Nuke, a member of the Squadron Supreme. He later faced Nuke in the village with a firearm but was incinerated by him.[149]

name: Porter
description: Porter was a stage magician who taught his tricks to Ezekiel Wright. Ezekiel proved to be better than Porter, and at his request to perform on stage, Porter refused, telling him that on Broadway they didn't want a black magician.[150]

name: Porter Mack
description: Porter Mack was the owner of a dude ranch near Buchanan's Butte.[151]

name: Portia
description: Portia was an acquaintance of Fife.[3]

name: Portnoy
description: Miss Portnoy asked the Ferret to find her mother.[152]

name: Postal
description: Mr. Postal was the SHIELD Mission Coordinator for the Deathlok-led cyborg team. He commissioned the team to travel to the Central American island of El Corazon de la Muerte and to support dissidents seeking free elections in opposition to the ruling dictator.[153]

name: Pow
description: A doctor who owned and worked out of an underground hospital in Chinatown in order to aid those criminals who had been injured that couldn't visit the hospital. Katherine Farrell appeared to have him as a source and went to him to see if he had patched up Judge Hart recently. He revealed he had not but told her she should not follow on with the story because he feared an evil spirit had descended on the city.[154]

name: Powell
description: Mr. Powell obtained the garments requested for Thor by the Enchantress.[155]

name: Precious
description: Precious was Alison Mongrain's pet cat.[156]

name: Price
description: Dr. Price was a scientist who did research to eliminate gene X from mutants. He was captured and tortured by Sabretooth on commission and rescued by Wolverine.[157]

name: Price
description: When Wolverine went to investigate Dr. Price's research aimed at eliminating the X gene, when he arrived at his home he did not find it, instead he found his terrified daughter who told him that her father had been taken away by a monster with the face of a man.[157]

name: Prince
description: Prince and Babyface were two homeless people arguing over being able to use a cardboard box from a refrigerator to sleep in, but after seeing a figure prowling around they got scared and decided to share the crate.[158]

name: Prince
description: Prince was slimed by Lief.[159]

name: Pripic
description: Pripic was a Wayde Tennis Academy tennis player who faced Mill Collins in a match soon after the latter accepted Cal Duffy as her coach, and lost the match in three sets.[160]

name: Proctor
description: Proctor and Loughridge were scientists of the Ararat Corporation with big black marks on their careers who were assigned to study the Venom symbiote's clone.[161]

name: Professor
description: A man who simply referred to himself as the Professor that was dismissed from Cambridge University for reckless and dangerous experiments. Afterwards he was hired by Mr. Kline to perform experiments on captured individuals to try and grant them abilities. When William Taurens and his men failed to get any test subjects he underwent the procedure himself using the experimental serum that would result in him becoming the Man-Bull.[162]

name: Pucci
description: Pucci was on the Sweat Shoppers team sent by the Power Broker on the order of the Red Skull to the federal penitentiary in Virginia to evade Viper from prison, which they successfully accomplished.[167]

name: Pueblitz
description: Nurse Pueblitz was the one who took care of the health care for Gabe Reyes and of whom Robbie Reyes, whenever he had to go to her, was afraid of being late.[168]

name: Quin
description: Quin was a member of the crime gang who kidnapped Vanessa Fisk.[1]

name: Quisling
description: One of the robotic members of Madame Masque's Inner Guard. It was destroyed in a battle between the Avengers and Count Nefaria.[2]

name: Rachel
description: Rachel reported the news about the battle between the Scarlet Spider and the Spidercide in the Daily Bugle Building.[1]

name: Rachel
description:
Rachel was a cocktail waitress at the Club Noir.[2]
She introduced herself to Ben Reilly, but he didn't pay her attention, distracted by Orlando Kannor.[3]
Rachel was mistreated by Club Noir's boss Jason Tso.[4]
Rachel then quit the job, as she couldn't make money while the club was closed for repairs.[5]

name: Rachel
description: While Steve Rogers and Bucky were investigating saboteurs at a Carnival, they met two girls, Rachel and her friend Donna, whom they fraternized with and used as a cover for their investigation.[6]

name: Raczkowski
description: Polish diplomat, Mr. Raczkowski was the guest of honor at the party organized by wealthy Mrs. Van Loan, and during the party the Leopard Woman kidnapped New York water commissioner William Sands.[7]

name: Radwa
description: Radwa was a girl who was taken hostage by the Rhino to avoid confrontation with She-Hulk and was thrown over a parapet but was saved by She-Hulk who caught her, making the rescue the best thing that ever happened to Radwa.[8]

name: Rafe
description: Rafe and his partner Mitch were sent to rob the grave of Joseph Travers for his voodoo ring by Mr. Six. They began to dig up the grave when the Zombie appeared and killed Mitch by slamming him against the bars, Rafe escaped back to Mr. Six. Mr. Six shot Rafe for failure.[9]

name: Rafe
description: Henry was a police officer who took in custody the members of the Dragon's Circle defeated by the Black Panther.[10]

name: Rafferty
description: Rafferty was one of the business associates of Doctor Octavius guarding Aunt May.[11]

name: Ragarr
description: Ragar was a Hellbride soldier who pursued Wolverine and Solem at the North Pole in the midst of the Progenitor's judgment, but during the pursuit he was eliminated by a mysterious force.[12]

name: Ragmar
description: Ragmar was a court poet of Zarfhaana who was condemned by Emperor Varicus for his latest satire and sought refuge in the City of Wonders. King Kull granted him asylum at his court, only to kill him after he found Ragmar in his secret treasure chamber.[13]

name: Raines
description: After stabilizing Christian who had attempted suicide, Dr. Raines tried to report his condition to the Frost family but was quickly scolded by Winston Frost who claimed to want to speak to the hospital chief of staff.[14]

name: Raji
description: Raji was a pet dog whose owner died when the Orb confronted the Avengers.[15]

name: Rajput
description: Minor Appearances: Daredevil (Vol. 6) #30

name: Raldo
description: Raldo gave Tonio Daredevil's secret identity.[18]

name: Ralph
description: Ralph was a friend of the Falcon from New Orleans, who apparently disappeared in the backwoods. He was found by Falcon and Captain America among a voodoo cult in some sort of trance, murmuring location coordinates expressed in latitude and longitude.[19]

name: Ralph
description: Ralph and his family traveled aboard a 747 jet alongside the Fantastic Four.[20]

name: Ralph
description: Ralph was a lorry driver who lent his truck to Captain America and Captain Britain, and ended up shot in the back by a Red Skull follower.[21]

name: Ralph
description: Ralph was told to get on the phone to find out what caused the serious anomaly detected on New York City.[22]

name: Ralph
description: Ralph and Rose met Longshot when he first appeared in Upstate New York.[23]

name: Ralphie
description:
Ralphie was one of Carlo Sanguino's henchmen.[24]
After his death, he began dealing drugs for the Kingpin.[25]
Ralphie was eventually forced to tell Spider-Man where to find his boss.[26]

name: Ramirez
description: A henchman of Raymond Gonzales who wore an Iron Man Armor stolen in the period of passage from Stark International to Stane International by an arms dealer. Ramirez in armor collided with the Punisher but was killed when the Punisher threw a knife that hit Ramirez in the slit of the eyes, killing him. When he was hit, Ramirez uncontrollably released the repulsor rays that demolished the building where they were in, killing Gonzales and all his men.[27]

name: Ramirez
description: Major Ramirez was a Mexican soldier who collaborated with the O.A.S.'s sci op, Suzi Endo to resolve the issue of the advent of the Silver Surfer on Earth.[28]

name: Ramon
description: Ramon was one of Doctor Doom's men who operated the nuclear-powered excavator.[29]

name: Ramon
description: Ramon didn't believe the Prophet's speech.[30]

name: Ramon
description:
Ramón was Lindy Lee-Reynolds's yoga trainer.[31]
He casually met Dr. Cornelius Worth at the Watchtower.[32]

name: Ramon
description: Luisa and Ramon were on board a pickup truck in the town of Beebe, Arkansas when they were hit in full by a tornado but fortunately they were rescued by Red Hulk.[33]

name: Ramon
description: Ramon witnessed how Grumpy mutated and became addict to the pink pills.[34] He abandoned Grumpy when Mister Hyde personally confronted him, and subsequently died in a shootout against McCallum's mercenaries.[35]

name: Rampar
description: Mullah Rampar was an usurper whose wisdom in the areas of diplomacy were legendary. He asked Hassan to get rid of the Great Khan's children.[36]

name: Randall
description:
Mr. Randall was Austin Cao's supervisor.[37]
Fearing for his own life, he escaped and met Daredevil.[38]
After Daredevil eventually saved him from Bruiser, Randall decided to leave the country.[39]

name: Randolph
description: Miss Randolph was Katie Power's baby-sitter; During a snowstorm during the busy Christmas shopping season, she was separated from Katie by Wade Cole's attack against Wolverine.[40]

name: Randy
description: Randy, worker of the Front Line, watched a video of J. Jonah Jameson while he was being held by the Extremist.[41]

name: Randy
description: Randy was a guy Carol Danvers met at the speed date arranged by her friends. He insisted to Carol that if she followed him for two weeks he would be able to shape her muscles.[42] When the new hero Binary appeared, Randy commented to a news crew that she was "hot."[43]

name: Ranjamaryam
description: Chancellor Ranjamaryam was murdered by Bloodsport.[44]

name: Ranulf
description: Ranulf was an ancient Viking who fought the Berzerkir with Thor.[45]

name: Raoul
description: Raoul was a driver whose Wells Fargo armored truck was hijacked by the Blank.[46]

name: Raoul
description: During the terraforming of the Chihuahuan Desert in a lush jungle by the High Evolutionary, a ground-to-ground missile was launched from the artillery vehicle led by Raoul, who said that he was not the one to launch it.[47]

name: Raphael
description: Raphael was the leader of a gang who occupied the Alley after the Morlocks were gone.[48]

name: Raskalnikov
description: Captain Raskalnikov was in command of a group of Russian soldiers under the orders of Agent Tatiana Nemikova in Madripoor to retrieve some mutants who had escaped from a secret place in Russia to study them and use them as weapons. After they captured the mutants, Nemikova made arrangements with Raskalnikov to also eliminate their allies, Prince Baran and General Coy. He was killed by Logan when Raskalnikov was about to shoot the little mutant.[49]

name: Rasko
description: Rasko and Baldy Kolak were two escaped convicts who were eventually defeated by Iron Man the Mechanoid.[50]

name: Rastor
description: Rastor was the brother of Count Tarcas Melphorr. Some years before Conan entered the count's manor, Rastor and Tarcas set out on one of their annual journeys of adventure and exploration, deep in the heart of a savage jungle, where they inadvertently uncovered a site that was still untouched and began to mine it for gems. After Rastor got sick of a deadly fever, the village shaman tried to help him, even leaving his own daughter to care for him. When, in his delirium, Rastor attacked and killed the girl, the shaman cursed him to be utterly dependent upon human flesh, slowly transforming into a subhuman monster, who dwelled in the catacomb underneath the house and fed upon unsuspecting travelers provided by Tarcas, until he was eventually killed by Conan.[51]

name: Rat
description: Rat and Tommy Kavanagh saved the Kingpin from Hammerhead.[52]

name: Ratzo
description: Ratzo was one of the Smashers who escorted Bullwhip Grogan to the Stark Industries factory on Lakani.[53]

name: Raul
description: Raul was one of the Bushmaster's bodyguards, who couldn't stop Misty Knight from fleeing his yacht to warn Iron Fist.[54]

name: Raul
appearences: Wolverine: The Amazing Immortal Man & Other Bloody Tales Vol 1 1
description: Raúl was the circus fire-eater.[55]

name: Raven
description:
Mr. Raven was a mercenary in the service of Caroline Le Fay who opposed the Valkyrie's Defenders.[56]
He managed to capture Dani Moonstar and take her to Caroline.[57]
He and Caroline witnessed the assault of the Doom Maidens against the Defenders.[58]
He doubts the Doom Maiden's ability and offers to face the Defenders with his men, but is threatened by Caroline if he still questions her judgment.[59]
Caroline and Mr. Raven were convinced they had overpowered the Defenders, did not imagine how many allies Brunnhilde could count and he himself was defeated in the melee by Moonstar.[60]
Upon entering Caroline's office, he was scolded by her for not wanting to be disturbed as she selected new allies.[61]
He accompanies Zheng Bao Yu to Caroline's office.[62]
Following Caroline and her allies, she suffered the onslaught of the Defenders and were soundly defeated.[63]

name: Ravenette
description: Ravenette was a girl who along with her partner Vince pinned a ghost in place to experiment on him until the ghost reacted and took over Ravenette. Brielle Brooks exorcised the ghost from Ravenette but discovered that the real victim was the ghost and feeling discovered Ravenette and Vince fled.[64]

name: Ravina
description:
Minor Appearances: Patsy Walker, A.K.A. Hellcat! #17
Mentioned: Patsy Walker, A.K.A. Hellcat! #9

name: Rawley
description: Senator Rawley were a loud advocate for the medical advances brought about by the treaty with Krakoa. He was killed by his friend Marcia Colpepper while she was being controlled by telephloronic technology.[67]

name: Ray
description: Ray and Jerry warned Adam Warlock about a bomb test.[68]

name: Ray
description: Ray was a doctor who had been a friend with Norman Osborn for many years.[69]

name: Ray
description: Ray was a fireman, and a friend of Paul Falcone and Tommy Kavanagh.[52]

name: Ray
appearences: Immortal Iron Fist: Orson Randall and the Death Queen of California Vol 1 1
description: Ray was one of Adam Simon's bodyguards.[70]

name: Ray
description: Ray was a tourist that visited the Chichen Itza site.[71]

name: Ray
description: Ray was the assistant of Steve, the cameraman of the kitchen webshow Only Cake who, to make a lot of money, poured a mutogen compound into the cake prepared by the star of the program Oliver Constantin that turned it into a monstrous being, even though Ray was not completely 'agreement.[72]

name: Rayner
description: Mr. Rayner was Susan Bishop's chauffeur. He took the Bishop sisters in their car to the Bishop Manor after they fled the destruction of the Chapiteau Resort.[73]

name: Rayshella
description: Layla's younger sister, Rayshella was charmed by Conan and approached him out on the balcony, but she ran quickly back to her home as soon as Baron Vjerzak appeared down the street.[74]

name: Razia
appearences: Ms. Marvel: Beyond the Limit Vol 1 1
description: Mentions: Ms. Marvel: Beyond the Limit #3

name: Reaper
description: Reaper was one of the members of The Huns, a biker gang based outside Saugerties in the New York state.[76]

name: Rebecca
description: Rebecca was one of Dr. Basel's controlled assistants at the Basel Stress Clinic.[77]

name: Rebecca
description: While visiting the Statue of Liberty under a heavy rain, Rebecca and her family were approached by a crazed Joseph Perrett, who after having massacred his family and a waitress in a diner, wandered around the city. Perrett released Rebecca and her family after Rebecca's mother sobered him a little making him look carefully at her children and the father of her children.[78]

name: Rebecca

When Venom broke free, after killing Perkins, he left Reggie alive only making him pass out, because he had shown kindness to him.[92]

United States Ambassador Reich in San Conception supported political leader Carlos Huevos, and went to his funeral when he was assassinated. Suspecting he was tainted by the stench of the Beast, Elektra broke into the embassy to kill him, but she was suddenly attacked and failed.[103]
Reich then met with United States presidential candidate Ken Wind and managed to transfer the Beast into him, before being killed by Elektra.[104]

name: Rhonda

When the mutant, now a man named Williams, fled the monastery, Brother Richard sought Spider-Man's help to save Williams, but despite the hero's intervention, William died anyway.[122]
A few days later, Brother Richard, aboard his Monkmobile, accepted a car challenge against the Mean Mimes, but his car paid the price.[123]

name: Rhonda

But when Moon Knight showed them what was happening to their fans, they all gave up their success and youth by destroying the mask.[134]

During the all-out melee between Excalibur and their allies and Albion's forces, Ricky tried to attack Shadow Iceman with his sword, and soon found his sword arm and them his entire body frozen solid for his efforts. Shadow Iceman then shattered and killed Ricky.[135]

name: Richie

Rio confided in Jessica that he could not pay protection to Hammerhead, and when the criminal and his men showed up to be paid, Jessica easily defeated them and showed Rio that it wasn't really Hammerhead, but an imposter exploiting the name of the gangster.[148]
Some time later, Rio was again threatened by the fake Hammerhead who brought Bruto the Strongman from Circus of Crime with him just as he entered the Rio bar Jessica Jones with three alternate versions of his that put the aspiring crime boss on the run.[149]

name: Ridge
description: Rip was a member of the Mudsharks street gang and they found Rachel Leighton handcuffed to a subway column and wanted to take advantage of her when Crossbones, the one who had handcuffed her, returned and killed Rob and all the other members of the Mudsharks.[150]

description: Ripper was the Bodybaggers' leader. He allied with the Punisher to fight the Psycho-Cops.[151]

name: Rita

name: Rob

name: Robbey

name: Robbey
description:
Robert was Mr. Six's chauffeur.[9]
He drove him out to the court building.[167]
Robert was eventually killed by the Zombie.[168]

name: Robbey
description: Robert was Wilson Fisk's driver and henchman. When Fisk and Spider-Woman were arguing in his limousine, Robert tried to draw his gun but Spider-Woman easily stunned him with her Venom Blast.[169]

name: Robbey
description: Robert was one of the five Crusader knights rendered almost immortal to protect the Spear of Destiny.[170]

name: Robbey
description: Robert was the director of the film on the fight against organized crime which saw Mary Jane Watson as the female protagonist.[172]

name: Robbey
description: Robert was Gordon Allsworth's assistant director for the film about the adventures of Hercules.[173]

name: Robbey

name: Robbey

name: Robbey
description: Robert was one of the patients who benefited from New U, but who also suffered its relative cellular decay due to the signal triggered by Jackal to reduce the resurrected people to Carrion zombies.[176]

name: Robbie
description:
After the Plastoid attack, Dr. Roberts gave Daredevil some medical treatment; as he received his blood test results, showing presence of radioactive particles, he ordered to call the police in order to find DD and administer him the essential antidote.[177]
Escorted by the police and D.A. Franklin Nelson, Robert found Daredevil in Matt Murdock's Apartment, and surprisingly noticed that the radioactive particles were gone, thanks to an open wound in DD's hand, which made them flow away.[178]

name: Robbie
description: Mentions: Amazing Spider-Man #373

name: Robbins

name: Robinson
description:
Rocco was one of the inmates who led the prison riot sparked by the Puppet Master.[183]
Some time later, he became one of Hammerhead's henchmen, and was hit by an explosive briefcase handed by Don Fortunato's men.[184]

name: Robinson
description: Rocco and Charlie witnessed the Angel steal some T.N.T. and fly away with it.[185]

name: Robinson
description: Rocco was one of the Purifiers who kidnapped the X-Men by ambushing their car as it drove through Central Park, then replacing them with burnt corpses that would be misidentified. He next assisted Anne in spying upon the X-Mansion, during which they captured both Kitty Pryde and Illyana Rasputina, who had sabotaged some surveillance equipment they'd hidden on the grounds. When Kitty escaped the Purifiers' attempt to execute her in the Bronx, Rocco took over the hunt after a street gang injured Anne, eventually catching up to her aboard a subway. He was stopped from killing her and a police officer by the timely intervention of the X-Men and Magneto. He and his fellow Purifiers were then teleported by Nightcrawler to Riker's Island Prison.[186]

name: Robinow
description: Rocko witnessed the Zombie walking by the docks.[167]

name: Robo-Commander Seven
description:
Old man Rockwell from Cheery-O's Dude Ranch startled Two-Gun Kid, as he was using a lawnmower behind him.[187]
He later enjoyed a poker game with him and Clint Barton.[188]

name: Rocco
description:
Rocky and Al were caught during an attempted car theft by Hulk and Betty Ross. As the Hulk scared off the crooks, he began to change back into Bruce Banner. Taking advantage of this, Rocky took a shot at Bruce and they both fled away.[189] 
Some time later, together with Big Eddie and Charlie, Rocky was caught stealing fur coats by Yellowjacket, who defeated them and delivered them to the police.[190]

name: Rocko
description: Rod served as Chicane County police officer. It was not revealed whether he also was a psychopath who had brainwashed or if he was a caretaker of Psychoville project.[191]

name: Rockwell
description: Roddy was an ambulance driver from Edinburgh who escaped from Cyber.[192]

name: Rockwell
description: Roddy was an attorney for Goodman, Lieber, Kurtzberg & Holliway, who represented Hobie Brown's crowdfunding business, Fairgray Pay. Following the company's suddent acquisition by the Beyond Corporation, Roddy explained the workings of the buy-out to Hobie.[193]

name: Rocky
description: Mr. Roderick was a monser truck driver in whose vehicle Walrus inserted flaming bees inside the tank (convinced that they would detonate it) during one of his performances causing him to have a disastrous accident.[194]

name: Rod
