description: Mr. Taylor is the leader of Uni-World Trading Corporation.[47]

name: Taylor
description: Ms. Taylor was a manager of the Mount Vernon Rehabilitation clinic who pointed out to Mary Jane that this was a private, non-public institution and the costs of treatment would be very high.[48]

name: Taylor
description: Taylor was a technician who worked at the Mys-Tech Computer Center in East London and was among those to whom Crowe asked if they were able to enter the code to stop the detonation of the nuclear warhead.[49]

name: Taylor
description: Ms. Taylor was a patient of Dr. Cecilia Reyes who broke both legs trying to skip a barrel with rollerblades.[50]

name: Taylor
description: Taylor was part of the Fist of Freedom paramilitary group, who was defeated by the Scorpion. He was the guard outside there meeting, who was thrown through the window by Scorpion, before he burst through himself.[51]

name: Taylor
description: He had a date with Marlene Alraune but ran away scared after seeing her aggressiveness reaction following an attempted assault on them by two hoodlums.[52]

name: Taylor
description: Taylor was a wheelchair basketball player of the team trained by Flash Thompson.[53]

name: Taylor
description: Mr. Taylor was the owner of a diner in Carefree, Arizona and offered a waitress job to Eva Alexander, the mother of Sam Alexander, after her husband disappeared leaving the family in financial difficulties.[54]

name: Taylor
appearences: Death of Wolverine: The Weapon X Program Vol 1 4
description: Taylor was Meifeng's girlfriend and was killed when her genetic data did not match what Dr. Cornelius was looking for.[55]

name: Taylor
description: Taylor was a student at Corbeau Preparatory High School who, during a training session in the school gymnasium, entered into a dialectical and racist diatribe about the mutant issue against Buddy Bartholomew, until he was kicked out of the gym by the coach.[56]

name: Taylor
appearences: United States of Captain America Vol 1 2
description: Taylor, embittered because his father had lost his job following Nichelle Wright's complaint of the pollution of the groundwater by the company where he worked, decided to rob a diner with guns along with his accomplice who was the son of a policeman, but they were opposed by Nichelle who still took the blame for attacking a son of a policeman.[57]

name: Ted
description: Ted, like Rick Jones and the rest of the Teen Brigade, was trapped by Count Nefaria in his castle atop the New Jersey Palisades: They were all eventually saved by Captain America when the Avenger broke into the building.[58]

name: Ted
description: Ted and his partner Marty were two eighteen-wheeler drivers who came across Will O' the Wisp on a desolate stretch of the New Jersey coast highway.[59]

name: Ted
description: Ted was one of the inhabitants of the village in British Columbia where Logan established himself with Rose O'Hara. He was offered a watch by Smitty, who was trying to raise money for his wedding with Rose O'Hara.[60]

name: Ted
description: Orb showed up at Ted and Mary Beth's home while they slept and after ranting about his ability to see beyond things, told the couple that he would watch as the two of them killed each other.[61]

name: Teddy
description: Teddy was confronted by Rogue after he tried to harass her in Salem Center.[62]

name: Temble
description: All of his family was slaughtered except for his daughter Mary, and although Arrowhead was accused of the carnage, he helped him escape because he had saved his daughter from the true perpetrators of the massacre and did not believe in his guilt.[63]

name: Tenenbaum
description: The sheriff's son tried to rob Miss DeLeon of the prize she had won at a county fair, but her two grandsons intervened in defense of the old woman, including Julian who used his mutant powers and wounded him.[64]

name: Tenenbaum
description: The sheriff attempted to arrest Julian, a mutant native boy, after he injured his son for attempting to rob Julian's grandmother. In defense of Julian, Mirage and Wolfsbane intervened and defeated the sheriff and his posse.[64]

name: Tenrek
description: Tenrek was a Gunderman who tried to hold Conan while he was fighting against Dalmus.[65]

name: Terrence
description: Terrence was a truck driver captured by Boyd Buzzard with the intention of eating him. He was rescued by Wolverine, who had been captured by Bufford Buzzard.[66]

name: Terri
description: Terri was a friend of Jack Russell.[67]

name: Terri
description: Terri was the owner of a bar on Yancy Street that Ben Grimm helped repair after the encounter with Knull's Symbiotes.[68]

name: Terry
description: Terry was one of Batroc's henchmen who were knocked out by Captain America.[69]

name: Terry
description: As he was watching the Metamorphosis act by Nadia Dornova in Broadway, Terry suddenly disappeared in thin air.[70]

name: Terry
description: Terry and Kevin were both attacked by Morbius.[71]

name: Terry
description: Terry was one of Annie's assistants at the Gamma Base.[72]

name: Terry
description: Terry was one of the guards hired by the Owl who captured the Sinister Six.[73]

name: Terry
description: Terry and his friends attempted to rob the Bank of the United States, but were thwarted by Spider-Man (Miguel O'Hara).[74]

name: Terry
description: During the confusion created by Saturnine's advent in Las Vegas, Terry was about to be trampled by the fleeing crowd but was saved by the timely intervention of Mr. Fixit who handed him over to his mother.[75]

name: Teru
description: Teru was one of Amiko's classmates.[76]

name: Teruki
description: Teruki was one of the children of a group of friends who witnessed a dragon appear in the sky, headed to attack Tokyo.[77]

name: Tetsuo
description: Tetsuo was an Osaka police office who was killed by Lady Deathstrike.[78]

name: Tetsuo
description: Tetsuo was a member of Strikeforce Ukiyoe who was knocked down by Captain America.[79]

name: Tex
description: Tex was a right-hand man for Hook Tebbs. He was killed in a gunfight with a band of Prairie City sheriff and the Masked Raider.[80]

name: Tex
description: Tex was a carnival performer who used to shoot at Blob to demonstrate his massive impact absorption power, though, at first glance it was believed he shot blanks.[81]

name: Thayer
description: Mr. Thayer was one of Bruce Banner's high school teachers.[82]

name: Thazarra
description: Thazarra the Sorcerer was an evil witch who commanded to enslaved demons. Her spirit was imprisoned by the Elder Gods within a mirror who was looted Conan and Fafnir in the Temple of the Dragon, and then given to a girl named Nadine. After she gazed into her new mirror while brushing her hair, the spirit of Thazarra was free to possess Nadine, and used the girl to reach the Temple of the Dragon and have the magical jewel placed in the pommel of the girl’s mirror, in order to be released forever. After Conan did it, Thazarra, laughing exultantly, emerged from the mirror as an evil green mist with a witch-like face. She once more possessed Nadine, but Conan threatened to slit her throat and the wild look in his eye convinced Thazarra to abandon her current body. Free to escape and possess any woman she liked, Thazarra returned to the mirror just before Marta and her thieves arrived. Conan then tossed the mirror to Marta just as the priests of the Dragon God come swarming up the stairs, so Thazarra emerged to possess Marta. Running to escape from the chamber, Thazarra darted through a doorway and triggered a bladed trap, which fell from the archway and beheads her. The mirror smashed when it fell to the floor, so the threat of Thazarra was seemingly ended.[83]

name: Thesillus
description: Thesillus went with King Conan to Dion's villa and was eventually killed by Thoth-Amon's traps.[84]

name: Thomas
description: Thomas was an agent of Skyyventures, Inc. who also acted as a bodyguard for Armand Skyy.[85]

name: Thomas
description: Thomas and his partner stole a Colombian shipment from Rico's gang. Running from gunshots, he sought refuge into the same church where he served as an altar boy seven years before, and was confronted by an old priest. Thomas was about to kill him, but when the priest got accidentally shot, he changed his mind and apparently repented.[86]

name: Thomas
description: Thomas attended Reed Richards' Singularity 2010 conference in Golden, Colorado.[87]

name: Thomas
description: Thomas was the Lionsgate Hotel receptionist.[88]

name: Thomasso
description: Thomasso was a member of King Conan's crew during his adventure in the Western Ocean. He along with all crew members except Conan perished when the ship crashed into the rocks. Conan later reunited with Thomasso among the horde of non-living who attacked him on the cursed Island of Golden Ruins.[89]

name: Thompson
description: An agent of the F.B.I., Thompson was killed by the Oriental Giants under the orders of Benson. He was discovered dying by Betty Ross and warned her that his attackers were unkillable.[90]

name: Thompson
description: Thompson was a colleague meteorologist from the London Weather Research Centre who laughed at Albert Potter's failed attempts to control the weather.[91]

name: Thompson
description: Thompson was an employee at the Coliseum Casino in Las Vegas and warned Mr. Fixit that Doctor Octopus was disturbing the casino.[92]

name: Thorn
description: Thorn was a mercenary hired by the local Kenyan magistrate to find out who made strange sacrifices with wild animals.[93]

name: Throckmorton
description: Ms. Throckmorton was a haughty wealthy woman whose dog went to the toilet inside a boutique and ignored Emma Frost, who was the shop assistant in the boutique, who told him what had happened, indeed, told her to clean up and this was also confirmed by the manager of the boutique who didn't want to lose Ms. Throckmorton as a customer.[94]

name: Tibior
description: Tibior was a reclusive Cimmerian who was slain by Grimm before Conan could warn him.[95]

name: Tick
description: Minor Appearances: Hulk (Vol. 4) #3

name: Tickle
description:
Mrs. Tickle was Declun's personal assistant. She declared that after months of planning she couldn't wait to see the world burn.[97]
She was eager to thwart the Wakandans during their attack on the base of Declun on Easter Island.[98]
Mrs. Tickles warns Walter Declun that they have hacked Doom's system by diverting his funds to charities.[99]

name: Tie
description: Tie was a little dog companion of an homeless who lived in an alley in an area where the owner of some buildings hired White Dragon and his gang to mistreat the homeless who lived there to rebuild, and among the actions carried out there was also the appropriation of Tie who however was freed by the Prowler.[100]

name: Tierra
description: Tierra and Jasper were two twin Under-Yorker children whose mother, Leilani, hid in the laundry basket of her neighbor, Peter Parker, so that Spider-Man could protect them.[101]

name: Tiffany
appearences: Nick Fury, Agent of SHIELD Vol 1 2
description: A Hollywood actress of the classic blonde bombshell-type, Tiffany reluctantly found herself frequently paired on screen with egotistical action star Brad Carter. She did so again, playing the role of the jungle girl/love interest, for a King Kong-inspired monster movie being produced and directed by P.D.Q. Werner, which became too close to real life as Werner took the crew to shoot scenes on a remote volcanic island. Furthermore, this was the secret “Valhalla” base of Centurius, and thus Tiffany, Carter, and the rest of the film crew found themselves drafted by Nick Fury to battle Centurius’ weird creations and foil his doomsday scheme. Returning to the freighter they’d arrived on, they narrowly escaped as the island was destroyed, Tiffany and a rarely introspective (for the moment) Brad sharing a kiss as the last of Valhalla collapsed into the ocean.[102]

name: Tilde
description: Tilde was Ben Reilly's landlady when he rented her Lower Manhattan apartment.[103]

name: Tilson
description: Tilson was an ex-prisoner who died from the shock of seeing another ex-prisoner, who was meant to be deceased.[105]

name: Tim
description: Tim was a student at Salem Center High School. He danced with Xi'an Coy Manh at a school dance attended by the New Mutants.[106]

name: Tim
description: Tim was the principal summoner of the M.O.R.D.OC.'s Cult and was the only one to clash with the Soldier Supreme after he had defeated their leader M.O.R.D.OC. but he too suffered an easy and resounding defeat.[107]

name: Timmy
description: Timmy and many other kids were saved by the X-Men from a fire in the Abercrombie Orphanage.[108]

name: Timmy
appearences: Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man Vol 1 110
description: Years later, in the middle of the night, Timmy was deceived by the Santa Claus thief to trade his dad's portable tv for a bigger one for Christmas.[109]

name: Timmy
description: Some time later, Timmy was hospitalized at Manhattan Hospital's children's ward.[110]

name: Timmy
description: Timmy came across Deadpool in the Bay City Aquarium.[111]

name: Timmy
description: When wondering about Earth-TRN243, Beast was given inadvertently given an idea of his counterpart's motives by Timmy and his mother.[112]

name: Timothy
description: Timothy was an assistant to Dr. Boggs at Oxford University. When he returned to the University because he had forgotten his phone he surprised Dr. Boggs talking with Dracula and the latter attacked him by biting him and turning him into a vampire.[113]

name: Tina
description: Tina was one of Freddy Moyer's models.[114]

name: Tina
description: Tina was a college student at Penn State.[115]

name: Tina
description: Tina's leg was eaten by the Human Fly.[116]

name: Tina
appearences: Civil War II: Choosing Sides Vol 1 1
description: After going to meet family in New York, Tina was saved from the Celestial Destructor by Night Thrasher.[117]

name: Tinker
appearences: Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 103
description: Tinker was the developer of the Doombringer suit for the Uni-World Trading Corporation.[47]

name: Tirador
description: Tirador was a fighter pilot who witnessed a U.F.O. shaped like a circus wagon flying above the Andes Mountains.[118]

name: Tito
description: Tito made the scar on Lucien Goff's face and eye with a razor.[119]

name: Tito
description: Tito was Mr. Murdock's driver.[120]

name: Tito
description: The owner and operator of the Velvet Morgue.[121]

name: TK421
description: This Spiderling stood guard of the vault that held all of the weapons Spider-Man confiscated in Spider-Island Two. He was apparently a Goblin Nation spy and was shot down by the Punisher.[122]

name: Toby
description: Toby was one of the hostage takers who were confronted and defeated by Excalibur.[123]

name: Toby
description: Toby was one of the Jackal's cell inmates in Salamanca.[124]

name: Toby
description: Toby was Bill Kinmont's bodyguard.[125]

name: Toby
description: When Bucky proposed to a girl he had just met in a dance hall to dance, Toby rushed at her asking what he meant with her and hit him to which Bucky reacted by hitting Toby repeatedly and causing a fight in the club.[126]

name: Todd
description: Todd was one of the Owl's lieutenants until he was crippled by Daredevil. Together with Mosley and Dennison, they ended up working for Wilson Fisk, who ordered them to inform the Owl that they were going to take over his territory, to keep Fisk in the shadows. When the three of them briefed Fisk about the outcome of the situation, Dennison revealed his intentions to work for himself, believing Fisk to be powerless, but Fisk gave a simple order to Lady Bullseye, who quickly killed Dennison.[127]

name: Tokor
description: Tokor was the captain of the Lemurian pirate craft which rescued and enslaved Kull when he escaped from Atlantis.[129]

name: Toledo
description: Professor Toledo was interrogated by Pedro Diaz about Babalú.[130]

name: Tom
description: Tom took Ms. Drayson to the Dell View Hospital with an ambulance after she had burned herself. Later Namor the Sub-Mariner captured the girl from the hospital, knocking Tom out.[80]

name: Tom
description: Tom and his co-pilot tried to catch the Infant Terrible atop a building overlooking Columbus Circle.[131]

name: Tom
description: Tom was at Central Park when he mistook the motionless Thing for a statue.[132]

name: Tom
description: Tom was a plainclothes guard assigned on the train from New York City to Montreal which was attacked by the Beetle, in order to rob the shipment of the Regina necklace: he was easily defeated by the nerve gas gushed into the locked compartment.[133]

name: Tom
description: Tom and his co-pilot witnessed a flying man up high into the sky over Manhattan.[134]

name: Tom
description: Tom and Bill were two police officers who confronted Death's Head.[135][136]

name: Tom
description: Tom was the town sheriff and an acquaintance of Barbara Denton Norris.[137]

name: Tom
description: Tom was one of the inhabitants of the village in British Columbia where Logan established himself with Rose O'Hara..[138]

name: Tom
description: Tom was working in the San Diego homeless shelter where Deadpool was attacked by the Tiger Shark.[139]

name: Tom
description: Tom co-hosted the show with Lacey on the episode that Miguel O'Hara auditioned.[140]

name: Tom
description:
Tom was a man from London, who at Druig's announcement that the Eternals would eliminate all mutants agreed that someone had to do something.[141]
While at the bar for a drink, Tom listens to Captain America on TV thinking that even though he's a Yankee he's a good person and nods to a guy's assertion that he shouldn't be punished for something the mutants did.[142]
Due to the riots awaiting the Progenitor's judgment, Tom is misunderstood for an Eastern European and beaten in the street.[143]
In the moment of the Progenitor's judgment, Tom wondered what he had done to deserve this, while the son takes the courage to tell him who he is.[144]
Tom does not trust the portals of the Eternals to save them and decides to stay with his family on the day of judgment, regretting the choice when it was too late. However, at the end of the day of judgment he returned to life with his entire family.[145]

name: T'ombatanna
description: Principal T'ombatanna was the principal of high school attended by Tarene and Amanda.[146]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy and his brother Bobby were called back home by their mother as soon as the Hulk was spotted heading that way.[146]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy then was hospitalized near the Baxter Building and wrote fan mail to the Fantastic Four. Mister Fantastic paid him a visit by stretching over from the Baxter Building straight to Tommy's room and the pair had a chat about the Unstable Molecules that form his costume.[147]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was rescued by the Beast from the top of a water tower.[148]

name: Tommy
description: Inspired by glamorized reports of The Matador's criminal escapades, Tommy and a friend played a game where they would take turns pretending to be the Matador fighting Daredevil, with the latter as the heavy, much to the actual hero's chagrin.[149]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was told by his friend Joey he had seen a man climbing over a tree faster than a cat, but he didn't believe him.[150]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was a friend of Jacko Tanner, who witnessed Brian Braddock leave Courtney Ross after being visited by his twin sister Betsy Braddock at Thames University.[151]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy and his mother witnessed Frank Castle in full gear when intervened during a robbery in Marion, Missouri.[152]

name: Tommy
description: Carl was DuPrey's valet, who was rewarded for covering the killing of Mr. Shockett.[153]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was a coroner and one of Kat Farrell's sources. He helped examine the body of Terri Kidder[154]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was a friend of Martin Bastelli.[155]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was killed by the Punisher.[156]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was a member of the Exchange. He was killed by the Punisher.[157]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was one of the students from the Cresskill School for the Blind who were rescued by Matthew Murdock when their bus crashed during a snowstorm in the Catskill Mountains.[158]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was caught by the Owl for stealing money from him.[159]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was a psychopathic boy who had been brainwashed for the Psychoville project. He was playing in the park with a toy weapon when its sight caused Frank Castle a breakdown because of the resurging memories of the death of his real family.[160]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was Mary Jane Watson's chauffeur who would serve her in her role until Overdrive took over the car.[161]

name: Tommy
description: Tommy was a New Yorker that happened to be playing baseball when the cosmically-empowered Iron Man used the Power Cosmic to boost the collective brainpower of the entire city to match his own. This caused Tommy to suddenly have an epiphany, prompting him to start talking about existential nihilism.[162]

name: Tomo
description: Tomo was a member of Mariko Yashida's household guard. He was one of the guards who confronted Wolverine when he went to the Clan Yashida ancestral stronghold to ask Mariko why she called off their wedding.[163]

name: Tomonori
description: Tomonori was a monk who found a way to entrap man's brutal nature and folded it into the great sword he was forging.[164]

name: Tomy
description: Tomy was a young gangbanger defeated by Spider-Man (Ben Reilly).[165]

name: Toni
description: Toni was Mariko Yashida's maid. She was knocked unconscious and replaced by Viper in her attempt to poison the X-Men.[166]

name: Tonio
description: Tonio received Daredevil's secret identity from Raldo.[167]

name: Tonio
description: 'Tonio was a drug dealer affiliated with Michael Dennager.[168]

name: Tono
description: Tono was a member of the Diablito's Gang, who was ordered to record the captured and bound Punisher. His thumb was bitten off by the Punisher, after he was trying to record his face. He was later shot by said Punisher.[169]

name: Tony
description: Tony was a mover of Verners Moving of Salt Lake City who cared to download a very heavy load of equipment that Herr Krauss' ring of Nazi spies had stolen to Namor.[170]

name: Tony
description: Namor went to the Tony's Auto Junk Parts to buy a radiator he needed to build a bantam car.[170]

name: Tony
description: He later became one of Pete London's henchmen, who mistook Daredevil for an enemy and attacked him, but he was easily defeated and knocked down.[171]

name: Tony
description: Tony introduced his wife's cousin Lucy's son Paul "Paulie" Falcone to Don Fortunato.[172]

name: Tony
description: At a time, he was one of Frankie Costa's partners.[173]

name: Tony
description: Tony was a gang leader from Red Hook who was persuaded by Captain America to put the guns down.[174]

name: Tony
appearences: Captain America: What Price Glory? Vol 1 1
description: Tony was one of Charles Medford Frizini's henchmen.[175]

name: Tony
description:
Tony was a thug who began dealing drugs for the Kingpin.[176]
He and Ralphie were interrogated by Spider-Man (Peter Parker) where to find their boss.[177]

name: Tony
description: Tony went to a party organized by Joey Chambers at Washington Heights. He locked up inside the bathroom and started to hook up with Stella. Due to this, they did not try the Toad Juice drug, and ended up being the only survivors of the party.[178]

name: Tony
description: Tony was a construction worker who accidentally let some bricks fall off.[179]

name: Tony
description: Tony was a video game kid that Jean Grey's friend Annie was infatuated with but was ignored by him. Years later Jean met Tony again in the same game room he frequented as a kid and where he now worked.[180]

name: Tony
description: Tony was Suzi Endo's boyfriend from when he was a teenager in Hong Kong.[181]

name: Tony
description: Tony was a The Rose henchman. After Spider-Man broke free from what appeared to be Tombstone's captivity, Tony and other henchmen ran in pursuit of him but fell into the trap set up by Spider-Man and got blocked by his web.[182]

name: Tony Wilson
description: Tony Wilson is one of the primary ants aiding Scott Lang with Ant-Man Security Solutions.[183]

name: Too-Tall
description: Too-Tall was defeated by Elsie-Dee.[184]

name: Toomer
description: Toomer was a penicillin smuggler that was captured by Miss Patriot.[185]

name: Topaz
description: Topaz was a colleague of Mary Jane Watson-Parker, although her catty comments -- to which MJ was easily able to make a snappy comeback -- quickly cemented them as less-than-friendly rivals.[186]

name: Torne
description: Torne was a flying ant who arrived to take Ant-Man and the Wasp home after their encounter with the Porcupine.[187]

name: Torq
description: Torq was a journalist who covered the 'Super Hero' beat for the National Reporter on the East Coast. When he got word Quicksilver and Crystal were spending some time together in Maine, he approached Mr. Maximoff and showed him compromising pictures of his wife with one of the Avengers. Quicksilver rejected them and threatened to kill Torq if he printed them.[188]

name: Toruk
description: Toruk was the hill-men champion chosen by their leader Hobar to fight against Conan in order to end the conflict in an honorable manner. Despite outmatching the Cimmerian physically, the mountainous hill-man was directed to a pile of precariously placed boulders. Conan caused a landslide that buried Toruk, who happened to be carrying the same magical sword Conan found some years ago in the wild lands between Aesgard and Vanaheim.[189]

name: Tosh
description: Tosh was one of Amiko's caretakers.[76]

name: Townley
description: Doctor Townley treated Hope Summers while she was trying to adjust to a normal life.[190]

name: Tracey
appearences: Wolverine, Nick Fury: The Scorpio Connection a Marvel Graphic Novel Vol 1 1
description: Tracey was a dental hygienist who met Mikel Fury during a cruise vacation in Andros.[191]

name: Trash
description: Trash was a gang member who was attacked by the Night Terror.[192]

name: Travers
description: Travers was a gambler and owner of a Gambling Hall in Leadville. When Black Rider got tired of seeing that the honest Leadville citizens swindling out of their money, he went to the Gambling Hall and threatened Travers to leave the town within a week. In search of revenge, Travers hired many criminals but they were all soundly defeated by the Black Rider and then Travers was forced to leave the town immediately.[193]

name: Travis
description: Mentions: Fantastic Four (Vol. 3) #39

name: Travis
description: Travis was a policeman from Hoboken who thought the Punisher had escaped from New York.[199]

name: Travkin
description: Dr. Travkin was a scientist who worked for the Red Room and for them he invented a device that was able to control the minds with which the Red Room controlled its Black Widows agents. Following Elektra's assault on the Red Room training center, it was revealed that Travkin was a double agent who was a member of the Hand.[200]

name: Treach
description: Treach was one of the former workers at Brombline Cross Mining who was interviewed after the mine closed and the Virago arrived.[201]

name: Trevor
description:
Trevor was Len's right-hand man, the leader of the Hell Hounds. He was ordered by Len to round up the gang's heavy hitters and go to the chief of the town they control and question him about what he knew about the hit against the gang and to remind him of who ran the town.[202]
When Len told Trevor to shoot Jake Yahkin during their duel, Trevor restated that he would not violate the gang rules regarding challenges and if he wanted to shoot him he would have to do it himself by breaking the rules.[203]

name: Trina
description: Trina was an coffee shop owner and she was friends with Rick Jones.[204][205]

name: Trina
description: Trina worked at the Coffee Bean for Harry Osborn.[206]

name: Trish
description: Trish was a Princess Bar maid.[207]

name: Trish
description:
Trish was ordered to round up the nurses to hunt down Johnny Blaze.[208]
She then joined the other nurses to confront Ghost Rider and Lucas Collier.[209]

name: Trudi
description: In November 1923, Trudi bought one bag of salt for sixteen billion reichsmarks in Munich.[210]

name: Trygve
description: Trygve and Einar, were Vanir warriors under the command of Hakon. They met Conan of Cimmeria on the battlefield among the corpses where the Vanir and Aesir had clashed, and being Conan an ally of the Aesir they confronted him, but the Cimmerian easily defeated them by killing all three.[211]

name: Tubby
description: Tubby was a low-brow comic who worked with Jonathan Powers, hitting him in the face with countless pies, until Powers could stand it no longer and became the Jester.[212]

name: Tupa
description:
Tupa was Kia Kaishek's aide.[213]
She was eventually defeated by Yukio and Amiko.[214]

name: Turhin
description: Turhin was the leader of the band of slavers who killed Ahirn and his family, he was in turn killed by Conan.[215]

name: Turk
description: Turk was one of the members of The Huns, a biker gang based Outside Saugerties in the New York state.[216]

name: Turner
description: He entered into a verbal disagreement with Castlemere during a Hellfire Club meeting and was killed by Castlemere himself who used his cybernetic enhancements.[217]

name: Tuttle
description: Tuttle was the curator of the San Francisco museum of antiquities.[207]

name: Ty
description: Ty was a street criminal who told Deadpool and Daredevil where to find Tombstone.[218]

name: Tyler
description: Tyler was saved by May Parker from the Anti-Venom.[219]

name: Tyler
appearences: Defenders: From the Marvel Vault Vol 1 1
description: Tyler mysteriously found himself suddenly in the body of the Sub-Mariner and experienced the thrill of swimming in the depths of the sea arriving in an illusory reality where he met Dorma and discovered that he had defeated the surface men by making the Earth a aquatic Atlantean domination.[220]

name: Tyler
description: Tyler was a musician who participated in a reality show where Lila Cheney pretended to be an ordinary person and the two would have a blind date, but during the date Tyler always talked about his band and his music annoying Lila who interrupted the appointment.[221]

name: Tyr
description: Tyr was a Genoshan Magistrate who was soiled by the passage of a car for cleaning the streets driven by a Mutate and who to punish him he made a cigarette into pieces, forcing the Mutate to collect them with his hands.[222]

name: Uller
description: In the year 912 A.D., Uller was a kid who listened to the tale of Thor against the Godstorm.[1][2][3]

name: Upjohn
description: Dr. Upjohn visited Hazel Frost after she had a seizure following Emma who used her powers to show her the truth. Dr. Upjohn said there was no need to hospitalize Hazel, but that she was still in shock and that and if she wouldn't get better she should see a specialist.[4]

name: Urgo
description: Urgo had just lost a fight against a Ludoxite when Lord Ludox's Homunculus attacked.[5]

name: Vadim
description: Vadim was a former KGB agent who had turned to the illicit trafficking. The Black Widow contacted him in order to get Barnes to escape and for that she did him the favor of eliminating the competition.[1]

name: Valerie
description: Valerie attended a roulette game which was won by Tony Stark.[2]

name: Valerie
description:
Valerie was a soldier who was afraid of Nikolas while in Province 13.[3]
He later ran across Wolverine while he was patrolling the woods around Province 13.[4]
Valerie was then assigned to watch over Omega Red.[5]

name: Valencia
description: Señor Valencia was a honest drug enforcement agent, who was kidnapped by Buktir Van Tranh. He helped Punisher to dismantle the Rockhouse Operation.[6]

name: Van
description: An amateur hunter on a safari in the jungles of the Congo led by the expert Greg Knight, both were rescued first by a lion and then by the elephant Killer Rogue thanks to the intervention of Lorna.[7]

name: Van
description: He was among the members of the Sword of Liberty who tried to flush out the Punisher but was easily overwhelmed by him and was killed when he was used by the Punisher as a human shield.[8]

name: Van Aster
description: A wealthy lady to whom Detective Trapp helped solve the case of the attempted theft of her precious necklace.[9]

name: Van Boom
description: Mrs. Van Boom was Kamala Khan's social studies teacher at Coles Academic High School.[10]

name: Van De Vere
description: Dr. Van De Vere was one of the scientists to whom Dr. Korbeau eliminated the soul by putting him under his total control.[11]

name: Van Der Lear
description: Mrs. Van Der Lear was assisted by Foggy Nelson for a custody case.[12]

name: Van Der Twilliger
description: Mrs. Van Der Twilliger went to visit the art exhibition organized by J. Jonah Jameson and there he praised his admiration for the famous editor.[13]

name: Van Dorn
description: Van Dorn and his colleague Cartwright were two executives of General Electronics, the company who were present when Roger decided to hire Reed Richards.[14]

name: Van Helsing
description: The Tavern Master of a small Transylvanian village near the castle of Count Dracula, he was the father of Rachel van Helsing in the 15th Century and the first of the Van Helsings of whom one is aware.[15]

name: Van Heusen
description: Mrs. Van Heusen was one of the wealthiest women in New York who needed a few surgeries for which Stephen Strange, in the midst of his career as a surgeon, was trying to carry out himself in order to enter the circle of wealthy people; it was just as he was going to a party at Mrs. Van Heusen's house that Strange had the accident with his sports car that he maimed his hands and led to a radical change in his life to the point of becoming the "Master of Mystic Arts" and then "Sorcerer Supreme".[16]

name: Van Horn
description: A rich elderly woman was killed by her nephew to collect the inheritance.[17]

name: Van Hosen
description: Professor Van Hosen is the most expert on Pink Mink and its sultry periphenomenology.[18]

name: Van Loan
description: Mrs. Van Loan organized a party in honor of the Polish diplomat Mr. Raczkowski, and during the party the Leopard Woman kidnapped the New York water commissioner William Sands.[19]

name: Van Puyster
description: Mrs. Van Puyster was a rich elderly lady who agreed to finance the construction of a playground for children.[20]

name: Van Schuyler
description: The owner of a ranch in Culver City that was assaulted by the rustlers and for which his young son Percy to prove his worth went hunting for the rustler alone.[21]

name: Van Schyler
description: She and her husband Roddy organized a reception in their mansion in Florida in honor of the Mahrajah Shalimar and the Sub-Mariner was also invited. Mrs. Schyler was desperate after the Maharajah was robbed of her precious jewels at the reception.[22]

name: Van Slyke
description: Van Slyke was hunted and killed by Wolverine for torturing and abusing a Canadian nun in Iraq.[23]

name: Van Vliet
description: Captain Van Vliet was a wealthy antiquity collector called the spouses Hellstrom and the Defenders Beast and Gargoyle to investigate the disappearance of an ancient mystical relic. While the detectives were arguing, Van Vliet committed suicide in his bedroom giving clues to Minerva Bannister's guilt.[24]

name: Vana
appearences: Ghost Rider/Wolverine/Punisher: The Dark Design Vol 1 1
description: Vana was eventually defeated by the Ghost Rider.[25]

name: Vanga
appearences: Ka-Zar: Lord of the Savage Land Vol 1 1
description: Vanga and Bawka, two Fall People farmers, were tending the harvest for their tribe when they were attacked by a diseased T-Rex but luckily they were rescued by Matthew Plunder and Zabu.[26]

name: Vanov
description:
After the battle against the Free Companions, Vanov and Sablat were ordered by Conan to take care of Isparana.[27]
When the Cimmerian returned to the Kozak Camp with Tuzun Thune and Red Sonja, Vanov remembered that swords woman stabbed Pah-Dishah's king, years back.[28]

name: Vanya
description: Vanya was one of Sat-Yr-Nine's amazonian guards.[29]

name: Venus
description: Venus was a club stripper.[30]

name: Varasdi
description: Mrs. Varasdi was a divorced mother of two who came to Nelson and Murdock Law Office for an alimony request.[31]

name: Vart
description: Facing the Progenitor's judgment, Ajak was confronted with an illusion of Vart, a primitive being who was about to tell her how it was possible that there were humans in 1,000,000 BC but which she did not conclude by killing him.[32]

name: Vasquez
description: Vasquez was a member of the Psycho-Cops, a band of deranged pleasure killers who modified conventional paintguns and fired ball bearings instead of paintballs. Vasquez was killed by the Punisher as he made his napalm magazine explode.[33]

name: Vasquez
description:
Vasquez was a member of the Gideon Trust's N-Explorers charged with eliminating any opposition in the Negative Zone while the Trust mined the place. During a simulation in an environment similar to the Negative Zone, Vasquez and other members of the N-Explorer opposed a simulation of Annihilus.[34]
Vasquez and the other N-Explorers opposed a horde of Negative Zone inhabitants who were protecting a temple where a power generator was stored which the Explorers appropriated and transported back to Earth.[35]
Back in the Negative Zone, the N-Explorers found themselves facing the real Annihilus and Vasquez was immediately killed by him.[36]

name: Vazhin
description: Director Vazhin was a senior Soviet officer in charge of researching a mystical artifact found on the bottom of the Murmansk harbor and for which he requested the supervision of mystics. He was killed after the artifact released mystical energies that stormed the research center.[37]

name: Vern
description: A homeless guy on the run from S.H.I.E.L.D. who helped Spider-Man stop Wayep.[38]

name: Vernon
description: Vernon was a survivor of a plane crash that helped Juston Seyfert.[39]

name: Vernon
description: Vernon was one of acquaintances of Doctor Octopus.[40]

name: Veronica
description: Veronica was a TV reporter who covered the fight between Spider-Man and Tendril.[41]

name: Vic
description: Vic spotted Tony Stark recharge his chestplate with a car battery and called the police, mistaking him for a thief[42].

name: Vic
description: Many years later, Vic and Wolfy were confronted and defeated by Daredevil for operating a bogus cash machine on the corner of 32nd and 3rd.[43]

name: Vic
description: Being responsible for providing security, Vic was eliminated by Jason Tso's men when he and Orlando Kannor failed to steal some experimental computer chips, mostly to the unexpected appearance of the Scarlet Spider.[44]

name: Vic
description: Vic was a classmate of Gwen Stacy's at Empire State University. Eve invited her to hang out with her, Vic, and their other two friends at Stews 'n' Sammies. Gwen initially declined, but ended up arriving up late to their get-together.[45]

name: Vic
appearences: Darkhawk: Heart of the Hawk Vol 1 1
description: Vic was a henchman of Phillipe Bazin in charge of accompanying his daughter Allegra to the theater where he was expected but while driving Vic lost control of the car and only thanks to the intervention of Darkhawk avoided running over passersby.[46]

name: Viccuci
description: Mrs. Viccuci was a Salamanca informer who was warned by Daredevil.[47]

name: Vicente
description:
Vicente was one of the partisan revolutionaries who fought the Nazis alongside Logan and Puck in 1937.[48]
Vicente crossed the Eroica pass to get Puck to medical attention.[49]

name: Vicki
description: Vicki announced on television the death of Captain America.[50]

name: Victor
description: Victor was one of Sensei Rand's students at the Thunder Dojo.[51]

name: Victor
description:
Victor was a member of the mercenary team known as the Kill Crew. When Ben Reilly sent the Kill Crew after his fellow clone, the other Scarlet Spider, Victor and Whiskey watched over a warehouse where Scarlet Spider had kept Rita Clarkson kidnapped while Foxtrot and Tango attacked him directly, in case Scarlet Spider escaped and was to return to said location.[52]
When Scarlet Spider returned to the warehouse and noticed Clarkson was gone, Victor launched a missile from a rooftop nearby which exploded the building. However, Scarlet Spider escaped in the nick of time and attacked the mercenaries by surprise. After easily taking them down, Scarlet Spider threated them not to cross his path again, breaking Victor's hand in the process.[53]

name: Victoria
description: A member of the Cult of Hades, she manipulated X-Force and the Champions into a plot to resurrect the Titans that preceded the Olympians.[54]

name: Vjerzak
description: Baron Vjerzak was Ramuda's local tyrant. He used to extort enormous wealth from the merchants upon threat of death, without any interference from the provincial governor, and to routinely abduct the wives and daughters of the townsfolk, using them to satiate his bestial lust. Before Conan's arrival in Ramuda, a valiant few had already attempted in vain to end the baron's reign of terror. He once had a wizened old Nemedian mage murdered, and made off with his magic globe and book of spells, practicing ever since to attain at least a working mastery of the mystic arts. Eventually confronted by Conan, he couldn't do much to protect his demon servant, Mrrsgarn, and was quickly defeated by the Cimmerian, who let him finish to the angry mob.[55]

name: Viktor
appearences: Uncanny X-Men: First Class Giant-Size Special Vol 1 1
description: Viktor was a childhood friend of Piotr Rasputin.[56]

name: Villardo
description: Villardo was a hairy beast like human who was captured by Barenzo for his traveling freakshow. Despite being able to get free, he preferred to stay in chains, feeling safer than in the outside world. When he met Alhambra, Villardo changed his mind, releasing the bird-woman and then setting himself free to stay with her.[57]

name: Vince
description: Vince was one of the mobsters who kidnapped Dr. Don Blake and Jane Foster to have them treat Thug Thatcher.[58]

name: Vince
description: Vince was a policeman from Concord who witnessed the Scarlet Witch and Spider-Man (Peter Parker) inside a car driven by Andrew Pauncholito.[59]

name: Vince
description: Vince was a boy who along with his partner Ravenette blocked a ghost in place to experiment on him until the ghost reacted and took over Ravenette. Brielle Brooks exorcised the ghost from Ravenette but discovered that the real victim was the ghost and feeling discovered Vince and Ravenette fled.[60]

name: Vincent
description: Mr. Vincent was the head of the Chamber of Commerce but secretly he was also the leader of a racketeers organization that was exposed and defeated by the Sub-Mariner.[61]

name: Vincent
description: Vincent was a screenwriter who was being blackmailed by an actress, and for this reason Vincent killed her, but Blonde Phantom discovered the killer who confessed and was arrested.[62]

name: Vincent
description: Vincent, the driver of the wealthy Albert Rudley, plotted with Lorna, Albert's wife, to eliminate her husband and divide the inheritance, but despite several attempts failed to complete the plot.[63]

name: Vincent
description: Vincent was a student in the town where the family who had adopted Alex Summers lived; instigated by Mr. Sinister, Vincent threatened to kill his adoptive family whereupon the stress of the situation brought out the mutant powers of Alex that he directed towards Vincent, killing him.[64]

name: Vincent
description: Vincent was a debtor who was tortured by Nobby Foster.[65]

name: Vincent
description:
Vincent was the maitre d' of a restaurant and watched as Emma Frost mentally made a waitress believe she had paid her bill and having discovered her scam forced Emma to pay her bill by having her wash the dishes.[66]
Vincent saw Emma rushing to the restaurant to warn Troy of Milo and Stu's arrival, trying in vain to stop her just as he couldn't stop the two henchmen from entering.[67]

name: Vincent
description: Vincent and his friends were playing in the park while Stilt-Man collided with Ms. Marvel and the van that the criminal raised rushed towards the kids and was the intervention of Ms. Marvel who avoided the tragedy by saving Vincent and his friends.[68]

name: Vinnie
description: Dr. Vinnie was an underworld-connected doctor who worked for Hobgoblin.[69]

name: Vinnie
description: Vinnie was Hammerhead's personal chef.[70]

name: Vinnie
description: Vinnie used to play pool with Clint Barton.[71]

name: Vinny
description: Vinny was driving an Omega Confederation troop van but given the situation on Kagan 7 he was about to return to his base when he was attacked by Deadpool who confiscated the van but let him go without killing him.[72]

name: Violet
description: Violet was a talk show host who interviewed Miriam Sharpe.[73]

name: Violet
description: Violet was a Frost House waitress who warned Emma, while she was looking after her mother, that there was a call for her and later asked Emma about the health of her brother Christian.[74]

name: Vito
description: Vito and Sylvie attended a barbecue cooked by Vincent Starwit, the gargantuan gourmet, at Bryce Canyon National Park.[75]

name: Vito
description: Vito and Carmelo, two of Hammerhead's henchmen, were confronted by Spider-Man, who took the captured Eel away from them.[76]

name: Vivian
description: King Stefan's fiancée, Vivian was murdered by ULTIMATUM's terrorist agents.[77]

name: Vivienne
description: Mentions: Emma Frost #6

name: Vlach
description: Professor Vlach was an expert on physics who attended Lawrence Zaxton's convention.[79]

name: Vladimir
description: Vladimir was an armament expert who was tricked by Anthony Stark to examine some new weapons designs in exchange of Pepper Potts' and Happy Hogan's lives, but he was beaten and defeated by Iron Man.[80]

name: Vladimir
description: Vladimir was a soldier of Vorozheika who was ordered by Druig to bring the kidnapped scientists and those who betrayed him into the parliament house and watched as he forced the current prime minister to slit his own throat and the rest of the parliament to kill the "traitorous" scientists.[81]

name: Voakes
description:
Voakes was the dean of the Wayde tennis academy who together with the vice dean and student development officer summoned Mill with the intention of expelling her from the academy for her poor tennis skills, but given Mill's determination gave her one last chance that she she would only stay at the academy if she won her next tennis match.[82]
Given Mill's improvements, Ms. Voakes offered Mill the last slot of the sixteen participants in the year-end tournament.[83]
Ms. Voakes bragged to Mr. Wayde, owner of the Wayde Tennis Academy, about Mill Collins' improvements by telling him that she was an example of what her academy could do for her students.[84]

name: Vogal
description: Mrs. Vogal was a lady infected by the zombie Nuke, and when a firefighter decapitated her he apologized for doing so.[85]

name: Volger
description: Volger was fired by Mayor J. Jonah Jameson during the Spider-Island crisis.[86]

name: Volkof
appearences: Kent Blake of the Secret Service Vol 1 1
description: A Soviet spy who tried to appropriate engraving plates for American currency to forge money and bring down the American economy, but his plan fell apart thanks to the intervention of Kent Blake who killed Volkof by throwing it into an acid tank.[87]

name: Volkov
description: Mrs. Volkov was rescued by Reptil during the Symbiote assault on New York, although Spider-Man thought Reptil was a Symbiote Dragon who was attacking the old lady and in turn attacked Reptil, but soon after Spider-Man understood the misunderstanding and ended that with Reptil accompanied Mrs. Volkov to her home making sure she got there safely.[88]

name: Volodin
description: General Volodin was a Russian officer who presided over the Black Widows training center for the Red Room. He used Dr. Travkin's mind control device following Elektra's assault on the center, but it was revealed that Travkin was indeed a member of the Hand, and after Elektra destroyed the device she went to Volodin and knocked him down with a fist.[89]

name: Von Boering
description: Von Boering was the head of a group of German saboteurs intent on disrupting American industry and transportation. Von Boering and his men were discovered by Terry Vance who reported it to the F.B.I. who captured all the saboteurs.[90]

name: Von Strudel
description: Von Strudel warns Red Skull with a dispatch that every attempt to stop the Young Allies has failed and that they are in Berlin.[91]

name: Vorster
appearences: Fear Itself: The Home Front Vol 1 1
description:
Vorster was the leader of the neo-Nazi group Hammer of Thule who committed various racist terrorist acts in Florida. Captured by the Agents of Atlas he confessed to being a descendant of the Thule Society who served Red Skull during World War II and revealed where their base was in Germany.[92]
Arriving at the base of the Thule Society, the presence of the Agents of Atlas awakened the security system of the place which consisted of heavily armed robots who started shooting wildly and Vorster was hit by a shot fired by the robots who killed him.[93]

name: Vosuero
description: Mr. Vosuero helped Anthony Stark coordinating the rescue efforts after Firebrand's attack.[94]

name: VR-37
description: When Seward Trainer used the virtual reality visor to enter Cyberspace, Lady Octopus dispatched her virtual operative VR-37 to intercept him. Although he was defeated by the Scarlet Spider, he did succeed in rendering Seward comatose.[95]

name: Wade
description: Councilman Wade planned to renovate the South Bronx by demolishing the neighborhood, but he had no chance of being reelected.[1]

name: Wade
description: Sandee's father was among those who participated in the theft of The Donald's casino. Deadpool broke into the motel room where the other participants in the coup were and began to fight with the various criminals when Sandee's mother arrived behind him and shot him in the back. Sandee's father panicked and started shooting, first hitting his wife and then another of his accomplices. Attempting to escape the man tripped over the various bodies on the ground and fell from the window and Deadpool believed he was dead, instead he did not perish and later attacked Deadpool and Sandee in a Motel room and when he was about to shoot Deadpool in the head, Sandee fired instead to his father by killing him.[2]

name: Wade
description: Sandee's mother was among those who participated in the theft of The Donald's casino. Deadpool broke into the motel room where the other participants in the coup were and began to fight with the various criminals when Sandee's mother arrived behind him and shot him in the back. Another criminal in the room panicked and started shooting by hitting Sandee's mother between the eyes, only to find out that the man was the father of Sandee himself.[2]

name: Wagner
description: Herr Wagner was the founder of a wax museum located in a lonely European village.[3]

name: Waldo
description: A would-be rock singer in Greenwich Village who, due to his glasses and style of hair, was mistaken by Hank McCoy as his would-be girlfriend Vera from a distance.[4]

name: Wallace
description: Wallace was a rival of James Johnsmeyer in the Great Game.[5]

name: Wallis
description: Wallis was Joe MacTagger's butler.[6]

name: Wally
description: Wally was the doorman of the Bedford Tower building.[7]

name: Wally
description: Mentions: X-Factor (Vol. 3) #21

name: Walsh
description: Mr. Walsh was a liquor store owner who was beaten up by Jack Murdock.[9]

name: Walt
description:
Walt was a disheveled tennis coach who saw potential in Mill Collins and offered to coach her.[10]
Walt made Mill great progress in tennis, but came into conflict with his wife because she wanted Mill to make a career in fashion.[11]
Walt went to see Mill's tournament final and was supportive, but despite Mill's good game, she lost through disqualification to her coach Cal. After the meeting, Mill made peace with Walt and he became her coach again.[12]

name: Walt
description: Walt was called by Bill and told him about the rocky being that had shown up at his motel. Initially incredulous of what Bill had told, he had to change his mind after seeing the Thing with his eyes. Convinced that his gun would have no effect on the Thing, he decided to launch his truck at him and then disappear moments before hitting the motel, due to the time loop in which the town of Cedar was stuck.[13]

name: Walter
description: Walter was a reporter who witnessed the demolition of the Irving Building by the Wrecking Crew.[14]

name: Walter
description: Walter, his granddaughter and Jerry were fishing in the Everglades when they were attacked by the Vellus-Kar hunters. Gerry managed to kill one of the hunters but when all three were about to be overwhelmed by the other two aliens, Man-Thing and Jennifer Kale intervened who rescued them by killing one and putting the other hunter to flight.[15]

name: Walters
description: Dr. Walters treated J. Jonah Jameson at Bellville Hospital.[16]

name: Walters
description: Walters was a technician and a controller in the Psychoville project. He was killed by Frank Castle after he rejected the brainwashing and regained his memory.[17]

name: Wang
description: Detective Wang interrogated Jessica Drew after she escaped from Madame Hydra.[18]

name: Warren
description: Dr. Warren contacted Dr. Strange to help him solve unexplainable cases of sleepers, people who couldn't be awakened after falling asleep.[19]

name: Warren
description: Warren was the companion and collaborator of the kitchen webshow Only Cake star Oliver Constantin. When the show's cameraman Steve to gain more likes with the show and then more money he poured a mutogen compound on the cake prepared by Oliver, he turned into live web in a monstrous being and Warren asked for She-Hulk's intervention and help but despite everything Oliver remained in his monstrous form leaving Warren in despair.[20]

name: Wasserschmidt
description:
Wasserschmidt was the inventor of the H-Phone, a prototype wi-fi and 4G hologram projector.[21]
He simulated a theft of his prototype in order to sell it privately to telephone company Terra-One.[22]

name: Watanabe
description: Mr. Watanabe was a real-estate agent who presented to Mr. and Mrs. Parker an expensive apartment, which they couldn't afford.[23]

name: Watson
description: Kelly and Watson were on the staff of St. Mabyn's Hospital in London when Misty Knight was a patient there. When Knight collapsed while trying to leave, her doctor ran out into the corridor and ordered them to fetch a crash team for her.[24]

name: Wayne
description: Wayne was one of Johnny Storm's schoolmates.[25]

name: Weasel
description: Weasel was a criminal who joined the Vanisher in battle against the X-Men, but he was quickly defeated by Marvel Girl.[26]

name: Weathers
description:
Mr. Weathers met Peter Parker at Midtown High School, where Peter taught, and remarked that he once again showed up with injuries on his face, and at Peter's excuse to explain the case Weathers replied to try to be more careful in the future.[27]
Still showing up with bruises on his face, Weathers asked if by chance he was drinking alcohol or if he was part of an underground fight club, but Peter replied with another made up excuse.[28]
When he showed up with worse and worse facial injuries, Weathers was stunned but Peter was ready to tell him yet another albeit absurd excuse.[29]

name: Weaver
description: Weaver was a nurse who assisted Dr. Shahrazad Rafiee at the E.R. of the General Hospital on the very day of the Fear Itself crisis with a large number of patients.[30]

name: Webber
description: At the head of the advertising agency commissioned by Reed Richards to improve the image of the Fantastic Four, and after explaining the situation to his employees in a summing he gave the job to Mr. Shertzer, although the latter usually dealt with rock stars.[31]

name: Webber
description: Webber was a member of the Raft staff who was present when Juggernaut destroyed it by picking up Kuurth's hammer. He attempted to rescue colleague Baxter who was stuck under the rubble and succeeded with the help of warden John Walker.[32]

name: Weber
description: A Latverian scientist who assisted Dr. Doom during his imminent discovery.[33]

name: Weezie
description: Weezie met Spider-Man (Peter Parker) while arguing with her boyfriend Justin.[34]

name: Welck
description: She welcomed the return of her daughter Sandy on Christmas Eve, who had fled home a few days ago because of her father who was abusing her.[35]

name: Wells
description: Miss Wells was Peter Parker's first-grade teacher, who organized the school play.[36]

name: Wendall
description: Wendall was a friend of Jessica Carradine.[37]

name: Wendy
description: Wendy was one of Patsy Walker's classmate. She lived next to Harold Heartbeat.[38]

name: Wendy
description: Wendy was a friend of Topaz, who introduced her to Jonathon White.[39]

name: Wendy
description: Wendy was a roller derby player and Carlie Cooper's teammate in the Midtown Maulers. She organized an outing with friends to cheer up Carlie but ended up drinking too much and Carlie who was not thinking clearly decided to get a tattoo and Wendy took her to her trusted tattoo artist.[40]

name: Wendy
description:
Wendy was the wife of Mill Collins' tennis coach Walt and also a beautician and she saw modeling potential for Mill.[10]
Wendy managed to get Mill to do a photo audition and later passed her a selection as a model for a sports goods house.[11]
Despite the breakup between Walt and Mill, Wendy remained friends with Mill and supported her during the tennis tournament matches. Not being able to go to the final, she told walt that he should go and support her as they were now like family.[12]

name: Wes
description: Wes was a prisoner of Infinite Solutions detention center. He assisted James Darnell during his training session at the gym and was scolded by Darnell whom Wes feared.[41]

name: West
appearences: Power Man and Iron Fist Vol 1 111
description: Dr. West was a physician who wanted to treat Bobby Wright, a boy who had found an alien spore who granted him superpowers but was also rapidly killing him.[42]

name: West
description: He invented the Fortified Rocket Springs that increased exponentially jumping capacity and was used by Mr. Fixit to destroy the giant asteroid launched by the alien Ralfzz children toward Earth for fun.[43]

name: Wexler
description: Ms. Wexler broke the news to Troy Killkelly that he had to leave the apartment after Milo and Stu raided, telling him that his presence was a danger to the other tenants.[44]

name: Whalen
appearences: Doctor Strange: Nexus of Nightmares Vol 1 1
description: In a nightmare induced by Nightmare to raise doubts in Doctor Strange, Stephen relives a memory of when he refused to operate on Mr. Whalen for his brain tumor because he was unable to deal with his fee.[45]

name: Whazir
description: Whazir and Omar tried to hire Conan to slay the city's mysterious wizard and plunder his citadel's treasures, but he wanted to do it in his own way. They later met the Cimmerian in the citadel, but Whazir was eventually slain by Neanderthals.[46]

name: Wheeler
description:
A former member of the Wakanda Air Patrol, he married T'Challa's cousin and moved to America. There he developed the habit of gambling and only thanks to the intervention of Daredevil he was able to get out of it and redeem himself.[47]
Some time later, Wheeler fell under Malice's influence as she tried to eliminate everyone who knew t'Challa in New York, and after seducing him she killed him.[48]

name: Wheeling
appearences: Giant-Size Chillers Featuring Curse of Dracula Vol 1 1
description: Wheeling was Inspector Chelm's assistant.[49]

name: Whiskey
description:
Whiskey was a member of the mercenary team known as the Kill Crew. When Ben Reilly sent the Kill Crew after his fellow clone, the other Scarlet Spider, Whiskey and Victor watched over a warehouse where Scarlet Spider had kept Rita Clarkson kidnapped while Foxtrot and Tango attacked him directly, in case Scarlet Spider escaped and was to return to said location.[50]
When Scarlet Spider returned to the warehouse and noticed Clarkson was gone, Whiskey launched a missile from a rooftop nearby which exploded the building. However, Scarlet Spider escaped in the nick of time and attacked the mercenaries by surprise. After easily taking them down, Scarlet Spider threated them not to cross his path again.[51]
When Scarlet Spider returned to the warehouse and noticed Clarkson was gone, Victor launched a missile from a rooftop nearby which exploded the building. However, Scarlet Spider escaped in the nick of time and attacked the mercenaries by surprise. After easily taking them down, Scarlet Spider threated them not to cross his path again.[51]

name: White
description: Director of an institution for the blind helped Angel identify and eliminate the blind Nazi killer Krauss.[52]

name: White
description: Wife of James White, a butcher, after her husband had not returned home sends his son Tod to look for him. Asking for help from Secret Stamp, Tod accompanies him home where Mrs. White reveals to Secret Stamp that they were in debt to a loan shark and worried about the fate of her husband.[53]

name: White
description: Miss White was the secretary of the head of the King Airplane Corporation and was drugged by Marvello to get her the King Dive Bomber blueprints to sell them to enemy agents but the plan was foiled by Angel and Miss White was freed from Marvello control and cleared for the theft of the blueprint.[54]

name: White
description: He tells Charlie Griffin to be careful with revenge and what he was going to do about Gavin and his gang.[55]

name: White
description: Mrs. White was the neighbor of a fairy family and advised Josie's mother to cultivate her daughter's female interests so that over time she would stop acting like a tomboy.[56]

name: White
description: Mr. White was a kindly, gentle soul who was saved from two thugs by a living statue.[57]

name: White
description: Nurse White was on duty at the hospital when the mutant boy Joey woke up and turned into his monstrous form, striking both the doctor who was treating him and Nurse White stunning both of them.[58]

name: White
description: Ms. White was a manager of an arms company that did not want to reveal the name of the company's clients to Captain America and the Punisher under false identity and then to the corrupt aide of the Attorney General Angela Stone who, in return, killed Ms. White using a drill.[59]

name: White
description: Mr. White was a scientist from Skyyventures, Inc. who experimented with Simon Caine to make him regain the powers of the meteor.[60]

name: White
description: Professor White was a science professor at the University of Utah in Salt Lake City, where Ben Reilly asked if he could become his assistant after doing a teaching test in his presence.[61]

name: White
description: Mrs. White was the mother of Sally White, the child kidnapped by a mysterious underground population who was liberated and returned to her mother by Nightcrawler.[62]

name: White
description: Mr. White was Ian McNee's assistant in his "Corner Stone on Creation" store in Brooklyn.[63]

name: White
description:
Ambassador White was the United States representative to the United Nations Security Council who attended a closed session of permanent members regarding an incident in China involving Nick Fury and his Howling Commandos.[64]
After questioning China's appropriation of Helicarrier technology, Ambassador White showed Dum-Dum and Sitwell some maps and asked them if they saw anything of interest.[65]
After analyzing the incident, White met Senator Robert Ralston in his office and told him that he assumed he already knew all about the secret meeting at the United Nations.[66]
Ambassador White introduces Ralston to the closed session of the United Nations Security Council who allegedly explained that the United States would place an American at the head of the organization against external threats.[67]

name: Whitey
description: Whitey and his gang got in a fight with Two-Gun Kid.[68]

name: Whitey
description:
Whitey and his gang captured Daredevil and brought him to the Beetle while holding him at gunpoint.[69]
As Daredevil was ultimately defeated, he wished to kill him, but the Beetle ordered to bind him and bring him to the Montreal Expo '67, where he planned on unmasking Daredevil on national television.[70]

name: Whitey
description: Whitey was the leader of the Satan's Angels biker gang in Coits Neck, New Jersey.[71]

name: Whiting
description: Namor came to the aid of Dr. Whiting and helped him secure funds for a cancer treatment centre. Namor also busted the corrupt politicians who sought to cash in on a lucrative road construction contract.[72]

name: Whitmore
description: Whitmore is a flying ant whom Scott Lang rode to infiltrate the Transcorp Tower and break into the company database.[73]

name: Whitten
description: Whitten was the leader of a gang who stole innovative electronic components. He and his entire gang were eradicated by Scarlet Spider.[74]

name: Wilbur
description: Wilbur was one of Seofon Inc.'s clients.[75]

name: Wilf
description: In the year 912 A.D., Wilf was a kid who listened to the tale of Thor against the Godstorm.[76][77][78]

name: Wilhelm
description: Wilhelm was a weaponeer for Dr. Doom. During his botched wedding, Doom activated the Armagedron to use it against the Human Torch. Knowing the danger of the weapon, Wilhelm rushed to the scene of the battle to warn that its instability could destroy Doomstadt.[79]

name: Will
description: Will was a reporter for the online tabloid newspaper Unexpected Truth who posted a post fanning the idea that Captain America / Barnes's death was a hoax and this infuriated Black Widow who went to the newsroom and quarreled with the various members.[80]

name: Willem
description: Young Willem, from the northern town of Gasparan, went with King Conan to Dion's villa and was eventually killed by Thoth-Amon's traps.[81]

name: William
description: Billy and her mother lived in the woods of British Columbia in Canada on the run after her mother killed her husband because he abused her and Billy. Billy's mother helped Nomad after he was attacked by a pack of wolves.[82]

name: William
description: William, on the orders of the Black Panther, had infiltrated a clandestine ring of poachers. Due to the intervention of Nature Girl and her allies, months of investigation and William's coverage were compromised.[83]

name: Williams
description: Williams was the assistant of Dakor the Magician in his role as private investigator.[84]

name: Williams
description: Williams was a tabloid photographer who took a picture of Debbie Harris as she left [[Franklin Nelson (Earth-616)|Foggy Nelson's office crying. Foggy was furious and was about to hit Williams but Matt stopped him. Changing clothes quickly, Matt transformed into Daredevil and purposely bumped into Williams causing him to drop his camera and exposed the film rendering it unusable.[85]

name: Williams
description: Williams was the butler of Anthony Stark's Upper Eastside town house.[86]

name: Williams
description: Ms. Williams was a secretary working at Imperial Chemical Industries in Sydney.[87]

name: Williams
description:
Mr. Williams was an old man who warned the Fantastic Four to turn back from the Pine Barrens.[88] He sheltered in his home the Invisible Woman, her son, and his friends from the extraterrestrials' attack.[89] 
He then told her the truth behind the legend of the Jersey Devil.[90]

name: Williams
description: Craig Williams' father was a person who put all his money into his son becoming a professional football player, even treating him badly if he didn't meet his standards. Also when he learned that Craig had been permanently removed from the team due to his behavior, he beat Craig and punched him. Craig reacted and wrestled with his father, eventually defeating him and walking away taking his money, with the father telling him that he was not his son.[91]

name: Williamson
description: Pvt. Williamson was a member of Sentinel Squad O*N*E in charge of piloting a Sentinel during a mission led by Sgt. John Steele in Savage Land against a pack of mutated tyrannosaurs.[92]

name: Willie
description: Willie was a rail worker who witnessed Hercules lifting a fallen sequoia from the tracks and hurling it into the surrounding hills.[93]

name: Willie
description: Willie was among Dominic Fortune's men who followed the killer sent by Simon Steele toward the docks.[94]

name: Willie
description: Willie was a member of the rival gang of Red Fever who was called by Ernie after he got the tip from Scooter that Red Fever was in Riverdale and ultimately he clashed with the whole gang against the Punisher.[95]

name: Willis
description: A Vietnam War veteran, Colonel Willis was responsible for guarding the United Nations nuclear weather control station. He refused to let Atlantean scientists examine its nuclear generators and reported back to the United Nations Headquarters, who sent the Avengers for aid. As he was preparing to open fire against the Titans Three, Ikthon and Dorma managed to convince him to allow them to examine the device. When Ikthon managed to repair a flaw in the device that could threaten them all, he realized his mistake and apologized to the Sub-Mariner.[96]

name: Willis
description: Willis was Thomas Fireheart's chauffeur. He took him to the Fireheart Enterprises building on his way back from New York, and Thomas told him to come and pick him up at the usual time.[97]

name: Willis
description: Willis was one of the leaders of the Dark Willow miners' Union who demanded better working conditions and for this he was badly beaten by Sheriff Minton's men. Rupert Kingsley went back to heal Willis from his injuries and because of this he was punished by burning his house with him inside.[98]

name: Willner
description: Willner was the student development officer of the tennis academy who together with the principal and her vice principal summoned Mill Collins with the intention of expelling her from the academy for her poor ability in tennis.[10]

name: Willoughby
description: Minor Appearance: Wolverine (Vol. 3) #15

name: Willow
description: Nurse Willow tried to prevent Daily Bugle reporter Ben Urich from talking to Daredevil at Bellevue Hospital.[104]

name: Wills
appearences: Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man Vol 1 27
description: Nurse Wills was Dr. Henry Orlock's assistant.[105]

name: Willy
description: Willy and his wife Doris were attacked by Bloodscream in Logan, Alberta, Canada.[106]

name: Wilma
description: Wilma was a homeless woman who Elektra met on the streets of Hell's Kitchen and after having her misadventures that led to her living on the street, Elektra gave her a necklace worth $ 5,000.[107]

name: Wilson
description: Wilson was an orderly at South Brooklyn Psychiatric Facility while Doctor Octopus was being treated there. Reed Richards sought Octavius's help to treat Sue Storm Richards's radiation sickness during her second pregnancy. Wilson marveled at Richards's rapid breakthrough but had suspicions about Octavius's intentions.

name: Wilson
description: Mr. Wilson was the District Circulation Manager of the newspaper, which was distributed by the newsboy Nicky and who, on orders from Mr. Million, gave him an exclusive area to sell newspapers.[108]

name: Wilson
description: A policeman told her that her husband Bill, just released on parole, had been found dead in a motel room for a heart attack despite her argument about her husband who was completely healthy. Suspicious of this, the Human Torch went to the morgue and found that Bill had been killed confirming his wife's statements about his state of health.[109]

name: Wilson
description: Wilson was one of the three partners of the Otis-Larrabee-Wilson musical enterprise; Larrabee and Wilson were killed by partner Sidney Otis after selling the company to take over all the proceeds and at the same time accusing singer Ed Clements of the murders.[110]

name: Wilson
description: Mr. Wilson was a diamond collector in Shanghai. When his collection was stolen, Wilson blamed his daughter Joyce's boyfriend. Joyce enlisted Namora's help in exonerating her boyfriend, and by agreeing to help her she discovered that the real culprit and the theft was Wilson's nephew, Paul West.[111]

name: Wilson
description: Wilson was an employee of the firm of Portsmouth inherited from Danny.[112]

name: Wilson
description: Together with his gang, Wilson killed the gold prospector Bob Manson to misappropriate his mine and blamed Kid Colt for the murder, but in the end Kid Colt exonerated himself from the murder charge and killed Wilson.[113]

name: Wilson
description: Mr. Wilson was the banker of Caliber City who was deceived by Mr. Duane, a fake businessman, to give him a loan despite the distrust of the Outlaw Kid which turned out to be accurate as Mr. Duane was a gambler and thanks to the Kid Mr. Wilson managed to get his money back and get Mr. Duane arrested.[114]

name: Wilson
description: After her husband, the banker of Caliber City, decided to meet the gambler Mr. Duane who had cheated him, Mrs. Wilson realized that her husband was not able to face the gambler and in fact was told by the Outlaw Kid to call the sheriff right away telling him to go to the Crystal Palace where her husband and Mr. Duane would meet.[114]

name: Wilson
description: Wilson was an astronomer who worked for the government and was among the first to observe the fleet of spaceships that attempted to invade the Earth.[115]

name: Wilson
description: Mr. Wilson was disfigured after an accident and was hospitalized at Metrogeneral where he had to undergo facial plastic surgery but when he learned that the operation would be performed by an Indian doctor he protested vehemently but had to change his mind when the surgery was impeccable.[116]

name: Wilson
description: Wilson was the banker of Tombstone who was robbed by Grizzly Grogan and his gang but the blame was given to the prizefighter Boom Boom Brown, because of his size and the characteristic hat that Grizzly purposely wore just to mislead the blame, so that Wilson he thought it was Boom Boom.[117]

name: Wilson
description: Wilson tried to take advantage of Cindy Jones while she was a prisoner on Dr. Doom's ship, when he was surprised by Doom himself. Doom was disgusted by what Wilson was trying to do, and consequently killed him on the spot.[118]

name: Wilson
description: Wilson was the District Office Circulation manager that Sherlock Holmes had given some help in one case and in return asked him if he could use his young aide in a search as well as to send a wire.[119]

name: Wilson
description: He covered the night shift at a Medical Center in the West Side with Dr. Donald Blake and was fascinated by him hoping he would notice her as a woman and not just professionally.[120]

name: Wilson
description: An MPDC officer, Wilson arrested the Black Knight on charges of murder against two petty thieves who tried to steal inside a church and were killed with a sword but that finally the culprit turned out to be the Crusader.[121]

name: Wilson
description: Ms. Wilson was a soldier of W.H.O. in service to the control tower at the RAF Ruthymere base the day that Charles Xavier wearing a Shi'ar armor sneaked into the base to regain possession of the Blackbird.[122]

name: Wilson
description: Mrs. Wilson was one of the flight passengers who were saved from a crazy gunman by Venom.[123]

name: Wilson
description: The corpse of the pedophile Mr. Wilson was possessed by the soul of an unnamed man.[124]

name: Wilson
description: Wilson was a street hood who told Daredevil all he knew about the Owl's comeback.[125]

name: Wilson
description:
One evening, Peter Parker came Mr. Wilson to buy some ice cream for him and Uncle Ben.[126]
Years later, drug store owner Mr. Wilson sold to Peter the medicine for Aunt May prescribed by Dr. Bromwell.[127]

name: Wilson
description: Wilson was one of Dr. Meridian's assistants who immediately stood up for him when Jessica Drew turned to the doctor sharply but Dr. Meridian told Wilson not to worry and that it was right to give her explanations.[128]

name: Wilson
description: Wilson was a gun trafficker who worked with corrupt Chicago Police Officer Frillo Moreletti, but was intercepted by Nighthawk during an operation involving an illegal arms sale for Detective Tom Dixon to various gangs in Chicago, and was killed during the scuffle.[129]

name: Winifred
description:
Winnie, short for Winifred, an art student, is introduced by D.W. Griffith to Luke Cage, telling him that she preferred to be called Win.[130]
While D.W. argues with Quentin Chase about Luyke Cage, Winnie tells D.W, that the way he replied to Chase isn't cool.[131]
Win tells D.W. that she spoke to some students she knew and who seemed excited about his film project.[132]
While Luke Cage, D.W. and Chase are arguing at the Gem Theater, Win eats a hot dog from the theater vending machine and tells D.W. that the hot dog tastes like ground-up leather.[133]

name: Winslow
description: Mr. Winslow was the head waiter where the immigrant Joe Martel worked, who with his singing managed to defeat a team of alien invaders.[134]

name: Winslow
description: Winslow was one of Rick's new neighbors.[135]

name: Winston
description: Winston was a colleague of John Rand and friend of of Rand's son David during the 1940's. While in the Belgian Congo, his lawyer Alec Wright tried to take control of his Rand diamond mines, but Wright's plan was stopped by Ka-Zar and fell off a cliff to his death. Ka-Zar sent Winston back to England to insure that the profits from his family diamond mine would go toward the war relief fund in England.[136]

name: Winterton
description: Mrs. Winterton was one of the citizens of Pleasant Valley. She noticed that the behavior of both her husband and son changed drastically, and she was later replaced by an Skrull like the rest of the citizens of the whole town.[137]

name: Winthrop
description: Ambrose Winthrop's child was killed by his father along with their mother and baby sibling as a collateral for his pact with Mephisto.[138]

name: Winthrop
description: Ambrose Winthrop's wife was killed by his husband along with their child and their baby as a collateral for his pact with Mephisto.[138]

name: Winthrop
description: The final of the many wives of Ambrose Winthrop. After Ambrose's death, the widow Winthrop was visited by Mephisto, who announced Abrose's debt for his deal with him had befallen on his family.
