As a token for the debt, Mephisto collected one finger from each of Winthrop's children as well as his widow.[138]

name: Witold
description: Witold was a waiter at the Masque Club, an exclusive Washington, D.C. but few knew it was owned by the Red Skull. During a meeting between Red Skull and his lieutenants, he was ordered to serve another round of drinks and he serving with a tray full of drinks replied that he had anticipated it in his request.[139]

name: Wolf
description:
Chief Wolf was the foreman on an oil rig that was attacked by Nature Girl and her X-Men. Wolf attempted to defend himself by pointing a gun at Nature Girl, but a swarm of flies prevented the gun from firing and soon after, Nature Girl killed him.[140]
Upon the arrival of the Marauders on the platform to save the survivors and limit the damage done by Nature Girl and her X-Men, Triage momentarily awakens the dead body of Chief Wolf to ask what had happened and then make him rest for good.[141]

name: Wolfy
description: Wolfy and Vic were confronted and defeated by Daredevil for operating a bogus cash machine on 32nd Street.[142]

name: Wooster
description: Ms. Wooster was the psychologist at the Farnum Observational Facility who questioned Titania who had agreed to participate in a study conducted by her on condition of her parole.[143]

name: Worley
description: Mrs. Worley owned a cat that she pretended was a Flerken who had devoured first her husband Henry and then her entire $ 80 million penthouse. She was the first person to ask Gus a legitimate complaint in his new assignment at Damage Control.[144]

name: Wozbaaarg
description: Mrs. Wozbaaarg was an employee of Timely Inc. to whom Rocket Raccoon delivered the mail and on the other hand she complimented him by saying that he was cute.[145]

name: Wrupp
description: Mrs. Wrupp was a resident of Centerville.[146]

name: Wuu
description: Wuu was Lord Zula's servant in the house of Sho-Onoru.[147]

name: Wylie
description: Mr. Wylie was a curator at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and was shot and killed by Copperhead.[148]

name: Xeres
description: Xeres was an hillman who was slain by Hobar when he tried to kill Conan.[1]

name: Yasir
description:
A member of the Islamic terrorist group Revolutionary Jihad went to the United States to buy plutonium from Manny Herrera but the negotiation was interrupted by the Punisher, however Yasir managed to escape with the plutonium.[1]
Yasir managed to position the plutonium on a crane from which he intended to detonate it, but immediately afterwards he was confronted by the Punisher who killed him.[2]

name: Yates
description: Yates was the head coach of the West Philadelphia High School P.E. class where Flash Thompson used to work as an assistant coach.[3]

name: Yatha
description: Yatha used to run the grey lotus business in Shadizar on behalf of his fellow Lords of the Lotus.[4]

name: Yogok
description: Yogok was the high priest of Raktavashi, who allied with Ormon and Pembrok to get rid of Nafertari's influence among the Kirghiz monks. He was eventually slain by the cannibal goblins who dwelled under the forbidden city.[6]

name: Yohei
description: A member of the Sunrise Society who did not agree with Kantaro Umezu to take control of the country but who had to be content with having obtained key positions in the Japanese industry and government but this infuriated Umezo who stabbed Yohei's hand with his blade.[7]

name: Yohei
description:
A killer midget belonging to the Hand pretended to be the head enforcer of the Clan Yashida, and handed Wolverine the Clan's sword to defeat the Iron Monk.[8]
Later Wolverine guessed who Yohei was, an infiltrated member of Akatora's Hand, and killed him.[9]

name: Yoritomo
description: A Japanese nationalist, he devised a plan to restore Japan to the grandeur it had in the past by exploiting Shiro Yoshida's heroism and ingenuity while at the same time rearming Japan using Harlan Ryker's Cybertek technology. But his plan was opposed and defeated by Deathlok and the S.H.I.E.L.D.[10]

name: Yoshi
description: Yoshi was one of the three businessmen who tried to exploit the mineral resources of Kamchatka.[11]

name: Yoshiro
description: Miss Yoshiro was a secretary working at Sony corporate headquarters.[12]

name: Yuri
description: Yuri was one of the operators who died during the Chernobyl Disaster.[13]

name: Yuri
description: Yuri was a Quark's agent who was killed by Logan.[14]

name: Yuri
description: Yuri was a Russian criminal who shot Beto.[15]

name: Zachary
description:
Mr. Zachary ordered Austin Cao's and Matthew Murdock's deaths.[1]
Zachary was eventually killed by Midas Investments' criminal customers.[2]

name: Zack
description: Zack and his friend witnessed the Ghost Rider confront Sin in ruined Dayton.[3]

name: Zackery
description: Zackery attempted to defend his mother when she was attacked by the Cold Warriors.[4][5]

name: Zang
description: Zang was one of Salome's slaves. He was a normal human probably with few knowledge in magic. Zang was a priest, so he probably helped Salome in her rites. Zang was instructed by Salome to follow Constantius' army and to use the crystal sphere to communicate to Salome how the battle against Conan went. Zang was involved in the battle and wounded. He learned that Conan's siege machines were false and that the Zuagirs had been helped by 3,000 Khauran knights, and that Constantius had been defeated. Zang managed to inform his master but was suddenly killed by an arrow.[6]

name: Zardu
description: Mr. Zardu was healed from a psychic tumor by Legion.[7]

name: Zechariah
description: Zechariah was a Jewish priest, and despite his and his wife's old age, the Archangel Gabriel announced to him in the temple that his wife would have a child and that he would call him John. By questioning the angel's words because of their age for conception, Gabriel punished him by making him unable to utter a single word until what he had announced had occurred.[8]

name: Zelda
description: Zelda and Mabel stumbled across the Fantastic Four while shopping in a New York department store.[9]

name: Zelda
description:
Zelda was the lover of "Filthy" Frankie Zapruder but she could not bear his change of smell.[10]
During Frankie's attack of anger, Zelda complained of his smell that had become horrible due to his anger, but Frankie didn't care and let Zelda out of the room.[11]
Zelda was still at Frankie's side when he was happy that the rival gang had been hit.[12]

name: Zell
description: Zell was a Hellbride's soldier who pursued Wolverine and Solem at the North Pole in the midst of the Progenitor's judgment, but during the pursuit he was eliminated by a mysterious force.[13]

name: Zeke
description:
Zeke was a partner in crime of Turk and Grotto.[14]
As instructed by the Kingpin, Zeke saved Daredevil from the Hand.[15]

name: Zeke
description: Zeke and his friend Clem were fishing in the swamp on a boat, when Clem claimed to have caught a very large fish but instead it turned out to be the Glob that overturned their boat.[16]

name: Zern
description: During the demonstration of the power of the robotic Agent ZERO, the city councilor Zern showed concern about the cost of the operation.[17]

name: Zhang
description: In a village in China, Zhang witnessed the Goddess' epiphany.[18]

name: Zhao
description: Zhao was a member of the Inner Demons. He was attacked and knocked out by the Anti-Venom.[19]

name: Zharov
description: Zharov was a military man who supervised the Hazar nuclear site where an accident had occurred in the past. Inside the site took refuge the inhabitants who had not yet been infected by the virus and welcomed the arrival of Crossbones as if he were a superhero, Initially Crossbones collaborated with Zharov, but as soon as he took the opportunity he used Zharov as a human bomb to find a way out of the assault of the mutated inhabitants.[20]

name: Zingy
description: Zingy was a song writer working for J. Nelson Earplug.[21]

name: Zinn
description: Zinn was one of Salome's slaves. He probably was a normal human. His cranium was deformed and his face was horrible. Zinn was called by Salome after she learned that the battle against the Zuagirs was lost. Zinn followed his master down to the prisons to kill Taramis, but when they reached the corridor where the Taramis' cell was, they found a guard dead. They heard the voices of Conan and Taramis and waited behind a corner. When the liberators reached them, Taramis blinded them with blue flashes and Zinn slew them with his knife. Zinn transported Taramis in the Temple but Conan reached them. Zinn tried to stop Conan but he was easily killed by the Cimmerian.[6]
